Title: Department of Transportation - Human Trafficking Awareness, Training, and Response (See Someone, Save Someone Act)
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Transportation to develop or identify and implement a training program for transportation sector employees on the identification and reporting of suspected human trafficking victims; requiring transportation sector employers to certify by January 1, 2027, and each year thereafter that certain employees have completed the training program; requiring new employees to receive training within 90 days of hiring; removing civil and criminal liability for reporting of suspected trafficking; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Transportation to develop or identify and implement training programs for transportation-sector employees on identifying and reporting human trafficking. It also mandates employers to certify employee training completion, establish reporting procedures, and implement prevention policies, along with public service announcements at transit locations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation
stakeholders: Transportation-sector employees, employers, and transportation users in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive approach combining training, reporting procedures, prevention policies, and public awareness campaigns to combat human trafficking within transportation sectors.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by addressing human trafficking, which can include child victims, and improving safety and awareness.

Title: State Board of Physical Therapy Examiners - Revisions
Synopsis: Clarifying the definition of "physical therapist assistant" as used in the Maryland Physical Therapy Act to mean an individual licensed by the State Board of Physical Therapy Examiners; increasing the membership of the State Board of Physical Therapy Examiners from 8 to 9; and requiring the Board to send renewal notices to licensees by electronic means, rather than first-class mail, unless the licensee requests to receive the renewal notice by first-class mail.
bill_summary: The bill revises the Maryland Physical Therapy Act by clarifying the definition of 'physical therapist assistant', adjusting the membership of the State Board of Physical Therapy Examiners, and changing the method of sending renewal notices to licensees from first-class mail to electronic means, with provisions for fallback mailing.
responsible_party: State Board of Physical Therapy Examiners
stakeholders: Licensed physical therapists, physical therapist assistants, and licensees in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a shift from traditional mail to electronic communication for license renewal notices, leveraging digital technology to improve efficiency and communication.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on professional licensing procedures.

Title: Restrictions on Use - Solar Collector Systems - Alteration
Synopsis: Prohibiting a restriction on land use that increases the cost of installing a solar collector system by at least 5% over a certain cost or that reduces the efficiency of the system by at least 10% under a certain energy generation level; authorizing a community association to impose certain restrictions on the installation of solar collector systems in common areas or common elements; authorizing a community association to install a solar collector system in common areas or common elements under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits restrictions on land use that increase the cost or decrease the efficiency of installing solar collector systems, and allows community associations to regulate or prohibit the installation of solar systems in common areas, including the ability to install systems in those areas.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development or local land use authorities
stakeholders: Property owners, community associations, solar energy providers, residents interested in solar energy
innovative_summary: The bill introduces specific standards for evaluating restrictions on solar energy systems, including requiring documentation from independent specialists and recording solar easements, which is a structured approach to facilitating solar energy adoption.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty as it mainly addresses land use restrictions and community association rules for solar energy systems.

Title: Public Safety - Food System Resiliency Council - Definitions and Reports
Synopsis: Altering certain definitions related to the Food Resiliency Council; defining what constitutes "healthy food priority areas" as predominantly lower-income areas that have limited access to retail outlets that sell, affordable, healthy foods; defining "wasted food" as food not used for its intended purpose; requiring the Council to make recommendations to increase the availability of local foods, create market opportunities for Maryland food businesses, and expand access to small scale food production infrastructure; etc.
bill_summary: This bill establishes the Maryland Food System Resiliency Council to address food insecurity, promote equitable access to healthy foods, reduce food waste, and support local food production and procurement. It defines key terms, sets reporting requirements, and aims to improve the long-term resilience of Maryland's food system.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Emergency Management (Office of Resilience)
stakeholders: Residents of Maryland, especially those experiencing food insecurity, local food businesses, schools, and food council organizations.
innovative_summary: The bill promotes a comprehensive, multi-stakeholder approach to food system resilience, including data analysis, policy recommendations, and support for local food markets, which is a modern approach to addressing food insecurity.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to reduce child poverty by improving access to healthy foods and supporting local food initiatives.

Title: Health Insurance - Access to Nonparticipating Providers - Referrals, Additional Assistance, and Coverage
Synopsis: Repealing the June 30, 2025, termination date for certain provisions of law related to referrals to and reimbursement of specialists and nonphysician specialists who are not part of a carrier's provider panel; prohibiting certain carriers from imposing utilization review requirements other than would be required if the covered benefit was provided by a provider on the carrier's provider panel under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the sunset date for laws requiring insurers and health plans to facilitate access to specialists and nonphysician specialists outside their provider panels, especially for mental health and substance use disorder services. It mandates procedures for referrals, assistance, and reimbursement rates, and sets a timeline for establishing reimbursement formulas.
responsible_party: Maryland Health Care Commission
stakeholders: Individuals seeking mental health and substance use disorder services, health insurers, providers, and consumers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured process for accessing nonparticipating providers, including assistance and standardized reimbursement formulas, which employs new approaches to healthcare access and provider reimbursement.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving access to mental health and substance use services, which can support child well-being.

Title: Cannabis - Sale and Distribution - Tetrahydrocannabinol Offenses
Synopsis: Authorizing the officers and employees of the Field Enforcement Division of the Alcohol, Tobacco, and Cannabis Commission to issue a citation for a violation of §10-108 of the Criminal Law Article; prohibiting the sale or distribution of certain products that contain tetrahydrocannabinol or are advertised as containing tetrahydrocannabinol; authorizing the Executive Director of the Commission to seize, destroy, or confiscate a certain unlawful product; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland laws regarding the sale, distribution, and regulation of tetrahydrocannabinol (THC) and related products, including establishing licensing, testing, and enforcement provisions, and increasing penalties for violations.
responsible_party: Maryland Alcohol, Tobacco, and Cannabis Commission
stakeholders: Cannabis producers, distributors, retailers, and consumers in Maryland, especially those under 21
innovative_summary: The bill employs modern regulatory approaches, including licensing, testing standards, and digital age-verification mechanisms, to control THC products.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but may improve public health and safety related to cannabis use.

Title: Corporations and Associations - Limited Worker Cooperative Associations - Authorization (Maryland Limited Worker Cooperative Association Act)
Synopsis: Authorizing the formation of limited worker cooperative associations; and establishing rules and procedures for the formation, governance, conversion, and dissolution of limited worker cooperative associations.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the formation of limited worker cooperative associations in Maryland, establishes rules for their formation, governance, conversion, and dissolution, and creates a new legal framework for these entities.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Commerce or relevant state agency for business registration and regulation
stakeholders: Workers interested in forming or joining worker cooperatives in Maryland, and the broader Maryland economy
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new legal structure for worker cooperatives, allowing them to operate as a distinct type of entity with specific governance and membership rules, employing innovative cooperative governance approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to impact child poverty by promoting worker ownership, economic stability, and income equality through cooperative business models.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Noise Abatement Monitoring Systems Pilot Program - Inspection and Extension
Synopsis: Establishing that certain provisions of law relating to the inspection of recorded images apply to recorded images produced by a noise abatement monitoring system; and extending by 2 years the reporting and termination dates of the noise abatement monitoring systems pilot programs in Montgomery County and Prince George's County.
bill_summary: The bill extends the pilot programs for noise abatement monitoring systems in Montgomery County and Prince George's County, including the use of noise monitoring systems and the reporting requirements for these counties.
responsible_party: Maryland counties implementing noise abatement monitoring systems
stakeholders: Residents and motorists in Montgomery County and Prince George's County
innovative_summary: The program employs noise abatement monitoring systems to reduce noise pollution and includes data collection and reporting to evaluate effectiveness.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on noise pollution reduction.

Title: Health Occupations - Nursing - Loan Repayment, Education, and Sunset Extension (Building Opportunities for Nurses Act of 2025)
Synopsis: Expanding the purpose of the Maryland Loan Assistance Repayment Program for Nurses and Nursing Support Staff; requiring the Department to prioritize funding for nurses or nursing support staff who practice in an area with a shortage of nurses or nursing support staff or who practice in a specialty where a shortage has been identified; altering certain education requirements for licensure; repealing a certain requirement that the State Board of Nursing approve certain nursing assistant training program sites within a certain time period; etc.
bill_summary: The bill extends and modifies the Maryland Loan Assistance Repayment Program for nurses, including expanding eligibility, increasing program duration to 2030, and updating licensing and training requirements for nursing support staff and nurses.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and Maryland Board of Nursing
stakeholders: Nurses, nursing support staff, healthcare facilities, and underserved communities in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach combining loan repayment, licensing updates, and targeted workforce incentives, integrating regulatory and financial strategies to address healthcare workforce shortages.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to reduce child poverty by strengthening healthcare workforce and improving access to healthcare services in underserved areas.

Title: Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services - Study on Location of Individuals Prior to and Following Incarceration
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services to conduct an annual study examining and comparing certain data regarding an individual's residence prior to incarceration and on release from a State correctional facility; and requiring the Department by October 1, 2026, and each October 1 thereafter, to report the results of the study to certain committees of the General Assembly.
bill_summary: This bill requires the Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services to conduct a study on the residence locations of individuals before and after incarceration, including data on their county of residence, transfer details, and comparison of release locations, with reports due annually starting October 1, 2026.
responsible_party: Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Individuals incarcerated in Maryland and their communities
innovative_summary: The bill employs data analysis and reporting to understand incarceration and release patterns, which is a standard approach but important for policy development.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing more on data collection and analysis of incarceration locations.

Title: Environment – Reservoir Augmentation Permit – Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Reservoir Augmentation Program in the Department of the Environment; defining "reservoir augmentation" as the planned placement of reclaimed water into a surface water reservoir used as a source for a drinking water treatment facility; requiring a person to obtain a permit from the Department to perform reservoir augmentation; establishing an Indirect Potable Reuse Pilot Program in the Department to make recommendations on whether the program should be extended or made permanent and any statutory or regulatory changes necessary; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Reservoir Augmentation Program in the Maryland Department of the Environment, requiring permits for reservoir augmentation projects, and sets rules for issuing, renewing, and revoking these permits. It also creates a fund funded by fees and penalties to oversee the program.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Public water systems, environmental agencies, and residents relying on surface water reservoirs in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program introduces a structured permit system for reservoir augmentation using reclaimed water, with a focus on public health and environmental protection, and includes reporting requirements and a dedicated fund.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on water management and environmental health.

Title: Estates and Trusts - Compensation of Guardians of Property and Trustees
Synopsis: Clarifying the commissions that a guardian of the property may charge; authorizing a trustee of a trust to charge compensation that is reasonable under the circumstances; and authorizing trustees who are financial institutions or members of the Maryland Bar to charge compensation that is reasonable under the circumstances and calculated in accordance with a schedule of rates filed with an appropriate agency.
bill_summary: This bill clarifies and updates the laws regarding the compensation of guardians of property and trustees in Maryland, including establishing specific rates and conditions for charging fees and commissions.
responsible_party: Maryland Courts and the Office of the Commissioner of Financial Regulation
stakeholders: Guardians of property, trustees, trust beneficiaries, and court systems in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a structured schedule of rates and formal filing and notification procedures for trustees' compensation, which introduces a more standardized approach to trustee fees.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty, as it mainly concerns legal and financial procedures for guardians and trustees.

Title: Consumer Protection - Right to Repair - Powered Wheelchairs
Synopsis: Requiring, in order to make repairs to powered wheelchairs, that a certain manufacturer make available certain documentation, parts, embedded software, firmware, and tools to a certain independent repair provider or owner of a powered wheelchair; providing that a violation of the Act constitutes an unfair, abusive, or deceptive trade practice subject to certain enforcement and penalty provisions; and applying the Act prospectively.
bill_summary: This bill requires manufacturers of powered wheelchairs to provide independent repair providers and owners with access to documentation, parts, embedded software, firmware, and tools necessary for repairs, under fair and reasonable terms, to promote repair independence and consumer rights.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Commerce or relevant regulatory agency
stakeholders: Owners of powered wheelchairs, independent repair providers, and consumers needing wheelchair repairs
innovative_summary: The bill employs a new approach by mandating manufacturers to provide repair resources to independent providers and owners, promoting repair accessibility and consumer rights.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving access to wheelchair repairs, which can enhance mobility and independence for children with disabilities.

Title: Maryland Department of Health - Forensic Review Board - Established
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health to establish a forensic review board at facilities that have charge of persons who have been committed to the facility as not criminally responsible; authorizing a forensic review board to make recommendations relating to the release or rehabilitation of a committed person; requiring the board to give notice at least 10 days before a meeting concerning the committed person; requiring the board to give consideration to a written statement offered by the committed person to the board; etc.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a forensic review board at facilities that have charge of persons found not criminally responsible, and creates a Community Forensic Aftercare Program to monitor these individuals on conditional release, including procedures for reviews, recommendations, and record sharing.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Persons found not criminally responsible and on conditional release, mental health providers, courts, and legal representatives
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured forensic review process and a dedicated community monitoring program employing regular meetings and record sharing, integrating mental health and legal oversight.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on mental health and legal procedures for a specific population.

Title: Department of Service and Civic Innovation - Maryland Corps Program Service Year Option Pathways - Revisions
Synopsis: Altering the duties of the Department of Service and Civic Innovation; renaming the Governor's Volunteer Council to be the Governor's Commission on Service and Volunteerism; altering certain requirements relating to qualifications for applicants and compensation for participants in the Young Adult Service Year Option Pathway and the Maryland Service Year Option Pathway; altering certain reporting requirements; and repealing the Executive Fellows Program.
bill_summary: The bill revises the Maryland Corps Program by establishing two new pathways: the Young Adult Service Year Pathway and the Maryland Service Year Pathway. It sets up funds, defines program requirements, and sets participation and funding targets to promote public service among young adults and residents, with a focus on addressing state challenges and building a pipeline into government employment.
responsible_party: Department of Service and Civic Innovation
stakeholders: Young adults, Maryland residents, state and local government agencies, community organizations, and employers
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach to public service by creating dedicated pathways, funding mechanisms, and targeted outreach, integrating service with workforce development and addressing state challenges.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to impact child poverty by providing young adults with service opportunities, skills development, and pathways to employment or education.

Title: Department of Aging – Aging Services – Program Repeal and Consolidation
Synopsis: Repealing provisions of law requiring the Secretary of Aging to develop certain congregate housing and assisted living programs for seniors; repealing the Interagency Committee on Aging Services and transferring certain responsibilities of the Committee to the Department of Aging; requiring the Department, beginning in June 2025, in coordination with area stakeholders, to conduct program transition planning and to co-design the new, consolidated program required by the Act; etc.
bill_summary: The bill repeals certain aging programs and committees, consolidates responsibilities into the Department of Aging, and establishes a new program to provide single points of entry for older adults to access various services, with a focus on program transition planning starting in June 2025.
responsible_party: Department of Aging
stakeholders: Older adults in Maryland and their caregivers
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a coordinated, single points of entry system for older adults, integrating multiple services and supports, and emphasizes stakeholder engagement and transition planning.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty indirectly by improving support systems for older adults, which can benefit families and communities.

Title: Public Health - Repeal of Prohibition on Transfer of Human Immunodeficiency Virus (Carlton R. Smith Act)
Synopsis: Repealing the prohibition on an individual from knowingly transferring or attempting to transfer the human immunodeficiency virus to another individual.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the existing law that prohibits individuals from knowingly transferring or attempting to transfer the human immunodeficiency virus (HIV) to another person.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals with HIV and the general public
innovative_summary: The bill removes a legal prohibition on HIV transfer, which is a change in legal policy rather than an innovative program or service.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Natural Resources - Fishing Licenses and Stamps - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the fees for resident consolidated senior sport fishing licenses, angler's licenses, and trout stamps; and repealing the exemption from the requirement to obtain a trout stamp under certain circumstances for a holder of a resident consolidated senior sport fishing license.
bill_summary: The bill increases fees for certain fishing licenses and stamps in Maryland, repeals some exemptions, and establishes a program to provide discounted licenses for Purple Heart recipients.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Maryland residents, especially senior citizens and disabled persons, and military service members
innovative_summary: The bill mainly updates fees and regulations for fishing licenses; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly concerns fishing license fees and regulations.

Title: Election Law - Petitions for the Formation of a New Political Party - Process
Synopsis: Altering the time periods during which a petition for the formation of a new political party or additional signatures to a petition may not be filed; and prohibiting signatures submitted with a petition that was officially determined as not meeting certain legal requirements from being resubmitted with a subsequent petition.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland election law to change the time periods during which petitions for the formation of a new political party or additional signatures can be filed, and prohibits resubmission of signatures if a petition previously failed to meet legal requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Individuals and groups involved in political party formation and election processes in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces specific restrictions on petition resubmission and adjusts filing periods, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on election process rules.

Title: Federally Qualified Health Centers Grant Program - Acquisition of Land
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of Public Works, on recommendation of the Secretary of Health, to make grants under the Federally Qualified Health Centers Grant Program to counties, municipal corporations, and nonprofit corporations for the acquisition of land for the construction or use of a federally qualified health center.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Board of Public Works to provide grants to counties, municipal corporations, and nonprofit organizations for acquiring land to build or operate federally qualified health centers, expanding the existing grant program.
responsible_party: Board of Public Works, Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Counties, municipal corporations, nonprofit organizations, residents needing health services
innovative_summary: The bill expands the existing federally qualified health centers grant program to include land acquisition, which is a new approach to support health center development.
child_poverty_direct_summary: By supporting the development of federally qualified health centers, the program has the potential to improve access to healthcare for underserved populations, which can reduce child poverty.

Title: Public Health - Cannabis Public Health Advisory Council - Membership
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the Cannabis Public Health Advisory Council to include the Administrator of the Motor Vehicle Administration, or the Administrator's designee, and the Executive Director of the Office of Social Equity in the Maryland Cannabis Administration, or the Executive Director's designee.
bill_summary: This bill amends the membership composition of the Cannabis Public Health Advisory Council in Maryland, adding new members appointed by the Governor, including representatives from historically black colleges or universities, health care providers, pharmacists, substance use disorder experts, researchers, and industry representatives.
responsible_party: Maryland Cannabis Administration and other state agencies involved in public health and cannabis regulation
stakeholders: Public health officials, cannabis industry stakeholders, healthcare providers, researchers, and communities affected by cannabis policies
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates the advisory council membership and does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty but may have indirect effects through improved public health policies.

Title: Environment - Building Energy Performance Standards - Alterations and Analysis
Synopsis: Altering the requirements for certain regulations adopted by the Department of the Environment relating to building energy performance standards to include certain exclusions, considerations, and a certain  annual reporting fee to cover certain costs; requiring the Department to certify a certain building energy performance standards program adopted by a county under certain circumstances; requiring the Department to conduct an analysis of the potential costs and benefits of certain building energy performance standards policy options; etc.
bill_summary: This bill establishes regulations and standards for building energy performance in Maryland, including targets, exemptions, and alternative compliance pathways, and creates a program for fees and incentives related to energy use and greenhouse gas emissions.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Owners and operators of covered buildings, including commercial, multifamily residential, and government buildings in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach combining energy performance standards, exemptions, waivers, and financial incentives, and integrates data collection, training, and county certification programs, representing a multifaceted and technologically integrated approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce energy costs and emissions, which can indirectly benefit children by improving living conditions and reducing environmental health risks.

Title: Health Services Cost Review Commission – User Fee Assessment – Repeal of Sunset
Synopsis: Repealing the termination date for a certain provision of law related to the maximum amount of total user fees that may be assessed on hospitals and related institutions by the Health Services Cost Review Commission.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the sunset clause that limited the maximum amount of user fees that the Health Services Cost Review Commission could assess on hospitals and related institutions, allowing the fee limits to continue indefinitely.
responsible_party: Health Services Cost Review Commission
stakeholders: Hospitals and related healthcare institutions in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily maintains existing fee structures without introducing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Procurement - State Department of Education - Local Food Purchasing Program
Synopsis: Requiring the State Department of Education, in coordination with the Department of General Services and the Department of Agriculture, to establish a program to procure, when funding is available, local food for local school systems with preference to providers that are certified local farms or certified Chesapeake invasive species providers; altering the percentage price preference adopted by the Board of Public Works for locally grown food from 5% to 10%; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland State Department of Education to establish a program to procure local food for schools, including food from farms within 200 miles, Chesapeake invasive species, and local farms certified by the Department of Agriculture. It also modifies procurement rules to favor local food providers and creates an Office for the Certified Local Farm and Fish Program to promote local sourcing.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education, Department of Agriculture, Department of General Services
stakeholders: Local school systems, local farmers, Chesapeake invasive species providers, students
innovative_summary: The program employs a coordinated, regional procurement approach with a dedicated office to promote local farms and invasive species, integrating local sourcing into state procurement processes.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve access to fresh, local food in schools, which can benefit children's health and nutrition, thereby potentially reducing child poverty.

Title: Property Tax – Tax Sales – Revisions
Synopsis: Authorizing a tax collector to withhold from tax sale certain property occupied by an heir of a deceased owner of the property; requiring that certain owner-occupied property and certain property occupied by an heir of a deceased owner of the property be withheld from tax sale; requiring each county to establish a registry for interested parties or the Tax Sale Ombudsman to designate property to be withheld from tax sale; requiring the State Department of Assessments and Taxation to assist each county in creating and maintaining the registry; etc.
bill_summary: This bill revises Maryland's property tax sale laws by establishing procedures for withholding certain properties from tax sales, especially owner-occupied and properties occupied by heirs of deceased owners, and creating a Homeowner Protection Program to help vulnerable homeowners retain their homes. It also modifies notice requirements, redemption rates, and the process for foreclosing rights of redemption.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation and local county or municipal governments
stakeholders: Homeowners, heirs, vulnerable homeowners, local governments, and property owners in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new Homeowner Protection Program and enhanced procedures for tax sale withholding and notices, employing technology for registries and targeted interventions to prevent unnecessary foreclosures.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by helping vulnerable homeowners stay in their homes and avoid displacement.

Title: State Board of Public Accountancy - Sunset Extension and Report
Synopsis: Continuing the State Board of Public Accountancy in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to July 1, 2030, the termination provisions relating to the statutory and regulatory authority of the Board; and requiring the Maryland Department of Labor to submit a certain report to the Joint Audit and Evaluation Committee on or before July 1, 2028.
bill_summary: The bill extends the sunset date for the State Board of Public Accountancy to July 1, 2030, and requires the Maryland Department of Labor to submit a report on the board by July 1, 2028.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Public accountants and related professionals in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill mainly extends existing regulatory authority and does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Education - Holocaust Education Assistance Grant Program - Established
Synopsis: Establishing the Holocaust Education Assistance Grant Program in the State Department of Education to assist local school systems with Holocaust education in public schools; authorizing a local school system to apply to the Department for a grant from the Program to be used for teacher training or teaching materials; and requiring the Governor to include in the annual budget bill an appropriation of $50,000 for the Program.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Holocaust Education Assistance Grant Program within the Maryland State Department of Education to support local school systems with Holocaust education through grants for teacher training and teaching materials.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Public school students and educators in Maryland, particularly those involved in Holocaust education
innovative_summary: The program is a targeted grant initiative to enhance Holocaust education in public schools, employing a straightforward funding approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing on educational content and teacher training.

Title: State Finance and Procurement - State Leasing of Real Property
Synopsis: Increasing the noncompetitive threshold for State leases of real property from less than 2,500 square feet to up to 5,000 square feet; altering the time frame during which the State is required to advertise the need for rental of building space from at least 30 days to 20 days before proposals for lease are due; requiring the advertisement to be in certain newspapers providing notice to at least the people of the affected locality; and requiring the notice to be posted on the Department's website and eMaryland Marketplace.
bill_summary: The bill increases the noncompetitive threshold for State leases of real property from 2,500 to 5,000 square feet, and changes the advertising requirements for leasing proposals, including reducing the notice period from 30 to 20 days and expanding the advertising platforms to include the Department's website and eMaryland Marketplace.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of General Services
stakeholders: State agencies and potential property lessees
innovative_summary: The bill employs an online procurement system, eMaryland Marketplace, to streamline and modernize the leasing advertisement process.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty as it mainly concerns leasing procedures and thresholds.

Title: Election Law – Special Elections
Synopsis: Altering requirements for scheduling special elections to fill vacancies in a county council or in the office of chief executive officer or county executive; requiring the State Administrator to conduct a special election in accordance with State law and regulations if the State Administrator determines a conflict exists between State law and regulations and a county charter or other county law relating to the conduct of a special election; etc.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland election law to alter requirements for scheduling special elections to fill vacancies in county councils or county executive offices. It allows counties to establish a single special election date, potentially eliminate a primary election, and specifies procedures for conducting the election, including mail-in voting options.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Voters in Maryland, county governments, and political parties involved in special elections
innovative_summary: The bill introduces flexible scheduling and voting procedures for special elections, including the possibility of eliminating primaries and using mail-in ballots with drop boxes, employing modern election practices.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's impact on child poverty is indirect and minimal, primarily affecting election procedures rather than social services or economic support.

Title: Estates and Trusts - Maryland Trust Decanting Act - Notification and Document Transmittal
Synopsis: Specifying the manner in which notice regarding an exercise of the decanting power or the sending of a document under the Maryland Trust Decanting Act is required to be provided.
bill_summary: This bill amends the Maryland Trust Decanting Act to specify acceptable methods for providing notice and transmitting documents related to decanting actions, including personal service, mail, courier, and agreed-upon alternative methods.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Estates and Trusts (or equivalent fiduciary oversight agency)
stakeholders: Trust beneficiaries, trustees, and estate planners in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill standardizes and clarifies the methods for notice and document transmission in trust decanting, employing established communication methods without introducing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily concerns procedural updates for trust decanting.

Title: Criminal Law - Crimes Relating to Animals - Conviction and Sentencing
Synopsis: Establishing that certain crimes relating to animals do not include certain activities; establishing that each animal harmed in a violation of a prohibition against animal cruelty is a separate offense and shall be deemed an individual victim for purposes of the sentencing guidelines stacking rule; establishing that a conviction for a crime relating to animals may not merge with a conviction for any other crime based on the act establishing the violation; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland's laws on animal cruelty, clarifying that certain activities like veterinary practices, research, and humane hunting are not considered cruelty. It establishes that each harmed animal is a separate offense and victim, and that convictions for animal cruelty cannot merge with other crimes, allowing for separate sentencing.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services or relevant law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Animals, animal welfare organizations, law enforcement, and the general public
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a legal framework that treats each harmed animal as a separate offense and victim, and prevents merging of animal cruelty convictions with other crimes, which is a more detailed approach to animal cruelty laws.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty.

Title: Heating, Ventilation, Air–Conditioning, and Refrigeration Contractors – License Restoration
Synopsis: Extending from 90 days to 4 years the time period during which an individual who has held a heating, ventilation, air-conditioning, and refrigeration contractor license may apply for license restoration after expiration.
bill_summary: The bill extends the period during which a licensed heating, ventilation, air-conditioning, and refrigeration contractor in Maryland can apply for license restoration from 90 days to 4 years after license expiration.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Heating, Ventilation, Air-Conditioning, and Refrigeration Contractors
stakeholders: Heating, ventilation, air-conditioning, and refrigeration contractors in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily changes the legal process for license restoration, increasing the time window from 90 days to 4 years, which is a procedural update rather than an innovative program.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Opioid-Associated Disease Prevention and Outreach Programs - Appeals and Membership of Standing Advisory Committee
Synopsis: Authorizing a local health department or community-based organization to appeal to the Secretary of Health or the Secretary's designee rather than to the Deputy Secretary for Public Health Services, an adverse decision of the Maryland Department of Health and a local health officer regarding an application for authorization to operate an Opioid-Associated Disease Prevention and Outreach Program; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes local health departments and community organizations to establish opioid prevention and outreach programs, outlines the application and appeal process for program authorization, establishes a standing advisory committee to support these programs, and sets regulations for their operation.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals affected by opioid use, local health departments, community organizations, law enforcement, healthcare providers, and families of individuals who inject drugs.
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured approach with a dedicated advisory committee and formalized appeal processes to support opioid prevention programs, employing collaborative and regulatory strategies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by addressing opioid-related issues that impact families and communities.

Title: Anne Arundel County - Class A (Off-Sale) and Class D (Off-Sale) Licenses - Population Ratio Quota
Synopsis: Establishing a population ratio quota for certain Class A (off-sale) and Class D (off-sale) licenses in Anne Arundel County; specifying a certain official map to be used to identify certain tax assessment districts for purposes of the population ratio quota; and prohibiting the Board of License Commissioners for Anne Arundel County from approving the transfer of certain alcoholic beverages licenses under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a population ratio quota for certain off-sale alcohol licenses in Anne Arundel County, limiting the number of licenses based on the population of specific assessment districts, and restricts license transfers outside these districts.
responsible_party: Anne Arundel County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Alcohol license holders, residents of Anne Arundel County, businesses in the county
innovative_summary: The bill employs a geographic and population-based approach to regulate alcohol licenses, using official maps and census data to control license distribution.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty as it mainly regulates alcohol licensing within a specific county.

Title: Insurance Pooling - Public Entity - Definition
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "public entity" to include a Resilience Authority for purposes of insurance pooling.
bill_summary: The bill amends the definition of 'public entity' to include Resilience Authorities, allowing them to participate in insurance pooling for casualty, property, or health insurance, or to self-insure against these risks.
responsible_party: Maryland State government, specifically local governments and Resilience Authorities
stakeholders: Resilience Authorities, local governments, and public entities involved in insurance pooling and resilience infrastructure projects
innovative_summary: The bill introduces the inclusion of Resilience Authorities into insurance pooling, which is a new approach to supporting resilience infrastructure through shared insurance mechanisms.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing more on infrastructure resilience and insurance mechanisms.

Title: Family and Medical Leave Insurance Program - Revisions
Synopsis: Defining "anchor date" to establish certain reference points for the calculation of a certain covered employee's average weekly wage and eligibility for increases in weekly benefits under the Family Medical Leave and Insurance Program; requiring the Maryland Department of Labor to adopt regulations establishing an optional self-employed enrollment program governing the participation of self-employed individuals in the Program; repealing certain requirements related to  contributions made by certain participating individuals; etc.
bill_summary: This bill revises the Maryland Family and Medical Leave Insurance Program by defining key terms, establishing an optional self-employed enrollment program, adjusting contribution and benefit calculation rules, and setting program timelines and reporting requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Employees, self-employed individuals, employers, and healthcare providers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces an optional self-employed enrollment program and adjusts benefit calculations, employing new approaches to program participation and funding.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by supporting workers during family and medical leave, but direct impact depends on program uptake and benefit levels.

Title: Maryland Farms and Families Fund – Purpose and Use – Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the purpose and use of the Maryland Farms and Families Fund to match purchases made with FMNP, SNAP, and WIC benefits at certain farmers markets and farm stands, support nonprofit farmers markets by providing logistical and marketing support to increase the use of federal nutrition programs at these markets, and to support nonprofit  organizations or other responsible persons to implement the Program.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the purpose and use of the Maryland Farms and Families Fund to support programs that increase access to fresh fruits and vegetables for food-insecure Maryland residents by matching federal nutrition benefits at farmers markets and supporting nonprofit organizations and farmers markets in implementing these programs.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Agriculture
stakeholders: Food-insecure Maryland residents, farmers, nonprofit organizations, farmers markets
innovative_summary: The program employs a coordinated approach to leverage federal nutrition benefits, support local farmers, and increase access to healthy foods through partnerships and matching funds.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to directly impact child poverty by increasing access to nutritious foods for low-income families.

Title: Consumer Protection - Automatic Renewals
Synopsis: Requiring a person who makes an automatic renewal offer to consumers to allow a consumer to cancel the automatic renewal in a cost-effective, timely, and easy-to-use manner; requiring automatic renewal offers to be displayed in a certain manner and contain certain information; establishing that compliance with certain regulations or a certain license shall be considered to be compliance with the Act; establishing that a violation of the Act is an unfair, abusive, or deceptive trade practice; etc.
bill_summary: This bill establishes regulations for automatic renewal offers, requiring clear disclosures, consumer rights to cancel, and prohibiting automatic charges without consent, to protect consumers from unfair trade practices.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Commerce or relevant consumer protection agency
stakeholders: Consumers engaging in automatic renewal contracts in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach to regulate automatic renewals, including clear disclosures and cancellation mechanisms, but does not introduce new technologies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on consumer protection does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Pesticide and Pest Control - Revisions to Pesticide Applicator's Law and Repeal of Obsolete Provisions
Synopsis: Establishing requirements for the commercial application of general use pesticides, the commercial application of restricted use pesticides, and the private application of restricted use pesticides; requiring a certified private applicator to ensure that certain individuals working under the certified applicator's supervision meet certain requirements; specifying the responsibility and liability of certified applicators for the application of certain pesticides; etc.
bill_summary: The bill revises Maryland's pesticide laws, establishing new requirements for the application of general use and restricted use pesticides, including certification and supervision rules, and repeals obsolete provisions related to certain pesticides and antifouling paints.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Agriculture
stakeholders: Pesticide applicators, agricultural producers, commercial boatyards, and the general public
innovative_summary: The bill updates and clarifies pesticide application regulations, including supervision and liability, but does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily affecting regulatory compliance and environmental safety.

Title: Electric Companies - Regional Transmission Organizations - Report (Utility Transparency and Accountability Act)
Synopsis: Requiring an electric company, other than a municipal electric utility, by February 1 each year, to submit a report to the Public Service Commission regarding each recorded vote cast by the electric company and any of its State affiliates at a meeting of a regional transmission organization.
bill_summary: The bill requires electric companies in Maryland to submit an annual report to the Public Service Commission detailing each recorded vote cast by the electric company and its affiliates at regional transmission organization meetings.
responsible_party: Public Service Commission of Maryland
stakeholders: Electric companies, regional transmission organizations, and consumers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces transparency measures by requiring detailed reporting of votes in regional transmission organizations, which is a new approach to oversight.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on transparency and accountability of electric companies.

Title: Maryland Correctional Training Commission – Membership
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the Maryland Correctional Training Commission to include the Director of the Division of Parole and Probation within the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services and one employee of the Division recommended by the exclusive representative for the employees of the Division of Parole and Probation and appointed by the Governor.
bill_summary: The bill amends the membership of the Maryland Correctional Training Commission to include the Director of the Division of Parole and Probation and an employee of the Division of Parole and Probation, appointed by the Governor.
responsible_party: Maryland Correctional Training Commission
stakeholders: Correctional officers, parole and probation employees, correctional institutions, criminal justice agencies
innovative_summary: The bill updates the commission's membership to include specific parole and probation division representatives, which is a standard administrative update without employing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Residential Property - Assignment of Contracts of Sale - Disclosure Requirements and Rescission
Synopsis: Authorizing a seller or assignee of certain residential property to rescind a contract of sale without penalty at any time before closing if a certain seller does not provide a certain notice; establishing that an assignee is entitled to a refund of any deposit paid in connection with the assignment of a contract of sale of the residential property under certain circumstances; requiring that a contract of sale comply with the requirements of the Act; and applying the Act prospectively.
bill_summary: This bill regulates the assignment and rescission of contracts of sale for residential property in Maryland. It requires disclosures from wholesale buyers and sellers and allows owners to rescind contracts before closing under certain conditions, including when the contract is assigned without proper notice.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Owners of residential property, wholesale buyers and sellers, and prospective buyers
innovative_summary: The bill introduces specific disclosure requirements and rescission rights related to the assignment of residential property contracts, which is a targeted regulatory approach rather than a new technological or innovative service.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on residential property transactions and disclosures is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Department of Housing and Community Development - Maryland Housing Rehabilitation Program - Local Rehabilitation Program Administration
Synopsis: Expanding the entities eligible to administer local rehabilitation programs to include certain nonprofit sponsors.
bill_summary: The bill expands the entities eligible to administer local rehabilitation programs under the Maryland Housing Rehabilitation Program to include certain nonprofit sponsors, and clarifies the roles and standards for these entities in managing rehabilitation loans.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Homeowners and communities in Maryland needing housing rehabilitation, nonprofit organizations, local governments
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a broader range of eligible entities, including nonprofits, to administer housing rehabilitation programs, and establishes standards and support for these entities, which is a moderate innovation in program administration.
child_poverty_direct_summary: By enabling more organizations to administer rehabilitation programs, the bill has the potential to improve housing conditions for low-income families, thereby potentially reducing child poverty.

Title: Climate Change Adaptation and Mitigation - Total Assessed Cost of Greenhouse Gas Emissions - Study and Reports
Synopsis: Requiring the Comptroller, in coordination with the Department of the Environment and the Department of Commerce, to conduct a study to assess the total cost of greenhouse gas emissions in the State and report certain findings to certain committees by December 1, 2026, on the total assessed cost of greenhouse gas emissions in the State based on the findings of the study; authorizing the Comptroller to hire a consultant to conduct the study; and requiring the report to include certain information and calculations.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Climate Change Adaptation and Mitigation Payment Program in Maryland, which requires certain fossil fuel companies to pay for their greenhouse gas emissions. It creates a fund to collect and disburse these payments to support infrastructure projects and programs that address climate change impacts, especially in vulnerable communities.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment and Maryland Department of Commerce
stakeholders: Fossil fuel companies, vulnerable communities, state agencies, general public
innovative_summary: The program employs a new approach by assigning liability to fossil fuel companies based on their historical emissions and requiring them to pay for climate change mitigation and adaptation efforts.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has high potential to impact child poverty by funding infrastructure and programs that benefit vulnerable communities, including children.

Title: Environment - Bay Restoration Fund - Septic System Upgrade Program
Synopsis: Updating the funding priorities for failing sewage systems and holding tanks; requiring as a second priority those located within the Maryland Chesapeake Bay 8-digit watershed that have a relative effectiveness for total nitrogen reduction of 9.24 or higher based on the Chesapeake Bay watershed model; requiring as a third priority funding for failing systems within the 500-year floodplain, and fourth to certain other failing systems; and expanding certain funding eligibility criteria for on-site and community sewage systems.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Department of the Environment to establish evaluation, ranking, and funding levels for nitrogen removal technologies for on-site sewage systems, expands funding eligibility, and prioritizes funding for upgrades and replacements to reduce nitrogen pollution, especially in critical water areas.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Residents and property owners with on-site sewage disposal systems, local governments, environmental agencies, and water quality stakeholders in Maryland.
innovative_summary: The bill employs a technology evaluation and ranking system to determine performance-based funding levels for nitrogen removal, integrating environmental technology assessment into government funding programs.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to improve water quality and public health, which can indirectly benefit children, but it does not directly target child poverty.

Title: State Department of Assessments and Taxation - Notification of Constant Yield Tax Rate - Alteration
Synopsis: Altering the requirement that the State Department of Assessments and Taxation notify each taxing authority of the constant yield tax rate for each taxable year by requiring that the notice be sent by the Department to a taxing authority only on the request of the taxing authority.
bill_summary: The bill alters the process for notifying taxing authorities about the constant yield tax rate by requiring the Department of Assessments and Taxation to send the notice only upon request, rather than automatically.
responsible_party: Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Taxing authorities and local governments in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a more request-based notification system for the constant yield tax rate, reducing automatic notifications and potentially increasing efficiency.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly changes notification procedures for tax rates.

Title: Criminal Procedure - Sexual Assault Exam and Treatment Reimbursement
Synopsis: Providing that the Governor's Office of Crime Prevention and Policy, rather than the Criminal Injuries Compensation Board, is responsible for payment to a physician, qualified health care provider, and hospital for providing certain services to a victim of an alleged rape or sexual offense or a victim of alleged child sexual abuse.
bill_summary: The bill shifts the responsibility for reimbursing physicians, healthcare providers, and hospitals for sexual assault and child sexual abuse treatment services from the Criminal Injuries Compensation Board to the Governor’s Office of Crime Prevention and Policy, effective June 1, 2025.
responsible_party: Governor’s Office of Crime Prevention and Policy
stakeholders: Victims of sexual assault and child sexual abuse, healthcare providers, hospitals
innovative_summary: The bill updates the reimbursement process for sexual assault services, streamlining it through a dedicated government office, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty but improves access to necessary healthcare services for victims, which may have indirect benefits.

Title: Estates and Trusts - Resignation of Trustee - Notice
Synopsis: Authorizing the trustee of a trust to resign under the Maryland Trust Act on 30 days' notice to qualified beneficiaries, the settlor, if living, all cotrustees, and any person that has a right to replace or appoint a successor to the resigning trustee.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland law to allow trustees of trusts to resign with at least 30 days' notice to specified parties or with court approval, and clarifies the process and protections involved.
responsible_party: Maryland Trust Law Enforcement
stakeholders: Trustees, beneficiaries, and parties involved in trust management in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a clearer process for trustees to resign, including notice requirements and court approval, streamlining trust management procedures.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily addresses trust management procedures.

Title: Child Care Centers - Certificated Staff Ratio Requirement - Alteration
Synopsis: Altering a requirement that a child care center that has 20 or more children have in attendance a certain ratio, set by the Department, of staff to children who hold a certificate in first aid and cardiopulmonary resuscitation under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill alters the staffing requirements for child care centers in Maryland, specifically changing the rules regarding the certification of staff responsible for supervision, including first aid and CPR certification, and modifies the ratio of certificate holders to children.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Child care centers, children, parents, and staff in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily makes regulatory changes to staffing requirements and does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on staffing and safety regulations has limited direct impact on child poverty but may improve overall child well-being.

Title: Department of Aging - Senior Call-Check and Social Connections Program
Synopsis: Renaming the Senior Call-Check Service and Notification Program to be the Senior Call-Check and Social Connections Program; providing that the purpose of the program is to provide regular, direct communication from the Department of Aging or the Department's designee to an eligible participant to promote wellness and purposeful social engagement; authorizing the integration of services between the Program and Telecommunications Access of Maryland to promote awareness of the availability of accessible telecommunications equipment; etc.
bill_summary: The bill renames the Senior Call–Check Service to the Senior Call–Check and Social Connections Program, and establishes this new program to provide regular communication and social engagement to older adults at risk of social isolation, including integration with the Telecommunications Access of Maryland. It also authorizes collaborations, contracts, and funding mechanisms for the program.
responsible_party: Department of Aging
stakeholders: Older adults at risk of social isolation in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive approach including various communication methods such as calls, texts, virtual, and in-person interactions, and integrates with accessible telecommunications services, employing technology and community-based models.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty indirectly by supporting social engagement and wellness among older adults, which can have positive ripple effects on families and communities.

Title: County Boards of Education - Curriculum Guides and Courses of Study - Discrepancies
Synopsis: Requiring each county board of education to adopt curriculum guides and courses of study aligned with content standards established by the State Department of Education; establishing a process for correcting discrepancies identified by the State Superintendent of Schools in a county board's curriculum guides and courses of study, including the imposition of certain penalties; requiring the Department, in consultation with certain teachers, to develop content and curriculum standards and resources for each subject at each grade level; etc.
bill_summary: The bill mandates the development of a comprehensive health education framework and curriculum for public schools in Maryland, including policies for parental opt-out and procedures for correcting curriculum discrepancies, with specific standards and resources to be developed and implemented.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Public school students, parents, teachers, and school administrators in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured, standardized health education framework with oversight, parental opt-out policies, and a process for correcting curriculum discrepancies, employing a coordinated approach across local and state agencies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to improve health education and related outcomes, which can contribute to reducing child poverty by promoting healthier lifestyles and better health literacy.

Title: Motor Home and Recreational Vehicle Shows in Worcester County - Permit for Out-of-State Dealers
Synopsis: Establishing the reciprocal out-of-state motor home and recreational trailer vehicle show permit, to be issued by the Motor Vehicle Administration, authorizing the holder to display motor homes and recreational vehicles at vehicle shows in Worcester County; and requiring a permit holder, after the permit is approved, to file a bond with the Administration.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a reciprocal out-of-state motor home and recreational vehicle show permit, allowing out-of-state dealers licensed in other states to display motor homes and recreational vehicles at shows in Worcester County, Maryland. It sets rules for permit issuance, bonding, and compliance.
responsible_party: Motor Vehicle Administration of Maryland
stakeholders: Out-of-state motor home and recreational vehicle dealers, residents of Worcester County, Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a reciprocal permit system for out-of-state vehicle dealers to participate in local vehicle shows, streamlining cross-state commerce and regulatory compliance.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly concerns vehicle show permits and out-of-state dealer regulations.

Title: Health - Maternal and Child Health Population Health Improvement Fund - Use
Synopsis: Altering from December 31, 2025, to December 31, 2027, the date through which the Maternal and Child Health Population Health Improvement Fund may be used for expenses associated with maternal and child health population health improvements.
bill_summary: This bill extends the use of the Maternal and Child Health Population Health Improvement Fund to December 31, 2027, allowing funds to be used for maternal and child health improvements.
responsible_party: Department and the Commission (unspecified agencies)
stakeholders: Maternal and child health populations in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily extends existing funding authority without introducing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve maternal and child health outcomes, which can reduce child poverty indirectly.

Title: Davis Martinez Public Employee Safety and Health Act
Synopsis: Requiring the Correctional Training Commission to adopt regulations for the training, issuance, and use of body-worn cameras by January 1, 2026; establishing the Public Employees' Safety and Health Unit in the Division of Labor and Industry to administer and enforce certain duties regarding the oversight of workplace safety and health of employees of certain public bodies; establishing and applying certain civil and criminal penalties to public bodies and persons in government; etc.
bill_summary: This bill updates Maryland's occupational safety and health laws to include public employees and public bodies, establishes regulations for correctional body-worn cameras, and enhances workplace violence prevention standards.
responsible_party: Maryland Division of Labor and Industry, Occupational Safety and Health Unit, and the Correctional Training Commission
stakeholders: Public employees, correctional officers, public bodies, and employees of public workplaces in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs new regulations for correctional body-worn cameras and expands workplace violence prevention standards, integrating technology and proactive safety measures.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving workplace safety and health, which can lead to better economic stability for families.

Title: Organized Retail Theft Act of 2025
Synopsis: Providing that multiple thefts committed by the same person in multiple counties under one scheme or continuing course of conduct may be joined and prosecuted in any county in which any one of the thefts occurred; prohibiting one or more persons from committing a series of thefts from retail merchants over a 90-day period with an aggregate value exceeding $1,500; requiring a court to make a finding as to whether a certain crime is organized retail theft under certain circumstances for a certain purpose; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes new laws and penalties related to organized retail theft in Maryland, including defining organized retail theft, setting thresholds for felony charges based on the value of stolen goods, and allowing multiple thefts under one scheme to be prosecuted together.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services or local law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Retail merchants, law enforcement, and consumers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a specific legal framework for organized retail theft, including the use of court findings to classify crimes and merging related convictions, which is a targeted approach to combat retail theft.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily focuses on criminal law and enforcement related to retail theft.

Title: Military Department – Chief of Staff and Aides – Appointment Authority
Synopsis: Authorizing the Adjutant General instead of the Governor to appoint certain staff in the Military Department; and establishing that certain staff in the Military Department serve at the pleasure of the Adjutant General instead of the Governor.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes the Adjutant General of Maryland's Military Department to appoint the chief of staff and aides, replacing the previous authority of the Governor, and specifies that these staff serve at the pleasure of the Adjutant General.
responsible_party: Maryland Military Department
stakeholders: Members of the Maryland Military Department and state military staff
innovative_summary: The bill shifts appointment authority from the Governor to the Adjutant General for certain military staff, streamlining military appointment processes.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Motor Vehicles - Speed Monitoring Systems -
Synopsis: Altering the penalties for a civil citation issued as a result of a recorded image produced by a speed monitoring system; requiring the State Highway Administration to convene a workgroup to study best practices regarding speed monitoring systems in school zones; and requiring the workgroup to submit its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly by December 1, 2025.
bill_summary: This bill modifies penalties for speeding violations recorded by speed monitoring systems and requires the Maryland State Highway Administration to convene a workgroup to study best practices for speed monitoring systems in school zones, including their placement and effectiveness.
responsible_party: Maryland State Highway Administration
stakeholders: Drivers, local governments, law enforcement, students, and school communities in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a data-driven approach by studying best practices for speed monitoring in school zones, which is a relatively new approach to traffic safety management.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on traffic safety and monitoring practices.

Title: Therapeutic Child Care Grant Program - Funding - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the fiscal years to include fiscal year 2027 through fiscal year 2029, during which the Governor is required to include in the annual budget bill an appropriation of $3,700,000 to the Therapeutic Child Care Grant Program.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the funding structure and fiscal years for the Therapeutic Child Care Grant Program in Maryland, including the amount allocated annually and the distribution to providers.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education
stakeholders: Children under 6 with developmental delays, physical disabilities, or behavioral challenges, and child care providers
innovative_summary: The bill primarily adjusts funding allocations and fiscal years; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to improve early childhood development for vulnerable children, which can help reduce child poverty.

Title: Drunk Driving - Commercial Driver's Licenses - Disqualification From Driving
Synopsis: Requiring the Motor Vehicle Administration to disqualify any individual from driving a commercial motor vehicle for 1 year if the individual, while holding a commercial instructional permit or commercial driver's license, drives or attempts to drive any motor vehicle while the alcohol concentration of the person's blood or breath is 0.08 or greater.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration to disqualify individuals from driving commercial motor vehicles for specified periods if they commit certain alcohol-related offenses, including driving with a blood alcohol concentration of 0.08 or higher.
responsible_party: Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration
stakeholders: Commercial drivers and the general public
innovative_summary: The bill updates existing disqualification rules to include a new blood alcohol concentration threshold of 0.08 for commercial drivers, aligning with general alcohol standards.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily concerns driver disqualifications for alcohol offenses.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Towed, Removed, or Abandoned Vehicles - Electronic Notice to Owner
Synopsis: Authorizing a person who tows or removes a vehicle from a parking lot to provide electronic notice of the tow or removal to the vehicle owner through the Motor Vehicle Administration under certain circumstances; and authorizing a police department that takes an abandoned vehicle into custody to send an electronic notice to the last known registered owner of the vehicle through the Administration under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes towing companies and police departments to send electronic notices to vehicle owners regarding towed, removed, or abandoned vehicles, replacing some traditional mailing notices, and establishes procedures for notification and vehicle impoundment.
responsible_party: Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration and local police departments
stakeholders: Vehicle owners, towing companies, police departments, and vehicle insurers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces electronic notification systems for vehicle towing and abandonment notices, leveraging digital communication to improve efficiency and timeliness.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving vehicle owner notification processes, which could reduce vehicle-related issues for families.

Title: Uninsured Employers' Fund - Assessments and Special Monitor
Synopsis: Altering the circumstances under which the Uninsured Employers' Fund must collect or suspend a certain assessment; altering, from 1% to up to 1.5%, the additional percentage the Uninsured Employers' Fund Board may direct the Workers' Compensation Commission to assess on awards and settlements if the Board determines that the reserves of the Fund are inadequate to meet anticipated losses; and requiring the Workers' Compensation Commission to designate a special monitor to assess the financial condition of the Uninsured Employers' Fund.
