bill_summary: The bill modifies the assessment process for the Maryland Uninsured Employers' Fund, including increasing the assessment rate when reserves are inadequate, establishing a special monitor to assess the fund's financial condition, and setting specific funding and reporting requirements.
responsible_party: Workers’ Compensation Commission
stakeholders: Employers, insurers, and workers in Maryland, especially those involved with uninsured employers and workers' compensation claims.
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a dedicated special monitor to oversee the financial health of the Uninsured Employers' Fund, which is a new approach to fund oversight and transparency.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on fund management and assessment.

Title: Public Schools - Restorative Practices Schools - Comprehensive Plan
Synopsis: Requiring the State Department of Education to develop a comprehensive plan by July 1, 2026, for the establishment of Restorative Practices Schools which integrate restorative practices into daily practices and activities of the whole school; requiring a county board of education to use the comprehensive plan if the county board chooses to establish a Restorative Practices School; and requiring the Department to report to the Governor and the General Assembly by December 1, 2026, on the comprehensive plan for Restorative Practices Schools.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Education to develop a comprehensive plan for establishing Restorative Practices Schools, which integrate restorative practices into daily school activities to improve discipline, school climate, and student outcomes. It also mandates the use of a statewide plan by local school systems if they choose to establish such schools.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Students, teachers, school administrators, and families in Maryland public schools
innovative_summary: The bill promotes the integration of restorative practices into school culture, including training models, standards, and outcome metrics, representing a comprehensive and innovative approach to school discipline and climate improvement.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to improve school climate and reduce disciplinary disparities, which can contribute to reducing child poverty impacts related to school experiences.

Title: Election Law - Notice to Permanent Absentee Voters
Synopsis: Altering the time before an election when a certain notice is required to be sent to each voter who is on the permanent absentee ballot list; repealing a requirement that the notice be sent to each voter who is on the permanent absentee ballot list as of a certain date; and altering the action the State Board of Elections is required to take if the State Board is unable to contact a voter who is on the permanent absentee ballot list using the method of communication chosen by the voter.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the procedures for notifying voters on the permanent absentee ballot list in Maryland. It changes the timing of the notice, clarifies the actions if contact cannot be made, and updates communication methods.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Voters on the permanent absentee ballot list in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs modern communication methods such as email and text messaging for voter notification, updating traditional mailing procedures.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on election communication procedures.

Title: Consumer Protection – False Advertising – Digital Goods
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person that is a seller from advertising or offering for sale a digital good using certain terminology unless, before executing the sale, a certain affirmative acknowledgment is received from the purchaser or a certain clear and conspicuous statement is provided by the seller; and establishing that a violation of the Act is an unfair, abusive, or deceptive trade practice subject to certain enforcement and penalty provisions.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits deceptive advertising of digital goods, requiring sellers to obtain acknowledgment from buyers that they are purchasing a license rather than ownership, and to provide clear statements about license terms. It also bans advertising digital goods alongside time-limited rental options without proper disclosures.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Commerce or Consumer Protection Agency
stakeholders: Consumers purchasing digital goods in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces new legal requirements for digital good advertising, emphasizing clear license disclosures and acknowledgment, which is a relatively new approach to digital consumer protection.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on digital advertising regulations.

Title: State Finance and Procurement - Local Cybersecurity Preparedness and Response Plan and Assessment - Repeal
Synopsis: Repealing a duplicative provision of law requiring each county government, local school system, and local health department, in consultation with the local emergency manager, to create or update a cybersecurity preparedness and response plan and complete a cybersecurity preparedness assessment in a manner and frequency established by the Department of Information Technology.
bill_summary: The bill repeals a law requiring local government entities in Maryland to create or update cybersecurity preparedness and response plans and complete assessments.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Information Technology
stakeholders: Local government entities in Maryland, including counties, local school systems, and local health departments
innovative_summary: The bill does not introduce new programs or initiatives; it removes existing requirements.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has no direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Human Services - Maryland Assistive Technology Program - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Assistive Technology Program in the Department of Disabilities; providing the purpose of the Program is to increase access to assistive technology services and devices for individuals with disabilities, support the State's efforts to provide assistive technology services and devices to persons with disabilities of all ages, including underrepresented populations, and ensure statewide access to assistive technology lending libraries; establishing the Assistive Technology Services Fund; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Assistive Technology Program within the Department of Disabilities to provide assistive technology devices and services to individuals with disabilities. It creates a dedicated fund, the Assistive Technology Services Fund, to support the program's operations and related activities.
responsible_party: Department of Disabilities
stakeholders: Individuals with disabilities in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive approach by integrating assistive technology services, device provision, and digital accessibility initiatives, supported by a dedicated fund and federal grant activities.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to directly impact child poverty by improving access to assistive technology for children with disabilities, thereby supporting their education and development.

Title: Public Safety - Fuel Gas Piping Systems and Corrugated Stainless Steel Tubing - Prohibitions and Study
Synopsis: Prohibiting the sale, offer for sale, transfer, or distribution of non-arc-resistant jacketed corrugated stainless steel tubing; providing a civil penalty of up to $1,000 for a violation of the Act; and requiring the Maryland Department of Labor and the Office of the State Fire Marshal, by September 1, 2026, to submit a final report to the Governor and certain committees of the General Assembly with recommendations related to preventing the fire hazards associated with commonly used fuel gas piping systems.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits the sale and use of non–arc-resistant jacketed corrugated stainless steel tubing that does not meet specific safety standards for use in fuel gas piping systems, and mandates a study on fire hazards related to fuel gas piping, including gas piping and stainless steel tubing, in residential and commercial buildings.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor and the Office of the State Fire Marshal
stakeholders: Manufacturers, builders, homeowners, and residents in Maryland using fuel gas piping systems
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive study and recommendation process to improve safety standards for fuel gas piping systems, including analyzing fire hazards and industry standards.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on safety standards and fire hazard prevention.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Exceptional Hauling Permits for Farm Products
Synopsis: Creating an exception for vehicles carrying fluid milk products to the prohibition against driving a vehicle subject to an exceptional hauling permit on the interstate highway system; altering certain weight limits and tolerances under an exceptional hauling permit; altering the preventive maintenance documents that an individual operating under an exceptional hauling permit must possess; and altering certain record-keeping requirements and the application of certain administrative penalties under an exceptional hauling permit.
bill_summary: The bill creates an exception for vehicles carrying fluid milk products from certain restrictions under the exceptional hauling permit rules, including restrictions on interstate highway use, weight limits, and record-keeping requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland State Highway Administration
stakeholders: Farmers, dairy producers, and transportation companies involved in hauling milk products in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces specific regulations and exceptions for milk transportation, including permit fee adjustments and record-keeping requirements, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily affecting dairy transportation regulations.

Title: Anne Arundel County – Public Schools – School Schedule Options
Synopsis: Authorizing the Anne Arundel County Board of Education to operate all schools within the county using a scheduling model that eliminates early dismissal days to allow for less than 180 school days if the minimal hours of attendance are met; requiring the board, if it elects to use a scheduling model that results in a school in the county being open for less than 180 days to offer certain school employees an opportunity to make up the lost wages; and requiring the Board to make a report on the schools using an alternative scheduling model.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Anne Arundel County to operate public schools using a flexible scheduling model that can eliminate early dismissal days and operate for fewer than 180 school days, provided the minimum 1,080 hours are met. It requires reporting on these alternative schedules and ensures employees can make up lost wages.
responsible_party: Anne Arundel County Board of Education
stakeholders: Students, teachers, and staff in Anne Arundel County public schools
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a flexible, alternative scheduling model for public schools, allowing for fewer school days with the same minimum hours, which is a new approach to school scheduling.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to impact child poverty by providing flexible scheduling options that could improve attendance and educational stability.

Title: Corporations and Associations - Electric Cooperatives - Nonescheat Capital Credits
Synopsis: Providing that certain unclaimed money held by an electric cooperative and due to a past member is not considered abandoned property; and authorizing an electric cooperative to use this money only to assist members of the cooperative or make donations to nonprofit, charitable organizations.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies that unclaimed money held by electric cooperatives and due to past members, specifically nonescheat capital credits, is not considered abandoned property and can only be used for certain purposes such as assisting members or making donations to nonprofits.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Commerce or relevant electric cooperatives
stakeholders: Past members of electric cooperatives and electric cooperatives themselves
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a specific classification for nonescheat capital credits, allowing their use for designated purposes, which is a new approach to handling unclaimed cooperative funds.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on the management of cooperative funds.

Title: Maryland Veterans Trust – Assistance to Members of the Maryland National Guard
Synopsis: Expanding the purposes of the Maryland Veterans Trust to include providing monetary and other assistance to members of the Maryland National Guard and their families; and authorizing the Maryland Veterans Trust to expend money from the Maryland Veterans Trust Fund to provide loans and grants to members of the Maryland National Guard and their families.
bill_summary: The bill expands the purposes of the Maryland Veterans Trust to include providing assistance, such as loans and grants, to members of the Maryland National Guard and their families.
responsible_party: Maryland Veterans Trust (under the Department of State Government)
stakeholders: Members of the Maryland National Guard and their families, veterans, and programs supporting veterans and their families
innovative_summary: The bill enhances existing veteran support programs by explicitly including National Guard members and their families, and authorizes the Trust to provide loans and grants, which is a standard approach in veteran assistance programs.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on support for National Guard members and veterans.

Title: Maryland Public Ethics Law - Training and Financial Disclosure Requirements - Revisions
Synopsis: Altering the format and content of training on the requirements of the Maryland Public Ethics Law provided by the State Ethics Commission to certain State employees and regulated lobbyists to be either through online training or live presentation on the conflict of interest, financial disclosure, relevant administrative, and other applicable requirements of the law; and altering the scope of disclosure for the employment of an individual or a member of the individual's immediate family reported in a financial disclosure statement.
bill_summary: The bill revises the Maryland Public Ethics Law by changing the format of ethics training courses for state officials and lobbyists, expanding disclosure requirements for employment and business interests, and updating related rules.
responsible_party: Maryland State Ethics Commission
stakeholders: State officials, lobbyists, and public employees in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates existing rules and requirements; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, focusing on ethics and disclosure rules.

Title: State Government - Information Technology - Cybersecurity Revisions
Synopsis: Altering the duties of the Cyber Preparedness Unit in the Maryland Department of Emergency Management; altering the duties of the Office of Security Management in the Department of Information Technology; requiring the Office to submit a yearly report to the Governor and certain committees of the General Assembly on the State's cybersecurity expenditures and recommendations for changes to the budget; and altering the responsibilities of the Secretary of Information Technology with regard to information technology policies.
bill_summary: The bill revises the duties and responsibilities of the Maryland Department of Emergency Management's Cyber Preparedness Unit and the Department of Information Technology's Office of Security Management. It enhances coordination, reporting, and strategic planning for cybersecurity across state and local government entities, including annual reports on cybersecurity activities and expenditures, and establishes standards and support for cybersecurity preparedness and response.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Information Technology and Maryland Department of Emergency Management
stakeholders: State and local government agencies, local school systems, local health departments, and other public entities involved in cybersecurity
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive, coordinated approach to cybersecurity, including annual reporting, development of standards, and regional exercises, which is a modern approach to government cybersecurity strategy.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on cybersecurity infrastructure and coordination.

Title: Peace Orders and Criminal Harassment - Intentional Visual Surveillance
Synopsis: Expanding the relief that may be included in a final peace order; altering the acts that constitute criminal harassment to include certain visual surveillance of an area of another person's residence where the other has a reasonable expectation of privacy; and providing that a person who violates the Act is guilty of a misdemeanor and on conviction for a first offense is subject to imprisonment of up to 90 days or a fine of $500 or both, and for a second or subsequent offense, imprisonment of up to 180 days or a fine of $1,000 or both.
bill_summary: The bill expands the legal protections against visual surveillance and harassment by allowing individuals to seek peace orders against those who conduct intentional visual surveillance of areas where they have a reasonable expectation of privacy, including their residence. It also modifies the acts that constitute criminal harassment to include such visual surveillance and provides remedies in peace orders, such as removing or repositioning surveillance devices.
responsible_party: Maryland Courts and Judicial Proceedings
stakeholders: Residents and individuals concerned about privacy and harassment
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a legal framework to address intentional visual surveillance, including the use of surveillance devices, as part of harassment and peace order proceedings, which is a new approach to privacy protection in Maryland.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly target child poverty but enhances privacy protections, which could indirectly benefit vulnerable populations.

Title: Charitable Organizations - Late Fees and Registration - Suspension and Cancellation Requirements
Synopsis: Authorizing the Secretary of State to suspend payment of certain late fees assessed to certain charitable organizations that fail to file an annual report under certain circumstances; and authorizing the Secretary of State to cancel a charitable organization's registration or reinstate a charitable organization's canceled registration under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill updates regulations for charitable organizations in Maryland, including fee structures, late fee suspension, and registration cancellation and reinstatement procedures.
responsible_party: Secretary of State of Maryland
stakeholders: Charitable organizations operating in Maryland and the public they serve
innovative_summary: The bill introduces provisions for suspending late fees and streamlines registration cancellation and reinstatement processes, employing regulatory adjustments to improve oversight.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily affecting organizational compliance and oversight.

Title: Marriage - Confidential Communication
Synopsis: Clarifying that "spouse" includes a former spouse for purposes of disclosure of confidential communications occurring during marriage; and establishing that a spouse, who is the alleged victim, is competent to disclose a confidential communication between spouses occurring during their marriage in a criminal action in which one spouse is charged with a crime against the other spouse.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies that a spouse includes a former spouse for the purpose of disclosing confidential communications during marriage, and establishes that a spouse who is the alleged victim can disclose confidential communications in criminal cases where one spouse is charged with a crime against the other.
responsible_party: Maryland Courts and Judicial Proceedings
stakeholders: Spouses, victims, defendants in criminal cases involving spouses
innovative_summary: The bill updates legal definitions and rules regarding confidential communications between spouses, including former spouses, and their admissibility in criminal cases.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Family Law - Adoption of an Adult
Synopsis: Limiting the requirement that a petitioner's spouse join in the petition for adoption to apply only when the prospective adoptee is a minor; authorizing a petitioner's spouse to join in the petition for adoption if the prospective adoptee is an adult; establishing that certain provisions of law requiring the issuance and service of a show-cause order on a prospective adoptee's parents do not apply if the prospective adoptee is an adult; etc.
bill_summary: This bill amends Maryland family law to allow the adoption of adults, removing certain requirements such as parental consent and the involvement of a spouse in the adoption process when the adoptee is an adult. It also modifies procedures related to investigations and service of legal notices in adult adoption cases.
responsible_party: Maryland Judiciary or Family Law Court System
stakeholders: Adults seeking adoption, their families, and legal system
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a legal framework for the adoption of adults, which is a relatively uncommon practice, and modifies existing procedures to accommodate adult adoptees, representing a new approach in family law.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily concerns adult adoption procedures.

Title: Human Services - Adult Protective Services
Synopsis: Specifying that certain provisions of law relating to confidentiality do not prohibit the disclosure of certain information relating to adult protective services or the disclosure of the identity of certain persons making certain reports under certain circumstances; expanding the definition of "health practitioner" to include certain emergency medical providers; and authorizing individuals who are required in specific instances to report information regarding alleged vulnerable adults to make a report by calling the statewide reporting hotline.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland laws to clarify the confidentiality rules related to adult protective services, expands the definition of health practitioners to include certain emergency medical services providers, and allows certain mandated reporters to make reports via a statewide hotline. It also specifies circumstances under which information can be disclosed and enhances procedures for reporting suspected abuse or neglect of vulnerable adults.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Human Services
stakeholders: Vulnerable adults, adult protective services workers, health practitioners, law enforcement, and the general public
innovative_summary: The bill employs a modernized approach to reporting and confidentiality, including the use of a statewide hotline for reporting adult abuse and expanding the scope of professionals involved in investigations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill primarily focuses on adult protective services and does not directly target child poverty, so its impact on child poverty is minimal.

Title: Residential Real Property - Local Limits on Summoning Law Enforcement or Emergency Services
Synopsis: Prohibiting a local jurisdiction from enforcing a law or ordinance that limits the summoning of law enforcement or emergency services to a residential property by establishing a certain threshold or penalty.
bill_summary: This bill prohibits local jurisdictions in Maryland from enacting or enforcing laws that set thresholds or penalties for summoning law enforcement or emergency services to residential properties, including limits on the number of calls or penalties such as fines, eviction, or license revocation.
responsible_party: Maryland local governments and law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Residents, property owners, tenants, law enforcement, local governments
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a legal restriction on local laws that limit or penalize summoning emergency services, which is a new legal approach to protect residents' rights to call for help without fear of penalties.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly addresses legal protections related to emergency calls.

Title: Human Services – Local Departments of Social Services – Audits
Synopsis: Altering the frequency, from once every 3 years to an interval of once every 4 years unless it is determined on a case-by-case basis that an audit occur at an interval of 3 years, with which the Office of the Inspector General in the Department of Human Services conducts or contracts for financial and compliance audits of local departments of social services.
bill_summary: The bill changes the frequency of financial and compliance audits conducted by the Office of the Inspector General in the Maryland Department of Human Services for local departments of social services, extending the interval from once every 3 years to a range of 3 to 4 years, with case-by-case exceptions for more frequent audits.
responsible_party: Office of the Inspector General in the Department of Human Services
stakeholders: Local departments of social services and their clients in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a flexible, risk-based approach to audit scheduling, allowing for more tailored oversight rather than fixed intervals.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily affecting oversight of social services.

Title: Health Occupations Boards - Membership Alteration and Sunset Extensions
Synopsis: Continuing certain health occupations boards and the Behavior Analyst Advisory Committee within the State Board of Professional Counselors and Therapists in accordance with the provisions of the Maryland Program Evaluation Act (sunset law) by extending to a certain date the termination provisions relating to the statutory and regulatory authority of the boards and Committee; and altering the membership of the State Board of Massage Therapy Examiners.
bill_summary: The bill extends the sunset dates for several health occupations boards and committees in Maryland, including the State Board of Examiners for Audiologists, Hearing Aid Dispensers, Speech–Language Pathologists, and Music Therapists, the State Board of Massage Therapy Examiners, the State Board of Pharmacy, the State Board of Professional Counselors and Therapists, and the Behavior Analyst Advisory Committee. It also makes changes to the membership of the Massage Therapy Examiners Board.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and relevant licensing boards
stakeholders: Health professionals, licensing boards, and the public seeking health services in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily focuses on extending existing regulatory structures and adjusting membership, with no new technologies or innovative approaches introduced.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty or include specific programs aimed at reducing it.

Title: Economic Development - West North Avenue Development Authority - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the administration and membership of the West North Avenue Development Authority; specifying the powers and duties of the Authority, subject to certain limitations; requiring the Authority to take certain actions regarding the finances of the Authority; exempting the Authority from certain taxation or assessments under certain circumstances; establishing the West North Avenue Development Authority Fund as a special, nonlapsing fund; altering the termination date of the Authority; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the West North Avenue Development Authority in Baltimore City to promote economic development, redevelopment, and community revitalization along the West North Avenue corridor. It details the authority's powers, governance, funding, and exemptions from certain laws, and aims to make the authority self-sustaining by fiscal year 2028.
responsible_party: West North Avenue Development Authority
stakeholders: Residents, businesses, and community organizations in the West North Avenue corridor in Baltimore City
innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive, multi-stakeholder approach to urban redevelopment, with a focus on economic growth, community engagement, and self-sustainability, utilizing a dedicated development authority and special fund.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to impact child poverty by revitalizing neighborhoods, creating jobs, and improving community resources.

Title: Public Safety - Statewide DNA Database System, DNA Collection, and Penalties - Alterations
Synopsis: Requiring a certain DNA sample to be collected in a certain manner from an individual who is required to register as a sex offender; requiring a DNA sample to be collected by a certain individual or at a certain location under certain circumstances; requiring a custodial agency or correctional facility to ensure a DNA sample is collected in a certain manner; prohibiting a DNA sample from being tested and placed in a certain statewide DNA database system until certain conditions are met; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland's laws regarding the collection, testing, and expungement of DNA samples from individuals involved in criminal cases, including those required to register as sex offenders, and establishes procedures for destruction and expungement of DNA records.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of State Police, Forensic Sciences Division
stakeholders: Individuals involved in criminal cases, sex offenders, law enforcement agencies, and the general public
innovative_summary: The bill introduces detailed procedures for DNA sample collection, testing, and expungement, including new regulations for destruction of untested samples and records, and enhances privacy protections.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on criminal justice procedures.

Title: Criminal Law - Drug Paraphernalia - Prohibitions and Penalties
Synopsis: Altering the penalties for a person using or possessing with intent to use, delivering or selling under certain circumstances, or manufacturing or possessing with intent to deliver or sell under certain circumstances drug paraphernalia to inject, ingest, inhale, or otherwise introduce into the human body a controlled dangerous substance; removing intent to administer a controlled dangerous substance from a certain list of intents; etc.
bill_summary: This bill amends Maryland law to alter penalties for possession, use, delivery, or sale of drug paraphernalia related to controlled dangerous substances. It removes certain prohibitions, clarifies circumstances under which penalties apply, and increases penalties for certain violations, including those involving minors.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services or law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Individuals involved in drug use, possession, or distribution, including minors and adults, and the broader community impacted by drug-related offenses.
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates and clarifies existing drug paraphernalia laws, with some adjustments to penalties, but does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly concerns legal penalties and law enforcement related to drug paraphernalia.

Title: Estates and Trusts - Priority of Claims on an Estate - Unpaid Child Support
Synopsis: Prioritizing the payment of unpaid child support over certain other claims on an estate of a decedent with insufficient assets to pay all claims in full.
bill_summary: This bill amends Maryland law to prioritize the payment of unpaid child support over certain other claims on an estate of a decedent when assets are insufficient to pay all claims in full.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Estates and Trusts (or equivalent estate management agency)
stakeholders: Families owed child support, estate administrators, and beneficiaries
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a legal priority for unpaid child support in estate settlement processes, which is a targeted legal reform rather than a technological innovation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: By prioritizing unpaid child support, the bill has the potential to improve financial stability for children and families, thereby reducing child poverty.

Title: Department of Agriculture - Maryland Agricultural Commission and Young Farmers
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the Maryland Agricultural Commission; establishing the Committee on Young Farmers for purposes of  communicating to the Maryland Agricultural Commission on issues relating to young and beginning farmers in the State; repealing the provisions of law establishing and governing the Young Farmers Advisory Board; and requiring the Maryland Agricultural Land Preservation Foundation to be governed and administered by a board of trustees composed in a certain manner.
bill_summary: The bill redefines the membership and structure of the Maryland Agricultural Commission, establishes a new Committee on Young Farmers to represent young and beginning farmers, and repeals the previous Young Farmers Advisory Board. It aims to enhance representation and address issues related to young farmers in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Agriculture
stakeholders: Young and beginning farmers in Maryland, agricultural industry stakeholders, Maryland Agricultural Commission
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a dedicated committee focused on young farmers, emphasizing regional diversity and direct involvement of young farmers in policy discussions, which is a relatively innovative approach to agricultural policy.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to impact child poverty indirectly by supporting young farmers, which can lead to economic stability and community development.

Title: Dental Services - Qualification for Maryland Dent-Care Program
Synopsis: Altering the eligibility criteria for Higher Education Loan Assistance Grants under the Maryland Dent-Care Program to include part-time employment.
bill_summary: The bill modifies eligibility criteria for the Maryland Dent–Care Program's loan assistance grants for dental professionals, establishes grant amounts, and requires a study on the use of online credentialing systems by dental insurance carriers.
responsible_party: Office of Student Financial Assistance and Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Dental professionals, dental patients, Maryland Medical Assistance Program recipients
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a loan assistance program for dental professionals and mandates a study on the use of online credentialing systems, employing new approaches to healthcare workforce support and administrative efficiency.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve access to dental care for low-income populations by incentivizing providers to serve Medicaid recipients.

Title: Hospitals - Financial Assistance and Collection of Debts - Policies
Synopsis: Altering provisions of law related to a hospital's financial assistance and collection of debts policies; specifying the percentage by which a hospital is required to reduce a patient's out-of-pocket expenses under certain circumstances; adding to the notice requirements relating to a hospital's financial assistance policy; prohibiting a hospital from filing a civil action to collect a debt against a patient whose outstanding debt is at or below $500; etc.
bill_summary: This bill updates Maryland laws regarding hospital financial assistance, debt collection policies, and legal procedures, including limits on civil actions, interest charges, and requirements for hospital notices and patient rights.
responsible_party: Maryland Health Care Commission and hospitals in Maryland
stakeholders: Hospital patients, especially those with low or no income, and hospitals
innovative_summary: The bill introduces comprehensive reforms to hospital billing and debt collection practices, emphasizing transparency, patient rights, and limits on aggressive collection actions, but does not employ new technologies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by making hospital billing more accessible and reducing financial barriers for low-income families.

Title: Data Center Impact Analysis and Report
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of the Environment, the Maryland Energy Administration, and the University of Maryland School of Business, in coordination with the Department of Legislative Services, to conduct an analysis of the likely environmental, energy, and economic impacts of data center development in the State; and requiring the Department of Legislative Services to coordinate preparation of the final report to be submitted to the Governor and the General Assembly by September 1, 2026.
bill_summary: This bill requires Maryland state agencies and the University of Maryland to analyze the environmental, energy, and economic impacts of data center development in the state, and to report their findings by September 1, 2026.
responsible_party: Department of the Environment, Maryland Energy Administration, University of Maryland School of Business, Department of Legislative Services
stakeholders: Data center industry, environmental agencies, energy sector, Maryland residents
innovative_summary: The bill employs a coordinated analysis approach involving multiple agencies and academic expertise to assess impacts of data centers, which is a comprehensive and collaborative approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly target child poverty but could indirectly impact it through environmental and economic assessments.

Title: Maryland Department of Planning – Modernization
Synopsis: Requiring the State Administrator of Elections to electronically submit certain precinct boundary information to the Secretary of Planning; altering certain requirements related to the Department of Planning preparing population projections for the Washington and Baltimore metropolitan areas to authorize the use of population figures developed by the Baltimore Metropolitan Council, the Metropolitan Washington Council of Governments and their member jurisdictions; etc.
bill_summary: The bill updates and modernizes the Maryland Department of Planning's responsibilities, including population projections, information management, and coordination with other agencies, and clarifies procedures for project approval and planning data sharing.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Planning
stakeholders: State and local government agencies, planning organizations, and residents of Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs modernized data sharing, updated population projections, and enhanced inter-agency coordination to improve planning processes.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving planning and resource allocation.

Title: Residential Leases - Late Payment Penalties - Calculation
Synopsis: Altering a prohibition concerning the maximum penalty for the late payment of rent that a landlord may charge in a residential lease to prohibit a penalty in excess of 5% of the amount of the unpaid rent rather than of the amount due.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland law to limit late payment penalties for residential rent to a maximum of 5% of the unpaid rent, replacing the previous limit of a percentage of the total rent due. It also clarifies enforcement and applicability of these rules.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Residential tenants and landlords in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a straightforward regulatory approach to cap late payment penalties, which is a common legal measure rather than a new technological or innovative approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily regulates late rent penalties for tenants.

Title: Family Law - Child Support - Multifamily Adjustment
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "adjusted actual income" under the State child support guidelines by requiring the deduction, from actual income, of an allowance for support for each child in the parent's home for whom the parent owes a legal duty of support but who is not subject to a support order; requiring that the amount of a certain allowance be subtracted from a parent's actual income before the court determines the amount of a child support award; etc.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland's child support laws by redefining 'adjusted actual income' to include a new allowance for support for children living in a parent's home, and specifies how this allowance is calculated and deducted before determining child support obligations. It also clarifies factors the court may consider when deviating from standard guidelines.
responsible_party: Maryland Judiciary or Family Law Courts
stakeholders: Parents, children, and families involved in child support cases in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new calculation method for child support that considers additional support obligations for children living in a parent's home, employing a more detailed approach to income and support calculations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by ensuring fairer child support calculations, especially for children in non-traditional living arrangements.

Title: State Government - Forms - Reporting Requirement - Repeal
Synopsis: Repealing a requirement that certain departments or units of State government annually submit a report on the management of forms to the Department of General Services.
bill_summary: This bill repeals the requirement for certain state departments to submit an annual report on their form management activities.
responsible_party: Department of General Services or relevant state departments
stakeholders: State government departments and units, and the general public who use government forms
innovative_summary: The bill simplifies government reporting requirements by removing an annual reporting obligation, which is a procedural change rather than an innovative program.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Environment - Water Bottle Filling Stations - Requirement
Synopsis: Requiring a water bottle filling station or a combined water bottle filling station and drinking fountain to be installed in certain new construction or as part of certain renovations beginning October 1, 2025, subject to certain exceptions; requiring the Maryland Department of Labor to adopt regulations to carry out the provisions of the Act; and applying the Act prospectively.
bill_summary: The bill requires that starting October 1, 2025, new construction and renovations in Maryland include water bottle filling stations in certain locations, replacing or supplementing drinking fountains, with some exceptions.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Public, building owners, and users of public buildings in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a regulatory approach to mandate the installation of water bottle filling stations in new and renovated buildings, promoting environmental sustainability and public health.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty but promotes access to clean drinking water in public spaces.

Title: Municipalities - Annexation Resolutions - Submission to Department of Planning
Synopsis: Adding the Department of Planning to the list of entities to which a municipality must send a copy of an annexation resolution with the new municipal boundaries.
bill_summary: This bill requires municipalities in Maryland to send a copy of their annexation resolution with new boundaries to the Department of Planning, in addition to other entities, within 10 days of the resolution taking effect.
responsible_party: Department of Planning
stakeholders: Municipalities and residents affected by annexation in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates administrative procedures for municipal annexation notifications, with no new technologies or innovative approaches introduced.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Procurement – Electronic Transactions – Clarification of Fees Due
Synopsis: Specifying that fees collected for electronic transactions for procurements are those due to the State and not any fees due to a third party.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies that fees collected for electronic procurement transactions are owed to the State of Maryland, not to third parties, and specifies procedures for charging and depositing these fees.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of General Services or Chief Procurement Officer
stakeholders: Businesses and vendors participating in Maryland's electronic procurement processes
innovative_summary: The bill primarily clarifies legal and procedural aspects of electronic procurement fees; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Local Comprehensive Planning and State Economic Growth, Resource Protection, and Planning Policy - Planning Principles
Synopsis: Providing certain planning principles that are collectively intended to create sustainable communities and to protect the environment utilizing active public participation; altering the State Economic Growth, Resource Protection, and Planning Policy to consist of planning principles for advancing sustainable growth in the State; and requiring the publisher of the Annotated Code of Maryland, along with the Department of Legislative Services, to correct cross-references and terminology in the Code that are rendered incorrect by the Act.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland's planning principles to promote sustainable communities, environmental protection, and public participation in local and state planning processes, and clarifies transportation project approval criteria.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Planning and Department of Transportation
stakeholders: Residents, local governments, environmental groups, and businesses in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill emphasizes integrated planning principles and adaptive transportation project approval, promoting sustainable development and community engagement.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on sustainable development and community engagement has the potential to indirectly benefit children by fostering healthier, more equitable communities.

Title: Maryland Transportation Authority – Tolls, Fees, and Other Charges – Temporary Adjustments
Synopsis: Increasing from 180 days to 300 days the maximum duration of an emergency status determination authorizing the temporary adjustment of tolls, fees, or other charges by the Maryland Transportation Authority.
bill_summary: This bill extends the maximum duration of emergency status determinations that allow the Maryland Transportation Authority to temporarily adjust tolls, fees, or other charges from 180 days to 300 days.
responsible_party: Maryland Transportation Authority
stakeholders: Drivers and users of Maryland transportation facilities
innovative_summary: The bill primarily modifies existing procedures for emergency toll adjustments, without introducing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Cooperative Housing Corporations, Condominiums, and Homeowners Associations - Funding of Reserve Accounts and Preparation of Funding Plans
Synopsis: Requiring that certain funds for certain reserve accounts be deposited on or before the last day of each fiscal year; requiring the governing body of a cooperative housing corporation, a residential condominium, or a homeowners association to prepare a certain funding plan subject to certain requirements; authorizing a reasonable deviation from certain reserve funding requirements following a certain financial hardship determination; requiring that certain updated reserve studies be prepared by a certain person; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires cooperative housing corporations, condominiums, and homeowners associations in Maryland to conduct reserve studies, prepare funding plans, and deposit funds into reserve accounts annually to ensure proper funding for future repairs and replacements of common elements.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development or relevant local housing authorities
stakeholders: Residents of cooperative housing, condominiums, and homeowners associations in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach to reserve funding, including regular reserve studies, detailed funding plans, and oversight, which is a structured and proactive approach to property management.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to impact child poverty by ensuring better-maintained housing environments, which can improve living conditions for families.

Title: Criminal Procedure - Child Victims - Testimony in Child Abuse Cases
Synopsis: Altering a certain requirement under which a court is authorized to order that the testimony of a child victim be taken outside a courtroom and shown in the courtroom by closed circuit television in certain child abuse cases; requiring the testimony of a child victim taken by closed circuit television within the courthouse be in a setting that reasonably mitigates the likelihood the child victim will suffer emotional distress; etc.
bill_summary: This bill amends Maryland law to clarify and expand the circumstances under which a child victim's testimony in child abuse cases can be taken outside the courtroom via closed circuit television, especially when testifying in the presence of the defendant or respondent might cause emotional distress.
responsible_party: Maryland Judiciary
stakeholders: Child victims in abuse cases, legal professionals, and courts
innovative_summary: The bill introduces the use of closed circuit television for child victims' testimony in court, with specific provisions to mitigate emotional distress and allow communication with legal counsel, enhancing the safety and comfort of child witnesses.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill primarily focuses on legal procedures for child testimony and does not directly impact child poverty levels.

Title: Maryland Health Benefit Exchange - State-Based Young Adult Health Insurance Subsidies Pilot Program - Sunset Repeal
Synopsis: Renaming the State-Based Young Adult Health Insurance Subsidies Pilot Program to be the State-Based Young Adult Health Insurance Subsidies Program; repealing the termination date of certain provisions of law that establish and govern the funding for the Program; authorizing rather than requiring the Maryland Health Benefit Exchange to establish and implement the Program; and prohibiting the Exchange from implementing the Program if certain funds are not available.
bill_summary: This bill renames the existing Young Adult Health Insurance Subsidies Pilot Program to a permanent program, removes its sunset clause, and authorizes the Maryland Health Benefit Exchange to establish and implement the program if funds are available. It also details the funding sources, program administration, and reporting requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland Health Benefit Exchange
stakeholders: Young adults aged 18 to 40 in Maryland, especially those with income between 133% and 400% of the federal poverty level
innovative_summary: The program employs targeted subsidies and tracks their impact on insurance rates and coverage, with a focus on covering 100% of premiums for some young adults, which is a relatively innovative approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by increasing health insurance coverage among young adults, which can lead to better health and economic stability for families.

Title: State Government - Grants and Contracts - Reimbursement of Indirect Costs
Synopsis: Altering the rate at which nonprofit organizations receiving State-funded grants or contracts may be reimbursed for indirect costs to match the rate established under relevant federal guidelines; requiring the Maryland Efficient Grant Application Council to study and make certain recommendations to the Department of Budget and Management regarding the entire grants life cycle; requiring the Council to submit a report on its full recommendations to the Department and the General Assembly by July 1, 2027; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the reimbursement rate for indirect costs for nonprofit organizations receiving state grants or contracts, establishes a study on indirect costs and grants management, and sets reporting requirements. It also defines the scope of indirect costs and the application of federal guidance to state grants.
responsible_party: Department of Budget and Management
stakeholders: Nonprofit organizations receiving state grants or contracts, state government agencies, and grant recipients
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive study and recommendation process to improve grants management and streamline processes, incorporating federal guidance modifications.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by improving grant management and ensuring better funding for services.

Title: Criminal Procedure - Forensic Genetic Genealogical DNA Analysis and Search - Affidavit for Judicial Authorization
Synopsis: Altering and clarifying the requirement that a sworn affidavit for judicial authorization to initiate forensic genetic genealogical DNA analysis and search (FGGS) assert that the reasonable investigative leads have been pursued and failed to identify the perpetrator and instead requiring that a sworn affidavit for judicial authorization assert that identity of the perpetrator is unknown.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland's criminal procedure laws to clarify and alter requirements for judicial authorization of forensic genetic genealogical DNA analysis and search (FGGS), including the process for law enforcement to obtain court approval before conducting such searches.
responsible_party: Maryland Judiciary or law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Individuals involved in criminal investigations, especially those related to violent crimes or sexual offenses, and the general public concerned with privacy and public safety
innovative_summary: The bill introduces the use of forensic genetic genealogical DNA analysis and search (FGGS) as a new investigative tool, employing genetic sequencing and genealogical research to identify suspects.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty or include programs aimed at reducing it.

Title: Courts and Judicial Proceedings - Statement of Charges - Human Service Workers
Synopsis: Expanding certain provisions of law relating to a certain investigation and recommendation by a State's Attorney concerning the filing of a statement of charges against certain professionals to include certain human service workers.
bill_summary: The bill expands the law to include human service workers, such as adult protective services workers and child welfare caseworkers, in the process of investigation and recommendation by the State's Attorney before filing a statement of charges against them for offenses committed in the course of their duties.
responsible_party: Maryland State's Attorney's Office
stakeholders: Human service workers, including adult protective services workers and child welfare caseworkers, and the populations they serve.
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a formal investigation and recommendation process by the State's Attorney for charges against human service workers, which is a new procedural approach to ensure proper oversight before filing charges.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has potential to improve the working conditions and accountability of human service workers, which can indirectly benefit vulnerable populations including children in poverty.

Title: Public Safety - Law Enforcement Agencies - Peer Support Programs
Synopsis: Establishing certain confidentiality requirements for peer support counseling programs for law enforcement agencies; prohibiting a peer support specialist from  disclosing the contents of any written or oral communication regarding a peer support interaction; and providing certain exceptions.
bill_summary: The bill establishes confidentiality requirements for peer support counseling programs for law enforcement officers, including rules about disclosures and protections for peer support specialists.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Law enforcement officers and law enforcement agencies in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces formal confidentiality protections for peer support programs within law enforcement, emphasizing emotional and moral support through trained peer specialists.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty but aims to improve mental health support for law enforcement officers.

Title: Motor Vehicles - Specially Designed Vintage Reproduction Registration Plates
Synopsis: Repealing the time limitation within which the Motor Vehicle Administration is required to make available specially designed vintage reproduction registration plates; and requiring the Administration to charge a fee of $100 for the initial issuance and $25 for the renewal of a specially designed vintage reproduction registration plate.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the time limitation for making available vintage reproduction registration plates in Maryland, requires the Motor Vehicle Administration to charge fees for initial issuance and renewal of these plates, and specifies the design resembling a 1910 black-on-yellow plate.
responsible_party: Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration
stakeholders: Vehicle owners interested in vintage or historic vehicle registration
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a specialized vintage registration plate that resembles historical plates, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly concerns vehicle registration fees and design.

Title: Task Force to Study Fiduciary Adjudication in Maryland
Synopsis: Establishing the Task Force to Study Fiduciary Adjudication in Maryland to examine and analyze the efficiency, uniformity, and quality of fiduciary adjudication in Maryland and make recommendations; requiring the orphans' courts, circuit courts, registers of wills, and Administrative Office of the Courts to comply with certain requests of the Task Force; and requiring the Task Force to report its findings and make recommendations on or before January 1, 2026.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a Task Force to Study Fiduciary Adjudication in Maryland to examine and improve the efficiency, uniformity, and quality of fiduciary adjudication processes in the state, including probate, trusts, and guardianships.
responsible_party: Department of Legislative Services in conjunction with the Maryland State Bar Association
stakeholders: Families, courts, judges, and individuals involved in fiduciary matters in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive review and comparison approach, including examining practices in other states and seeking public input, to recommend improvements in fiduciary adjudication.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to improve legal processes related to wealth transmission and guardianship, which can indirectly benefit children in affected families.

Title: Election Law - Municipal Elections - Administration
Synopsis: Authorizing the State Administrator of Elections to enter into memoranda of understanding with municipal corporations that allow the State Administrator to work collaboratively with a municipal corporation to support the administration of the municipal corporation's elections; authorizing the State Administrator to lease a voting system or other equipment used to administer an election for use in a municipal election; repealing the authority of a local board to lease a voting system to certain entities within the county; etc.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes the Maryland State Administrator of Elections to collaborate with municipal corporations, lease voting systems to them, and support their election administration. It also modifies procedures for including municipal elections on ballots and clarifies leasing authority for local boards.
responsible_party: Maryland State Administrator of Elections
stakeholders: Municipal governments and voters in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a collaborative approach to municipal election administration, including leasing voting systems and supporting election processes, which is a relatively innovative approach to local election management.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on election administration processes.

Title: Domestic Partnership and Marriage - Required Information
Synopsis: Clarifying required information for registering a domestic partnership or obtaining a marriage license; and requiring a declaration of domestic partnership filed with the register of wills to include the Social Security number of each domestic partner who has a Social Security number.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies requirements for registering a domestic partnership and obtaining a marriage license in Maryland. It mandates including Social Security numbers in declarations and applications, and adjusts public record disclosure rules.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and the Register of Wills
stakeholders: Individuals registering domestic partnerships or applying for marriage licenses in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces stricter data collection and privacy protections for domestic partnership and marriage license records, including the handling of Social Security numbers.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on legal and administrative procedures.

Title: County Boards of Education - Antibias Training for Members - Requirement (County Board Member Antibias Training Act)
Synopsis: Requiring each member of a county board of education to complete certain antibias training at least once during the member's term.
bill_summary: The bill requires each member of a county board of education in Maryland to complete an antibias training at least once during their term. It also mandates the development of antibias training guidelines for school employees and requires biennial training for public school employees involved with students.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education
stakeholders: Members of county boards of education, public school employees, students, and communities in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a comprehensive antibias training program for education officials and staff, emphasizing cultural awareness, reducing implicit bias, and promoting inclusivity, with guidelines based on real-life incidents and updated periodically.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to foster more inclusive and equitable school environments, which can contribute to reducing child poverty by addressing biases and discrimination that affect marginalized students.

Title: Adult Education - High School Diploma by Examination - Requirements and Study
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Labor to allow an individual to choose to take all components of the General Educational Development Test in either English or Spanish; and requiring the Department to study the feasibility and cost of offering the examination in additional languages and to report its findings and recommendations to certain committees of the General Assembly on or before December 1, 2026.
bill_summary: The bill allows individuals in Maryland to obtain a high school diploma by examination in the same language, either English or Spanish, and requires the Maryland Department of Labor to study offering the GED test in additional languages and report on its feasibility.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor and Maryland Department of Education
stakeholders: Individuals seeking a high school diploma through examination, including English language learners and adult learners
innovative_summary: The bill introduces the option for examinees to take all components of the high school equivalency exam in the same language, either English or Spanish, and studies expanding language options for the GED test.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to impact child poverty by increasing educational attainment opportunities for adults, which can improve economic stability for families.

Title: State Lottery – Instant Ticket Lottery Machines – Veterans’ and Fraternal Organizations
Synopsis: Authorizing the Director of the State Lottery and Gaming Control Agency to issue certain fraternal organizations a license for not more than three instant ticket lottery machines; altering the distribution of proceeds from instant ticket lottery machine sales by veterans' organizations; providing for the distribution of proceeds from instant ticket lottery machine sales by fraternal organizations; altering certain requirements concerning the conduct of gaming through instant ticket lottery machines; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland State Lottery to issue licenses to certain veterans' and fraternal organizations to operate instant ticket lottery machines, modifies the distribution of proceeds from these machines, and sets regulations on their operation and location.
responsible_party: Maryland State Lottery and Gaming Control Agency
stakeholders: Veterans' organizations, fraternal organizations, veterans, and the general public
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new program allowing veterans' and fraternal organizations to operate lottery machines and directs proceeds to various social programs, employing a novel approach to community engagement and funding.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty through funding community and educational programs.

Title: Public Information Act - Public Access Ombudsman - Delegation of Powers
Synopsis: Authorizing the Public Access Ombudsman to delegate to a staff member of the Office of the Public Access Ombudsman any of the powers and duties granted to the Ombudsman that are appropriate to the staff member's training and expertise.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Public Access Ombudsman to delegate certain powers and duties to a staff member of the Office of the Public Access Ombudsman, enhancing the operational flexibility of the office.
responsible_party: Office of the Public Access Ombudsman, Office of the Attorney General
stakeholders: Public access to government information and transparency advocates
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a delegation of powers within a government office, which is a common administrative practice but not highly innovative.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Healthcare Ecosystem Stakeholder Cybersecurity Workgroup
Synopsis: Establishing the Healthcare Ecosystem Stakeholder Cybersecurity Workgroup to develop strategies to prevent cybersecurity disruptions to the healthcare ecosystem, ensure the continuous delivery of essential healthcare ecosystem services, and enhance recovery efforts of the healthcare ecosystem following a cybersecurity incident; and requiring the Workgroup to submit an interim report on or before January 1, 2026, and a final report of its findings and recommendations on or before December 1, 2026.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a Healthcare Ecosystem Stakeholder Cybersecurity Workgroup in Maryland to develop strategies for preventing cybersecurity disruptions, ensuring continuous delivery of healthcare services, and improving recovery efforts following cybersecurity incidents within the healthcare sector.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Emergency Management, Maryland Health Care Commission, Maryland Insurance Administration, and Maryland Department of Information Technology
stakeholders: Healthcare entities in Maryland, including hospitals, medical facilities, health information exchanges, and insurance providers
innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive, multi-entity cybersecurity strategy that includes audits, standards, and a dedicated workgroup to improve cybersecurity resilience in healthcare.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by securing healthcare infrastructure, which can improve health outcomes and access to care.

Title: Workgroup on Newborn Nurse Home Visiting Services - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Workgroup on Universal Newborn Nurse Home Visiting Services; requiring the Workgroup to compile updated participant data and expenditure per participant from the home visiting programs currently operating in the State, compare the data for home visiting programs to the data for evidence-based models, identify service gaps, and identify workforce needs; and requiring the Workgroup to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly by December 31, 2025.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a statewide, voluntary program in Maryland to provide universal newborn nurse home visiting services to all families with newborns, aiming to support healthy child development, postpartum health, and family strengthening. It creates a workgroup to plan and coordinate the program, sets guidelines for service delivery, and mandates insurance coverage and reimbursement for these services.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Families with newborns in Maryland, healthcare providers, insurers, community organizations, and public health agencies
innovative_summary: The program employs evidence-based models, integrates virtual visits, and coordinates across multiple agencies and community organizations, utilizing data collection and quality assurance activities to improve outcomes.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to reduce child poverty by supporting early child development and family stability through health and social services.

Title: State Lottery Fund - Laurel Race Course - Local Impact Aid
Synopsis: Requiring the Comptroller, beginning in fiscal year 2026, to distribute from the State Lottery Fund $250,000 of supplemental local impact aid to Anne Arundel County, Howard County, and the City of Laurel from the proceeds of the Racetrax lottery game to be used for certain programs and services in the communities surrounding Laurel Race Course; specifying the purposes for and manner in which the supplemental local impact aid may be utilized; etc.
bill_summary: The bill allocates funds from the State Lottery Fund to provide supplemental impact aid to Anne Arundel County, Howard County, and the City of Laurel, specifically related to revenue from the Racetrax lottery game and the Laurel Race Course. It specifies how the funds are to be used for community programs and services, and sets conditions for the continuation of aid.
responsible_party: Maryland State Comptroller and local governments of Anne Arundel County, Howard County, and the City of Laurel
stakeholders: Residents of Anne Arundel County, Howard County, the City of Laurel, backstretch workers at Laurel Race Course, and local community organizations
innovative_summary: The program employs a targeted approach to use lottery proceeds for community health, social, and wellness programs, with specific provisions for nonprofit organizations and local service delivery, integrating lottery revenue with community development.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by funding health, social, and wellness services that can benefit children and families in the affected communities.

Title: Motor Vehicles - Speed Monitoring Systems - Statements and Certificates of Violations
Synopsis: Authorizing certain technicians to swear to and affirm, based on inspection of recorded images, the occurrence of violations recorded by speed monitoring systems; requiring law enforcement officers and technicians to complete a reasonable training specific to the speed monitoring system before certifying any certificates of violation; and defining "reasonable training" as a sufficient level of education, instruction, and practical experience to ensure competency in the inspection of images generated by speed monitoring systems.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes technicians to swear to violations recorded by speed monitoring systems, requires law enforcement and technicians to complete specific training before certifying violations, and makes related amendments to Maryland transportation law.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation or local agencies implementing speed monitoring systems
stakeholders: Motor vehicle owners, law enforcement agencies, technicians, and local governments
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new certification process for technicians and emphasizes training for speed monitoring violations, employing a specialized certification approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on procedural and certification changes for speed violations.

Title: Maryland Environmental Service - Membership of Board of Directors - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the composition of the Board of Directors of the Maryland Environmental Service to include the Secretary of Planning or a designee and, as nonvoting members, one member from the Senate of Maryland and one from the Maryland House of Delegates; and providing that certain provisions of law relating to terms of members of the Board do not apply to the Secretary of Planning, certain legislative members, and the Executive Director.
bill_summary: The bill amends the composition of the Maryland Environmental Service Board of Directors, replacing the State Treasurer with the Secretary of Planning or their designee, and clarifies the appointment process and terms for board members.
responsible_party: Maryland Environmental Service
stakeholders: State government, environmental management sectors, and the public in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill updates governance structure and appointment processes for the environmental service board, but does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty, focusing instead on governance of an environmental agency.

Title: Interstate Social Work Licensure Compact
Synopsis: Entering into the Social Work Licensure Compact for the purpose of authorizing regulated social workers who hold multistate licenses to practice social work in member states in order to improve public access to competent social work services; establishing requirements for multistate licensure; establishing the Social Work Licensure Compact Commission; providing for withdrawal from the Compact; and providing that the Act is contingent on the enactment of substantially similar legislation in six other states.
bill_summary: The bill establishes Maryland's participation in the Interstate Social Work Licensure Compact, which allows social workers with multistate licenses to practice across member states, improving access and workforce mobility while maintaining state regulatory authority.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Licensed social workers, clients receiving social work services, military families, and the general public in member states
innovative_summary: The program employs a multistate licensure system and a shared data system, utilizing technology to facilitate interstate practice and information exchange, representing a modern approach to professional regulation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to reduce child poverty by increasing access to social work services, especially in underserved areas.

Title: Baltimore City - Alcoholic Beverages - 43rd Alcoholic Beverages District - Class B-D-7 Licenses
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore City to issue additional B-D-7 beer, wine, and liquor licenses in certain areas of the 43rd alcoholic beverages district of Baltimore City if the license applicant meets certain criteria; and extending to July 1, 2026, an alcoholic beverages license issued for a certain area for the purpose of renewal.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Baltimore City Board of License Commissioners to issue specific new alcohol licenses in certain districts, extends the validity of some existing licenses until July 1, 2026, and establishes criteria for issuing new Class B–D–7 licenses in the 43rd alcoholic beverages district.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Alcohol license applicants, Baltimore City residents, local businesses in the 43rd district
innovative_summary: The bill introduces specific licensing criteria and extends license validity, but does not employ new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on alcohol licensing in Baltimore City does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Real Property – Recordation and Land Records – Requirements
