Synopsis: Altering certain provisions relating to the filing, maintenance, and transmittal of land records; and defining "land record" as any document recorded by a clerk of the circuit court relating to property.
bill_summary: This bill makes changes to the laws governing land records, including recordation requirements, procedures for releasing mortgages and deeds of trust, subdivision plat recording standards, and notices related to property leases and foreclosures.
responsible_party: Maryland Circuit Court Clerk and Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Property owners, land record professionals, mortgagees, tenants, and local governments in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill updates and clarifies existing land record procedures, including electronic recordation and standardized plat requirements, but does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill primarily updates land record procedures and does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Prince George's County - Speed Monitoring Systems - Maryland Route 210 PG 306-25
Synopsis: Increasing the maximum civil penalties for violations recorded by speed monitoring systems on Maryland Route 210 (Piscataway Highway) in Prince George's County that involve exceeding the maximum speed limit by certain amounts.
bill_summary: This bill increases the maximum civil penalties for speeding violations recorded by speed monitoring systems on Maryland Route 210 (Piscataway Highway) in Prince George's County, especially for exceeding the speed limit by certain amounts.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation or local authorities in Prince George's County
stakeholders: Drivers and residents in Prince George's County, Maryland, especially those on Maryland Route 210
innovative_summary: The bill primarily adjusts penalties for automated speed violations; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on traffic enforcement penalties does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Budget Bill (Fiscal Year 2026)
Synopsis: Making the proposed appropriations contained in the State Budget for the fiscal year ending June 30, 2026, in accordance with Article III, Section 52 of the Maryland Constitution; etc.
bill_summary: The bill is a comprehensive budget bill for Maryland's fiscal year 2026, detailing appropriations, reductions, and supplemental allocations across various state agencies, programs, and funds, including adjustments contingent on legislation and specific conditions.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Budget and Management
stakeholders: State agencies, local governments, educational institutions, healthcare providers, and Maryland residents benefiting from public services and programs.
innovative_summary: The bill employs detailed contingency planning, fund realignments, and performance-based adjustments, but does not introduce new technologies or innovative government approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill allocates significant funds to education, healthcare, and social services, which can have a direct impact on child poverty, but the impact depends on implementation and specific program effectiveness.

Title: Creation of a State Debt - Maryland Consolidated Capital Bond Loan of 2025, and the Maryland Consolidated Capital Bond Loans of 2011, 2012, 2013, 2014, 2015, 2016, 2017, 2018, 2019, 2020, 2021, 2022, 2023, and 2024
Synopsis: Authorizing the creation of a State Debt in the amount of $1,763,325,000, the proceeds to be used for certain necessary building, construction, demolition, planning, renovation, conversion, replacement, and capital equipment purchases of the State, for acquiring certain real estate in connection therewith, and for grants to certain subdivisions and other organizations for certain development and improvement purposes; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the creation of multiple state debt loans through bonds to fund various public infrastructure, educational, health, and community development projects across Maryland from 2025 through 2029.
responsible_party: Maryland Board of Public Works and various state agencies
stakeholders: Maryland residents, local governments, schools, health facilities, community organizations, and specific populations served by the projects
innovative_summary: The bill employs traditional bond financing for state projects, with some provisions for federal matching funds and historic preservation easements, but does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has the potential to impact child poverty indirectly by funding educational, health, and community development projects that can improve living conditions and access to services.

Title: Budget Reconciliation and Financing Act of 2025
Synopsis: Establishing or altering certain administrative penalties; altering or repealing certain required appropriations; authorizing the use of certain funds for certain purposes; establishing certain funds; authorizing, requiring, or altering the distribution of certain revenue; altering the rates and rate brackets under the State income tax on certain income of individuals; requiring certain groups of corporations to file a combined income tax return reflecting the aggregate income tax liability of all members of the group; etc.
bill_summary: This bill is a comprehensive budget reconciliation act that allocates funds, establishes programs, and makes legal and procedural changes across various sectors including transportation, health, education, environment, and economic development. It authorizes significant funding for infrastructure, health services, education grants, environmental projects, and tax credits, and includes provisions for transfers, tax adjustments, and program implementations.
responsible_party: Maryland State government agencies including the Department of Budget and Management, Department of Health, Department of Natural Resources, Maryland Department of Transportation, and other relevant departments.
stakeholders: Maryland residents, local governments, businesses, health care providers, educational institutions, environmental organizations, and specific populations such as students, seniors, and individuals involved in the criminal justice system.
innovative_summary: The bill employs a mix of traditional funding allocations and innovative approaches such as new tax credits, digital service taxes, and technology investments, including cloud computing and cybersecurity, to modernize government functions and stimulate economic growth.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a moderate to high potential to impact child poverty through increased funding for education, health, and social services, and targeted programs for vulnerable populations.

Title: Prince George's County - Community Associations - Registration Fees for Administrative Hearing Process PG 408-25
Synopsis: Altering the registration fee requirement for the Community Association Registry; permitting the County Executive to establish the registration fee; prohibiting a person or entity who fails to register from filing a dispute; and requiring the Prince George's County Office of Community Relations to provide revenue from annual community association registration fees to fund the administrative hearing process for disputes between community associations and owners in Prince George's County.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the community association registration process in Prince George's County, including establishing a fee structure, requiring registration of community associations and management entities, and funding an administrative dispute resolution process through collected fees.
responsible_party: Prince George’s County Office of Community Relations
stakeholders: Community associations, property owners, community management entities in Prince George’s County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a dedicated registry and funding mechanism for an administrative dispute resolution process, employing technology for registration and fee collection.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving community management and dispute resolution, which can enhance community stability.

Title: Health Occupations Boards - English Proficiency Requirements and Licensure by Endorsement for Nursing
Synopsis: Prohibiting a health occupations board from requiring additional evidence of English proficiency as a condition for licensure, certification, or registration if an applicant holds a valid, unrestricted license, certification, or registration from another state that requires evidence of English proficiency; requiring each health occupations board that requires evidence of English proficiency to post a statement on their website that an applicant may not be required to provide additional evidence of proficiency; etc.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits health occupations boards in Maryland from requiring additional evidence of English proficiency for licensure if the applicant already holds a valid license from another state that requires English proficiency. It also mandates that these boards prominently display on their websites a list of states with similar requirements and updates the acceptable proof of English proficiency for nursing licensure, endorsement, and pharmacy licensing.
responsible_party: Maryland State Health Occupations Boards
stakeholders: Applicants for health occupation licenses, including nurses and pharmacists, and the general public receiving health services.
innovative_summary: The bill employs a streamlined, cross-state recognition approach to English proficiency requirements, reducing redundant testing and promoting reciprocity among states, which is a relatively innovative approach in licensing.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly affects licensing procedures for health professionals.

Title: Prince George's Gateway Development Authority - Sunset Repeal PG 403-25
Synopsis: Repealing the termination of certain provisions of law establishing the Prince George's Gateway Development Authority.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the sunset clause for the Prince George's Gateway Development Authority, extending its existence and responsibilities, including developing a neighborhood revitalization plan for certain communities in Prince George's County.
responsible_party: Prince George's Gateway Development Authority and related local and state agencies
stakeholders: Residents, businesses, and communities within the target area in Prince George's County, Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill establishes a local development authority with a focus on comprehensive neighborhood revitalization, which is a common approach but tailored to specific communities in Prince George's County.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to impact child poverty by improving neighborhood conditions, housing, and economic opportunities.

Title: Bicycles, Play Vehicles, and Unicycles - Authorizations and Requirements (Jay's Law)
Synopsis: Authorizing a person to ride a bicycle, play vehicle, or unicycle on a sidewalk or sidewalk area unless prohibited by local ordinance; and requiring a person riding a bicycle, play vehicle, or unicycle on a sidewalk or sidewalk area or in or through a crosswalk to yield the right-of-way to a pedestrian or a person using an electric personal assistive mobility device.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes people to ride bicycles, play vehicles, or unicycles on sidewalks unless prohibited by local law, and requires riders on sidewalks or in crosswalks to yield to pedestrians and electric personal assistive mobility device users.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation or local transportation authorities
stakeholders: Bicycle riders, pedestrians, users of electric personal assistive mobility devices, local governments
innovative_summary: The bill updates existing laws to explicitly allow bicycle, play vehicle, and unicycle riding on sidewalks and crosswalks, with specific yielding requirements, aligning with pedestrian rights and safety.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on transportation laws and safety.

Title: Maryland Cybersecurity Council - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the selection of the membership and chair of the Maryland Cybersecurity Council; requiring beginning on October 1, 2025, and every 2 years thereafter, the Council to elect a chair and vice chair from among the members of the Council; requiring the Council, working with certain entities, to assess and address cybersecurity threats and associated risks from artificial intelligence and quantum computing; etc.
bill_summary: This bill amends the Maryland Cybersecurity Council by altering its membership, chair selection process, and expanding its responsibilities to include assessing and addressing cybersecurity threats from artificial intelligence and quantum computing, as well as addressing emerging threats like deepfakes and cyber attacks.
responsible_party: Maryland Cybersecurity Council
stakeholders: Cybersecurity companies, higher education institutions, private sector organizations, government agencies, and residents of Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a focus on emerging technologies such as artificial intelligence and quantum computing, and mandates the Council to assess and address associated cybersecurity threats, which is a forward-looking and innovative approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on cybersecurity and infrastructure does not directly target child poverty but could indirectly benefit vulnerable populations by strengthening critical infrastructure.

Title: Maryland Disability Service Animal Program - Established
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Disability Service Animal Program in the Department of Disabilities to select one or more nonprofit training entities to participate in the Program and provide additional funding mechanisms to assist eligible individuals in the Program; requiring the Department to select at least one nonprofit training entity to develop and implement a training protocol and to select qualified participants; and establishing the Maryland Disability Service Animal Program Fund to pay a participating nonprofit training entity.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Disability Service Animal Program within the Department of Disabilities, which trains and partners service animals with eligible individuals with disabilities, and creates a dedicated fund to support this initiative.
responsible_party: Department of Disabilities
stakeholders: Individuals with disabilities in Maryland who could benefit from service animals
innovative_summary: The program employs a structured approach to train and partner service animals with individuals with disabilities, including a dedicated funding mechanism and partnerships with nonprofit training entities.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving support for children with disabilities and their families.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Drunk and Drugged Driving - Points Assessments
Synopsis: Imposing assessments of 12 points for certain subsequent drunk and drugged driving violations.
bill_summary: The bill increases the points assessed for subsequent drunk and drugged driving violations in Maryland, specifically adding 12 points for violations of certain vehicle laws related to alcohol and drugs, and establishes stricter penalties for repeat offenders.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation or Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration
stakeholders: Drivers in Maryland, law enforcement, and the general public concerned with road safety
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates legal penalties and points assessments for DUI and drugged driving violations, without employing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Property Tax - Day Care Centers, Child Care Homes, and Child Care Centers
Synopsis: Exempting personal property used in connection with certain large family child care homes from valuation and taxation; authorizing the Mayor and City Council of Baltimore City or the governing body of a county or a municipal corporation to grant, by law, a property tax credit against the real property tax owed on the portion of real property used for certain large family child care homes; increasing the maximum amount of a property tax credit that may be granted for certain child care homes and centers and day care centers; etc.
bill_summary: The bill exempts personal property used in connection with large family child care homes from property valuation and taxation, and increases the maximum property tax credits available for certain child care facilities, while also allowing local governments to grant these credits.
responsible_party: Maryland local governments (cities, counties, municipal corporations) and the Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Large family child care homes, child care centers, day care centers, local governments, and families using child care services
innovative_summary: The bill introduces targeted property tax exemptions and credits for child care providers, which is a strategic approach to support early childhood education and care through fiscal incentives.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to reduce child poverty by making child care more affordable for providers and families.

Title: Affordable Housing Payment In Lieu of Taxes Expansion Act
Synopsis: Authorizing an owner of real property used for rental housing and the governing body of a county to enter into a payment in lieu of taxes agreement for maintaining at least 25% of the rental housing units located at the real property as affordable dwelling units for at least 15 years; and authorizing the governing body of the county to require the owner of real property to maintain a higher percentage of rental housing units as affordable dwelling units than the minimum percentage specified in the Act.
bill_summary: The bill expands the use of payment in lieu of taxes agreements for rental housing properties, allowing property owners and counties to negotiate agreements where owners maintain at least 25% of units as affordable for at least 15 years, in exchange for property tax exemptions.
responsible_party: Maryland local governments and property owners
stakeholders: Renters and low-to-moderate income households in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a flexible, negotiated approach to affordable housing incentives through payment in lieu of taxes agreements, encouraging local governments and property owners to collaborate on affordable housing.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to increase affordable housing availability, which can help reduce child poverty by providing stable, affordable living options.

Title: Maryland Agricultural and Resource-Based Industry Development Corporation - Oyster Shucking House Loan Program
Synopsis: Altering a certain loan program to authorize the Maryland Agricultural and Resource-Based Industry Development Corporation to provide loans in an amount up to $25,000 for certain seasonal full-time jobs; and reducing, from 5 years to 3 years, the number of years that a person must have been a licensed seafood dealer in order to be eligible to receive financing under the loan program.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the Maryland Oyster Shucking House Loan Program to allow loans up to $250,000 for seafood processing projects, with specific provisions for seasonal full-time jobs and eligibility criteria, including reducing the required years of experience for seafood dealers from 5 to 3 years. It also allocates $1,000,000 for the program in fiscal year 2024.
responsible_party: Maryland Agricultural and Resource–Based Industry Development Corporation
stakeholders: Seafood dealers, oyster shucking businesses, Chesapeake Bay oyster industry, local seafood processing businesses
innovative_summary: The program employs a targeted loan and forgiveness approach to support oyster shell recycling and seafood processing, integrating environmental goals with economic development.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to create jobs and support local seafood businesses, which can contribute to reducing child poverty in communities dependent on these industries.

Title: Anne Arundel County Board of Education - Student Member Scholarship - Increase
Synopsis: Increasing the scholarship award for a student member of the Anne Arundel County Board of Education who completes a full term on the county board from $8,000 to $15,000.
bill_summary: The bill increases the scholarship award for a student member of the Anne Arundel County Board of Education who completes a full term from $8,000 to $15,000.
responsible_party: Anne Arundel County Board of Education
stakeholders: Student members of the Anne Arundel County Board of Education and their higher education institutions
innovative_summary: The bill enhances support for student representatives on the school board by significantly increasing the scholarship amount, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily supporting student leadership and education.

Title: State Board of Examiners for Audiologists, Hearing Aid Dispensers, Speech-Language Pathologists, and Music Therapists - Appointment of Hearing Aid Dispenser Members
Synopsis: Altering the appointment process for licensed hearing aid dispenser members of the State Board of Examiners for Audiologists, Hearing Aid Dispensers, Speech-Language Pathologists, and Music Therapists by requiring the Board to notify all licensed hearing aid dispensers in the State of the vacancy and to solicit nominations to fill the vacancy.
bill_summary: This bill alters the appointment process for the Maryland State Board of Examiners for Audiologists, Hearing Aid Dispensers, Speech–Language Pathologists, and Music Therapists, including the composition of the board and the appointment procedures for its members.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Examiners for Audiologists, Hearing Aid Dispensers, Speech–Language Pathologists, and Music Therapists
stakeholders: Licensed audiologists, hearing aid dispensers, speech-language pathologists, and music therapists practicing in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill mainly updates appointment procedures and composition of a professional licensing board, which is a standard administrative process, not employing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty or include programs aimed at reducing it.

Title: Anne Arundel County - Board of License Commissioners - Part-Time Deputy Chief Inspector - Compensation
Synopsis: Increasing the annual salary of a part-time deputy chief inspector employed by the Board of License Commissioners for Anne Arundel County from $9,000 to $18,000.
bill_summary: The bill increases the annual salary of a part-time deputy chief inspector employed by the Board of License Commissioners for Anne Arundel County from $9,000 to $18,000, and maintains the salaries for 18 part-time inspectors at $7,000 each.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Anne Arundel County
stakeholders: Residents and businesses in Anne Arundel County, especially those involved in alcohol licensing and enforcement
innovative_summary: The bill does not employ new technologies or approaches; it mainly adjusts salary levels for existing roles.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has no direct impact on child poverty.

Title: State Designations – State Mineral – Chromite (State Mineral Act)
Synopsis: Designating chromite, which reflects the nature of Maryland's rich mining history and vast mineral resources, as the State mineral.
bill_summary: The bill designates chromite as the official state mineral of Maryland, highlighting its historical significance and presence in the state's mining history.
responsible_party: Maryland General Assembly (Legislature)
stakeholders: Maryland residents, historians, educators, and the mining community
innovative_summary: The bill is primarily a symbolic designation and does not introduce new programs or initiatives, so it is not particularly innovative.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty as it is a symbolic designation.

Title: Elections - Local Boards of Elections - Open Meeting Requirements (Local Boards of Elections Transparency Act)
Synopsis: Requiring each local board of elections to make available on its website each open meeting agenda, a summary of any finalized documents, certain written testimony, and other materials on which the  board will be voting; requiring each local board to provide live video streaming of each open meeting and to maintain a complete and unedited archived video recording of each open meeting for 5 years; requiring the State Board of Elections to adopt regulations to ensure that the streaming requirements are met in a certain manner; etc.
bill_summary: This bill establishes enhanced open meeting requirements for local boards of elections in Maryland, including public access to agendas, live video streaming of meetings, and archiving of recordings for at least 5 years.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Voters, local election officials, candidates, political parties, and the general public interested in election processes
innovative_summary: The bill employs technology by requiring live video streaming and archiving of local election board meetings to increase transparency.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on election transparency.

Title: Criminal Law - Controlled Dangerous Substances and Firearms
Synopsis: Authorizing a person who is at least 21 years of age to manufacture a personal use amount of cannabis products or concentrated cannabis for personal use or adult sharing at a private residence if the manufacturing process does not involve the use of a volatile solvent; specifying that manufacturing, distributing, dispensing, or possessing certain large quantities of certain controlled dangerous substances is a felony; altering the penalties for being a volume dealer and drug kingpin with regard to cannabis; etc.
bill_summary: This bill legalizes the manufacturing of small amounts of cannabis for personal use and adult sharing at private residences, with restrictions on the use of volatile solvents. It also revises penalties for large-scale drug manufacturing, distribution, and firearm offenses, and introduces modifications to sentences for certain drug offenses, including the possibility of sentence reduction. Additionally, it establishes regulations for firearm serial number requirements and prohibits the sale of certain firearms.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Adults 21 and older, law enforcement, criminal justice system, firearm owners, drug offenders
innovative_summary: The bill employs a combination of legalizing personal cannabis manufacturing, adjusting sentencing laws, and implementing new firearm marking regulations, representing a comprehensive approach to drug and firearm regulation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's impact on child poverty is indirect, primarily through criminal justice reforms and potential reductions in incarceration.

Title: State Library Agency - Family Literacy Pilot Program - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Family Literacy Pilot Program administered by the State Library Agency in consultation with the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services and the Correctional Education Council to enable certain incarcerated individuals to read aloud to their children by preparing a recording; and requiring the State Library Agency to submit a certain report on or before December 1, 2028.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Family Literacy Pilot Program, which allows incarcerated individuals to record themselves reading children's books and send these recordings and books to their children, aiming to foster family literacy and strengthen parent-child relationships.
responsible_party: Maryland State Library Agency
stakeholders: Incarcerated individuals and their children
innovative_summary: The program employs a novel approach by enabling incarcerated individuals to record themselves reading to their children, using technology to strengthen family bonds.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve family stability and literacy, which can contribute to reducing child poverty.

Title: Education and Health - Emergency Use Epinephrine - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the defined term "auto-injectable epinephrine" to be "emergency use epinephrine" and to include certain drug delivery devices and products; and altering the name of the Emergency Use Auto-Injectable Epinephrine Program to be the Emergency Use Epinephrine Program.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland law to rename 'auto-injectable epinephrine' as 'emergency use epinephrine', broadens the types of devices included, and establishes a comprehensive Emergency Use Epinephrine Program across schools, child care facilities, youth camps, and institutions of higher education. It authorizes trained personnel to administer epinephrine in emergencies, provides liability protections, and sets reporting requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and Education Department
stakeholders: Students, children, youth camp attendees, higher education students, school and child care staff, emergency responders
innovative_summary: The program employs a coordinated, multi-sector approach to emergency allergy treatment, including training, legal protections, and broad device inclusion, which is relatively innovative in its comprehensive scope and integration.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but improves emergency health responses for children and youth, potentially reducing health disparities.

Title: Public Safety - 9-1-1 Trust Fund - 9-8-8 Suicide Prevention Hotline
Synopsis: Authorizing the use of the 9-1-1 Trust Fund for certain expenditures that support the 9-8-8 suicide prevention hotline; and altering a certain restriction on the use of the 9-1-1 Trust Fund to prohibit funds from being used for expenses solely related to the 9-8-8 suicide prevention hotline, instead of preventing the use of funds for any costs associated with the 9-8-8 suicide prevention hotline.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the use of the Maryland 9-1-1 Trust Fund to support the 9-8-8 suicide prevention hotline, including costs related to its operation, training, and software interfaces, but prohibits funds from being used solely for the hotline.
responsible_party: Maryland 9-1-1 Trust Fund and related public safety agencies
stakeholders: Individuals seeking mental health and suicide prevention services, public safety agencies, and 9-8-8 hotline operators
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new integrated funding approach for the 9-8-8 suicide prevention hotline through the existing 9-1-1 Trust Fund, including shared operational costs and software interfaces.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to directly impact child poverty by improving access to mental health and suicide prevention services for vulnerable populations, including children.

Title: Public Safety - Maryland 9-1-1 Board and Maryland Department of Emergency Management - Regulatory Authority
Synopsis: Authorizing the Maryland 9-1-1 Board to adopt regulations to implement and enforce certain responsibilities of the Board; and authorizing the Maryland Department of Emergency Management to adopt regulations to implement and enforce the responsibilities of the Department.
bill_summary: This bill grants regulatory authority to the Maryland 9–1–1 Board and the Maryland Department of Emergency Management to adopt regulations for enhancing and managing 9–1–1 systems, including standards for Next Generation 9–1–1 services, training, cybersecurity, and record retention.
responsible_party: Maryland 9–1–1 Board and Maryland Department of Emergency Management
stakeholders: Public safety answering points, emergency response personnel, and residents of Maryland who use 9–1–1 services
innovative_summary: The bill introduces comprehensive standards and regulations for Next Generation 9–1–1 services, including cybersecurity, interoperability, and specialized training, employing modern technology and best practices.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on emergency response systems and training has limited direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Prescription Drug Affordability Board - Authority and Stakeholder Council Membership (Lowering Prescription Drug Costs for All Marylanders Now Act)
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the Prescription Drug Affordability Stakeholder Council; requiring the Prescription Drug Affordability Board, under certain circumstances, to establish a process for setting upper payment limits for purchases and payor reimbursements of prescription drug products that the Board determines have led or will lead to affordability challenges; authorizing the Board to reconsider an upper payment limit for a drug that becomes a current shortage; and altering requirements related to the setting of upper payment limits.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Prescription Drug Affordability Board's authority to set upper payment limits for prescription drugs in Maryland, create a stakeholder council, and develop processes for managing drug affordability challenges, including during shortages.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Patients, pharmacies, healthcare providers, insurance companies, and the biotechnology industry in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach to drug affordability, including setting upper payment limits, establishing a stakeholder council, and monitoring impacts, which is a relatively innovative government approach to controlling drug costs.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by lowering prescription drug costs and improving access to medications.

Title: Natural Resources - State Boat Act - Auctioneers
Synopsis: Exempting certain auctioneers from certain provisions of the State Boat Act.
bill_summary: The bill exempts certain auctioneers from specific provisions of the State Boat Act in Maryland, clarifying that licensed auctioneers acting on behalf of sellers, secured parties, or owners do not qualify as dealers under the law.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Boat auctioneers, boat sellers, and buyers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill clarifies legal definitions to streamline boat auctions, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Election Law - Postelection Tabulation Audits - Risk-Limiting Audits
Synopsis: Requiring the State Board of Elections, in collaboration with the local boards of elections, to conduct a risk-limiting audit after each statewide election; authorizing the State Board, in collaboration with the local boards, to conduct a risk-limiting audit after a special general election; authorizing the State Board, in collaboration with the local boards, to conduct an automated software audit after a statewide election; authorizing a local board to conduct a risk-limiting audit of a local contest under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The bill mandates the Maryland State Board of Elections to conduct risk-limiting audits after each statewide election, including automated software audits and manual audits of voter-verifiable paper records, to ensure the accuracy of vote tabulation. It also allows for audits of local contests and specifies procedures for conducting and reporting these audits.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Voters, election officials, political candidates, and the general public involved in elections in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs statistical and technological methods, such as risk-limiting audits and automated software audits, to improve election accuracy and transparency, representing a modern approach to election integrity.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus is on election integrity and does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: State Board of Public Accountancy - Emeritus Status
Synopsis: Authorizing the State Board of Public Accountancy to place a licensee on emeritus status under certain circumstances; and requiring the Board to reinstate the license of an individual who is on emeritus status under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland State Board of Public Accountancy to place licensed certified public accountants on 'emeritus' status, allowing them to retire from active practice while maintaining a form of recognition and limited rights, such as using specific titles and descriptions.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Public Accountancy
stakeholders: Certified Public Accountants in Maryland, retired professionals, and the public seeking accounting services
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a formal 'emeritus' status for retired accountants, including specific title usage and practice limitations, which is a new approach to professional retirement recognition.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily concerns professional licensing and retirement status for accountants.

Title: Medical Debt - Complaints for Money Judgment and Real Property Liens
Synopsis: Establishing certain requirements for a complaint for a money judgment; defining "medical debt" as a debt owed by a consumer to a provider of medical services, products, or devices, but does not include debt charged to a credit card except under certain circumstances; prohibiting the creation of a lien on owner-occupied residential property by contract or as a result of a breach of contract for the payment of medical debt; and applying the Act prospectively.
bill_summary: This bill establishes requirements for complaints for money judgments related to medical debt, prohibits creating liens on owner-occupied residential property for medical debt through contracts or breach of contracts, and provides procedures for removing such liens if they are created in violation of the law.
responsible_party: Maryland courts and judiciary system
stakeholders: Homeowners with owner-occupied residential property, medical debt creditors, legal system
innovative_summary: The bill introduces legal protections against liens on primary residences for medical debt, which is a targeted legal reform rather than a new technological or innovative approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, mainly protecting homeowners from liens related to medical debt.

Title: Consumer Protection - Consumer Contracts - Limitation Periods
Synopsis: Prohibiting a consumer contract from setting a shorter time to bring an action under or on the consumer contract than required by the law of the State; excluding certain entities from the application of this Act; and applying the Act prospectively.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits consumer contracts from including provisions that set shorter time limits for legal actions than those mandated by Maryland law, making such provisions void and illegal. It also clarifies enforcement and penalties for violations.
responsible_party: Maryland Courts and the Maryland Attorney General's Office (implied)
stakeholders: Consumers entering into consumer contracts in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs legal clarifications to protect consumers from unfair contractual provisions, but does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on consumer contract law.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Medical Exemption for Enhanced Tinted Windows - Time Limitation
Synopsis: Repealing the 2-year time limitation on medical exemptions for enhanced tinted windows for vehicle owners with certain permanent medical conditions.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the 2-year time limitation on medical exemptions for enhanced tinted windows on vehicles for owners with certain permanent medical conditions.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of State Police
stakeholders: Vehicle owners with medical conditions requiring tinted windows, law enforcement, and the general public
innovative_summary: The bill simplifies the process for medical exemptions for tinted windows by removing the time limit, potentially improving safety and accessibility for individuals with medical needs.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Criminal Law - Visual Surveillance With Prurient Intent - Modifications
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "private place" as it relates to the prohibition on conducting visual surveillance with prurient intent of an individual without the consent of the individual to include a residence; and altering the prohibition against conducting visual surveillance with prurient intent.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland law to redefine 'private place' and clarifies the prohibition on visual surveillance with prurient intent, making it illegal to secretly observe individuals in private areas without consent, with penalties including fines and imprisonment.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety or relevant law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Individuals whose privacy may be invaded by visual surveillance, general public, law enforcement agencies
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates legal definitions and clarifies existing laws regarding visual surveillance, without introducing new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty or include programs aimed at reducing it.

Title: Civil Actions - Tortious Injury to or Death of Pet - Compensatory Damages (Buddy's Law)
Synopsis: Increasing from $10,000 to $25,000 the maximum amount of compensatory damages that may be awarded to an owner of a pet from a person who tortiously causes an injury to or death of the pet while acting individually or through an animal under the person's ownership, direction, or control.
bill_summary: The bill increases the maximum amount of compensatory damages that can be awarded to pet owners when their pet is injured or killed due to someone else's tortious actions from $10,000 to $25,000.
responsible_party: Maryland courts and judicial system
stakeholders: Pet owners and pet owners' pets in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily changes legal damages limits; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has no direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Criminal Procedure - Victims and Witnesses - Out of Court Statement of Child to Forensic Interviewer
Synopsis: Expanding the evidentiary rule on the admissibility of out of court statements made by child victims or witnesses to make admissible an out of court statement made by a child to a forensic interviewer.
bill_summary: The bill expands the rules for admitting out-of-court statements made by child victims or witnesses in criminal and juvenile court proceedings, specifically allowing statements to be admitted if made to forensic interviewers under certain conditions.
responsible_party: Maryland Judiciary or relevant court system
stakeholders: Child victims and witnesses, legal system, law enforcement, child advocacy organizations
innovative_summary: The bill introduces the inclusion of forensic interviewers as a recognized professional role for the purpose of admitting child statements, which is a new approach in evidentiary rules.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve justice outcomes for children, which may indirectly impact child poverty by supporting victims and reducing trauma.

Title: Baby Food Labeling - Statement Regarding Toxic Heavy Metal Testing - Terminology
Synopsis: Altering the statement that must be included on a baby food product label if the baby food product has been tested for toxic heavy metals for the purpose of changing the term included on the label from "toxic heavy metal" to "toxic element".
bill_summary: The bill requires baby food manufacturers in Maryland to test their products for toxic heavy metals and include specific labeling information, including a QR code linking to test results and health guidance, starting in 2025. It also bans the sale of baby food exceeding FDA limits for toxic heavy metals after January 1, 2025.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Baby food manufacturers, parents, and children under 2 in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs modern technology by requiring QR codes on baby food labels to provide consumers with real-time access to testing results and health information, representing a new approach to transparent food labeling.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty but improves food safety and transparency for children, which can contribute to better health outcomes.

Title: Criminal Law - Interference With a Public Safety Answering Point - Penalties
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from taking certain actions with the intent to interrupt or impair the functioning of a public safety answering point; and providing that a person who violates the Act is guilty of a felony and on conviction is subject to imprisonment not to exceed 5 years or a fine of up to $25,000 or both.
bill_summary: The bill enhances laws related to interference with public safety systems, specifically criminalizing acts that disrupt or impair the functioning of public safety answering points and other critical infrastructure, with specified penalties.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Public safety agencies, emergency response systems, and the general public
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates legal penalties and definitions related to cyber interference with public safety systems; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty or include programs aimed at reducing it.

Title: Natural Resources - Invasive Blue Catfish Pilot Program
Synopsis: Establishing the Invasive Blue Catfish Pilot Program in the Department of Natural Resources to curb the spread of the invasive blue catfish in the Chesapeake Bay and its tributaries; requiring the Department to expand the use of practices determined to be effective under the Program; and requiring the Department to report to the Governor and the General Assembly by December 1, 2025, on its findings and recommendations based on the Pilot Program.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Invasive Blue Catfish Pilot Program to control the spread of invasive blue catfish in the Chesapeake Bay and its tributaries, including regulations for fishing and harvest methods.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Fishermen, environmental agencies, residents and ecosystems of the Chesapeake Bay area
innovative_summary: The program employs new approaches such as expanding the use of electrofishing, longer trotlines, and non-corrodible hooks to increase blue catfish harvests.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on environmental management.

Title: Anne Arundel County – Property Tax Credit – Habitat for Humanity of the Chesapeake, Incorporated
Synopsis: Altering the name of Arundel Habitat for Humanity, Inc., to be Habitat for Humanity of the Chesapeake, Incorporated, for purposes of a certain property tax credit against the county or municipal corporation tax imposed on the entity; and authorizing the tax credit for any real property owned by the entity.
bill_summary: The bill alters the name of Arundel Habitat for Humanity, Inc., to Habitat for Humanity of the Chesapeake, Incorporated, and authorizes a property tax credit for real property owned by this entity in Anne Arundel County.
responsible_party: Anne Arundel County government or municipal corporation in Anne Arundel County
stakeholders: Habitat for Humanity of the Chesapeake, Incorporated and property owners in Anne Arundel County
innovative_summary: The bill primarily changes the name of an organization and extends a property tax credit to its real property, which is a standard policy measure, not an innovative program.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, mainly supporting a nonprofit organization.

Title: Modernization of Military Laws Act
Synopsis: Establishing rules of interpretation related to the uniformed services; altering the rule of interpretation for "veteran"; requiring the Secretary of Veterans and Military Families to develop certain policies related to life transitions of veterans, service members, and military families; and altering the application of certain provisions of law related to veterans, the uniformed services, and the filing of certificates of candidacy, the powers of the Governor, State veterans' cemeteries, and housing and employment discrimination.
bill_summary: The bill modernizes Maryland's military and veterans laws by establishing interpretation rules, creating policies for life transitions of veterans and service members, and improving veterans' benefits, cemeteries, and employment preferences.
responsible_party: Department of Veterans and Military Families
stakeholders: Veterans, service members, military families, and their dependents in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach to veteran and service member support, including new policies for life transitions and improved benefits, but does not introduce new technologies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on veterans and military families.

Title: Maryland Transit Administration - Disability Reduced Fare Program - Renewal for Permanently Disabled Individuals
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Transit Administration to automatically renew the Disability Reduced Fare Program certification of an enrollee who is permanently disabled.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Transit Administration to automatically renew the certification of individuals who are permanently disabled for the Disability Reduced Fare Program, and mandates the administration to establish regulations for this process.
responsible_party: Maryland Transit Administration
stakeholders: Permanently disabled individuals using the Disability Reduced Fare Program
innovative_summary: The bill introduces an automatic renewal process for disability fare certification, streamlining access for disabled individuals.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily benefits disabled adults.

Title: Outdoor Lighting - Guidance and Use of State Funds
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Green Building Council, on or before October 1, 2026, to update or develop guidance for the purchase of outdoor lighting fixtures in consideration of certain recommendations; prohibiting State funds from being used to install or replace certain permanent outdoor luminaires for lighting unless certain requirements are met; altering the requirements for the use of State funds for the installation or replacement of certain permanent outdoor luminaires for lighting; applying the Act prospectively; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Green Building Council to develop or update guidance for outdoor lighting fixtures, focusing on reducing light pollution and considering medical recommendations. It restricts the use of state funds for installing or replacing outdoor luminaires unless they meet energy efficiency and light pollution standards, with some exceptions. The Department of Transportation must review highway lighting practices, and the bill sets standards for outdoor lighting on state properties.
responsible_party: Maryland Green Building Council and Department of Transportation
stakeholders: State agencies, outdoor lighting users, environmental and health advocates, general public
innovative_summary: The program employs new guidelines for outdoor lighting based on health and environmental considerations, including restrictions on light temperature and pollution.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but promotes healthier environments which can benefit children indirectly.

Title: Anne Arundel County - Development Impact Fees
Synopsis: Altering the scope of certain limitations on the authority of the Anne Arundel County Council to grant exemptions from or credits against development impact fees.
bill_summary: This bill amends the laws in Anne Arundel County regarding development impact fees, specifically expanding the scope of exemptions and credits that can be granted for certain types of development projects, including affordable housing and land conveyances.
responsible_party: Anne Arundel County Council
stakeholders: Developers, affordable housing projects, local government, residents of Anne Arundel County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces expanded exemptions and credits for impact fees, including for affordable housing and land conveyances, which is a strategic approach to incentivize development and affordable housing.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has the potential to support affordable housing development, which can reduce child poverty by increasing access to stable housing.

Title: Braille Flag Memorial Act of 2025
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Veterans and Military Families to designate a location for an American braille tactile flag to be placed on the grounds of one or more State veterans' cemeteries to honor members of the uniformed services, veterans, and other individuals in the State who are blind or visually impaired.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Veterans and Military Families to designate a location for an American braille tactile flag at one or more State veterans' cemeteries to honor blind and visually impaired veterans and individuals.
responsible_party: Department of Veterans and Military Families
stakeholders: Blind and visually impaired veterans and individuals, visitors of State veterans' cemeteries
innovative_summary: The program introduces a tactile American flag designed for blind and visually impaired individuals, allowing them to experience the flag through touch, which is a novel approach to honoring veterans.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly focuses on veterans and accessibility features at cemeteries.

Title: University of Maryland, College Park Campus - TerpsEXCEED Program - Funding
Synopsis: Authorizing the Governor to include in the annual budget bill, beginning in fiscal year 2027, an appropriation of $350,000 to the University of Maryland, College Park Campus TerpsEXCEED (EXperiencing College through Education and Employment Discovery) Program to provide educational and employment opportunities to students with intellectual disabilities.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland governor to allocate $350,000 annually starting in fiscal year 2027 to fund the University of Maryland, College Park's TerpsEXCEED program, which provides educational and employment opportunities for students with intellectual disabilities.
responsible_party: Governor of Maryland / Maryland State Budget Office
stakeholders: Students with intellectual disabilities, University of Maryland students, educational and employment support organizations
innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive, multi-faceted approach to support students with disabilities, including counseling, course modifications, peer mentorship, career development, and employment opportunities, integrating various services and resources.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to significantly improve educational and employment outcomes for students with disabilities, which can contribute to reducing child poverty among this population.

Title: Counties - Cancer Screening for Professional Firefighters - Required Coverage (James "Jimmy" Malone Act)
Synopsis: Requiring counties that offer self-insured employee health benefit plans to provide to firefighters employed by the county coverage for preventive cancer screenings in accordance with certain guidelines; authorizing a county to satisfy the requirement by providing a no-cost annual examination or applying for a grant to pay for certain cancer screening technologies; prohibiting counties from imposing a copayment, coinsurance, or deductible requirement; and requiring the Maryland Health Commission to conduct a certain study.
bill_summary: This bill requires health insurers, nonprofit health plans, and health maintenance organizations to provide coverage for preventive cancer screenings for professional firefighters without copayments, coinsurance, or deductibles. It also mandates counties offering self-insured employee health plans to ensure coverage for firefighters and to possibly provide free annual examinations or apply for grants to fund innovative cancer screening technologies. The bill includes a study by the Maryland Health Care Commission on expanding such coverage to the commercial insurance market.
responsible_party: Maryland Health Care Commission and local counties with self-insured plans
stakeholders: Professional firefighters in Maryland, counties offering self-insured health plans, and the general public interested in cancer prevention
innovative_summary: The bill employs a proactive approach to cancer prevention for firefighters by mandating coverage for screenings and exploring innovative technologies like multancer early detection blood tests, and includes a study to potentially expand coverage to the broader insurance market.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving health outcomes for a vulnerable workforce, which can indirectly benefit families and communities.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Motor Vehicle Administration - 3-Hour Roadway Safety Driving Education Program - Requirements
Synopsis: Altering the requirements of the 3-hour Roadway Safety Driving Education Program established by the Motor Vehicle Administration for certain applicants for driver's licenses; and requiring the Administration to adopt regulations establishing criteria for certifying a private entity to offer the 3-hour Roadway Safety Education Program.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration to establish a 3-hour Roadway Safety Driving Education Program for certain new drivers and modifies the existing requirements for driver licensing, including the implementation of this program.
responsible_party: Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration
stakeholders: New driver applicants in Maryland, especially those who have never held a license before
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured, mandatory roadway safety education program for new drivers, incorporating specific curriculum content and private provider certification, which is a modern approach to driver education.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily focuses on driver safety education for new drivers.

Title: Health Equality for Service Members Act
Synopsis: Establishing rules of interpretation related to the uniformed services; altering the rule of interpretation for "veteran"; and altering the application of certain provisions of law governing public health, the regulation of health occupations, and housing vouchers and assistance to apply to all uniformed services, rather than only the armed forces.
bill_summary: The bill establishes rules of interpretation for uniformed services, expands legal protections and benefits to all uniformed service members and veterans, and creates a program to support behavioral health services for service members and veterans in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Veterans and Military Families
stakeholders: Service members, veterans, and their families in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach to support military and veteran populations, including expanding legal protections, benefits, and specialized behavioral health programs, integrating federal and state resources, and streamlining licensing processes for service members and veterans.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by supporting military families and improving access to housing and health services.

Title: Local Government - Annapolis and Anne Arundel County Conference and Visitors Bureau Designation
Synopsis: Altering references to the Annapolis and Anne Arundel County Conference and Visitors Bureau to be Visit Annapolis and Anne Arundel County, Inc.
bill_summary: The bill updates the name of the local tourism and visitors bureau from the Annapolis and Anne Arundel County Conference and Visitors Bureau to Visit Annapolis and Anne Arundel County, Inc., and modifies related references and funding allocations from hotel tax revenue to this new entity.
responsible_party: Anne Arundel County and the City of Annapolis government agencies
stakeholders: Tourism industry, local residents, visitors to Annapolis and Anne Arundel County
innovative_summary: The bill mainly renames an existing bureau and adjusts references and funding allocations; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty or include programs aimed at reducing it.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Obscured, Modified, or Blocked Registration Plates and Registration Plate Covers
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from obscuring or modifying any vehicle registration plate in a manner that may prevent identification and enforcing the prohibition as a secondary offense; prohibiting a person from advertising for or promoting the sale of an unlawful registration plate cover by falsely claiming that the registration plate cover is lawful in the State; and establishing that a violation of the Act is an unfair, abusive, or deceptive trade practice subject to certain enforcement and penalties.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits obscuring, modifying, or blocking vehicle registration plates and the sale or promotion of unlawful registration plate covers in Maryland. It enforces penalties for violations and aims to improve vehicle identification.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation and law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Vehicle owners, law enforcement, and the general public
innovative_summary: The bill mainly updates legal rules and enforcement related to vehicle registration plates and covers, without introducing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Baltimore City - Alcoholic Beverages - 45th Alcoholic Beverages District - Licenses
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore City to issue a Class C beer, wine, and liquor license in a certain area of the 45th alcoholic beverages district in Baltimore City under certain circumstances; and altering a geographic boundary in the 45th district within which the holder of a Class A or Class B-D-7 beer, wine, and liquor license must operate in accordance with specified hours.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Baltimore City Board of License Commissioners to issue a new Class C alcohol license in the 45th district, modifies geographic boundaries for existing licenses, and adjusts sale hours and conditions for various alcohol licenses within Baltimore City.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Alcohol license applicants, Baltimore City residents, local businesses, community organizations
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new license type with specific outdoor serving conditions and geographic restrictions, employing targeted licensing approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on licensing and sale hours.

Title: Maryland Community College Promise Scholarship Program - Revisions
Synopsis: Altering the number of years that a recipient of an award under the Maryland Community College Promise Scholarship Program may hold the award under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill revises the Maryland Community College Promise Scholarship Program by extending the maximum duration a recipient can hold the award from 3 years to 6 years after first enrolling, under certain conditions.
responsible_party: Maryland Community College
stakeholders: Community college students in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a straightforward extension of existing scholarship duration rules, without introducing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by supporting community college students, many of whom may be from low-income backgrounds.

Title: Transportation Equality for Service Members Act
Synopsis: Establishing rules of interpretation related to the uniformed services; altering the rule of interpretation for "veteran"; and altering the application of certain provisions of law governing transportation to apply to all uniformed services, rather than only certain uniformed services.
bill_summary: The bill, titled 'Transportation Equality for Service Members Act,' establishes rules of interpretation related to the uniformed services, broadens the legal application to include all uniformed services, and makes various amendments to transportation laws to better recognize and support service members and veterans in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Veterans and Military Families
stakeholders: Service members, veterans, and their families in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach to recognizing and supporting service members and veterans through legal definitions, transportation benefits, and exemptions, integrating military status into transportation laws.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on legal and transportation support for service members and veterans.

Title: St. Mary's County - Alcoholic Beverages - Class A License Quota
Synopsis: Altering the quota for the number of Class A alcoholic beverages licenses that may be issued in the 8th election district in St. Mary's County.
bill_summary: The bill alters the quota for the number of Class A alcoholic beverage licenses that can be issued in the 8th election district in St. Mary's County, Maryland, by changing the population-based limits and the rules for transferring licenses between districts.
responsible_party: St. Mary's County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Residents and businesses in St. Mary's County, especially in the 8th election district
innovative_summary: The bill employs a population-based approach to regulate license quotas and uses recent county planning data to determine quotas, which is a standard regulatory approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it mainly concerns licensing regulations for alcohol sales.

Title: State Department of Education - Family Child Care Homes and Child Care Centers - Regulatory Analysis
Synopsis: Requiring the State Department of Education to conduct a thorough analysis of the State's regulatory framework for child care facilities with particular emphasis on regulations that limit a person's ability to register a child care facility, receive a license to operate a child care center, or operate a child care facility in a profitable manner while providing quality care; and requiring an interim and final report be submitted to the Governor and the General Assembly by January 1, 2026, and September 1, 2026, respectively.
bill_summary: This bill modifies regulations concerning the number of children allowed in family child care homes and centers, and requires the Maryland Department of Education to analyze the state's child care regulations and report on potential improvements.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education
stakeholders: Child care providers, children in care, families, and regulatory agencies in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive regulatory analysis approach, comparing Maryland's regulations with other states and regions, and involves stakeholder consultation to improve child care quality and accessibility.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to impact child poverty by improving access to quality, affordable child care, which supports low-income families.

Title: Hagerstown Community College Police Force - Jurisdiction
Synopsis: Authorizing a Hagerstown Community College police officer to exercise powers granted to a peace and police officer under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Hagerstown Community College police officers to exercise certain law enforcement powers outside the college property under specific circumstances within Washington County, Maryland.
responsible_party: Hagerstown Community College Police Force
stakeholders: Hagerstown Community College students, staff, and the local community in Washington County
innovative_summary: The bill expands the jurisdiction of a college police force to include specific emergency and operational situations outside college property, which is a relatively new approach for college law enforcement agencies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily concerns law enforcement jurisdiction and authority.

Title: St. Mary’s County – County Plans – Public Sewerage Systems and Water Supply Systems
Synopsis: Applying certain provisions relating to the adoption of or revision or amendment to a county plan to county plans in St. Mary's County; and repealing certain provisions relating to public sewerage systems and water supply systems in St. Mary's County.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the process for adopting or amending county plans related to public sewerage and water supply systems in St. Mary’s County, including repealing certain existing provisions and establishing new review and approval procedures.
responsible_party: St. Mary’s County Planning Commission and Board of County Commissioners
stakeholders: Residents and local government in St. Mary’s County, especially those affected by sewerage and water supply projects
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured review process involving public hearings and specific findings for sewerage and water supply projects, emphasizing local planning and community input.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but could indirectly benefit public health and living conditions.

Title: Washington County - Board of License Commissioners - Membership
Synopsis: Requiring that certain numbers of members of the Board of License Commissioners for Washington County belong to certain political parties based on the aggregated number of votes in the preceding election of the Board of County Commissioners.
bill_summary: This bill amends the membership rules for the Washington County Board of License Commissioners, requiring that two members belong to the political party with the highest votes in the previous election and one member to the second highest, replacing the previous rule that no more than two members could belong to the same party.
responsible_party: Washington County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Residents and businesses in Washington County, Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a political party-based appointment system for the Board of License Commissioners, which is a new approach to selecting board members based on election results.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly changes appointment rules for a local licensing board.

Title: Occupational Licensing and Certification - Criminal History - Predetermination Review Process
Synopsis: Providing that "department" does not include the Maryland Department of Health or the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services for purposes of certain provisions prohibiting a department from refusing to issue an occupational license or certificate based on a certain conviction under certain circumstances; establishing a predetermination review process for occupational licenses and certificates in certain departments of State government; authorizing a department to charge a criminal history review fee of up to $100; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a predetermination review process for occupational licenses and certificates in certain Maryland state departments, allowing individuals to request a review of their criminal history to determine if it disqualifies them from obtaining a license.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Agriculture, Department of the Environment, Department of Human Services, Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Individuals seeking occupational licenses or certificates in Maryland with criminal histories
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a formal predetermination review process for criminal history assessments related to occupational licensing, which is a relatively new approach to reducing barriers for ex-offenders.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to reduce barriers to employment for individuals with criminal histories, which can help alleviate child poverty.

Title: St. Mary's County - Corrections
Synopsis: Adding programs, a day reporting program, an in-patient treatment program, and a pretrial release supervision program, that the St. Mary's County Sheriff is authorized to establish; repealing a requirement that the Sheriff or the Sheriff's designee collect the earnings of a certain individual participating in a certain program; and authorizing the Sheriff or the Sheriff's designee to direct an individual participating in a certain program to provide proof that the individual has made payments toward certain obligations.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the St. Mary's County Sheriff to establish various correctional programs, including home detention, day reporting, work release, inpatient treatment, pretrial supervision, and prerelease programs. It also allows the Sheriff to direct participants to provide proof of payments toward certain obligations and removes the requirement to collect earnings from participants.
responsible_party: St. Mary's County Sheriff
stakeholders: Individuals participating in correctional programs in St. Mary's County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a more flexible correctional program structure, including the ability to direct participants to provide proof of payments and to establish various rehabilitative programs, which is a moderate innovation in correctional management.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to impact child poverty by providing rehabilitative and community-based correctional options that may reduce recidivism and support family stability.

Title: St. Mary's County - Alcoholic Beverages - Civil Penalty for Sales Violations
Synopsis: Increasing, from $1,000 to $2,500, the maximum civil penalty that the Board of License Commissioners for St. Mary's County may impose for a violation of a law relating to licensing the sale of alcoholic beverages.
bill_summary: The bill increases the maximum civil penalty that the Board of License Commissioners for St. Mary's County can impose for violations related to the sale of alcoholic beverages, raising it from $1,000 to $2,500.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for St. Mary's County
stakeholders: Alcoholic beverage licensees and the general public in St. Mary's County
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates existing penalties and does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Maryland Department of Labor - Study on Building Code Requirements for Single-Staircase Buildings
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Labor to study building code requirements for single-staircase buildings in the State and other States and analyze best practices when drafting building code requirements; requiring the Department to make legislative and regulatory recommendations for the purpose of increasing the affordable housing supply by reducing barriers to multifamily housing development; and requiring the Department to report to the Governor and certain committees of the General Assembly by December 1, 2026.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Labor to study building code requirements for single-staircase buildings up to six stories high, analyze best practices, and make recommendations to potentially amend regulations to increase affordable housing by reducing barriers to multifamily housing development.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Housing developers, residents, fire safety officials, local governments, and advocacy groups for affordable housing
innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive study and analysis approach, including cross-state comparisons and stakeholder consultations, to inform potential regulatory changes for building safety and affordability.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to increase affordable housing options, which can directly impact child poverty by providing more stable and affordable living environments.

Title: St. Mary's County - Competitive Bidding - Threshold
Synopsis: Increasing the minimum contract value to $50,000 to require a competitive bidding process in St. Mary's County for contracts for services or supplies.
bill_summary: This bill increases the minimum contract value requiring a competitive bidding process in St. Mary's County from $15,000 to $50,000 for contracts for services or supplies.
responsible_party: St. Mary's County government
stakeholders: Residents and businesses in St. Mary's County
innovative_summary: The bill mainly changes procurement rules and thresholds, which is a standard administrative update, not an innovative program.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.
