Title: St. Mary's County - Metropolitan Commission - Discontinuance of Service
Synopsis: Authorizing the St. Mary's County Metropolitan Commission to discontinue all or part of water or sewer service provided to an improved private property determined to be unsafe, unfit, or unsuitable for human occupancy due to an accident, artificial disaster, or natural disaster; requiring the suspension of the ready-to-serve charge on certain private properties; and authorizing the St. Mary's County Metropolitan Commission to utilize certain remedies for a violation related to certain public water and sewer use.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes the St. Mary's County Metropolitan Commission to discontinue water or sewer service to private properties under certain circumstances, such as nonpayment or unsafe conditions, and to suspend the ready-to-serve charge during service discontinuance. It also allows the Commission to use various enforcement remedies for violations of water and sewer regulations.
responsible_party: St. Mary's County Metropolitan Commission
stakeholders: Residents and property owners in St. Mary's County who use water and sewer services
innovative_summary: The bill introduces the use of administrative enforcement remedies, including fines and emergency suspensions, for water and sewer regulation violations, and allows discontinuance of service for unsafe conditions.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily affecting water and sewer service policies.

Title: Frederick County - County Employees and Volunteers - Criminal History Records Check
Synopsis: Authorizing the Director of Human Resources of Frederick County to request from the Criminal Justice Information System Central Repository of the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services a State and national criminal history records check for a prospective or current county employee or county volunteer; requiring the Central Repository to forward certain information to certain persons; requiring that the information remain confidential and that it be used only for personnel-related purposes; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Frederick County's Director of Human Resources to request criminal history records checks for current or prospective employees and volunteers, and establishes procedures for handling and contesting this information.
responsible_party: Frederick County Department of Human Resources
stakeholders: County employees and volunteers in Frederick County
innovative_summary: The bill employs existing criminal record check technology and procedures, with a focus on local government implementation and confidentiality.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty but enhances background check processes for county personnel and volunteers.

Title: Recreational Equality for Service Members Act
Synopsis: Establishing rules of interpretation related to the uniformed services; altering the rule of interpretation for "veteran"; altering the application of certain provisions of law governing public health and the regulation of health occupations to apply to all uniformed services, rather than only the armed forces; altering the circumstances under which licenses for fishing in tidal waters do not lapse; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes programs and benefits for service members and veterans in Maryland, including fee waivers for park entry, fishing licenses, hunting licenses, and recreational activities, as well as defining interpretation rules for military-related terms.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Veterans and Military Families
stakeholders: Service members, veterans, and their families in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach to support service members and veterans through various recreational and benefit programs, utilizing existing identification and establishing new grants and fee exemptions.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on recreational benefits for service members and veterans.

Title: Residential Child Care Programs - Transportation Companies - Regulation (Preventing Abduction in Youth Transport Act of 2025)
Synopsis: Prohibiting transportation companies that transport children to residential child care programs from using certain restraints unless there is a substantial likelihood of imminent serious physical harm to a child or others; prohibiting transportation companies that transport children to residential child care programs from picking up children between the hours of 9 p.m. and 6 a.m.; authorizing an individual and the Attorney General to bring a certain civil action against certain transportation companies; and applying the Act prospectively.
bill_summary: The bill regulates transportation companies that transport children to residential child care programs, prohibiting certain restraints and pick-up times, and establishing legal actions for violations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Human Services and Attorney General
stakeholders: Children transported to residential child care programs, transportation companies, families, and residential care providers
innovative_summary: The bill introduces specific regulations on restraints and pick-up times for youth transportation, with legal enforcement mechanisms, representing a targeted approach to improve safety and oversight.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by ensuring safer transportation to care programs, which can improve stability and well-being.

Title: Procurement Reform Act of 2025
Synopsis: Authorizing the Secretary of General Services to delegate certain powers and duties to the Chief Procurement Officer; altering the authority of the Department of General Services to engage in or control procurement of certain equipment and services; requiring the Department of Information Technology to establish a technical procurement team; altering the authority of the Department of Transportation and the Maryland Transportation Authority to engage in procurement for certain supplies and services; etc.
bill_summary: This bill overhauls Maryland's procurement laws, establishing new procedures, standards, and programs to promote small, minority, women, veteran, and environmentally focused businesses, including the creation of pay-for-success environmental contracts, workforce development initiatives, and enhanced transparency and accountability measures.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of General Services and Maryland Environmental Service
stakeholders: Small businesses, minority-owned businesses, veteran-owned businesses, environmental organizations, state agencies, contractors, and workforce development programs
innovative_summary: The bill introduces innovative approaches such as pay-for-success environmental contracts, a comprehensive workforce development and apprenticeship program, and new procurement methods leveraging technology and performance-based outcomes.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has high potential to impact child poverty by promoting workforce development, supporting small and minority businesses, and creating economic opportunities.

Title: Office of Disability Employment Advancement and Policy and Maryland as a Model Employer Initiative - Established
Synopsis: Establishing the Office of Disability Employment Advancement and Policy within the Department of Disabilities; establishing the Maryland as a Model Employer Initiative within the Office of Disability Employment Advancement and Policy to facilitate efforts that improve outcomes in the hiring, recruitment, retention, and advancement of people with disabilities in the State government workforce; authorizing the Governor for fiscal year 2027, to include $250,000 in the annual budget bill for the Office; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Office of Disability Employment Advancement and Policy within the Maryland Department of Disabilities and creates the Maryland as a Model Employer Initiative to improve employment outcomes for people with disabilities in state government.
responsible_party: Department of Disabilities
stakeholders: People with disabilities seeking employment, state government agencies, and the general public
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a dedicated office and a state-wide initiative focused on improving employment opportunities for people with disabilities, including outreach, training, and policy evaluation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty indirectly by increasing employment opportunities for people with disabilities, which can benefit families and children.

Title: Excellence in Maryland Public Schools Act
Synopsis: Altering the source of funds for the Blueprint for Maryland's Future Fund to include the interest earnings of the Academic Excellence Fund; authorizing the Department to establish a national teacher recruitment campaign; establishing the Academic Excellence Program in the Department to address critical academic needs in public schools; requiring the Department to consult with a certain entity to evaluate  the Concentration of Poverty School Grant Program and establish requirements for community school implementation plans; etc.
bill_summary: The bill enhances Maryland's education system by increasing funding, establishing new programs for teacher recruitment, retention, and leadership development, supporting community schools, and implementing innovative educational models and assessments, including a new interstate teacher licensure compact.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Students, teachers, school administrators, families, and communities in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs innovative approaches such as a new interstate teacher licensure compact, a statewide community schools initiative, and a comprehensive teacher leadership and professional development system, integrating technology and evidence-based practices.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a high potential to directly impact child poverty by funding community schools, supporting schools with high concentrations of poverty, and improving access to quality education and wraparound services.

Title: Chesapeake Bay Legacy Act
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Leaders in Environmentally Engaged Farming (LEEF) Program; establishing the Maryland Leaders in Environmentally Engaged Farming (LEEF) Program Fund to support actions associated with the Program's purpose; altering the definition of "healthy soils" for purposes of the Maryland Healthy Soils Program; exempting certain holders of certain fishing licenses from the requirement to obtain a food establishment license from the Maryland Department of Health; establishing the Water Quality Monitoring Program; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Leaders in Environmentally Engaged Farming (LEEF) Program, creates related funds and initiatives to promote sustainable farming practices, water quality monitoring, fishery management, and watershed restoration projects, with a focus on Chesapeake Bay health and environmental justice.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Agriculture and Maryland Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Farmers, environmental agencies, local communities, fishery participants, and residents in overburdened or underserved communities
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive, multi-agency approach integrating conservation practices, water quality monitoring, fishery management, and watershed restoration, utilizing new data systems and certification processes, and fostering community engagement and innovation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to impact child poverty by improving environmental conditions, supporting local employment, and promoting community health and resilience.

Title: State Contracts - Prohibited Provisions
Synopsis: Clarifying a prohibition on including in State contracts provisions pertaining to limitations of liability for damage to real or tangible personal property; and clarifying a prohibition on including in State contracts provisions limiting the recovery of costs related to the use of replacement contractors under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: This bill clarifies and prohibits certain provisions in State contracts, including limitations on liability for property damage, restrictions on recovery of costs related to replacement contractors, and other unfair contractual terms.
responsible_party: Maryland State Government (likely the Department of General Services or equivalent)
stakeholders: State agencies and contractors involved in State contracts
innovative_summary: The bill employs a legal and regulatory approach to prevent unfair contractual provisions, rather than introducing new technologies or innovative methods.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly target child poverty but aims to improve fairness and transparency in State contracting.

Title: State Procurement Preferences - Blind Industries and Services of Maryland - Packaging and Repackaging
Synopsis: Requiring a State or State aided or controlled entity to require a prime contractor to procure certain janitorial products packaged or repackaged by Blind Industries and Services of Maryland.
bill_summary: The bill requires state entities to include in maintenance contracts a requirement that prime contractors procure janitorial products from Blind Industries and Services of Maryland if the products are made, remanufactured, packaged, repackaged, or assembled by them and are available.
responsible_party: State or State aided or controlled entities
stakeholders: Blind Industries and Services of Maryland, janitorial product suppliers, state agencies, and contractors
innovative_summary: The bill employs a procurement preference to support a state-operated social enterprise, integrating social impact into government purchasing.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to support employment and economic stability for individuals served by Blind Industries and Services of Maryland, which could indirectly impact child poverty.

Title: Maryland Inventory of Cemeteries and Burial Sites Workgroup - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Inventory of Cemeteries and Burial Sites Workgroup for the purpose of studying issues related to the establishment and maintenance of a State cemetery inventory system; and requiring the Workgroup to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly by December 1, 2025.
bill_summary: This bill establishes the Maryland Inventory of Cemeteries and Burial Sites Workgroup to study issues related to creating and maintaining a statewide cemetery inventory system, including definitions, practices, costs, and potential funding and grants.
responsible_party: Maryland Historical Trust and Maryland Office of Cemetery Oversight
stakeholders: Cemetery owners, genealogical and historical organizations, local governments, descendant communities, religious groups, and the general public interested in cemetery preservation and documentation.
innovative_summary: The program aims to create a comprehensive, integrated statewide cemetery inventory system, which involves evaluating existing practices, adopting best practices from other states, and potentially implementing new technology and data management approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on cemetery documentation and preservation.

Title: Frederick County - Barbershop and Beauty Salon Beer and Wine License - Alterations
Synopsis: Increasing from 5 to 6.5 ounces of wine by the glass that a holder of a barbershop or beauty salon beer and wine license in Frederick County may provide to a certain customer for on-premises consumption.
bill_summary: The bill amends the regulations for beer and wine licenses in Frederick County, Maryland, increasing the allowed wine serving size from 5 ounces to 6.5 ounces for barbershop and beauty salon license holders, and clarifies the rules around on-premises consumption and licensing.
responsible_party: Frederick County Department of Permits and Inspections
stakeholders: Barbershop and beauty salon license holders, customers in Frederick County
innovative_summary: The bill makes a modest adjustment to existing alcohol licensing rules, primarily increasing serving sizes and clarifying regulations, without employing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly involves licensing regulations for alcohol service in specific local businesses.

Title: Crimes Relating to Animals - Restrictions on Keeping Roosters
Synopsis: Prohibiting, beginning January 1, 2027, a certain person from keeping a rooster movement-constrained through use of a certain enclosure or tether, subject to certain exceptions; establishing that a violation of the Act is a civil offense; and providing the Act may be enforced by any State or local law enforcement officers or local animal control authority for the jurisdiction where the violation occurs.
bill_summary: This bill prohibits keeping more than 5 roosters per acre or more than 25 roosters on a property in Maryland starting January 1, 2027, with certain exceptions. It aims to address issues related to cockfighting and the spread of avian flu.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Agriculture and local law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Rooster owners, animal control agencies, local governments, and the general public in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a regulatory approach to limit rooster populations through enforcement and cooperation between state and local agencies, with specific restrictions and penalties.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on animal control and public health.

Title: Health Occupations - State Board of Chiropractic Examiners - Revisions
Synopsis: Altering certain provisions of law governing the State Board of Chiropractic Examiners and the practice of chiropractic in the State related to Board membership, licensure of chiropractors, the discipline of chiropractors, and the denial of licenses to applicants; authorizing the Board to inspect chiropractor offices under certain circumstances; and requiring the Board to require a licensee or applicant to submit to an examination by a health care provider under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill revises laws governing the Maryland State Board of Chiropractic Examiners, including changes to Board membership, licensure, discipline, inspection authority, and examination requirements for chiropractors.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Chiropractic Examiners
stakeholders: Chiropractors and chiropractic students in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates regulatory and licensing procedures; it does not introduce new services or interventions.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, focusing on professional regulation.

Title: Anne Arundel County - Alcoholic Beverages Licenses - Veterans' Organizations
Synopsis: Authorizing a certain holder of a Class C beer, wine, and liquor license in Anne Arundel County to convert the license to a Class C (veterans' organization) license; reducing from $400 to $300 the annual license fee for a Class C (veterans' organization) license; authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Anne Arundel County to provide application and administrative fee discounts to certain licensees and applicants; and authorizing a Class C (veterans' organization) licensee to operate on Sunday without a Sunday license.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes a specific type of license conversion for veterans' organizations in Anne Arundel County, Maryland, allowing them to operate with a Class C (veterans' organization) license, which includes changes to licensing fees and operating hours, including Sunday sales without a separate Sunday license.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Anne Arundel County
stakeholders: Veterans' organizations and their members in Anne Arundel County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a streamlined license conversion process for veterans' organizations, simplifying licensing and operational rules, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily concerns licensing and operational rules for veterans' organizations.

Title: Motor Vehicles - Automated Enforcement Programs - Privacy Protections
Synopsis: Requiring a custodian of recorded images produced by certain automated enforcement systems to deny inspection of the images, subject to certain exceptions; prohibiting certain State and local agencies from using a recorded image or associated data from an automated enforcement system subject to certain exceptions; and establishing certain requirements and authorizations for the removal and destruction of recorded images and associated data produced by an automated enforcement system.
bill_summary: This bill enhances privacy protections for automated enforcement programs in Maryland by restricting access to recorded images and data, requiring warrants or court orders for use, establishing destruction protocols, and setting standards for program operation and data storage.
responsible_party: Maryland State and local transportation and law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Motor vehicle owners, drivers, law enforcement agencies, and the general public in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs new privacy safeguards and data management standards for automated enforcement systems, including restrictions on data sharing and biometric technology.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on privacy and legal protections.

Title: Workgroup on the Reorganization of the Maryland Transit Administration
Synopsis: Establishing the Workgroup on the Reorganization of the Maryland Transit Administration to study reorganizing the Maryland Transit Administration; requiring the Workgroup to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly on or before December 1, 2025; and requiring the Department of Transportation, in consultation with the Department of Legislative Services, to submit to the President of the Senate and the Speaker of the House draft legislation to effectuate the recommendations of the Workgroup.
bill_summary: This bill establishes the Maryland Area Rail Commuter (MARC) Rail Authority to oversee and manage MARC rail services and projects, and creates a workgroup to study the reorganization of the Maryland Transit Administration and the Department of Transportation, including options for local Baltimore City transit services.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation
stakeholders: Maryland residents, transit riders, Baltimore City transit users, government agencies involved in transit services
innovative_summary: The bill employs a new governance structure for MARC rail services and initiates a comprehensive study on reorganizing transit agencies, including potential technological and structural innovations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving transit services, which can enhance access to education and employment.

Title: Maryland Transit Administration - Purple Line - Free Ridership and Promotional Materials and Services
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Transit Administration to develop and implement a program providing for the first month after transit service begins on the Purple Line, free ridership on Purple Line transit vehicles to individuals residing within a one-quarter-mile radius of the Purple Line track; and requiring the Administration to include, beginning on October 1, 2025, for 3 months after service on the Purple Lines begins promotional materials and services at no cost to small businesses located within a one-quarter-mile radius of the Purple Line track.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Transit Administration to develop and implement a program that offers free ridership on the Purple Line for residents within a quarter-mile of the track for the first three months of service. It also mandates free advertising space on transit vehicles and stations for small businesses within the same radius for three months after service begins.
responsible_party: Maryland Transit Administration
stakeholders: Residents living near the Purple Line, small businesses near the Purple Line, transit users
innovative_summary: The program employs a targeted approach to promote transit use and support small businesses through free ridership and advertising, utilizing existing resources and regulations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on transit promotion and small business support.

Title: Baltimore County - Vehicle Laws - Private Roadways in Residential Communities
Synopsis: Prohibiting, from October 1, 2025, to July 1, 2028, a person from driving a motor vehicle in violation of certain provisions of the Maryland Vehicle Law on private roadways in a certain residential community in Baltimore County; authorizing, from October 1, 2025, to July 1, 2028, a police officer to enforce the vehicle law on private roadways in a certain residential community in Baltimore County; and prohibiting a person from driving a motor vehicle in violation of the Act on any roadway located in certain areas of Calvert County.
bill_summary: This bill prohibits driving violations on private roadways within certain residential communities in Baltimore County and Calvert County, and authorizes police enforcement in these areas for a specified period. It also requires a report on the program's effectiveness after three years.
responsible_party: Baltimore County Police Department
stakeholders: Residents of the Queen Anne Village community in Owings Mills, Baltimore County, and Calvert County residents using private roadways in residential communities.
innovative_summary: The bill employs a temporary enforcement program on private roadways in specific residential communities, with a formal reporting requirement to evaluate its effectiveness.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly focuses on traffic enforcement in private communities.

Title: Peace Orders and Protective Orders – Military Protection Orders
Synopsis: Authorizing a judge to consider whether a military protection order has been issued against a respondent when determining whether to grant a temporary peace order or a temporary protective order; and requiring a law enforcement officer to notify a certain law enforcement agency that an individual may have violated a military protection order under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes judges to consider military protection orders when issuing peace or protective orders, requires law enforcement to notify agencies of potential violations of military protection orders, and updates legal procedures and penalties related to peace and protective orders in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland courts and law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Individuals involved in peace or protective orders, military service members, law enforcement agencies, and the judiciary in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces the consideration of military protection orders in civil protective order proceedings and mandates notification of potential violations to federal databases, employing integrated legal and law enforcement approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on legal protections and law enforcement procedures.

Title: Abandoned and Neglected Cemeteries Fund - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Abandoned and Neglected Cemeteries Fund to provide for the care, preservation, maintenance, and restoration of abandoned and neglected cemeteries in the State; authorizing the Governor to include in the annual budget bill an appropriation of $250,000 to the fund; and requiring an annual report by September 30 to the General Assembly on the donations to the Fund and promotional efforts undertaken by money from the Fund.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Abandoned and Neglected Cemeteries Fund in Maryland, which will be funded through voluntary contributions via a checkoff on individual income tax returns. The fund is intended to support the care, preservation, maintenance, and restoration of abandoned and neglected cemeteries in the state. The bill also authorizes appropriations and sets reporting requirements for the fund.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor and State Treasurer
stakeholders: Communities with abandoned or neglected cemeteries, local governments, and descendants of those buried in such cemeteries
innovative_summary: The program employs a voluntary tax checkoff system to fund cemetery preservation efforts, integrating government services with community contributions through tax forms.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing on cemetery preservation.

Title: Department of Human Services - Federal Commodity Supplemental Food Program - Administration
Synopsis: Requiring the Family Investment Administration in the Department of Human Services to be the central coordinating and directing agency of the federal Commodity Supplemental Food Program using certain funds and resources; and repealing the requirement that the Secretary of Aging administer the Program.
bill_summary: The bill designates the Family Investment Administration in the Maryland Department of Human Services as the central agency for coordinating the federal Commodity Supplemental Food Program, replacing the previous requirement that the Secretary of Aging administer the program.
responsible_party: Family Investment Administration, Department of Human Services
stakeholders: Low-income individuals and families participating in the federal Commodity Supplemental Food Program in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill consolidates federal food assistance programs under a single state agency, streamlining administration and coordination.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to directly impact child poverty by improving access to nutritional assistance for low-income families.

Title: Department of Commerce - Nonprofit Organizations Navigator - Established
Synopsis: Establishing a nonprofit organizations navigator within the Department of Commerce to provide technical assistance and work with nonprofits and units of State government to resolve complexities and delays in State grant-making processes, collect and share certain information, and represent nonprofit organizations' interests and concerns as a member of the Maryland Efficient Grant Application Council; and requiring the Department to report to certain committees of the General Assembly on the implementation of the navigator.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a nonprofit organizations navigator within the Maryland Department of Commerce to assist nonprofits with accessing and applying for state grants, and to represent their interests on the Maryland Efficient Grant Application Council. It also modifies the composition and duties of the Maryland Efficient Grant Application Council and related provisions.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Commerce
stakeholders: Nonprofit organizations in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a dedicated navigator role and a comprehensive council to streamline grant processes and improve support for nonprofits, utilizing coordinated efforts and stakeholder engagement.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to directly impact child poverty by improving access to grants that support services for children and families.

Title: Adult Protective Services - Investigations and Disclosure of Information
Synopsis: Authorizing a local department of social services to request assistance from federal law enforcement officers in an investigation relating to an alleged vulnerable adult; and altering certain provisions relating to the disclosure of certain information concerning human services to include adult protective services.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes local departments of social services to request assistance from federal law enforcement in investigations related to vulnerable adults, modifies disclosure rules for human services information, and enhances adult protective services procedures.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Human Services
stakeholders: Vulnerable adults and their caregivers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new approach by allowing local social services to request federal law enforcement assistance in adult protective investigations, integrating federal resources into state-level adult protection efforts.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on adult protective services and law enforcement cooperation.

Title: Digital Advertising Gross Revenues Tax - Assessments - Appeals and Corrections
Synopsis: Establishing a certain appeal process for persons who are subject to the digital advertising gross revenues tax and receive a notice of assessment from the Comptroller; authorizing the Comptroller or the Comptroller's designee to issue an order to correct an erroneous assessment of the digital advertising gross revenues tax, subject to certain conditions; and applying the Act to assessments of the digital advertising gross revenues tax made after December 31, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill establishes an appeal process for persons subject to the digital advertising gross revenues tax in Maryland, allowing them to contest assessments and request corrections or abatements.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller's Office
stakeholders: Businesses subject to the digital advertising gross revenues tax in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a formalized appeal and correction process for digital advertising tax assessments, which is a standard administrative procedure but tailored for this specific tax.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty as it mainly deals with tax assessment procedures.

Title: Maryland Medical Assistance Program - Maternal Health Self-Measured Blood Pressure Monitoring
Synopsis: Requiring, beginning on January 1, 2026, the Maryland Medical Assistance Program to provide coverage for self-measured blood pressure monitoring for certain eligible Program recipients; and requiring reimbursement of health care provider and other staff time used for patient training, transmission of blood pressure data, interpretation of blood pressure readings and reporting, remote patient monitoring, and the delivery of co-interventions, including educational materials or classes.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Medical Assistance Program to start providing coverage for self-measured blood pressure monitoring for eligible recipients starting January 1, 2026. It also mandates the development of an education campaign about blood pressure monitoring and requires annual reporting on program outcomes and savings.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Medicaid recipients with hypertension, pregnant women, postpartum women, and individuals with chronic kidney disease, diabetes, heart disease, or cardiometabolic disease in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a modern approach by integrating home blood pressure monitoring technology into Medicaid coverage, including education and remote monitoring, which is a relatively innovative approach to managing hypertension and related conditions.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve health outcomes for vulnerable populations, which can indirectly reduce child poverty by decreasing health-related financial burdens and improving family stability.

Title: Food Establishments - Portable Chemical Toilets
Synopsis: Authorizing food establishments that are businesses that conduct agritourism, Class 4 limited wineries, or Class 8 farm breweries to comply with the requirement to provide a convenient lavatory by providing a portable chemical toilet that is supplied with approved hand drying devices, kept in a sanitary condition, is properly ventilated, and is placed at least 25 feet from a well.
bill_summary: The bill allows certain food establishments, specifically those involved in agritourism, limited wineries, and farm breweries, to meet the requirement of providing a convenient lavatory by using a portable chemical toilet that meets specific requirements, instead of a traditional lavatory.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Food establishments involved in agritourism, wineries, and farm breweries in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces the use of portable chemical toilets as an alternative to traditional lavatories for specific food establishments, which is a practical and flexible approach to compliance.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it mainly changes compliance options for certain food establishments.

Title: Baltimore County - Political Party Central Committee - Elections
Synopsis: Altering from four to three the number of members elected from each councilmanic district of Baltimore County to the Baltimore County Republican Party Central Committee; and altering the number of members elected from each legislative district of Baltimore County to the Baltimore County Democratic Party Central Committee.
bill_summary: This bill amends the election rules for the Baltimore County Republican and Democratic Party Central Committees, changing the number of members elected from each district.
responsible_party: Baltimore County election authorities and party committees
stakeholders: Members of Baltimore County political party central committees and voters in Baltimore County
innovative_summary: The bill primarily changes election district representation for party committees; it does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Dorchester County - Alcoholic Beverages - Venue Beer, Wine, and Liquor License
Synopsis: Establishing in Dorchester County a venue beer, wine, and liquor license that authorizes the holder to sell or serve beer, wine, and liquor for on-premises consumption during an event where food is served; authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Dorchester County to issue the license to certain nonprofit or for-profit retail businesses that meet certain criteria; and authorizing the issuance of a license to an establishment that is within 300 feet of a place of worship or a school with certain written consent.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a new venue beer, wine, and liquor license in Dorchester County that allows holders to sell or serve alcohol during events where food is served, with specific size and capacity requirements, and includes provisions for proximity to places of worship or schools.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Dorchester County
stakeholders: Event venues, alcohol consumers, local community, places of worship and schools within proximity
innovative_summary: The program introduces a specialized license for event venues that combines alcohol sales with event hosting, including proximity considerations to sensitive sites, which is a tailored approach to alcohol licensing.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily affecting event venues and alcohol sales regulations.

Title: State Board of Pharmacy - Renewal Notices - Electronic Means
Synopsis: Requiring the State Board of Pharmacy to send renewal notices to licensees, permit holders, and registrants by electronic means, rather than by first-class mail, unless the licensee, permit holder, or registrant requests to receive the renewal notice by first-class mail.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland State Board of Pharmacy to send renewal notices to licensees, permit holders, and registrants via electronic means (email) by default, with an option for individuals to request traditional first-class mail. It updates the procedures and timelines for renewal notices for various pharmacy-related licenses and registrations.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Pharmacy
stakeholders: Pharmacy licensees, permit holders, registrants, and pharmacy professionals in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs digital communication technology to streamline and modernize the renewal notice process, reducing reliance on traditional mail.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily updates administrative procedures for pharmacy license renewals.

Title: Dorchester County - Alcoholic Beverages Licenses - Fees
Synopsis: Altering licensing fees for certain alcoholic beverages licenses in Dorchester County; and authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Dorchester County to charge an application or transfer fee under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill increases licensing fees for alcoholic beverages licenses in Dorchester County, Maryland, and authorizes the Board of License Commissioners to charge application and transfer fees.
responsible_party: Dorchester County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Alcoholic beverage license applicants and licensees in Dorchester County
innovative_summary: The bill mainly adjusts fees and authorizes additional fees; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Dorchester County - Alcoholic Beverages - Arts Beer and Wine License
Synopsis: Establishing in Dorchester County an arts beer and wine license that authorizes the holder to sell or serve beer and wine for on-premises consumption; authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Dorchester County to issue the license to a nonprofit or for-profit retail business that engages in the display and sale of original artwork in an arts and entertainment district; authorizing the issuance the license within 300 feet of a place of worship or a school with certain written permission; and providing an annual fee of $250.
bill_summary: The bill establishes an arts beer and wine license in Dorchester County, allowing certain retail businesses engaged in art display and sale to sell beer and wine for on-premises consumption within specified regulations, including proximity rules to places of worship or schools.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Dorchester County
stakeholders: Art businesses, local residents, visitors, and the arts community in Dorchester County
innovative_summary: The program introduces a specialized license for art-focused businesses to sell alcohol, integrating arts and entertainment with alcohol licensing, which is a novel approach in local licensing policies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily concerns licensing and alcohol sales regulations.

Title: Dorchester County - Alcoholic Beverages - Beer, Wine, and Liquor Tasting License
Synopsis: Authorizing certain Class A license holders in Dorchester County to conduct tastings of liquor under certain circumstances, in addition to tastings of beer and wine; and limiting the quantity of liquor allowed per individual for tastings to 0.5 ounces from each offering and 1.5 ounces from all offerings of liquor in 1 day.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes certain Class A license holders in Dorchester County to conduct tastings of liquor, in addition to beer and wine tastings, with specific quantity limits and licensing fees.
responsible_party: Dorchester County Alcoholic Beverages Board
stakeholders: Alcohol license holders, consumers in Dorchester County, local businesses involved in alcohol sales and tastings
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new licensing option allowing liquor tastings, expanding traditional alcohol tasting regulations with specific quantity limits and fees.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily pertains to alcohol licensing and tastings.

Title: Anne Arundel County - Alcoholic Beverages - Class C Licenses - Events
Synopsis: Authorizing a holder of certain Class C licenses in Anne Arundel County to sell beer, wine, and liquor to certain individuals for on-premises consumption during events held at the licensed premises; and requiring an outside group to obtain a per diem license from the Board of License Commissioners for Anne Arundel County if the outside group holds an event hosted by the holder of a certain Class C license.
bill_summary: The bill establishes an event permit system in Anne Arundel County that allows holders of Class C (veterans' organization) licenses to sell alcohol during events, with specific rules for outside groups and permit fees.
responsible_party: Anne Arundel County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Veterans' organizations, event attendees, local residents, alcohol license holders in Anne Arundel County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a specialized event permit for veterans' organizations to sell alcohol during events, streamlining licensing and expanding alcohol sales opportunities for these organizations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily supporting veterans' organizations and event-based alcohol sales.

Title: State Board of Dental Examiners - Expanded Function Dental Assistants - Education and Reinstatement
Synopsis: Authorizing the State Board of Dental Examiners to approve a certain course of study for expanded function dental assistant certification; requiring that a course of study for initial dental assistant certification include at least 35 hours of in-person and online instruction; requiring the Board to reinstate a certain certification only under certain circumstances; requiring the Board to adopt regulations requiring continuing education, including clinical hands-on training, for expanded function dental assistants; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland State Board of Dental Examiners to approve specific courses for expanded function dental assistant certification, including online and in-person instruction, and sets regulations for reinstating expired certifications and continuing education requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Dental Examiners
stakeholders: Dental assistants, dental professionals, and patients in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program introduces flexible online and in-person training options and updates certification renewal processes, employing modern educational approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on professional certification processes.

Title: St. Mary's County - Alcoholic Beverages Licenses - Multiple Licensing Plans
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for St. Mary's County to issue not more than three Class B beer, wine, and liquor restaurant licenses to a person under certain circumstances; and prohibiting a person from having a direct or indirect interest in more than a certain number of Class B beer, wine, and liquor restaurant licenses.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Board of License Commissioners for St. Mary's County to issue up to three Class B beer, wine, and liquor restaurant licenses to an individual or entity, with restrictions on ownership interests to prevent excessive concentration of licenses among the same person or related entities.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for St. Mary's County
stakeholders: Businesses and individuals involved in the sale of alcoholic beverages in St. Mary's County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured licensing cap and detailed rules on ownership interests to regulate alcohol licenses, which is a targeted regulatory approach rather than a new technological or innovative service.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's direct impact on child poverty is minimal as it mainly regulates licensing rules for alcohol sales.

Title: Maryland Protecting Opportunities and Regional Trade (PORT) Act – Reports of Attorney General – Frequency
Synopsis: Altering the frequency, from every month to every 6 months, of the reports required to be submitted by the Attorney General to the General Assembly regarding the status of the recovery of economic damages arising from the closure of the Helen Delich Bentley Port of Baltimore and the collapse of the Francis Scott Key Bridge.
bill_summary: The bill amends the Maryland Protecting Opportunities and Regional Trade (PORT) Act to change the reporting frequency of the Attorney General's reports on recovering economic damages from the Port of Baltimore closure and the Francis Scott Key Bridge collapse, from monthly to every six months.
responsible_party: Attorney General of Maryland
stakeholders: State of Maryland, residents and businesses affected by the Port and Bridge damages
innovative_summary: The bill primarily changes reporting frequency, which is a procedural update; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Business Regulation - Enforcement for Miscellaneous State Business Licenses - Study
Synopsis: Requiring the Comptroller to consult with certain stakeholders to study and make recommendations on the enforcement process for miscellaneous State business licenses; and requiring the Comptroller to report the findings and recommendations of the study to the General Assembly by December 1, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill studies and recommends improvements to the enforcement process for miscellaneous State business licenses, including the use of civil citations and contact procedures for enforcement.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller's Office
stakeholders: Business owners, enforcement agencies, and stakeholders involved in business licensing in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill proposes to review and potentially implement new enforcement methods, such as civil citations, and improve contact procedures, which are relatively innovative approaches to government enforcement.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on enforcement procedures for business licenses.

Title: Terminology and Obsolete References – Maryland State Firefighters Association and Related Terms
Synopsis: Replacing obsolete references to the Maryland State Firemen's Association with references to the Maryland State Firefighters Association; and replacing related terminology.
bill_summary: This bill updates terminology and references related to the Maryland State Firefighters Association, replacing obsolete terms and ensuring consistency across various legal and organizational documents. It also clarifies procedures for notification of contagious disease exposure among emergency personnel and makes related administrative updates.
responsible_party: Maryland State Firefighters Association and relevant state agencies
stakeholders: Firefighters, emergency medical technicians, law enforcement officers, correctional officers, and volunteer rescue squads in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates terminology and procedural references; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty or include programs aimed at reducing it.

Title: State Retirement and Pension System - Transfers Between Systems - Workgroup
Synopsis: Requiring the State Retirement and Pension System to convene a workgroup to study transfers of member service between State and local retirement and pension systems; and requiring the Agency to submit a report of the Workgroup's findings and recommendations, including the need for any legislative initiatives, to the Governor and the General Assembly by December 1, 2025.
bill_summary: This bill requires the Maryland State Retirement Agency to convene a workgroup to study and recommend improvements to the process of transferring member service credits between various state and local retirement systems.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement Agency
stakeholders: Members of Maryland's state and local retirement and pension systems, including employees and retirees
innovative_summary: The bill employs a collaborative approach by forming a workgroup to analyze and recommend legislative changes, which is a common but effective approach to policy improvement.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on pension system transfers does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Property Tax - Low-Income Housing Tax Credit - Valuation of Property
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Housing and Community Development to notify the State Department of Assessments and Taxation, within 30 days of closing and the execution and delivery of a certain regulatory agreement, that a commercial property that is developed under a certain provision of federal law has been awarded a low-income tax credit; and applying the Act to all taxable years beginning after June 30, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill modifies how commercial real estate developed under federal law is valued for property tax purposes, specifically in relation to low-income housing tax credits. It requires the Department of Housing and Community Development to notify the State Department of Assessments and Taxation when a property is awarded a low-income housing tax credit.
responsible_party: Department of Housing and Community Development and the State Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Commercial real estate developers, low-income housing residents, local governments, and property tax authorities
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a specific evaluation process for properties developed under federal low-income housing programs, including adjustments for affordability restrictions, which is a targeted approach to property valuation for tax purposes.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has the potential to impact child poverty by encouraging the development of affordable housing through tax credit valuation adjustments.

Title: Election Law - Election Judges - Compensation
Synopsis: Requiring a local board of elections to pay an election judge compensation for completing a certain course of instruction only after the election judge actually serves an election day or early voting day; and authorizing a public school student in the State to earn hours toward the service-learning graduation requirement or receive election judge compensation for service as an election judge.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland local election boards to pay election judges only after they serve on election day or early voting day, and allows public school students to earn service-learning hours or receive election judge compensation for serving as election judges.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections and local election boards
stakeholders: Election judges, public school students, Maryland voters
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new approach by linking election judge compensation to actual service and allowing students to earn service-learning hours through election judging.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on election judge compensation and student service hours.

Title: Public Libraries - Automated External Defibrillator Program (Raymono A. Russell Act)
Synopsis: Requiring certain libraries, beginning January 1, 2026, to place an automated external defibrillator in a prominent area accessible to employees and library users, to provide maintenance for the automated external defibrillator, and to comply with the Public Access Automated External Defibrillator Program; granting certain immunities to libraries and individuals under certain circumstances; requiring by December 1, 2026, a report to certain committees of the General Assembly on the use of defibrillators in libraries; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires public libraries in Maryland to install and maintain automated external defibrillators (AEDs), ensure trained individuals are present when the library is open, and register the AEDs with the Maryland Institute for Emergency Medical Services Systems. It grants immunities to libraries and individuals acting in good faith during emergencies.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and Maryland Institute for Emergency Medical Services Systems
stakeholders: Public libraries, library users, and staff in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a health emergency response approach by equipping libraries with AEDs and training staff, integrating emergency medical preparedness into public library services.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty but improves emergency health safety in public spaces.

Title: Anne Arundel County - Property Tax Credit - Supermarkets
Synopsis: Authorizing the governing body of Anne Arundel County or of a municipal corporation in Anne Arundel County to grant, by law, a property tax credit against the personal property tax imposed on personal property of a supermarket that completes certain construction and is located in a certain food desert retail incentive area; requiring the governing body to designate what constitutes a food desert retail incentive area for purposes of the tax credit; etc.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes Anne Arundel County to grant property tax credits to supermarkets that complete certain construction in designated food desert areas, encouraging supermarket development in underserved areas.
responsible_party: Anne Arundel County government or municipal corporations within Anne Arundel County
stakeholders: Supermarkets, residents of food desert areas in Anne Arundel County, local government
innovative_summary: The program employs targeted tax incentives to promote supermarket development in food deserts, which is a strategic approach to address food access issues.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by improving access to nutritious food in underserved areas.

Title: State Personnel - BWI Airport Fire and Rescue Department - Collective Bargaining and Arbitration Processes
Synopsis: Altering the collective bargaining process between the State and uniformed fire employees of the BWI Airport Fire and Rescue Department by requiring the parties to reach a collective bargaining agreement on or before September 30 of the year in which the collective bargaining agreement will expire; and establishing a process of binding arbitration in the event of an impasse.
bill_summary: This bill modifies the collective bargaining process for the uniformed fire employees of the BWI Airport Fire and Rescue Department, including establishing deadlines for negotiations, procedures for resolving impasses through binding arbitration, and requirements for including the costs of employment terms in the state's budget. It also proposes a constitutional amendment to ensure that budgets include appropriations necessary to implement employment agreements for state employees, including those in the fire department.
responsible_party: Maryland State Government, specifically the Department of Budget and Management and the Office of the Governor
stakeholders: Uniformed fire employees of the BWI Airport Fire and Rescue Department, Maryland State Government, and the general public of Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a structured approach to binding arbitration in public sector labor disputes and proposes a constitutional amendment to explicitly include employment terms in the state budget, which is a relatively innovative approach to public sector labor relations and budget law.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by ensuring stable employment conditions and fair wages for public safety employees, which can indirectly benefit families and communities.

Title: Educational Equality for Service Members Act
Synopsis: Establishing rules of interpretation related to the uniformed services; altering the rule of interpretation for "veteran"; and altering the application of certain provisions of law governing education to apply to all uniformed services, rather than only the armed forces.
bill_summary: The bill establishes rules of interpretation related to the uniformed services, expands education law to include all uniformed services, and creates programs and policies to support military members, veterans, and their families in Maryland, including expedited educator certification, school enrollment support, scholarships, and veteran resources.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Veterans and Military Families and Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Military service members, veterans, their families, and students in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach to support military-connected individuals through expedited certification, dedicated school programs, scholarships, and resource centers, integrating various government agencies and educational institutions.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a moderate potential to directly impact child poverty by supporting military families and improving educational access and stability.

Title: Economic Development - Small Business Guaranty Fund - Alterations
Synopsis: Authorizing the Maryland Small Business Development Financing Authority to authorize the provision of a guaranty under the Small Business Guaranty Fund in an irrevocable letter of credit, an official treasurer's check, funds on deposit in an escrow or other depository account, or any other legal instrument promising a financial institution restitution or reimbursement for its loan losses, within the limits of the guaranty.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Small Business Development Financing Authority to provide guarantees for up to 80% of certain long-term loans to small businesses, with specific conditions on loan amounts, uses, and terms, supported by the full faith and credit of the State or other legal instruments.
responsible_party: Maryland Small Business Development Financing Authority
stakeholders: Small businesses in Maryland seeking long-term loans
innovative_summary: The program employs a government-backed guarantee mechanism to facilitate access to financing for small businesses, which is a common but effective approach to support economic development.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty indirectly by supporting small business growth and job creation.

Title: State Board of Nursing - Advanced Practice Nursing Licensure and Specialty Certification - Reciprocity Discussions (Maryland Border States Advanced Practice Nursing Act)
Synopsis: Requiring the State Board of Nursing to hold discussions with Delaware, Pennsylvania, Virginia, West Virginia, and the District of Columbia to pursue reciprocity agreements for advanced practice nursing licensure and specialty certification; and requiring the Board, by November 1, 2025, and each November 1 for the following 4 years, to submit a report to certain committees of the General Assembly on the status of the discussions, agreements reached, challenges in the negotiations, and any legislative recommendations.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland State Board of Nursing to hold discussions with nursing licensing boards in Delaware, Pennsylvania, Virginia, West Virginia, and the District of Columbia to establish reciprocity agreements for advanced practice nursing licensure and certification, aiming to improve access, portability, and telehealth services.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Nursing
stakeholders: Advanced practice registered nurses, patients, healthcare providers in Maryland and neighboring states
innovative_summary: The bill promotes interstate reciprocity agreements for nursing licensure, enhancing licensure portability and telehealth access through collaborative negotiations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve healthcare access, which can indirectly reduce child poverty by providing better health services.

Title: Earned Income Tax Credit - Notice of Eligibility - Alteration
Synopsis: Altering the method by which the Comptroller must provide notice of the maximum income eligibility for the earned income tax credit for the calendar year to all employers in the State to include an electronic means of notification.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Comptroller to annually publish the maximum income eligibility for the state's earned income tax credit and mandates employers to notify eligible employees about their potential eligibility for both federal and state earned income tax credits. The bill also specifies that employees cannot sue employers for failing to provide this notice.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller's Office
stakeholders: Employees who may be eligible for the earned income tax credit in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a straightforward approach to improve awareness of tax credits through mandated notices, utilizing existing communication channels without introducing new technologies or novel methods.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by increasing awareness of tax credits that can support low-income families.

Title: Local Earned Income Tax Credit - Calculation - County Income Tax Rate
Synopsis: Clarifying that a county's applicable income tax rate is the tax rate used to calculate the local earned income tax credit that certain individuals may claim against the county income tax; and applying the Act to all taxable years beginning after December 31, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies how the county income tax rate is used to calculate the local earned income tax credit in Maryland, including provisions for counties to offer refundable credits and the timing of such provisions.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller's Office
stakeholders: Taxpayers in Maryland, particularly residents and counties implementing the earned income tax credit
innovative_summary: The bill introduces clarification on the calculation of local earned income tax credits and allows counties to provide refundable credits, which is a nuanced approach to local tax credits.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty as it mainly clarifies tax credit calculations and county tax policies.

Title: Criminal Law - Destroying Funerary Objects and Cemetery Elements - Statute of Limitations and Prohibition
Synopsis: Extending from 1 year to 3 years the statute of limitations for prosecutions relating to destroying funerary objects and other elements of a cemetery to begin at the time local authorities knew or reasonably should have known of the violation; and prohibiting a person from willfully destroying, damaging, defacing, or removing any part of the grounds of a cemetery.
bill_summary: The bill increases the statute of limitations for prosecuting crimes related to destroying funerary objects and cemetery elements from 1 year to 3 years after the local authorities knew or should have known of the violation. It also prohibits willful destruction, damage, defacement, or removal of cemetery property, including landscaping, and establishes penalties for violations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services (implied) or local law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Cemetery owners, local authorities, descendants of the deceased, and the general public concerned with cemetery preservation
innovative_summary: The bill employs a longer statute of limitations for cemetery-related crimes, aligning legal response timeframes with the nature of the offense, but does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on cemetery crime laws.

Title: Comptroller - Recording and Monitoring Telephone Calls - Clarification
Synopsis: Clarifying which telephone calls the Comptroller of the State may record and monitor for training, quality control, and employee safety purposes; and providing that the Comptroller may monitor and record calls to the Comptroller's call centers only.
bill_summary: This bill clarifies the circumstances under which the Maryland Comptroller's office can record and monitor telephone calls, specifically limiting recordings to calls made to the Comptroller's call centers for training, quality control, and safety, and establishing rules for notice, retention, and use of such recordings.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller's Office
stakeholders: Maryland taxpayers and state employees
innovative_summary: The bill introduces specific regulations and limitations on call recording practices for government call centers, including notice requirements and retention limits, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it mainly addresses call recording policies for government offices.

Title: State Lottery - Internet Sales of Subscription Plans - Authorization
Synopsis: Authorizing the State Lottery and Gaming Control Agency to allow the establishment of a system or program that allows an individual to purchase a State lottery subscription plan through an electronic device that connects to the Internet, such as a personal computer or mobile device; and requiring the Agency to report by December 1, 2026, to certain committees of the General Assembly on State lottery subscription sales.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland State Lottery and Gaming Control Agency to establish a system allowing individuals to purchase lottery subscription plans online, including through internet-connected devices, and requires a report on subscription sales.
responsible_party: Maryland State Lottery and Gaming Control Agency
stakeholders: Individuals interested in purchasing lottery subscriptions, licensed lottery agents, and the Maryland state government
innovative_summary: The bill introduces an online subscription system for the state lottery, allowing internet-based purchases and voucher funding, which is a new approach for Maryland's lottery system.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to increase lottery participation and revenue, which could be used for programs benefiting children, but direct impact on child poverty is indirect.

Title: Sales and Use Tax - Sales Between Cannabis Businesses and Cannabis Nurseries - Exemption
Synopsis: Expanding the exemption from the sales and use tax for certain cannabis sales to include sales between certain licensed cannabis businesses and registered cannabis nurseries.
bill_summary: The bill expands the sales and use tax exemption to include sales of cannabis between licensed cannabis businesses and registered cannabis nurseries in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Revenue (implied, as it handles tax laws)
stakeholders: Licensed cannabis businesses and registered cannabis nurseries in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily modifies tax exemptions and does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it mainly concerns tax exemptions for cannabis businesses.

Title: Highways - Sidewalks and Bicycle Pathways - Construction and Reconstruction
Synopsis: Requiring the State Highway Administration to prioritize funding for the construction and reconstruction of sidewalks and bicycle pathways to sidewalks and bicycle pathways that are, or are adjacent to highways that are, subject to a complete streets policy or another similar Vision Zero program; requiring a local government to request certain funding from the Department of Transportation; and authorizing certain State funding for the construction or reconstruction of sidewalks or bicycle pathways.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland State Highway Administration to prioritize funding for the construction and reconstruction of sidewalks and bicycle pathways, especially those adjacent to highways with complete streets policies or Vision Zero programs. It also details funding sharing arrangements between the state and local governments for these projects and mandates guidelines for implementation.
responsible_party: Maryland State Highway Administration
stakeholders: Local governments, pedestrians, cyclists, and residents in urban areas of Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a targeted funding prioritization approach based on safety and Vision Zero initiatives, integrating transportation planning with safety policies and community involvement.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve safety and accessibility for pedestrians and cyclists, which can contribute to reducing barriers faced by low-income communities, but its direct impact on child poverty is indirect.

Title: Gaming - Slot Machines - Skills-Based Amusement Devices
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "slot machine" to provide that certain skills-based amusement devices excluded from the definition may award merchandise, tickets, tokens, or other objects that do not exceed a certain minimal value per play and may be accumulated and exchanged for noncash merchandise or prizes of value that is similar to the cumulated value of the objects exchanged, and does not exceed a minimal wholesale value of $599.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland law to redefine 'slot machine' to exclude certain skills-based amusement devices that award objects of minimal value, which can be accumulated and exchanged for merchandise or prizes of limited value.
responsible_party: Maryland State Lottery and Gaming Control Commission
stakeholders: Operators of skills-based amusement devices, players, and the general public in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new category of skills-based amusement devices that can award prizes of limited value, allowing for regulated gaming options that blend skill and chance.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty as it primarily changes definitions and regulations around amusement devices and gaming.

Title: Income Tax - Income Tax Reconciliation Program - Established (Maryland Fair Taxation for Justice-Involved Individuals Act)
Synopsis: Establishing the Income Tax Reconciliation Program in the State to allow certain justice-involved individuals to establish installment payment plans and receive a waiver of any interest and penalties that accrue for unpaid income tax due for a taxable year beginning after December 31, 2024, but before January 1, 2030; requiring the Comptroller to administer the Program; requiring the Comptroller, in collaboration with the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services, to develop an awareness campaign about the Program; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Income Tax Reconciliation Program in Maryland, allowing justice-involved individuals to set up payment plans and receive waivers for interest and penalties on unpaid income taxes for certain taxable years, particularly while they are incarcerated.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller's Office in collaboration with the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Justice-involved individuals, taxpayers, Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services, Maryland Comptroller's Office
innovative_summary: The program employs a targeted approach to assist incarcerated individuals with tax debt management, including waivers and installment plans, which is a relatively innovative approach to tax and criminal justice integration.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce financial burdens on justice-involved individuals, which may indirectly impact child poverty, but its direct impact is limited.

Title: Higher Education - Janet L. Hoffman Loan Assistance Repayment Program - Eligibility
Synopsis: Expanding the eligibility for the Janet L. Hoffman Loan Assistance Repayment Program to include individuals who received a certain degree from an accredited veterinary school and provided veterinary services in the State for not less than 5 years or provided volunteer veterinary services at certain animal shelters for 3 years and to include individuals who provided veterinary technician services for not less than 5 years or provided volunteer veterinary technician services at certain animal shelters over a 3-year period.
bill_summary: The bill expands the eligibility criteria for the Janet L. Hoffman Loan Assistance Repayment Program to include veterinary practitioners and veterinary technicians who have provided services for a certain period or volunteered at animal shelters, in addition to existing eligible professions.
responsible_party: Office of Student Financial Assistance
stakeholders: Veterinary practitioners, veterinary technicians, animal shelters, students with educational loans in related fields
innovative_summary: The program introduces specialized loan repayment assistance for veterinary professionals and volunteers, integrating veterinary services into a state loan assistance program.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily supporting professionals in veterinary and educational fields.

Title: Task Force on the Creation of a Division of Returning Citizens and Expanded Reentry Services - Extension of Report Deadline and Task Force
Synopsis: Extending the deadline for the reporting requirement for the Task Force on the Creation of a Division of Returning Citizens and Expanded Reentry Services to be October 31, 2026; and extending the termination date for the Task Force to be June 30, 2027.
bill_summary: The bill extends the deadline for the Task Force on the Creation of a Division of Returning Citizens and Expanded Reentry Services to submit its report to October 31, 2026, and extends the task force's duration until June 30, 2027.
responsible_party: Maryland General Assembly (or the specific task force as designated)
stakeholders: Returning citizens, formerly incarcerated individuals, and the community involved in reentry services
innovative_summary: The bill mainly extends existing reporting deadlines and the duration of a task force; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it focuses on reentry services and task force extensions.
