Title: Wicomico County - Alcoholic Beverages - Temporary To-Go Event Permit and Class C Per Diem Municipal To-Go Beer, Wine, and Liquor License
Synopsis: Establishing a temporary to-go event permit in Wicomico County; authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Wicomico County to issue a temporary to-go event permit to a holder of a Class B beer, wine, and liquor license; establishing a Class C per diem municipal to-go beer, wine, and liquor license in the county; authorizing the Board to issue a Class C per diem municipal to-go beer, wine, and liquor license to a municipality in the county; requiring the Board to adopt certain regulations; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a temporary to-go event permit and a Class C per diem municipal to-go beer, wine, and liquor license in Wicomico County, allowing licensed establishments and municipalities to sell alcohol for takeout and at special events within designated areas.
responsible_party: Wicomico County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Alcoholic beverage license holders, municipalities, event attendees, local residents
innovative_summary: The program introduces a new approach to alcohol sales by allowing temporary and municipal licenses for to-go alcohol sales at special events, including regulations for designated areas and sale conditions.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but could indirectly support local economic activity and community events.

Title: Juvenile Services Education Board - Alterations
Synopsis: Authorizing the Secretary of Higher Education and the State Superintendent of Schools to select a designee to serve on the Juvenile Services Education Board; altering the terms of membership for the Board; and altering certain requirements for meetings of the Board.
bill_summary: This bill makes changes to the composition, meeting requirements, and terms of the Maryland Juvenile Services Education Board, including allowing the Secretary of Higher Education and the State Superintendent of Schools to select designees and adjusting member terms and meeting frequency.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Human Services
stakeholders: juvenile education and juvenile justice populations in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates governance and operational rules for the existing Juvenile Services Education Board, with no new programs or technological innovations introduced.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly create or fund programs aimed at reducing child poverty.

Title: Health Occupations - Licensed Direct-Entry Midwives - Disciplinary Actions
Synopsis: Clarifying that the State Board of Nursing may deny a license or grant a license, including a license subject to a reprimand, probation, or suspension, if an applicant for a license to practice direct-entry midwifery or a licensed direct-entry midwife violates a ground for discipline.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies the disciplinary actions that the Maryland State Board of Nursing can take against applicants and licensed direct-entry midwives who violate certain rules or laws, including grounds for denial, suspension, or revocation of licenses.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Nursing
stakeholders: Direct-entry midwives and their clients in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill mainly updates existing disciplinary rules and does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty but ensures professional standards and accountability in midwifery care.

Title: Maryland Medical Assistance Program and Health Insurance - Required Coverage for Calcium Score Testing
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Medical Assistance Program and insurers, nonprofit health service plans, health maintenance organizations, and managed care organizations to provide coverage in accordance with the most recent guidelines issued by the American College of Cardiology that expand the scope of preventive care services for the benefit of consumers; and applying the Act to all policies, contracts, and health benefit plans issued, delivered, or renewed in the State on or after January 1, 2026.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Medical Assistance Program and certain health insurance providers to cover calcium score testing for individuals with specific risk factors, starting from January 1, 2026.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and Insurance Department
stakeholders: Individuals at risk for heart disease, health insurance companies, Medicaid recipients
innovative_summary: The bill employs a targeted preventive health approach by expanding coverage for calcium score testing based on risk factors, integrating clinical guidelines into insurance coverage.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it focuses on adult preventive health services.

Title: School Health and Wellness Personnel Assessment and Maryland Council on Advancement of School-Based Health Centers
Synopsis: Requiring the State Department of Education and the Maryland Department of Health jointly to conduct an assessment of school health and wellness personnel each year; altering the membership of the Maryland Council on Advancement of School-Based Health Centers; and requiring the Department and the State Department of Education to annually report to the General Assembly on the findings of the assessment beginning December 1, 2027, and publish the report on the website of each agency.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Education and the Maryland Department of Health to conduct an annual assessment of school health and wellness personnel, and it modifies the membership of the Maryland Council on the Advancement of School-Based Health Centers to include a school nurse.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education and Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: School students, school health personnel, local school systems, local health departments, and stakeholders involved in school health services
innovative_summary: The bill employs a collaborative assessment approach and expands the council membership to include a school nurse, aiming to improve school health services through data collection and stakeholder engagement.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving access to school health services, which can support children's well-being and educational success.

Title: Criminal Law - Dismembering or Burying Human Remains With Intent to Conceal a Crime
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person, with the intent to conceal a crime, from knowingly and willfully dismembering, destroying, removing, burying, disposing of, or obliterating by any means any portion of human remains; prohibiting a person from aiding or abetting another in committing a violation of the Act; and establishing that a violation of the Act is a felony with a penalty of imprisonment not exceeding 5 years.
bill_summary: This bill criminalizes acts related to concealing the death of another person, including failing to notify authorities, dismembering, destroying, or disposing of human remains with the intent to conceal a crime, and burying or otherwise disposing of a dead body. It also prohibits aiding or abetting such acts.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services or law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Individuals involved in crimes related to concealment of death and human remains, law enforcement, legal system
innovative_summary: The bill introduces specific criminal penalties for acts related to the concealment of death and human remains, which is a targeted legal approach but not employing new technologies or innovative methods.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Public Safety - Rape Kit Testing - Tracking Program and Grant Fund
Synopsis: Altering from December 31, 2025, to March 31,2026, the date by which a certain report under a certain sexual assault evidence collection kit tracking program is required to be submitted; altering the purpose and use of the Rape Kit Testing Grant Fund; expanding the duties of the Executive Director of the Governor's Office of Crime Prevention and Policy relating to the Fund; and prohibiting the use of the Fund for a certain sexual assault evidence collection kit tracking program.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a Rape Kit Testing Grant Fund to provide funding for testing sexual assault evidence collection kits, especially those collected before October 1, 2020, and to support victim notification and advocacy services. It also updates reporting deadlines for tracking the location and status of sexual assault kits.
responsible_party: Governor’s Office of Crime Prevention and Policy
stakeholders: Victims of sexual assault, law enforcement agencies, forensic laboratories, sexual assault victims' advocacy groups
innovative_summary: The program employs a dedicated grant fund to systematically test untested rape kits and improve victim notification and support services, integrating funding and tracking systems.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by improving justice and support services for victims, which can have long-term social benefits.

Title: Maryland Deaf Culture Digital Library - Funding and Budget Submission
Synopsis: Requiring the Governor to include in the annual budget bill an appropriation of $450,000 to the Maryland Deaf Culture Digital Library; and requiring the Deaf Culture Digital Library to submit its annual operating budget to the State Library Agency on or before June 1 each year.
bill_summary: The bill establishes funding and organizational requirements for the Maryland Deaf Culture Digital Library, including annual budget allocations, development of resources, partnerships, and advisory boards to support deaf culture and services.
responsible_party: State Library Agency of Maryland
stakeholders: Deaf and hard of hearing individuals, library users, and organizations serving the deaf community in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill promotes a comprehensive digital library dedicated to deaf culture, including partnerships, advisory boards, and sensitivity training, employing digital and community engagement approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving access to resources and services for deaf children and their families.

Title: Child Support - Driver's License Suspension for Arrearages and Court Orders
Synopsis: Altering the circumstances under which the Child Support Administration may notify the Motor Vehicle Administration of an individual's child support arrearages for the purpose of suspending the individual's driver's license or privilege to drive; and requiring the court, after establishing a child support order, to send a copy of the guideline calculation and the order to the Child Support Administration.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the rules for suspending driver's licenses for child support arrearages, including reducing the arrearage threshold from 120 days to 60 days for noncommercial licenses, and clarifies procedures for notification, investigation, and reinstatement. It also requires courts to send support calculation details to the Child Support Administration.
responsible_party: Child Support Administration of the Department of Human Services and the Maryland Department of Transportation
stakeholders: Parents with child support obligations, individuals with driver’s licenses, and children receiving support
innovative_summary: The bill employs a data-driven approach to enforce child support payments by linking court orders, administrative notifications, and license suspensions, with provisions for investigations and appeals.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to improve child support compliance, which can directly impact child poverty by ensuring consistent support payments.

Title: Garrett County Alcoholic Beverages Act of 2025
Synopsis: Establishing certain deluxe complex restaurant and resort complex beer and wine and beer, wine, and liquor licenses in Garrett County; requiring the Board of License Commissioners for Garrett County to hold a hearing for the issuance of certain festival licenses and altering certain notice requirements for the hearing; requiring certain festival license applicants to apply to the Board in a certain manner; clarifying the entities to which the Board may issue certain multiple day and multiple event licenses; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes new licensing options and regulations for alcoholic beverages in Garrett County, including resort, complex restaurant, and festival licenses for beer, wine, and liquor, along with setting fees, application procedures, and operational rules.
responsible_party: Maryland Alcoholic Beverages Board and Garrett County licensing authorities
stakeholders: Alcoholic beverage license applicants, Garrett County businesses, event organizers, and the general public attending festivals and licensed establishments
innovative_summary: The bill introduces specialized licenses for resort complexes, large-scale festivals, and nonprofit organizations, employing new licensing categories and operational approaches for alcohol sales and events.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily affecting licensing and event regulations.

Title: Tax Relief and State Personnel Equality for Service Members Act
Synopsis: Establishing rules of interpretation related to the uniformed services; altering the rule of interpretation for "veteran"; and altering the application of certain provisions of law governing personnel and taxation to apply to all uniformed services, rather than only the armed forces.
bill_summary: This bill expands and clarifies benefits, tax relief, and employment protections for veterans, active service members, and their families across Maryland, including establishing rules for interpretation of terms, extending reemployment rights, and providing property tax exemptions and deferrals.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Veterans and Military Families
stakeholders: Veterans, active service members, military families, and disabled veterans in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach to support military personnel and veterans through legal, tax, and employment benefits, integrating existing laws with new provisions to enhance support and recognition.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by supporting military families and veterans, which can stabilize household income and access to services.

Title: Local Government - Development Impact Fees, Surcharges, and Excise Taxes - Reporting
Synopsis: Requiring county governments to make a certain report by July 1 each year to the Department of Planning on the amount, use, and location of the use of county development impact fees, surcharges, and excise taxes; and requiring county governments to make certain reports to the Department of Planning identifying certain local laws.
bill_summary: This bill requires Maryland county governments to report annually on the collection and use of development impact fees, surcharges, and excise taxes, including details on amounts collected, locations, and how funds are spent.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Planning
stakeholders: County governments, developers, and residents in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a standardized annual reporting requirement for local governments on impact fees and taxes, enhancing transparency and accountability.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on impact fee transparency may indirectly influence community development, but it does not directly target child poverty.

Title: General Provisions - Veterans Benefits - Honorable Discharge
Synopsis: Defining "honorable discharge" with respect to any State program of benefits, rights, or privileges applicable to a veteran to include certain discharges.
bill_summary: This bill redefines 'honorable discharge' for veterans in Maryland to include discharges that are less than honorable under certain conditions, such as those related to sexual orientation, gender identity, post-traumatic stress disorder, sexual trauma, or if the discharge should be upgraded according to federal criteria.
responsible_party: Department of Veterans and Military Families
stakeholders: Veterans in Maryland, especially those with discharges previously considered less than honorable
innovative_summary: The bill employs a broader, more inclusive definition of 'honorable discharge' for veterans, recognizing certain discharges that are typically not classified as honorable, based on specific circumstances and federal criteria.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily addresses veteran discharge classifications.

Title: County Boards of Education - Special Education Service Delivery Models - Publication Requirement
Synopsis: Requiring each county board of education to publish on its website a certain list of special education service delivery models provided for parentally-placed private school students; and defining "parentally-placed private school student" as a child with a disability enrolled by the parent or guardian of the child in a private elementary or secondary school or facility, including a religious school or facility.
bill_summary: This bill requires Maryland county boards of education to publish on their websites a list of all special education service delivery models and services provided to parentally-placed private school students, and to clearly state that placement decisions are made by an individualized education program team in consultation with parents, in accordance with federal law.
responsible_party: Maryland county boards of education
stakeholders: Students with disabilities, parents of students with disabilities, private schools, local education agencies
innovative_summary: The bill enhances transparency by requiring public posting of special education service models and services for private school students, promoting informed decision-making and compliance with federal law.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on transparency and procedural requirements.

Title: Higher Education - Maryland Graduate and Professional Scholarship Program - Eligible Institutions
Synopsis: Expanding eligibility under the Maryland Graduate and Professional Scholarship Program to include certain students attending the Meritus School of Osteopathic Medicine.
bill_summary: The bill expands eligibility for the Maryland Graduate and Professional Scholarship Program to include students attending certain institutions in the state that offer master's degrees in nursing, social work, or first professional degrees in pharmacy.
responsible_party: Maryland Higher Education Commission
stakeholders: Graduate and professional students in Maryland, especially those attending eligible institutions in the fields of nursing, social work, and pharmacy.
innovative_summary: The program is a traditional scholarship initiative with expanded eligibility, not employing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by supporting higher education for students in health and social services fields, but its direct impact is limited.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Licenses, Identification Cards, and Moped Operator's Permits - Notation of Nonapparent Disability (Eric's ID Law)
Synopsis: Requiring that an original and renewal application for a license, an identification card, or a moped operator's permit allow an applicant to choose to indicate on the document the applicant's nonapparent disability; requiring the Motor Vehicle Administration to ensure that a certain license, identification card, or moped operator's permit include a notation of a nonapparent disability; requiring the immediate implementation of training for law enforcement concerning interactions with persons with nonapparent disabilities; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration to allow applicants for licenses, ID cards, or moped permits to indicate if they have a nonapparent disability, such as developmental or intellectual disabilities. It mandates that the Administration include a notation of this disability on the document if indicated, and establishes procedures for removing the notation, public outreach, and confidentiality protections.
responsible_party: Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration
stakeholders: Individuals with nonapparent disabilities applying for licenses, ID cards, or moped permits in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a new approach by allowing individuals to voluntarily disclose nonapparent disabilities on official documents and ensuring confidentiality and public awareness.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily focuses on disability notation and awareness.

Title: Harford County - Alcoholic Beverages - Multiple Licenses - Golf Simulator Facilities
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Harford County to issue a Class GSF (golf simulator facility) license to a holder of a Class B license; and clarifying that the Class GSF (golf simulator facility) license counts toward the maximum number of nine Class B alcoholic beverages licenses a holder may be issued.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Harford County to issue a new type of alcoholic beverage license, called a Class GSF (golf simulator facility) license, to holders of existing Class B licenses. It clarifies that this new license counts toward the total number of licenses a person can hold.
responsible_party: Harford County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Golf simulator facility operators, alcohol license holders, local residents and visitors in Harford County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a specialized license for golf simulator facilities, integrating alcohol licensing with recreational technology use, which is a novel approach in licensing.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly pertains to licensing regulations for alcohol and recreational facilities.

Title: Harford County - Alcoholic Beverages - Performing Arts Nonprofit Organization License - Record-Keeping Requirements
Synopsis: Repealing certain incorrect references to the Comptroller of Maryland in certain provisions of law requiring the holder of a performing arts nonprofit organization license in Harford County to comply with certain record-keeping and reporting requirements; repealing the authority of the Comptroller to suspend the license of a license holder without a hearing under certain circumstances; and authorizing, rather than requiring, the Board to summon a license holder for a hearing and impose a fine under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill amends regulations for performing arts nonprofit organization alcohol licenses in Harford County, including record-keeping requirements and procedures for license suspension and hearings.
responsible_party: Harford County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Performing arts nonprofit organizations in Harford County that hold alcohol licenses
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates legal procedures and record-keeping rules; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Harford County - Alcoholic Beverages - Alteration of License Quota
Synopsis: Altering the quota used to determine the maximum number of certain alcoholic beverages licenses that the Board of License Commissioners for Harford County may issue from every 4,000 to every 4,750 individuals in the county.
bill_summary: The bill alters the quota for the maximum number of certain alcoholic beverage licenses that the Harford County Board of License Commissioners can issue, based on the county's population, and specifies the conditions under which new licenses can be issued if the quota is exceeded.
responsible_party: Harford County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Alcoholic beverage license applicants and businesses in Harford County
innovative_summary: The bill employs a population-based quota system to regulate the issuance of alcohol licenses, which is a standard regulatory approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it primarily regulates alcohol licensing.

Title: Housing and Community Development - Statewide Rental Assistance Voucher Program Eligibility - Alterations
Synopsis: Including the Department of Housing and Community Development in the definition of "public housing agency" for the purposes of the Statewide Rental Assistance Voucher Program; authorizing a public housing agency to administer the Program in accordance with a local administrative plan; authorizing the Department to project-base up to 100% of its authorized voucher units; altering the manner in which the Department and each public housing agency shall prioritize vouchers and housing assistance payments for certain families; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the Maryland Statewide Rental Assistance Voucher Program by including the Department of Housing and Community Development as a public housing agency, allowing it to administer the program, project-base vouchers, and prioritize certain families for assistance. It also updates inspection standards, funding allocations, and payment expectations.
responsible_party: Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Low-income families, foster children, military veterans, homeless individuals, disabled individuals, elderly individuals in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a more flexible and inclusive approach to rental assistance, including project-based vouchers and prioritized assistance for vulnerable populations, with updated inspection and funding mechanisms.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to directly impact child poverty by providing targeted rental assistance to families with children and vulnerable populations.

Title: Natural Resources - Public Lands - Acquisition, Staffing, Operations, and Funding
Synopsis: Altering provisions of law regarding the acquisition of real property by the Department of Natural Resources; establishing a Land and Property Management Program in the Department to process certain  transactions; authorizing the Department and the Natural Resources Police to establish affiliated foundations; authorizing the Governor to transfer certain Program Open Space funds to the Department under certain circumstances; altering and repealing certain provisions of law regarding the use of Program Open Space local funding; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Land and Property Management Program within the Maryland Department of Natural Resources, creates affiliated foundations to support land management and public access projects, and modifies funding and acquisition rules for public lands and open space.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Public land users, conservation groups, local governments, and residents benefiting from public lands and open space programs.
innovative_summary: The bill introduces the creation of affiliated foundations to partner with the Department and employs a new Land and Property Management Program to streamline real property transactions, which is a relatively innovative approach to land management.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to improve access to natural spaces and recreational areas, which can benefit children and families, but its direct impact on child poverty is moderate.

Title: Maryland Health Insurance Coverage Protection Commission - Established
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Health Insurance Coverage Protection Commission to monitor and assess the impact of potential and actual federal changes to specified health care programs and to provide recommendations for State and local action to protect the access of residents of the State to affordable health coverage; and requiring the Commission to submit a report of its findings and recommendations, including any legislative proposals, to the Governor and the General Assembly by December 31 each year.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Health Insurance Coverage Protection Commission to monitor and assess the impact of federal changes to health care programs like the ACA, Medicaid, and Medicare, and to recommend actions to protect residents' access to affordable health coverage.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health, Maryland Insurance Administration, and Department of Legislative Services
stakeholders: Residents of Maryland, especially those at risk of losing health coverage due to federal policy changes
innovative_summary: The program employs a dedicated commission to proactively monitor federal policy impacts and recommend state actions, which is a strategic and collaborative approach to health coverage protection.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to directly impact child poverty by safeguarding access to health coverage for vulnerable populations.

Title: Natural Resources - State Boat Act - Alterations
Synopsis: Repealing certain advertising and public hearing requirements for proposed regulations implementing the State Boat Act; increasing certain funding thresholds for certain projects financed by the Waterway Improvement Fund; and altering the fees for manufacturer and dealer licenses, certificates of number, Maryland use stickers, and the issuance of certificates of title, transfer of title, or duplicate or corrected certificates of title.
bill_summary: This bill updates Maryland's State Boat Act by redefining 'personal watercraft' and 'personal flotation device', repealing certain vessel classifications and advertising requirements, increasing funding thresholds for waterway projects, adjusting licensing fees, establishing a nonmotorized vessel decal, and setting new safety requirements for children and vessel operators.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Vessel owners, boaters, children, maritime safety authorities, waterway users
innovative_summary: The bill introduces new safety regulations, fee structures, and vessel identification programs, employing modern safety standards and administrative updates.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on safety and vessel regulation could indirectly improve safety for children, but it does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Natural Resources - Repeal of Somers Cove Marina Commission and Improvement Fund and Alteration of Operations
Synopsis: Repealing provisions of law relating to the Somers Cove Marina Commission, the Somers Cove Marina Improvement Fund, and the operation of Somers Cove Marina; requiring the Secretary to develop a master plan for the operation and improvement of services at Somers Cove Marina by October 1, 2027; requiring all revenue received by the Department from activities associated with Somers Cove Marina be deposited in the Natural Resources Property Maintenance Fund; establishing the Somers Cove Marina Advisory Commission; etc.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the Somers Cove Marina Commission and its Improvement Fund, transfers management responsibilities to the Department of Natural Resources, and establishes new advisory commissions and funds to oversee and operate the marina.
responsible_party: Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Marina users, local government, boating community, tourism industry, and residents of Somerset County and Crisfield
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new management structure for the marina, including advisory commissions and a dedicated maintenance fund, employing modern governance and financial management approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty but may indirectly benefit local economic development and community well-being.

Title: Maryland Department of Health - Report on Oversight of Substance Use Disorder Treatment Programs and Recovery Residences
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health to submit reports on or before December 1, 2025, and December 1, 2026, to the Senate Finance Committee, the Senate Budget and Taxation Committee, the House Health and Government Operations Committee, and the House Appropriations Committee on the oversight of substance use disorder treatment programs and recovery residences.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Health to submit reports in 2025 and 2026 on the oversight and regulation of substance use disorder treatment programs and recovery residences, including improvements and measures to prevent adverse events.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals undergoing substance use disorder treatment and recovery residences in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill mainly focuses on oversight, regulation, and reporting improvements, rather than introducing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty but may indirectly impact families affected by substance use disorders.

Title: Health Occupations - Authorization to Practice for Former Federal Employees and Dental Applicants Licensed or Certified in Another State
Synopsis: Requiring the State Board of Dental Examiners to issue a license or certification to certain applicants licensed or certified by another state within 15 business days after receiving the completed application; requiring the Maryland Department of Health to develop a plan for a temporary or permanent authorization to practice a health occupation in the State for certain individuals who left employment with a federal agency after January 20, 2025; requiring the Department to submit the plan by October 1, 2025 to certain committees; etc.
bill_summary: The bill streamlines licensing for dental professionals licensed in other states, establishes certification procedures for dental radiation technologists, and requires the Maryland Department of Health to develop a plan for temporary or permanent health occupation practice authorization for individuals who left federal employment after January 20, 2025.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Dental professionals, dental radiation technologists, health care workers, federal employees leaving federal employment
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a streamlined licensing process for out-of-state licensed dental professionals and a plan for health occupation practice authorization for federal employees, employing cross-state recognition and federal employment considerations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving access to dental and health services through streamlined licensing and practice authorization.

Title: Opioid Restitution Fund - Authorized Uses
Synopsis: Altering the allowable uses of the Opioid Restitution Fund to provide funds for the operating expenses and personnel costs for investigations, enforcement actions, and other activities conducted by the Opioids Enforcement Unit within the Office of the Attorney General that are related to the recovery of funds from opioid-related judgments or settlements; and requiring, beginning October 1, 2025, the Office of the Attorney General to report annually to the General Assembly on the status of activity of the Opioids Enforcement Unit.
bill_summary: This bill alters the uses of the Maryland Opioid Restitution Fund to include funding for investigations, enforcement, and activities by the Opioids Enforcement Unit within the Office of the Attorney General related to recovering funds from opioid-related judgments and settlements.
responsible_party: Office of the Attorney General
stakeholders: Individuals affected by opioid use disorder, law enforcement, public health agencies, and community organizations involved in substance use prevention and recovery
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a dedicated enforcement unit within the Attorney General's Office to recover funds from opioid settlements, integrating enforcement activities with the broader opioid response efforts.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has potential to reduce child poverty indirectly by supporting substance use disorder treatment and recovery, which can improve family stability and economic conditions.

Title: Public Health - Use of Opioid Restitution Fund and Training Under the Overdose Response Program
Synopsis: Altering the training that the Maryland Department of Health is authorized to provide under the Overdose Response Program to include emphasis on the restoration of breathing, avoiding withdrawal, and compassionate postoverdose support and care; clarifying that the use of the Opioid Restitution Fund is subject to certain restrictions; and altering the authorized uses of the Opioid Restitution Fund so as to include the addressing of racial disparities in access to prevention, harm reduction, treatment, and recovery support services.
bill_summary: This bill modifies the use of the Maryland Opioid Restitution Fund and the Overdose Response Program, including clarifying restrictions on fund use and expanding authorized activities for opioid overdose education, treatment, and harm reduction.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals at risk of opioid overdose, substance use disorder treatment providers, community organizations, and the general public
innovative_summary: The bill emphasizes addressing racial and socioeconomic disparities and supports evidence-informed pilot programs, integrating equity and emerging evidence into opioid response efforts.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has potential to reduce child poverty by supporting substance use disorder treatment and harm reduction, which can improve family stability and health outcomes.

Title: Wildlife - Protections and Highway Crossings
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Connectivity Coalition to foster collaboration among State and federal agencies, nongovernmental organizations, and other stakeholders for the purpose of protecting endangered wildlife from habitat fragmentation; requiring the State Highway Administration to have final decision-making authority regarding decisions related to placement, funding, or design of wildlife crossings; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Connectivity Coalition and the Wildlife Connectivity Fund to promote wildlife habitat connectivity and reduce vehicle-wildlife collisions through projects like wildlife crossings. It also requires the inclusion of wildlife connectivity considerations in transportation and land use planning.
responsible_party: Department of Natural Resources and Maryland State Highway Administration
stakeholders: Wildlife, motorists, local governments, environmental organizations, and the general public
innovative_summary: The bill employs a collaborative approach involving multiple agencies and stakeholders, and develops a dedicated website and performance metrics for wildlife connectivity projects, which is a relatively innovative approach in government programs.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on wildlife and transportation infrastructure.

Title: Department of Information Technology - Major Information Technology Development Projects - Oversight
Synopsis: Providing that a unit of State government may not purchase, lease, contract for, or rent an information technology service or product unless consistent with the master plan, as determined by the Secretary of Information Technology; providing that the Secretary is responsible for overseeing the implementation of major information technology projects in the State; establishing the Maryland Office of Digital Experience in the Department to provide oversight, leadership, and strategic modernization for major technology projects; etc.
bill_summary: This bill establishes the Maryland Office of Digital Experience to oversee, modernize, and improve major information technology projects within the Maryland state government. It creates new standards, reporting requirements, and oversight mechanisms for IT projects, and sets up a Digital Service Unit to enhance digital services for residents.
responsible_party: Maryland Office of Digital Experience and Department of Information Technology
stakeholders: State government agencies and residents of Maryland who use digital government services
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a comprehensive, technology-driven approach to modernize government IT projects, including the use of a new Office, digital service units, and public dashboards for project transparency, employing innovative project oversight and digital service strategies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has high potential to improve access to government services through digital modernization, which can reduce barriers for low-income and underserved populations.

Title: Motor Vehicles - Reckless, Negligent, and Aggressive Driving (Sergeant Patrick Kepp Act)
Synopsis: Altering the penalties and points assessments related to the offenses of reckless, negligent, and aggressive driving; and adding certain motor vehicle offenses as elements that may contribute to charges for reckless or aggressive driving.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland's traffic laws by changing penalties and points for reckless, negligent, and aggressive driving, and adds new offenses that can contribute to charges of reckless or aggressive driving.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation
stakeholders: Motor vehicle drivers and the general public in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates existing traffic laws and penalties; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly concerns traffic law enforcement.

Title: State Board of Professional Counselors and Therapists - Behavior Analysts - Licensure Applications
Synopsis: Requiring the State Board of Professional Counselors and Therapists to issue a license to practice behavior analysis to qualified applicants within 30 days of receiving the completed application; requiring the State Board to issue a license within 50 days to an applicant who submitted an incomplete application but has presented additional information; and requiring the State Board to provide a certain e-mail notification regarding the status of an application for a license to practice behavior analysis.
bill_summary: This bill requires the Maryland State Board of Professional Counselors and Therapists to issue licenses for behavior analysts within specified timeframes, provides for email notifications to applicants about their application status, and outlines criteria for license issuance and review.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Professional Counselors and Therapists
stakeholders: Applicants for behavior analyst licensure in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a streamlined, electronic notification system to keep applicants informed about their licensing process, enhancing transparency and efficiency.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily focuses on licensing procedures for behavior analysts.

Title: Baltimore County - Alcoholic Beverages Licenses - Transfers
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore County to approve the transfer of a Class B or Class D license existing on a certain date that is located in an eligible transferor district to another election district under certain circumstances; and limiting the number of license transfers that the Board may approve from an eligible transferor district.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Baltimore County Board of License Commissioners to approve the transfer of certain Class B or D alcohol licenses between election districts under specific conditions, limits the number of such transfers, and establishes rules for assessing the economic impact of transfers.
responsible_party: Baltimore County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Alcohol license holders, local communities in Baltimore County, economic development agencies
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured process for license transfers that considers economic impact and future use of property, integrating community impact assessments into licensing decisions.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing more on economic and licensing regulations.

Title: Washington County - Public Safety - Buildings Used for Agritourism
Synopsis: Adding Washington County to the list of counties that exempt agricultural buildings used for agritourism from certain building performance standards and where an existing agricultural building used for agritourism is not considered a change of occupancy that requires a building permit under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill exempts agricultural buildings used for agritourism in Washington County from certain building standards and simplifies permit requirements, allowing existing structures to be used for agritourism without a permit under specific conditions.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety or local building authorities
stakeholders: Farmers, agritourism operators, local communities in Washington County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a regulatory exemption for agritourism buildings, reducing regulatory barriers and promoting agricultural tourism.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily affecting agricultural and tourism sectors.

Title: Washington County - Property Tax Credit - Economic Development Projects
Synopsis: Altering eligibility requirements for a certain property tax credit for certain business entities that invest a certain amount in certain real property in Washington County and create a certain number of new and permanent full-time jobs in the county; and altering the amount and duration of the property tax credit.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the property tax credit program in Washington County to incentivize business investments and job creation through increased eligibility requirements, larger investment thresholds, and extended tax credit durations for businesses that expand or establish new premises and create full-time jobs.
responsible_party: Washington County government
stakeholders: Businesses investing in Washington County, new and existing employees, local government
innovative_summary: The program employs a tiered tax credit system based on investment size, job creation, and property improvements, which is a strategic approach to economic development but not technologically innovative.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty as it primarily targets business investment and job creation, which may indirectly benefit the local economy.

Title: Harford County - Alcoholic Beverages - Hearing Notice
Synopsis: Altering certain notice requirements before the Board of License Commissioners for Harford County may hold public hearings on proposed regulatory changes or license applications; and providing that the Board may publish a decision on certain license applications either in certain newspapers or on its website.
bill_summary: This bill modifies notice and publication requirements for alcohol license applications and regulatory changes in Harford County, allowing notices to be published either in newspapers or on the Board's website, and updates procedures for public hearings and decisions.
responsible_party: Harford County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Alcohol license applicants, license holders, and residents of Harford County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces the option to publish notices and decisions online instead of solely in newspapers, leveraging digital technology for transparency.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on administrative procedures.

Title: Common Ownership Communities - Recreational Common Areas - Sensitive Information as Condition for Access
Synopsis: Prohibiting a cooperative housing corporation, condominium association, or homeowners association from requiring certain sensitive information of certain individuals as a condition for access to a recreational common area; and defining "sensitive information" as an individual's Social Security card or Social Security number, Individual Taxpayer Identification Number, birth certificate, racial or ethnic origin, national origin, citizenship or immigration status,  religious or philosophical beliefs, or medical records.
bill_summary: This bill prohibits cooperative housing corporations, condominiums, and homeowners associations from requiring residents or their guests to provide sensitive personal information as a condition for accessing recreational common areas such as pools, playgrounds, or lounges.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development or relevant local agencies
stakeholders: Residents of cooperative housing, condominiums, and homeowners associations, including their guests and children
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a legal restriction on the collection of sensitive personal information for recreational access, emphasizing privacy protections in community living environments.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but improves privacy rights for residents and families.

Title: Professional and Volunteer Firefighter Innovative Cancer Screening Technologies Program - Funding
Synopsis: Altering the amount the Governor is authorized to include in the annual budget for the Program from $500,000 to at least $1,000,000; and authorizing the Secretary to use up to 20% of Program funds to support research centers, including the University of Maryland Institute for Health Computing, in the collection, analysis, and processing of Program outcome data for the purposes of assessing, maximizing, and improving the effectiveness and clinical utility of the cancer screening funded by the Program.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a funding program for innovative cancer screening technologies specifically for professional and volunteer firefighters, funded through a portion of oil transfer license fees collected in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Firefighters, cancer research centers, and the general public in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a new approach by dedicating a portion of oil transfer fees to fund innovative cancer screening technologies for firefighters, and supports academic research centers.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on firefighter health and research funding.

Title: Maryland Uniform Disposition of Abandoned Property Act - Revisions
Synopsis: Making certain virtual currency subject to the abandoned property laws in the State; establishing certain provisions to determine certain information about certain apparent owners of abandoned property; altering and establishing certain provisions pertaining to the presumption of abandonment for certain types of property; establishing certain procedures to establish the death of a certain insured or certain annuitant; altering from $100 to $50 the value at which the Comptroller is required to publish a certain notice; etc.
bill_summary: This bill revises Maryland's laws on the disposition of abandoned property, including virtual currency, and updates procedures for identifying, claiming, and handling such property.
responsible_party: Maryland State Comptroller's Office
stakeholders: Owners of abandoned property, including virtual currency holders, insurance policyholders, and the general public
innovative_summary: The bill introduces provisions for handling virtual currency as abandoned property, including liquidation and remittance, employing digital asset management approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on legal and procedural updates for abandoned property.

Title: Hospitals - Medical Debt Collection - Sale of Patient Debt
Synopsis: Authorizing a hospital, under certain circumstances, to sell the medical debt of patients if the debt is sold to a governmental unit or an entity that is under contract with the unit or a nonprofit organization for the purpose of canceling the debt; requiring that a hospital's financial policy require the hospital to dismiss actions pending against a patient for the collection of debt that was sold and prohibit the hospital from engaging in specified collection activities; etc.
bill_summary: This bill regulates hospital medical debt collection practices in Maryland. It authorizes hospitals to sell certain old debt to government or nonprofit entities for debt cancellation, requires hospitals to follow specific policies on debt collection, and mandates transparency and oversight. It also limits hospitals' ability to report adverse information or take legal action against patients within certain timeframes.
responsible_party: Maryland Health Commission
stakeholders: Patients with hospital debt, hospitals, government health agencies, nonprofit organizations
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new approach to managing hospital debt by allowing sale of old debt for cancellation and requiring transparency and oversight, employing technology for reporting and oversight.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has potential to reduce child poverty by alleviating medical debt burdens on low-income families and improving access to healthcare.

Title: Real Property - Landlord and Tenant - Procedures for Failure to Pay Rent, Breach of Lease, and Tenant Holding Over
Synopsis: Requiring a landlord to provide certain notice to a tenant when a court has issued a warrant of restitution for a failure of a tenant to pay rent, a breach of lease, or a tenant holding over under certain circumstances; establishing certain procedures and requirements for the execution of a warrant for repossession; establishing that the Act does not restrict the authority of the State or a local jurisdiction to enact or enforce certain legislation; applying the Act prospectively; etc.
bill_summary: This bill establishes new procedures and requirements for landlords and tenants regarding eviction, repossession, and the handling of tenant personal property, including notice requirements, execution of warrants, and disposal of abandoned property.
responsible_party: Maryland District Courts and local law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Tenants and landlords in Maryland, especially those facing eviction or repossession
innovative_summary: The bill introduces comprehensive reforms to eviction procedures, including detailed notice requirements, handling of tenant personal property, and protections for tenants, employing modernized legal processes.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has the potential to reduce child poverty by providing clearer protections for tenants, reducing abrupt evictions, and promoting stable housing.

Title: Higher Education - Hunger-Free Campus Grant Program - Alterations
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Higher Education Commission to designate certain private institutions of higher education as hunger-free campuses; and prohibiting certain private institutions of higher education from being eligible to receive grant funding under the Hunger-Free Campus Grant Program.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Hunger–Free Campus Grant Program in Maryland, designating certain higher education campuses as hunger–free if they meet specific criteria, and providing funding and guidelines for supporting students facing food insecurity.
responsible_party: Maryland Higher Education Commission
stakeholders: Students at Maryland higher education institutions, especially those facing food insecurity
innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive approach including designation of hunger–free campuses, student surveys, food pantries, meal-sharing programs, and data collection to address student food insecurity.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to directly impact child poverty by reducing food insecurity among college students, many of whom are from low-income backgrounds.

Title: Correctional Services - Death of Incarcerated Individual - Notification
Synopsis: Requiring the Commissioner of Correction to notify certain elected representatives whenever an incarcerated individual dies in a Division of Correction facility; and requiring the Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services to adopt certain regulations compliant with the federal Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act.
bill_summary: This bill requires the Maryland Department of Correction to notify certain officials and representatives when an incarcerated individual dies in custody, including the cause of death, and mandates the department to adopt regulations to implement this requirement.
responsible_party: Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Incarcerated individuals, their families, correctional staff, and government officials
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a mandatory notification process for deaths in correctional facilities, including specific details to be shared, and requires regulation adoption to ensure compliance.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on correctional facility procedures.

Title: Maryland Medical Practice Act and Maryland Physician Assistants Act - Revisions
Synopsis: Repealing obsolete and redundant language in, clarifying language in, and making language consistent across certain provisions of law governing the State Board of Physicians and the regulation of physicians, physician assistants, and allied health professionals; altering certain licensure requirements; altering the grounds for discipline for physicians, physician assistants, and allied health professionals; authorizing the Board to impose a civil penalty for a certain report made in bad faith; etc.
bill_summary: This bill updates and clarifies regulations governing physicians, physician assistants, and allied health professionals in Maryland, including licensure, disciplinary procedures, reporting requirements, and program structures across various health professions.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Physicians
stakeholders: Physicians, physician assistants, allied health professionals, and the public in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily makes regulatory updates and clarifications; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on professional regulation and licensing does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Study on Detecting Deadly Weapons in Public Middle and High Schools
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Center for School Safety to study how best to detect deadly weapons in public middle and high schools and how best to rapidly report the detection of weapons to a law enforcement agency; requiring the Center to request any available assessment technologies evaluated under the Act; and requiring the Center to issue an interim report by December 1, 2025, and a final report on the findings of the study, in a manner that does not jeopardize school safety, by December 1, 2026, to
bill_summary: This bill requires the Maryland Center for School Safety to study how to detect deadly weapons in public middle and high schools and how to quickly report their detection to law enforcement. It includes evaluating current security measures, exploring new technologies like AI and metal detectors, and assessing the placement of security cameras.
responsible_party: Maryland Center for School Safety
stakeholders: Public middle and high school students, school staff, law enforcement agencies, and school administrators
innovative_summary: The bill promotes the use of advanced technologies such as artificial intelligence and increased security camera deployment to improve school safety and weapon detection.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving school safety, which can contribute to a more secure learning environment for all students.

Title: Health Occupations - Implicit Bias and Structural Racism Training
Synopsis: Requiring applicants for renewal of certain licenses and certain certificates issued by certain health occupation boards to attest that the applicant completed an implicit bias and structural racism training program, rather than an implicit bias training program, approved by the Cultural and Linguistic Health Care Professional Competency Program; authorizing certain health occupations boards to adopt regulations allowing applicants renewing licenses to receive continuing education credits for completing certain training; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires health care professionals in Maryland to complete implicit bias and structural racism training for license renewal, with the goal of reducing racial disparities in healthcare.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health or relevant health occupation boards
stakeholders: Health care professionals and patients in Maryland, especially from marginalized communities
innovative_summary: The bill incorporates structural racism training into health care licensing requirements, emphasizing a comprehensive approach to cultural competency and anti-racism in healthcare.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce health disparities that contribute to child poverty, but its direct impact is moderate.

Title: Baltimore City - Alcoholic Beverages Licenses - Alterations
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore City to provide a certain waiver from certain requirements for a restaurant within a certain bounded area in the 46th alcoholic beverages district; expanding the class of license to which a certain requirement for a memorandum of understanding applies to include any alcoholic beverages license in Baltimore City; providing an exception to a certain prohibition against the Board allowing a certain license transfer under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The bill makes various changes to alcohol licensing laws in Baltimore City, including allowing waivers, expanding license types, requiring memorandums of understanding with community associations, and extending license transfer deadlines.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Alcohol licensees, community associations, residents of Baltimore City
innovative_summary: The bill introduces extended license transfer deadlines and requires memorandums of understanding, which are somewhat innovative approaches to licensing and community engagement.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly target child poverty but may have indirect effects through community engagement and local economic activity.

Title: Common Ownership Communities and Zoning Authorities - Operation of Family Child Care Homes - Limitations
Synopsis: Prohibiting a provision in certain documents of certain cooperative housing corporations from prohibiting or restricting the establishment or operation of certain family child care homes; prohibiting a provision in certain documents of certain cooperative housing corporations from limiting the number of children for which certain family child care homes provide family child care below the number authorized by the State Department of Education; etc.
bill_summary: This bill prohibits certain restrictions and limitations on the operation of family child care homes within common ownership communities, condominiums, and other residential associations in Maryland. It ensures that such communities cannot restrict the number of children in these homes or prohibit their operation through governing documents.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education and local zoning authorities
stakeholders: Families, child care providers, residents of common ownership communities, and local governments
innovative_summary: The bill employs legal protections to ensure the operation of family child care homes is not restricted by community governing documents, promoting access to child care within residential communities.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a moderate potential to reduce child poverty by increasing access to affordable child care.

Title: Appellate Court of Maryland - Sessions at Educational Institutions
Synopsis: Authorizing the Appellate Court of Maryland, in conjunction with the administrations of secondary and postsecondary educational institutions in the State, to hold sessions at certain secondary and postsecondary educational institutions in the State.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes the Appellate Court of Maryland to hold sessions at secondary and postsecondary educational institutions in the state, in addition to its usual location in Annapolis.
responsible_party: Appellate Court of Maryland
stakeholders: Students and educational institutions in Maryland, legal community, general public
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new approach by allowing the appellate court to hold sessions at various educational institutions, potentially increasing accessibility and engagement.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to increase access to justice and legal education, which could indirectly benefit children in poverty.

Title: Courts - State Reporter - Publication of Cases
Synopsis: Repealing a requirement that the State Reporter secure copyright for the State of published reports of opinions of the Supreme Court of Maryland and the Appellate Court of Maryland.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the requirement that the Maryland State Reporter secure copyright for published reports of opinions of the Supreme Court and the Appellate Court of Maryland, and makes related amendments to the publication process of case reports.
responsible_party: Supreme Court of Maryland
stakeholders: Legal professionals, courts, and the public interested in Maryland case law
innovative_summary: The bill simplifies the publication process of court opinions by removing the copyright requirement, potentially streamlining access and publication procedures.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Judiciary Department - Commission on Judicial Disabilities - Temporary Appointment
Synopsis: Allowing the chair of the Commission on Judicial Disabilities to appoint a former member to temporarily fill a certain vacancy on the Commission; allowing the Governor, upon certain request of the chair, to appoint a temporary substitute member or extend the term of an existing member of the Commission; and requiring that any temporary substitute is subject to the same qualifications applicable to the member the substitute is replacing and if the member is a judge or an attorney, must be a member in good standing of the Maryland bar.
bill_summary: This bill proposes a constitutional amendment to allow the chair of the Commission on Judicial Disabilities to appoint a temporary member from a former member or request the Governor to appoint or extend the term of a current member, to fill vacancies on the Commission.
responsible_party: Maryland Judicial Conference and the Governor of Maryland
stakeholders: Judges, judicial officials, and the public involved in the Maryland judicial system
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new approach for temporarily filling vacancies on the Commission on Judicial Disabilities through appointments by the chair or the Governor, which is a novel procedural change.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly concerns judicial appointment procedures.

Title: Property Tax - Payment Plans - Notice to Taxpayers
Synopsis: Requiring the State Tax Sale Ombudsman to include certain information concerning a certain State installment payment program for property taxes on the Ombudsman's website; requiring the Ombudsman to contract with a vendor to operate an installment payment program for payment of taxes in which any homeowner may enroll; requiring a collector of taxes to include certain information concerning a certain State or local installment payment program for property taxes in a separate insert included with each property tax bill; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department and local tax collectors to provide information about installment payment programs for property taxes to taxpayers. This includes adding notices to property tax bills, websites, and notices sent before tax sales, to inform homeowners about options to pay taxes in installments and how to enroll.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Taxation and local tax collectors
stakeholders: Homeowners with delinquent or overdue property taxes in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive communication approach, including notices on bills, websites, and mailed notices, to inform homeowners about installment payment options, which is a proactive and integrated approach to tax collection and homeowner assistance.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to impact child poverty by helping homeowners retain their homes and avoid foreclosure, thereby providing stability for families.

Title: Somerset County - Property Tax - Emergency Services Tax
Synopsis: Authorizing the County Commissioners of Somerset County to impose an emergency services tax on all property subject to the county property tax to pay costs of emergency services; and prohibiting the county commissioners from initially imposing or subsequently increasing an emergency services tax until after a public hearing is held.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Somerset County to impose an annual emergency services property tax to fund fire, rescue, and emergency medical services. It requires public hearings before imposing or increasing the tax and details collection and enforcement procedures.
responsible_party: Somerset County Commissioners
stakeholders: Property owners and residents of Somerset County who benefit from emergency services
innovative_summary: The bill employs a traditional approach of funding emergency services through property taxes with added procedural requirements for public hearings and transparency.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily providing funding for emergency services that benefit all residents.

Title: University System of Maryland - Academic Facilities Bonding Authority
Synopsis: Approving certain projects for the acquisition, development, and improvement of certain academic facilities for the University System of Maryland; authorizing the issuance of bonds by the University System of Maryland in a total principal amount of $25,000,000 for financing the projects; and providing that the bonds issued under the authority of the Act are not a debt or obligation of the State or any of its subdivisions.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the University System of Maryland to issue bonds totaling $30,000,000 to finance projects for academic facilities, including new construction and renewal of existing facilities, without creating debt for the State.
responsible_party: University System of Maryland
stakeholders: Students, faculty, and staff of the University System of Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a bonding approach to finance academic facilities, which is a common but effective method for funding large infrastructure projects.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty but may indirectly benefit students and communities through improved educational facilities.

Title: Federal Public Service Loan Forgiveness Program - Employee Certification and Awareness Materials
Synopsis: Establishing requirements related to the certification of employment by public service employers under the federal Public Service Loan Forgiveness Program, including requirements regarding determinations of whether employees are full-time; and requiring the Student Loan Ombudsman in the Office of the Commissioner of Financial Regulation to develop and disseminate information to increase awareness of and participation in the Program.
bill_summary: The bill establishes requirements for public service employers in Maryland to certify employment for employees participating in the federal Public Service Loan Forgiveness Program. It also mandates the development and dissemination of informational materials to increase awareness and participation in the program, and designates the Student Loan Ombudsman to oversee these efforts.
responsible_party: Office of the Commissioner of Financial Regulation and the Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Public service employees in Maryland, including government workers, educators, and employees of non-profit organizations
innovative_summary: The bill employs a coordinated approach involving certification procedures and informational campaigns, utilizing a designated ombudsman to increase awareness and participation in a federal loan forgiveness program.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to reduce child poverty by supporting public service employees in managing student debt, which can improve their economic stability and ability to support their families.

Title: Real Property – Filing Fee for Residential Mortgage Foreclosure – Increase
Synopsis: Increasing the filing fee required to accompany an order to docket or a complaint to foreclose a mortgage or deed of trust on residential property from $300 to $450.
bill_summary: This bill increases the filing fee for residential mortgage foreclosure cases from $300 to $450, effective October 1, 2025.
responsible_party: Maryland Judiciary or the Office of Administrative Hearings
stakeholders: Homeowners facing foreclosure, mortgage lenders, mortgage originators, and legal professionals involved in foreclosure proceedings
innovative_summary: The bill does not employ new technologies or approaches; it mainly adjusts the existing fee structure.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily affects legal filing fees in foreclosure cases.

Title: Opioid Restitution Fund - Interactive Dashboard
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Office of Overdose Response, in collaboration with the Maryland Department of Health, to develop and maintain an interactive dashboard on Opioid Restitution Fund spending to share prescription opioid-related settlement information with the public; requiring the dashboard to include links to the State, county, or municipal websites that provide access to additional information on the use of opioid-related settlement funds; etc.
bill_summary: This bill requires the Maryland Office of Overdose Response, in collaboration with the Maryland Department of Health, to develop and maintain an interactive online dashboard that displays information about the use of funds from opioid settlement agreements. The dashboard will include details on payments, past spending, future plans, and initiatives funded by the settlement funds, with links to additional information from relevant government websites.
responsible_party: Maryland Office of Overdose Response and Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Public, government agencies, and communities affected by opioid use and overdose
innovative_summary: The program employs an interactive online dashboard to transparently share data on opioid settlement fund spending, utilizing existing platforms and online portals for reporting and data sharing.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to impact child poverty by improving transparency and accountability in opioid settlement fund spending, which can support community health and social services.

Title: Economic Development - Maryland Innovation Initiative Institution Partnership Extension Program - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Innovation Initiative Institution Partnership Extension Program to expand opportunities for technology validation, entrepreneurial development, and industry engagement at eligible institutions; establishing eligibility criteria for project proposals to receive funding under the Program; authorizing the Governor to include an appropriation of $250,000 in the annual budget bill for fiscal years 2027 and 2028 for the Program; and altering the purpose and contents of the Maryland Innovation Initiative Fund.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Innovation Initiative Partnership Extension Program to support technology validation, entrepreneurial development, and industry engagement at eligible Maryland higher education institutions, with funding and reporting requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Economic Development (or equivalent agency responsible for economic development and innovation)
stakeholders: Eligible Maryland higher education institutions, industry partners, entrepreneurs, and the regional economy
innovative_summary: The program employs a collaborative approach to expand technology commercialization and entrepreneurial development through targeted funding and industry partnerships, leveraging existing university and industry collaborations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to create economic opportunities and jobs, which could help reduce child poverty in the region.

Title: Columbia Association - Lease Requirements and Governing Documents Ho. Co. 14-25
Synopsis: Requiring a written lease for certain residential or commercial real property in Howard County to include information on the annual charge assessed by the Columbia Association and a description of certain rights and privileges under certain circumstances; requiring a landlord to provide a tenant with a copy of certain covenants and governing documents under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires landlords in Howard County to include specific information about the Columbia Association's annual charges and rights in written leases for residential and commercial properties. It also mandates landlords to provide tenants with copies of covenants and governing documents.
responsible_party: Howard County government or relevant local agencies
stakeholders: Tenants and landlords in Howard County subject to Columbia Association covenants
