innovative_summary: The bill introduces transparency requirements for lease agreements, including detailed disclosures about association charges and rights, which enhances tenant awareness and rights.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing more on lease transparency and tenant rights.

Title: Out-of-Home Placement Providers - Individuals Enrolled in Higher Education and Vocational Training Programs
Synopsis: Authorizing an individual enrolled in an accredited institution of higher education or a residential vocational training program to return to an out-of-home placement provider with whom the individual was previously placed under certain circumstances; requiring an individual to make a request to a local department of social services at least 30 days before the scheduled break; requiring the local department to make a recommendation to the Department of Human Services not later than 21 days before the scheduled break; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes regulations for out-of-home placement providers, including setting maximum numbers of children they can care for, with exemptions for children enrolled in higher education or vocational training programs. It allows individuals in higher education or vocational training to return to previous out-of-home placements under certain conditions and procedures.
responsible_party: Department of Human Services
stakeholders: Children in out-of-home placements, especially those enrolled in higher education or vocational training programs
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured process for students in higher education or vocational training to return to previous out-of-home placements, integrating educational schedules with child welfare services.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by supporting stability for children in out-of-home placements who are pursuing higher education or vocational training.

Title: Maryland Insurance Administration and Maryland Department of Health - Workgroup to Study Pharmacy Benefits Managers
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Insurance Administration and the Maryland Department of Health, in consultation with the Prescription Drug Affordability Board, to convene a workgroup to study and review reimbursement for pharmacists; and requiring the workgroup to submit an interim report by December 31, 2025, and a final report on their findings and recommendations to certain committees of the General Assembly by December 31, 2026.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a workgroup to study pharmacy benefits managers, review reimbursement levels for drugs, and analyze related pharmacy and drug pricing issues in Maryland's Medicaid and insurance programs. It aims to improve transparency, reimbursement practices, and drug coverage policies.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Administration and Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Pharmacies, pharmacists, drug manufacturers, insurance carriers, managed care organizations, Medicaid recipients, and the general public in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive, multi-stakeholder approach to analyze and improve pharmacy benefit management and drug pricing transparency, including reviewing legal and interstate practices.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by improving access to affordable medications through better pharmacy reimbursement and transparency.

Title: Department of Juvenile Services - Report on Youth Service Bureaus
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Juvenile Services to submit an annual report to certain committees of the General Assembly by October 1 detailing efforts by the Department to promote predelinquent programs, including youth service bureaus, efforts by the Department to collaborate with and provide technical assistance to local governments regarding the establishment of youth service bureaus, and an assessment of the programs and activities of the bureaus and any other efforts to prevent youth offenses.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Juvenile Services to submit annual reports on youth service bureaus, including their efforts, collaboration, assessment, and youth offense prevention activities.
responsible_party: Department of Juvenile Services
stakeholders: Youth, local governments, juvenile justice system
innovative_summary: The bill promotes ongoing assessment and collaboration efforts for youth prevention programs, emphasizing data collection and inter-agency cooperation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by preventing youth offenses and supporting youth development through community-based services.

Title: Procurement - Employee Stock Ownership Plan Preference - Pilot
Synopsis: Authorizing the Maryland Stadium Authority, Morgan State University, St. Mary's College of Maryland, and Baltimore City Community College to establish a certain preference program for certain procurements; authorizing the establishment of a certain evaluation factor for certain proposals by an entity that utilizes certain employee stock ownership plans; requiring contractors to provide certain information to a unit regarding the use of an employee stock ownership plan; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a pilot program in Maryland that provides procurement preferences for entities that utilize employee stock ownership plans (ESOPs). It authorizes certain state agencies and educational institutions to establish evaluation factors favoring ESOP-utilizing bidders and requires contractors to provide verification of their ESOP status.
responsible_party: Maryland State agencies including the Maryland Stadium Authority, University System of Maryland, Morgan State University, St. Mary’s College of Maryland, and Baltimore City Community College
stakeholders: Employees and contractors involved in procurement processes at the specified state agencies and educational institutions, and the entities utilizing employee stock ownership plans
innovative_summary: The program employs a new approach by providing procurement preferences based on the use of employee stock ownership plans, encouraging employee ownership and participation in state contracts.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to impact child poverty indirectly by promoting employee ownership and economic participation, but its direct impact is limited.

Title: Health Insurance - Utilization Review - Use of Artificial Intelligence
Synopsis: Requiring that certain carriers, pharmacy benefits managers, and private review agents ensure that artificial intelligence, algorithm, or other software tools are used in a certain manner when used for conducting utilization review.
bill_summary: The bill requires health insurance carriers, pharmacy benefits managers, and private review agents in Maryland to ensure that artificial intelligence and other software tools used in utilization review are used properly, with specific rules on transparency, fairness, and oversight.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and the Maryland Insurance Administration
stakeholders: Health insurance companies, pharmacy benefits managers, private review agents, and enrollees in Maryland health plans
innovative_summary: The bill introduces regulations on the use of artificial intelligence in health insurance utilization review, emphasizing transparency, fairness, and oversight, which is a relatively new approach in health policy.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly regulates the use of AI in health insurance review processes.

Title: Maryland Small Business Retirement Savings Board - Membership - Alteration
Synopsis: Adding the Comptroller, or the Comptroller's designee, as a member to the Maryland Small Business Retirement Savings Board.
bill_summary: The bill amends the Maryland Small Business Retirement Savings Board to add the Comptroller or their designee as a member.
responsible_party: Maryland Small Business Retirement Savings Board
stakeholders: Small businesses and employees in Maryland who are affected by retirement savings programs
innovative_summary: The bill mainly updates the membership of an existing board; it does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it focuses on the composition of a retirement savings board.

Title: Office of Small, Minority, and Women Business Affairs - Repeal of Interdepartmental Advisory Committee and Establishment of the Governor's Subcabinet on Socioeconomic Procurement Participation
Synopsis: Repealing the Interdepartmental Advisory Committee on Small, Minority, and Women Business Affairs within the Office of Small, Minority, and Women Business Affairs; establishing the Governor's Subcabinet on Socioeconomic Procurement Participation to study and make recommendations on socioeconomic procurement in the State; requiring the Subcabinet to conduct certain meetings and report annually to the Governor on the Subcabinet's activities, progress, and recommendations.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the existing Interdepartmental Advisory Committee on Small, Minority, and Women Business Affairs and establishes the Governor’s Subcabinet on Socioeconomic Procurement Participation to study and improve socioeconomic procurement programs in Maryland.
responsible_party: Governor’s Subcabinet on Socioeconomic Procurement Participation
stakeholders: Minority, women, disabled individuals, and small business enterprises in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill creates a new high-level government subcabinet to coordinate and improve socioeconomic procurement programs, including studying best practices and recommending reforms.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to impact child poverty by promoting economic opportunities for disadvantaged groups, but the direct impact is moderate.

Title: Carroll County - Prospective Employees and Volunteers - Criminal History Records Check
Synopsis: Repealing certain limitations on the prospective employees or volunteers of Carroll County for whom the Department of Human Resources of Carroll County may request a criminal history records check.
bill_summary: The bill repeals certain restrictions on Carroll County's ability to request criminal history records checks for prospective employees or volunteers, expanding the types of positions for which checks can be requested.
responsible_party: Carroll County Department of Human Resources
stakeholders: Prospective employees and volunteers of Carroll County, and the community served by these individuals
innovative_summary: The bill broadens the scope of criminal history checks for county employees and volunteers, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily affecting employment and volunteer screening processes.

Title: Carroll County - Public Facilities Bond
Synopsis: Authorizing and empowering the County Commissioners of Carroll County to borrow not more than $36,900,000 in order to finance the construction, improvement, or development of certain public facilities in Carroll County and to effect such borrowing by the issuance and sale at public or private sale of its general obligation bonds; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Carroll County to issue up to $36,900,000 in bonds to finance public facilities, water and sewer projects, and volunteer fire department facilities, including the ability to borrow, issue refunding bonds, and make loans to fire departments.
responsible_party: Carroll County Commissioners
stakeholders: Residents of Carroll County, volunteer fire departments, public facility users
innovative_summary: The bill employs traditional bond issuance and financing mechanisms for public infrastructure and emergency services, with no new technologies or approaches specified.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could have a moderate impact on child poverty by improving public facilities and emergency services, which can benefit children indirectly.

Title: Charles County - Alcoholic Beverages - Baseball Stadium License - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the areas in which beer, wine, and liquor may be sold and consumed under a Class B-Stadium (baseball stadium) beer, wine, and liquor license in Charles County to exclude any parking areas; and altering the types of containers in which beer, wine, and liquor may be served.
bill_summary: The bill amends the regulations for the Class B–Stadium (baseball stadium) alcohol license in Charles County, including changes to where alcohol can be sold and consumed, the types of containers used, and the hours of sale.
responsible_party: Charles County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Baseball stadium patrons, stadium operators, local residents
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates existing alcohol licensing rules for a specific stadium, with some adjustments to serving containers and consumption areas, but does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly concerns alcohol licensing regulations at a stadium.

Title: Health Occupations - Licensed Direct-Entry Midwives - Revisions
Synopsis: Altering the scope of practice of licensed direct-entry midwives; providing that the practice of direct-entry midwifery is independent and not does not require oversight by another health care practitioner; repealing the requirement that licensed direct-entry midwives report certain information to the Direct-Entry Midwifery Advisory Committee; altering the disciplinary actions that may be taken against a licensed direct-entry midwife or an applicant for a license; etc.
bill_summary: This bill revises the scope of practice for licensed direct-entry midwives in Maryland, making their practice independent without oversight, and updates reporting, disciplinary, and transfer procedures.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Nursing
stakeholders: Licensed direct-entry midwives, pregnant individuals, newborns, and families in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a more autonomous practice model for midwives, including new protocols for emergency transfers and comprehensive reporting requirements, employing modern standards and practices.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but may improve access to maternity and newborn care, which can indirectly benefit child well-being.

Title: Election Law - Provisional Ballots - Nonpartisan Board of Education Contests
Synopsis: Providing that a voter is qualified to vote a provisional ballot if the provisional ballot was cast because the voter claimed a different political party affiliation from the political party affiliation on record for the voter and the voter made a selection in a nonpartisan board of education contest; and requiring a local board of canvassers to count only the votes cast in a nonpartisan board of education contest for those provisional ballots.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland election law to specify that a provisional ballot cast by a voter who claims a different political party affiliation than the one on record, and who makes a selection in a nonpartisan board of education contest, should only have the votes from that nonpartisan contest counted. It clarifies the conditions under which provisional ballots are accepted and counted, particularly focusing on nonpartisan contests and party affiliation discrepancies.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Voters, election officials, political parties, and candidates in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a specific rule for counting votes in nonpartisan contests on provisional ballots when there is a party affiliation discrepancy, which is a targeted procedural change rather than a new technology or broad approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's impact on child poverty is likely minimal as it primarily concerns election procedures and vote counting rules.

Title: Public Senior Higher Education Institutions - Pregnant and Parenting Students - Plan Requirements (Pregnant and Parenting Student Support Act)
Synopsis: Requiring certain public senior higher education institutions to adopt a plan regarding pregnant and parenting students to include referral to on-campus or off-campus services to assist regarding the availability of or eligibility for certain government assistance programs and any other programs, scholarships, or subsidies that may be available for pregnant and parenting students; and requiring each public senior higher education institution to post the plan on the institution's website on or before August 1, 2026.
bill_summary: The bill requires certain public higher education institutions in Maryland to adopt and post a plan to support pregnant and parenting students, including providing information on government assistance programs, resources for adoption, accommodations, and healthcare referrals.
responsible_party: Public senior higher education institutions in Maryland
stakeholders: Pregnant and parenting students at Maryland public higher education institutions
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach to support pregnant and parenting students by requiring institutions to develop detailed plans that include resource referrals, accommodations, and healthcare support, which is a proactive and holistic approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to directly impact child poverty by supporting students who are parents, thereby improving their educational outcomes and economic stability.

Title: Gaming - Charles County Gaming Permit Review Board - Repeal
Synopsis: Repealing the Charles County Gaming Permit Review Board; and transferring certain powers and duties concerning gaming activities in Charles County from the board to the County Attorney for Charles County.
bill_summary: The bill repeals the Charles County Gaming Permit Review Board and transfers its powers and duties to the County Attorney for Charles County, streamlining the regulation of gaming activities in the county.
responsible_party: Charles County Attorney's Office
stakeholders: Fundraising organizations, gaming permit applicants, and residents of Charles County
innovative_summary: The bill centralizes gaming permit review authority from a board to the County Attorney, simplifying the process and reducing the number of regulatory bodies involved.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly changes administrative procedures for gaming regulation.

Title: Somerset County - Salaries of Local Officials - Increase
Synopsis: Increasing the salaries of the Sheriff of Somerset County, the County Commissioners of Somerset County, the President of the County Commissioners of Somerset County, a member of the County Roads Board of Somerset County, and the President of the County Roads Board of Somerset County.
bill_summary: The bill increases the salaries of certain public officials in Somerset County, including the Sheriff, County Commissioners, and members of the County Roads Board, effective from October 1, 2025.
responsible_party: Somerset County government
stakeholders: Public officials and residents of Somerset County
innovative_summary: The bill does not employ new technologies or approaches; it mainly adjusts salary levels for existing officials.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty or include programs aimed at reducing it.

Title: Health Insurance - Adverse Decisions - Notices, Reporting, and Examinations
Synopsis: Requiring that certain adverse decision and grievance decision notices include certain information in a certain manner; requiring that the information regarding criteria and standards for utilization review that a private review agent is required to post on its website or the carrier's website be posted on the member's and provider's pages of the websites; requiring that certain information submitted to the Maryland Insurance Commissioner be aggregated by zip code; etc.
bill_summary: The bill enhances transparency and accountability in health insurance adverse decision processes by requiring detailed notices, posting of criteria on websites, aggregation of decision data by zip code, and improved communication channels for members and providers.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Commissioner
stakeholders: Health insurance members, healthcare providers, insurance carriers, and the Maryland Insurance Commissioner
innovative_summary: The bill employs detailed reporting, website posting of criteria, and dedicated communication channels, representing a comprehensive approach to transparency and oversight in health insurance decisions.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving access to clear health insurance decisions and reducing barriers to care.

Title: Workgroup on the Creation of a Data Dashboard for Public Work Contracts and Apprentices - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Workgroup on the Creation of a Data Dashboard for Public Work Contracts and Apprentices to study the most efficient and cost-effective method to create a publicly available data dashboard that disaggregates information regarding public work contracts with the State and apprentices working under the public work contracts; and requiring the Workgroup to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly by January 7, 2027.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a workgroup to create a publicly accessible data dashboard that disaggregates information about public work contracts in Maryland, including contractor details, wages, apprenticeships, and demographic data.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Public work contractors, subcontractors, employees, apprentices, and the general public interested in transparency of public contracts.
innovative_summary: The bill employs a new approach by creating a comprehensive, publicly accessible data dashboard that disaggregates detailed information about public work contracts and apprenticeships, utilizing modern data visualization and transparency tools.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to impact child poverty by promoting transparency, fair wages, and equitable apprenticeship opportunities, which can lead to improved economic conditions for families.

Title: Postconviction Review - Procedure to Reduce Duration of Sentence (Maryland Second Look Act)
Synopsis: Authorizing a certain individual to file a motion to reduce the duration of a certain sentence if the individual was convicted between the ages of at least 18 and under 25, was not sentenced to life, is not a sex offender, has served at least 20 years of the term of confinement, and was not convicted of murder involving a victim who was a first responder who was killed in the line of duty; applying procedures for a proceeding under the Act; etc.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes individuals serving long-term sentences in Maryland to petition for a reduction of their sentences after serving at least 20 years, with specific procedures and considerations for hearings and decisions, including factors like age, behavior, and rehabilitation.
responsible_party: Maryland courts and Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Long-term incarcerated individuals, victims, and the Maryland public
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured, evidence-based process for sentence reduction petitions, considering factors like age, maturity, and rehabilitation, and incorporates victim input and modern hearing options such as video conferencing.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on criminal justice reform for long-term inmates.

Title: Workgroup on Establishing a Science and Technology Best Practices and Innovation Network - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the Workgroup on Establishing a Science and Technology Best Practices and Innovation Network; and extending the workgroup to June 30, 2027.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Workgroup on Establishing a Science and Technology Best Practices and Innovation Network, with expanded membership and an extended timeline for reporting its findings and recommendations.
responsible_party: University of Maryland, Baltimore County (provides staff for the Workgroup)
stakeholders: Scientists, technology experts, community organizations, and the general public interested in science and technology innovation in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill promotes the creation of an open access science, technology, and innovation network or hub to facilitate collaboration, data sharing, and decision-making based on sound science and best practices, leveraging digital and virtual platforms.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to impact child poverty by fostering innovation and access to scientific resources, but its direct impact is moderate.

Title: Natural Resources - Pursuing Wounded Deer After Legal Hunting Hours and Using a Light - Authorization
Synopsis: Authorizing a person who is authorized by the Department of Natural Resources to hunt deer and who wounds a deer during legal hunting hours to pursue and kill the deer after legal hunting hours using the means authorized for the applicable hunting season or permit which may include use of a light or throw or cast the rays of a spotlight, a headlight, an artificial light, a battery, or any other device while pursuing the wounded deer.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes individuals authorized by the Maryland Department of Natural Resources to pursue and kill wounded deer after legal hunting hours, using lights and other devices, under certain restrictions.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Deer hunters and wildlife management authorities in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new approach to hunting regulations by allowing the use of lights and devices to pursue wounded deer after hours, which is a change from traditional hunting rules.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has no direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Access to Health Insurance for Child Care Professionals - Outreach
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Health Benefit Exchange to promote access to health insurance for child care professionals; and requiring the Exchange to conduct a survey, in consultation with the State Department of Education and relevant nonprofit organizations, to assess current levels of health care access across the child care community.
bill_summary: The bill promotes access to health insurance for child care professionals by encouraging collaboration between the Maryland Department of Education, the Maryland Health Benefit Exchange, and nonprofit organizations. It includes outreach, assistance with obtaining insurance, and conducting a survey on healthcare access within the child care community.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education in collaboration with the Maryland Health Benefit Exchange
stakeholders: Child care professionals and child care providers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a collaborative approach involving multiple agencies and nonprofit organizations to improve health insurance access for a specific workforce, including outreach, assistance, and data collection.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to reduce child poverty by improving health coverage for child care professionals, which can lead to better economic stability and quality care.

Title: Public Nuisance - Common Carriers - Damage to Public Infrastructure
Synopsis: Prohibiting certain common carriers from damaging certain public infrastructure necessitating the closure of the infrastructure; establishing that a violation of the Act is a public nuisance; authorizing the State or a local government to bring a civil action against a common carrier for a violation under the Act; and providing that a common carrier that commits a violation may be liable to the State or local government for civil penalties of $1,000 per day for each day the public nuisance continues.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits certain common carriers from damaging public infrastructure such as bridges and highways, making such damage a public nuisance. It allows the state or local governments to take civil action against violators, including seeking injunctive relief, damages, and civil penalties.
responsible_party: State or local government
stakeholders: Public infrastructure, state and local governments, common carriers
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a legal framework specifically targeting damage caused by common carriers to public infrastructure, with civil penalties and enforcement provisions.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on infrastructure protection.

Title: Transportation Network Companies - Weekly Fare and Earnings Summary and Operator Data Reporting
Synopsis: Requiring a transportation network company to provide each operator with a weekly fare and earnings summary; requiring a transportation network company to report, on or before February 1 each year, certain information to the Public Service Commission; and providing that the report submitted to the Commission may be made available to the General Assembly on request, provided that the report remain confidential and exempt from public disclosure.
bill_summary: The bill requires transportation network companies to provide weekly fare and earnings summaries to their operators, offer digital receipts after each ride, and report annual aggregated data to the Public Service Commission, including information on fares, operator earnings, and demographics.
responsible_party: Public Service Commission of Maryland
stakeholders: Transportation network operators, passengers, and the Public Service Commission
innovative_summary: The program employs digital reporting, real-time digital receipts, and annual data reporting to enhance transparency and oversight of transportation network services.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on transparency and data collection could indirectly support policies to reduce child poverty by improving transportation services and oversight.

Title: Catastrophic Event Account - Transfer of Funds - State Disaster Recovery Fund
Synopsis: Authorizing the transfer of funds from the Catastrophic Event Account to the State Disaster Recovery Fund if the balance of the Fund has been depleted due to use or transfer or the estimated costs for providing adequate disaster relief for a natural disaster or catastrophic situation are in excess of the Fund's balance; and providing the Legislative Policy Committee has 10 days to review and make comments before the Governor may transfer certain funds from the Account through budget amendment.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the transfer of funds from the Catastrophic Event Account to the State Disaster Recovery Fund under certain circumstances, modifies review periods for fund transfers, and clarifies the sources and uses of these funds.
responsible_party: Maryland State Government, specifically the Public Safety Department and the State Finance and Procurement Department
stakeholders: State and local government agencies involved in disaster response and recovery, and residents affected by disasters
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a streamlined process for transferring funds between disaster-related accounts, including quicker review periods during federal shutdowns, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily supporting disaster response and recovery efforts.

Title: Frederick County - Alcoholic Beverages - Class C (Theater) Beer, Wine, and Liquor License
Synopsis: Establishing a Class C (theater) beer, wine, and liquor license in Frederick County; authorizing the manager of the theater or any other official designated by the theater to sign the application for the license; authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Frederick County to issue the license for use by certain theaters; authorizing the license holder to sell beer, wine, and liquor for on-premises consumption, subject to certain limitations; establishing an annual license fee of $150; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a new Class C (theater) beer, wine, and liquor license in Frederick County, allowing theaters to sell alcohol for on-premises consumption during certain events.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Frederick County
stakeholders: Theaters and their patrons in Frederick County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a specialized alcohol license for theaters, enabling them to sell alcohol during performances and events, which is a targeted approach to support local theaters.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty as it mainly pertains to licensing and alcohol sales in theaters.

Title: Preserve Telehealth Access Act of 2025
Synopsis: Repealing the limitation on the period during which the Maryland Medical Assistance Program and certain insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations are required to provide reimbursement for certain health care services provided through telehealth on a certain basis and at a certain rate; altering the circumstances under which health care practitioners are authorized to prescribe certain controlled dangerous substances for the treatment of pain through telehealth; etc.
bill_summary: The bill expands telehealth access in Maryland by removing the time limit on audio-only telephone consultations, requiring reimbursement for telehealth services at the same rate as in-person services, and establishing reporting requirements for telehealth developments. It also clarifies standards for healthcare practitioners prescribing controlled substances via telehealth and mandates coverage for telehealth services by insurers and health plans.
responsible_party: Maryland Health Care Commission and relevant health insurance entities
stakeholders: Patients, healthcare providers, insurers, and health plans in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach to expand and standardize telehealth services, including removing restrictions on audio-only consultations and ensuring reimbursement parity, which is a significant step towards modernizing healthcare delivery.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has the potential to improve healthcare access for underserved populations, including children, by expanding telehealth services and reimbursement, which could reduce barriers to care.

Title: Health Services Cost Review Commission - Community Benefits - Community Health Worker Workforce Program
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "community benefit" to include a community health worker workforce program which is intended to provide services to patients of a nonprofit hospital and to improve health outcomes; authorizing a nonprofit hospital and a community-based organization to establish a community health worker workforce program; providing that a partnership that establishes a community health worker workforce program may be executed through a memorandum of understanding; establishing requirements for the memorandum of understanding; etc.
bill_summary: The bill expands the definition of 'community benefit' to include community health worker workforce programs and authorizes partnerships between nonprofit hospitals and community organizations to establish these programs, which aim to improve health outcomes and address social determinants of health.
responsible_party: Health Services Cost Review Commission and nonprofit hospitals
stakeholders: Community health workers, nonprofit hospitals, community-based organizations, and residents served by these programs
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured approach to integrating community health workers into hospital community benefit programs through formal partnerships and memoranda of understanding, emphasizing data management and health outcomes.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to directly impact child poverty by improving access to health and social services through community health workers.

Title: Residential Real Property - Tenants' Right of First Refusal
Synopsis: Clarifying the circumstances under which liability for the failure to comply with certain requirements relating to a tenant's right of first refusal to purchase residential property is restricted to the owner of the property and does not attach to the property.
bill_summary: This bill clarifies that liability for failing to comply with tenants' right of first refusal to purchase residential property is limited to the owner and does not attach to the property itself.
responsible_party: Office of Tenant and Landlord Affairs
stakeholders: Tenants of residential rental properties in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily clarifies legal liability and does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on legal rights and liabilities for tenants.

Title: Prison Education Delivery Reform Commission - Reporting and Sunset Extension
Synopsis: Extending the time for submission of the interim report and final report of the Prison Education Delivery Reform Commission by 3 years; and extending the termination date for the Commission by 3 years.
bill_summary: The bill extends the reporting deadlines and the duration of the Prison Education Delivery Reform Commission, delaying its interim and final reports to 2028 and 2029 respectively, and prolonging its existence until June 30, 2029.
responsible_party: Prison Education Delivery Reform Commission
stakeholders: Prison inmates and the criminal justice system in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill mainly extends existing reporting and sunset dates; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it focuses on prison education reform oversight.

Title: Task Force to Improve Attendance and Reduce Chronic Absenteeism in Schools
Synopsis: Establishing the Task Force to Improve Attendance and Reduce Chronic Absenteeism in Schools for the purpose of studying and making recommendations on practices to identify, prevent, and eliminate chronic absenteeism by students from schools in the State; and requiring the Task Force to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly by December 31, 2025.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a Task Force to Study and Make Recommendations on Improving Attendance and Reducing Chronic Absenteeism in Maryland Schools. It outlines the composition, responsibilities, and reporting requirements for the task force, and mandates updates to regulations and distribution of guidance and toolkits to local school systems.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Students, parents, teachers, school administrators, and local school systems in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive, data-driven approach with the development of culturally responsive, nonpunitive strategies, and the creation of toolkits and guidance for local school systems, integrating best practices and community involvement.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to directly impact child poverty by addressing absenteeism, which is linked to poor educational outcomes and long-term economic disadvantages.

Title: Family Investment Program - Child Support
Synopsis: Phasing in a requirement that all child support received in a month pass through to a family seeking assistance under the Family Investment Program and prohibiting the consideration of child support in computing the amount of assistance received.
bill_summary: The bill phases in a policy that ensures all child support received in a month passes through to families receiving assistance under the Family Investment Program (FIP) and prohibits considering child support when calculating assistance and benefits, including Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) benefits.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Human Services
stakeholders: Families receiving public assistance and child support recipients in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a phased approach to pass through all child support to families and prohibits its consideration in benefit calculations, which is a significant policy change aimed at supporting low-income families.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to directly reduce child poverty by increasing the amount of support families receive and removing child support from benefit calculations.

Title: State Retirement and Pension System – Deferred Vested Former Members – Return to Service
Synopsis: Establishing that an individual who, after earning service credit sufficient for a vested allowance in the State Police Retirement System, the Correctional Officers' Retirement System, or the Law Enforcement Officers' Pension System, separates from service, and subsequently returns to service in a position in the same system under certain circumstances, is subject to the same requirements to which certain members of the same system are subject.
bill_summary: This bill clarifies rules for individuals who have earned service credit in various Maryland state retirement systems, separated from employment, and then returned to service within a certain timeframe. It specifies that such individuals are subject to the same requirements as other members of their respective systems.
responsible_party: Maryland State Retirement Systems and relevant state agencies
stakeholders: Members of the Maryland State Retirement and Pension System, including police, correctional officers, and other public employees
innovative_summary: The bill mainly updates and clarifies existing rules regarding reemployment and vesting in state retirement systems; it does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily concerns retirement system rules for public employees.

Title: Accountants - Licensed Out-of-State Practice Privileges - Qualifications
Synopsis: Altering the qualifications for an individual licensed as a certified public accountant in another state to practice certified public accountancy in the State by requiring that the individual must have passed the Uniform CPA Examination when qualifying for the license in the other state.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the qualifications for out-of-state licensed certified public accountants (CPAs) to practice in Maryland, allowing those with licenses from other states where they passed the Uniform CPA Exam to practice in Maryland without additional licensing, under certain conditions.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Public Accountancy
stakeholders: Certified Public Accountants licensed in other states, Maryland businesses and consumers needing CPA services
innovative_summary: The bill streamlines and simplifies the process for out-of-state CPAs to practice in Maryland by recognizing out-of-state licenses based on exam passage, reducing barriers and increasing mobility.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily affecting professional licensing processes.

Title: Education - Initial Teacher Certification - Qualifications
Synopsis: Altering the qualifications for an initial teacher certificate to include passing a portfolio-based assessment of a nationally accredited teacher preparation program.
bill_summary: The bill amends the qualifications for initial teacher certification in Maryland to include passing a portfolio-based assessment of a nationally accredited teacher preparation program, starting July 1, 2025.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Teacher candidates and educational institutions in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a portfolio-based assessment as an alternative pathway for teacher certification, which is a relatively innovative approach to evaluating teaching ability.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus is on teacher certification qualifications and does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Tidal Fish Licenses - Oyster Authorizations - Administrative Penalties
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Natural Resources to suspend for up to 5 years for a first violation, rather than revoke, a person's oyster authorization for knowingly committing certain violations; providing for the reinstatement for certain persons of an oyster authorization and an entitlement to engage or work in the oyster fishery; altering a certain offense related to the use of prohibited gear; and repealing the 90-day time period within which a certain administrative hearing must be held.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the penalties and procedures related to oyster fishing violations in Maryland, including suspending rather than revoking oyster authorizations for first offenses and establishing conditions for reinstatement of revoked authorizations.
responsible_party: Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Oyster fishers and related industry stakeholders in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a revised approach to penalties, emphasizing suspension and reinstatement over revocation, but does not employ new technologies or innovative methods.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, focusing on regulatory procedures for oyster fishing.

Title: Endangered and Threatened Species - Incidental Taking - Bats
Synopsis: Authorizing the Secretary of Natural Resources to issue an incidental taking permit for the Indiana bat, the northern long-eared bat, the tricolor bat, or the eastern small-footed bat if an applicant submits a certain conservation plan and the Secretary makes certain findings.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Department of Natural Resources to issue incidental taking permits for certain bat species, including the Indiana bat, Northern long-eared bat, Tricolored bat, and Eastern small-footed bat, under specific conservation plans that ensure minimal impact on the species' survival.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Bat species, conservation agencies, developers, and landowners in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a conservation planning approach that allows incidental take permits for certain bat species, integrating ecological protection with development activities.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on wildlife conservation.

Title: Employment and Insurance Equality for Service Members Act
Synopsis: Establishing rules of interpretation related to the uniformed services; altering the rule of interpretation for "veteran"; and altering the application of certain provisions of law governing the regulation of business, economic development, insurance, and labor and employment to apply to all uniformed services, rather than only the armed forces.
bill_summary: The bill establishes various programs and legal protections for service members, veterans, and their families in Maryland, including expedited licensing, employment protections, and small business loans, as well as clarifying legal definitions related to the uniformed services.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Veterans and Military Families and other relevant state agencies
stakeholders: Service members, veterans, military families, and veteran-owned small businesses in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach to support service members and veterans through expedited licensing, employment protections, and financial assistance, integrating legal, employment, and financial programs.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by supporting military families and veterans, which can improve economic stability for affected families.

Title: Property Tax - Exemption for Blind Individuals - Alteration
Synopsis: Increasing the amount of a certain property tax exemption for dwelling houses owned by blind individuals or their surviving spouses from $15,000 to $40,000.
bill_summary: This bill increases the property tax exemption amount for dwelling houses owned by blind individuals or their surviving spouses from $15,000 to $40,000, and makes related adjustments to the law.
responsible_party: Maryland local governments (counties and municipal corporations) for administering exemptions and refunds
stakeholders: Blind individuals and their surviving spouses who own and reside in qualifying dwelling houses in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill does not employ new technologies or approaches; it mainly updates the exemption amount in existing law.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily benefits blind homeowners and their spouses.

Title: Baltimore City - Speed Monitoring Systems - Interstate 83
Synopsis: Increasing from two to four the number of speed monitoring systems that may be placed on Interstate 83 in Baltimore City; limiting to not more than one speed monitoring system in each direction that may be in operation at the same time on Interstate 83 in Baltimore City; and making permanent the authorization to place speed monitoring systems on Interstate 83 in Baltimore City.
bill_summary: The bill increases the number of speed monitoring systems that can be placed on Interstate 83 in Baltimore City from two to four, limits the number of systems in operation at the same time to one per direction, and makes the authorization for these systems permanent.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Government or Maryland Department of Transportation (implied)
stakeholders: Drivers and residents in Baltimore City, law enforcement, transportation authorities
innovative_summary: The bill employs a technological approach to traffic enforcement by increasing the deployment of speed monitoring systems, but it does not introduce new technologies or innovative methods beyond existing speed monitoring practices.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily concerns traffic enforcement infrastructure.

Title: Family Law - Permanent Protective Orders - Consent
Synopsis: Specifying that an individual may consent to the issuance of a permanent protective order against the individual.
bill_summary: This bill specifies that an individual can consent to the issuance of a permanent protective order against themselves, under certain conditions, including if they have served at least 12 months of a prison sentence for abuse or if they consent to the order.
responsible_party: Maryland Judiciary
stakeholders: Individuals involved in protective orders, victims of abuse, and the legal system in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new legal provision allowing individuals to consent to permanent protective orders against themselves, which is a novel approach in family law.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty or include programs aimed at reducing it.

Title: Public Health Abortion Grant Program - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Public Health Abortion Grant Program to provide grants to improve access to abortion care clinical services for individuals in the State; establishing the Public Health Abortion Grant Program Fund as a special, nonlapsing fund to provide grants under the Program; and requiring that certain premium funds collected by health insurance carriers be used to provide certain coverage and to support improving access to abortion care clinical services under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Public Health Abortion Grant Program and Fund to provide grants to organizations that improve access to abortion care services in Maryland. It also mandates that certain health insurance premium funds be used to support abortion care services, especially for individuals with insufficient resources.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and the Maryland Insurance Administration
stakeholders: Individuals seeking abortion care, healthcare organizations providing abortion services, uninsured and underinsured individuals in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a new approach by creating a dedicated grant fund to support abortion access and mandates the use of insurance premium funds for abortion services, integrating healthcare access with insurance regulation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to directly impact child poverty by improving access to reproductive health services for low-resource individuals, thereby supporting economic stability.

Title: Public Ethics - Conflicts of Interest and Blind Trust - Governor
Synopsis: Requiring the Governor to place certain interests into a certain certified blind trust or divest of certain interests within 6 months after taking the oath of office; requiring the Governor to enter into a nonparticipation agreement with the State Ethics Commission for any interests not included in a blind trust; authorizing the Ethics Commission to impose a fine of up to $5,000 for each violation of the Act; requiring the Commission to adopt regulations to carry out the Act including standards for types of interests that be exempted; etc.
bill_summary: This bill establishes new rules for the Governor of Maryland regarding conflicts of interest, including the requirement to place certain interests into a blind trust or divest of them, and mandates reporting of interests in businesses seeking state contracts. It also updates regulations related to ethics, employment, and financial interests of state officials.
responsible_party: Maryland State Ethics Commission
stakeholders: Governor, Maryland state officials, entities seeking state contracts, and the general public
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach to conflict of interest management by mandating blind trusts, detailed reporting, and regulatory updates, integrating transparency and accountability measures.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on ethics and conflict of interest rules for officials.

Title: Nursing Homes - Cost Reports
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health to review the cost reports and other data submitted by each nursing home that participates in the Maryland Medical Assistance Program; and requiring the Department to report the findings resulting from the review conducted under the Act to the Governor and certain committees of the General Assembly by October 1, 2025, and each October 1 thereafter through 2029.
bill_summary: The bill requires nursing homes in Maryland to spend at least 75% of their total revenue from nursing and residential care on direct care wages and benefits. It also mandates annual submission of cost reports by nursing homes to the Maryland Department of Health, which will review the data related to wages, revenues, and other costs, and report findings to the governor and legislative committees.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Nursing home residents, nursing home staff, and the Maryland Medical Assistance Program
innovative_summary: The program employs data collection and analysis to ensure compliance with wage expenditure requirements and to monitor costs and revenues in nursing homes, using annual reporting and oversight.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has the potential to improve wages and benefits for direct care staff, which could positively impact child poverty indirectly through improved economic stability of families.

Title: Health Insurance - Cancellation and Nonrenewal of Coverage - Required Notice
Synopsis: Requiring that a carrier provide notice by certain electronic means, in addition to written notice, of cancellation or nonrenewal of a small group market health benefit plan and include information regarding additional health benefit coverage options in the notice; and applying the Act to all policies, contracts, and health benefit plans issued, delivered, or renewed in the State on or after January 1, 2026.
bill_summary: This bill requires health insurance carriers in Maryland to provide electronic notices, in addition to written notices, to small group market health plan enrollees about cancellations or nonrenewals. It also mandates that these notices include information about additional coverage options, such as COBRA and plans through the Maryland Health Benefit Exchange.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Insurance
stakeholders: Small group health insurance enrollees and small employers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs electronic communication methods to improve notification processes for health insurance cancellations and nonrenewals, enhancing transparency and accessibility.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by ensuring families are better informed about health coverage options during insurance changes.

Title: Continuing Care Providers - Governing Bodies - Membership
Synopsis: Requiring the appointment of an alternate subscriber member to the governing body of a continuing care provider; and authorizing the alternate subscriber member to attend all meetings of the governing body and vote only if the regular subscriber is unable to fulfill the subscriber's duties as a regular member of the governing body.
bill_summary: This bill requires the appointment of an alternate subscriber member to the governing body of a continuing care provider, outlining their duties and the process for their appointment, to ensure subscriber representation and participation.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Human Services or the governing bodies of continuing care providers
stakeholders: Subscribers of continuing care providers, residents of facilities, and the providers themselves
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a formal requirement for alternate subscriber members on governing bodies, enhancing subscriber participation and oversight.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly focuses on governance of care providers for adults.

Title: Maryland Commission for Women - Maryland Collaborative to Advance Implementation of Coverage of Over-the-Counter Birth Control
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Commission for Women to establish the Maryland Collaborative to Advance Implementation of Coverage of Over-the-Counter Birth Control to study access to over-the-counter birth control; and requiring the Collaborative to submit an interim report by January 1, 2026, and a final report of its findings and recommendations to the Governor and General Assembly by December 1, 2027.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Collaborative to Advance Implementation of Coverage of Over-the-Counter Birth Control, a group tasked with studying and making recommendations to improve access to over-the-counter birth control in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Commission for Women in the Department of Human Services
stakeholders: Individuals seeking access to over-the-counter birth control, healthcare providers, pharmacies, insurers, and community organizations in Maryland.
innovative_summary: The program employs a collaborative approach involving multiple stakeholders, including consumer organizations, industry, and government, to study and improve access to over-the-counter birth control, incorporating recent federal policy developments.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to reduce child poverty by increasing access to reproductive health services, which can lead to better health and economic outcomes for families.

Title: Criminal Law - Crimes of Malicious or Fraudulent Burning - Prohibitions and Penalties
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from committing a certain crime of malicious or fraudulent burning that causes the death of or serious physical injury to a firefighter; and establishing that a person who violates the Act is guilty of a felony and on conviction is subject to imprisonment not to exceed 10 years.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits individuals from committing malicious or fraudulent burning crimes that result in the death or serious injury of a firefighter, establishing it as a felony with penalties up to 10 years in prison.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Firefighters, criminal justice system, general public
innovative_summary: The bill introduces specific legal protections and penalties for crimes of arson that harm firefighters, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it primarily addresses criminal penalties for arson crimes.

Title: Election Law - Gubernatorial Primary Election - Date
Synopsis: Altering, from the last Tuesday in June to the fourth Tuesday in June, the date for the primary election in the year of the gubernatorial election.
bill_summary: This bill changes the date of the statewide primary election in Maryland for gubernatorial election years from the last Tuesday in June to the fourth Tuesday in June, starting in 2025.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Voters and candidates participating in Maryland's primary elections
innovative_summary: The bill primarily modifies election dates, which is a procedural change rather than an innovative program or service.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty, as it pertains to election scheduling.

Title: Tax Sales - Homeowner Protection Program - Funding and Alterations
Synopsis: Requiring each collector of taxes that maintains a website to include on the collector's website certain information and a certain link relating to the Homeowner Protection Program; altering the information the State Department of Assessments and Taxation is required to obtain and include in a certain annual report regarding tax sales; requiring the State Tax Sale Ombudsman to take certain actions to maximize enrollment in the Homeowner Protection Program; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Homeowner Protection Program in Maryland, which aims to help vulnerable homeowners avoid tax sales and remain in their homes. It details funding sources, program administration, and requirements for local governments and tax collectors to support the program.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation and the State Tax Sale Ombudsman
stakeholders: Homeowners at risk of tax sale, local governments, and the Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation
innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive approach including a dedicated fund, voluntary donations, and active outreach and screening to maximize enrollment and support vulnerable homeowners.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to directly impact child poverty by helping vulnerable homeowners, including low-income and elderly residents, stay in their homes.

Title: Consumer Protection - Workgroup on Artificial Intelligence Implementation
Synopsis: Establishing the Workgroup on Artificial Intelligence Implementation; requiring the Workgroup to monitor and make recommendations related to the regulation of artificial intelligence, consumer protection, current private sector use of artificial intelligence, enforcement authority for the Office of the Attorney General's Office of Consumer Protection, and impact in the determination of government benefits; and requiring the Workgroup to make its recommendations to certain committees of the General Assembly by July 1, 2026.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Workgroup on Artificial Intelligence Implementation in Maryland to monitor issues related to AI and consumer protection, and to make recommendations. It includes members from various sectors and agencies, and reports annually.
responsible_party: Department of the University of Maryland Center for Health and Homeland Security
stakeholders: Consumers, AI developers, industry sectors, government agencies, and civil rights organizations in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill creates a dedicated government workgroup to oversee and regulate artificial intelligence applications, fostering a coordinated approach to AI governance.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to impact child poverty indirectly through regulation of AI that affects employment, privacy, and access to services.

Title: Public Health - Pediatric Hospital Overstay Patients and Workgroup on Children in Unlicensed Settings and Pediatric Overstays
Synopsis: Specifying that the scope of the Maryland Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Registry and Referral System includes private and State inpatient and outpatient mental health and substance use services; requiring the Maryland Department of Health and the Department of Human Services, under certain circumstances, to ensure pediatric hospital overstay patients are placed in the least restrictive setting when clinically indicated and when possible; etc.
bill_summary: This bill addresses pediatric hospital overstays and children in unlicensed settings by establishing protocols for placement, creating coordinators within relevant departments, and forming workgroups to assess needs and develop plans to reduce unlicensed placements.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and Department of Human Services
stakeholders: Children in hospitals, children in unlicensed settings, families, healthcare providers, state agencies
innovative_summary: The bill employs coordinated data sharing, dedicated coordinators, and a comprehensive workgroup approach to address pediatric overstays and unlicensed placements, integrating multiple agencies and data systems.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child hospital overstays and unlicensed placements, which can improve health and stability for vulnerable children, thus potentially reducing child poverty impacts.

Title: Montgomery County - Task Force on the Displacement of Residents of Emory Grove MC 5-25
Synopsis: Establishing the Task Force on the Displacement of Residents of Emory Grove to study how urban renewal caused the displacement of residents from the Emory Grove community and make recommendations on potential remedies to those who were displaced by urban renewal; requiring the Task Force to submit an interim report by December 15, 2025, and a final report of its findings and recommendations to the Montgomery County Council, the Montgomery County Executive, the Montgomery County Delegation, and the General Assembly by December 15, 2026.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a Task Force on the Displacement of Residents of Emory Grove to study how urban renewal from 1960 to 1985 caused displacement and to recommend remedies for those displaced.
responsible_party: Montgomery County Office of Human Rights
stakeholders: Residents displaced from Emory Grove community, landowners, local government, and community organizations involved in urban renewal
innovative_summary: The program employs a historical analysis and community engagement approach to address past urban renewal impacts and recommend remedies, which is a relatively innovative approach to urban displacement issues.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to impact child poverty by addressing displacement issues that may affect housing stability and community well-being.

Title: Somerset County Code of Public Local Laws - 2025 Edition - Legalization
Synopsis: Legalizing the 2025 Edition of the Somerset County Code of Public Local Laws and any supplement to the extent to which that code or supplement contains laws enacted by the General Assembly.
bill_summary: This bill legalizes the 2025 Edition of the Somerset County Code of Public Local Laws and any supplements, making them official legal references within Maryland.
responsible_party: Somerset County government
stakeholders: Residents and officials of Somerset County and Maryland legal system
innovative_summary: The bill primarily formalizes existing local laws into the state's legal framework without introducing new programs or technologies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Business Regulation – Licensing – Definition of Storage Warehouse
Synopsis: Altering, with respect to business licensing requirements in the State, the definition of "storage warehouse" to exclude a self-service storage facility.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland's business licensing law to define 'storage warehouse' as a building used for keeping goods for a fee, excluding self-service storage facilities, and requires a license for such storage warehouses.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Business Regulation
stakeholders: Storage warehouse operators and businesses that store goods for a fee in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill clarifies licensing requirements for storage warehouses and excludes self-service storage facilities from the definition, streamlining regulation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty as it primarily concerns business licensing regulations.

Title: Property Tax - Payment in Lieu of Taxes Agreements - Broadband Service Providers
Synopsis: Authorizing the governing body of a county to enter into a payment in lieu of taxes agreement with a provider of broadband service located in the county for property located in the county and owned by the provider; and applying the Act to all taxable years beginning after June 30, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill allows Maryland counties to enter into agreements with broadband service providers for negotiated payments in lieu of property taxes, and it modifies how the valuation of broadband provider property is determined for tax purposes, including considerations for rural broadband providers.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Assessments and Taxation
stakeholders: Broadband service providers, county governments, residents in rural and broadband-developing areas
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new approach for counties to negotiate payments with broadband providers and adjusts valuation methods to support rural broadband development, employing innovative tax and valuation strategies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve broadband access, which can contribute to economic development and reduce child poverty in underserved areas.

Title: Health Insurance - Insulin - Prohibition on Step Therapy or Fail-First Protocols
Synopsis: Prohibiting certain insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations from imposing a step therapy or fail-first protocol for insulin or an insulin analog used to treat an insured's or enrollee's Type 1, Type 2, or gestational diabetes; and applying the Act to all policies, contracts, and health benefit plans issued, delivered, or renewed in the State on or after January 1, 2026.
bill_summary: This bill prohibits certain health insurers and plans from imposing step therapy or fail-first protocols on insulin or insulin analogs used to treat diabetes, with some exceptions for advanced metastatic cancer treatments.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health or Insurance Department (not explicitly specified)
stakeholders: People with diabetes insured by Maryland health plans
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a specific exemption for insulin and insulin analogs from step therapy protocols, which is a targeted policy change rather than a new technological approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly affects insurance protocols for diabetes treatment.

Title: Anne Arundel County Crownsville Hospital Memorial Park Advisory Committee
Synopsis: Establishing the Anne Arundel County Crownsville Hospital Memorial Park Advisory Committee to provide advice on the planning of the Park; requiring the Advisory Committee to make recommendations to ensure that the Park focuses on mental and physical health and well-being, is equitable in providing access to the property, is truthful about the history of Crownsville Hospital, and preserves the natural beauty of the site; and requiring the Committee to report its achievements and recommendations to certain entities by February 1 each year.
bill_summary: This bill establishes the Anne Arundel County Crownsville Hospital Memorial Park Advisory Committee to advise on planning and development of the memorial park, including community involvement, cultural history, health, recreation, infrastructure, and educational opportunities.
responsible_party: Anne Arundel County government
stakeholders: Residents of Anne Arundel County, local community, cultural and historical organizations, health and wellness groups, educational institutions
innovative_summary: The program employs a community advisory approach with a focus on cultural, historical, health, and educational integration, emphasizing community input and holistic development.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve community well-being and access to green spaces, which can indirectly benefit children, but it is not specifically targeted at child poverty.

Title: Real Estate Commission - Continuing Education Requirements - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering certain requirements for continuing education required for the renewal of a license for real estate brokers, associate real estate brokers, and real estate salespersons, including the number of clock hours, course topics, course instructors, and course application fees.
bill_summary: This bill amends the continuing education requirements for real estate license renewal in Maryland, including the number of hours, course topics, and instructor qualifications, effective October 1, 2025.
responsible_party: Maryland Real Estate Commission
stakeholders: Real estate licensees in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates existing education requirements and incorporates provisions for virtual courses, but does not establish a new distinct service or program.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty or include specific measures targeting it.

Title: Health Insurance - Preventive Services - High Deductible Health Plans and Enforcement Authority
Synopsis: Clarifying the application of certain health insurance preventive services coverage requirements to certain high deductible health plans; and requiring the Insurance Commissioner to enforce certain provisions of law related to preventive services consistent with the recommendations and guidelines set by certain federal agencies in effect on December 31, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies the application of health insurance preventive services coverage requirements to high deductible health plans in Maryland. It mandates enforcement of these provisions consistent with federal guidelines and recommendations, and allows the Maryland Insurance Commissioner to adopt regulations to expand preventive coverage.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Commissioner
stakeholders: Health insurance policyholders in Maryland, especially those with high deductible health plans
innovative_summary: The bill employs a regulatory approach to align state insurance coverage with evolving federal guidelines for preventive services, ensuring flexibility and future expansion.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to impact child poverty by increasing access to preventive health services, which can improve overall health outcomes.

Title: Maryland Self-Service Storage Act - Sale of Personal Property in Satisfaction of Lien - Notice Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring a certain operator of a certain self-service storage facility to notify at least 10 days prior to conducting a sale of an occupant's personal property stored in certain leased space at the self-service storage facility of the time, place, and terms of the sale by hand delivery, verified mail, or electronic mail at the occupant's last known address.
bill_summary: This bill updates Maryland law regarding the sale of personal property stored in self-service storage facilities, specifically requiring operators to notify occupants of default and sale details through specified methods and timelines.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Commerce or relevant self-service storage regulatory authority
stakeholders: Self-service storage facility operators and occupants in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces specific notification requirements and timelines for notices and sales, including electronic communication methods, which modernize and clarify the process.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on legal procedures for storage lien enforcement.

Title: Election Law - Local Boards of Elections - Language Assistance Program
Synopsis: Establishing the Language Assistance Program; requiring a local board of elections to participate in the Program if the State Board determines that there is a significant need for language assistance to voters in the county in a language other than English; requiring the State Board to designate, not later than February 1 of the year of the election, certain languages other than English in which a local board that is required to participate in the Program must provide assistance to voters; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Language Assistance Program for voters in Maryland, requiring local election boards to provide language support and materials in designated languages based on community needs, and sets procedures for designating languages and enforcing compliance.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Voters with limited English proficiency in Maryland, election officials, and community organizations
innovative_summary: The program employs technology such as video conference translation and online materials, and establishes a structured process for language designation and assistance, representing a modern approach to language accessibility in elections.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve voting access for non-English speaking communities, which can contribute to reducing barriers faced by low-income and minority populations, including children in these communities.

Title: Public Utilities - Electric Cooperatives - Rate Proceedings
