Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Behavioral Health Crisis Response System to have a State 9-8-8 Suicide and Crisis Lifeline, rather than a crisis communication center, in each jurisdiction; requiring each State 9-8-8 Suicide and Crisis Lifeline in the System to coordinate with the national 9-8-8 Suicide and Crisis Lifeline Network to provide supportive counseling, suicide prevention, crisis intervention, referrals to additional resources, and direct dispatch to other services as needed; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Maryland Behavioral Health Crisis Response System that includes a State 9-8-8 Suicide and Crisis Lifeline in each jurisdiction, coordinating with the national 9-8-8 network to provide comprehensive crisis services, support, and outcome evaluations.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals experiencing mental health crises and their families in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a coordinated 9-8-8 crisis lifeline integrated with national services, comprehensive outcome evaluations, and community-based crisis interventions, representing a modern, technology-enabled approach to crisis response.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to impact child poverty by providing accessible mental health crisis services, reducing emergency and hospitalization costs, and supporting families in crisis.

Title: Residential Condominium Unit Insurance - Lapses in Coverage - Prohibition on Denial
Synopsis: Prohibiting an insurer, with respect to residential condominium unit insurance, from refusing to issue a policy based solely on a prior lapse in coverage of the applicant if the lapse was due to an insurer's withdrawal from the market, the lapse in coverage was for no longer than 90 days, the applicant provides an affidavit that the applicant has not incurred any losses during the lapse in coverage, and the applicant provides any other documentation required by the insurer.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits property and casualty insurers from denying coverage for homeowner's or renter's residential condominium unit insurance solely due to a prior lapse in coverage, under certain conditions. It also allows insurers to require an affidavit from applicants regarding the lapse.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Insurance
stakeholders: Homeowners, renters, and condominium unit owners in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces protections against denial of coverage based solely on past lapses, with specific conditions and documentation requirements, which is a targeted regulatory change rather than a new technological approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly affects insurance coverage rules for adults and property owners.

Title: Real Property - Residential Rental Property - Pet Policy Disclosure (Pet Policy Transparency Act)
Synopsis: Requiring the landlord of a residential rental property to provide the property's pet policy on the property's website and as part of an application form for a rental unit on the property.
bill_summary: The bill requires landlords of residential rental properties in Maryland to disclose their pet policies on their websites, in digital advertisements, and in rental applications. It also mandates landlords to provide specific pet policy details to prospective tenants.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Housing and Community Development or relevant local housing authorities
stakeholders: Residential tenants and landlords in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a digital transparency approach by requiring landlords to publish pet policies online and in advertisements, enhancing accessibility and clarity for prospective tenants.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily focuses on pet policy transparency for tenants.

Title: Department of the Environment - Definition of Ecological Restoration
Synopsis: Defining the term "ecological restoration" as an activity undertaken with the goal of recovering, re-establishing, or enhancing a degraded, damaged, or destroyed ecosystem through improvements to physical, chemical, or biological characteristics or processes, returning natural or historical functions or services, or protecting or improving resiliency.
bill_summary: This bill defines 'ecological restoration' as activities aimed at recovering, re-establishing, or enhancing ecosystems that are degraded, damaged, or destroyed. It requires the Maryland Department of the Environment to update relevant regulations to incorporate this definition.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Ecosystems, environmental agencies, conservation groups, and the general public interested in ecological health and restoration
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a formal definition of ecological restoration and mandates regulatory updates to support ecological recovery efforts, which is a strategic approach to environmental management.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing primarily on ecological and environmental regulation.

Title: Heating, Ventilation, Air-Conditioning, or Refrigeration Contractors - Equipment Sales
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from knowingly offering to sell or selling heating, ventilation, air-conditioning, or refrigeration equipment to an individual that does not hold a certain license issued by the Board of Heating, Ventilation, Air-Conditioning, or Refrigeration Contractors except under certain circumstances; requiring certain persons to provide a certain notice to purchasers of heating, ventilation, air-conditioning, or refrigeration equipment at the time of sale; etc.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits the sale of HVAC and refrigeration equipment to unlicensed individuals unless certain conditions are met, requires sellers to collect and report information about buyers' licenses, and establishes penalties for violations. It also clarifies licensing exemptions and responsibilities of the State Board of Heating, Ventilation, Air-Conditioning, and Refrigeration Contractors.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Heating, Ventilation, Air-Conditioning, and Refrigeration Contractors
stakeholders: HVAC and refrigeration equipment sellers, licensed contractors, and consumers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a new approach by requiring sellers to verify and report the licensing status of buyers, enhancing oversight and compliance in the HVAC and refrigeration industry.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on industry regulation and compliance.

Title: Montgomery County - Municipal Authority to Regulate Structures - Alterations MC/PG 116-25
Synopsis: Altering the authority of a municipal corporation or governed special taxing district in Montgomery County to adopt an additional or stricter building requirement than is required by a State, regional, or county unit to regulate the construction, repair, or remodeling of certain structures on land zoned for single-family residential use to apply to buildings with four or fewer dwelling units and their accessory structures without regard to the zoning for the land where the building is located.
bill_summary: The bill grants Montgomery County the authority to regulate certain residential structures, specifically buildings with four or fewer units, without regard to zoning, and establishes rules for adopting building requirements, public hearings, and waivers.
responsible_party: Montgomery County government
stakeholders: Residents and property owners in Montgomery County, especially those involved with small residential buildings
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a localized authority for Montgomery County to set building standards for small residential structures, including provisions for public input and waivers, which is a tailored approach to local land use regulation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on local building regulations for small residential structures may indirectly impact affordable housing and community stability, but it does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Corporations and Associations – Revisions
Synopsis: Establishing a process for and certain exceptions to the transfer of assets that are collateral for securing a mortgage, pledge, or security interest without the approval of the stockholders; and repealing provisions of law specifying what shall be included in the articles of merger if a limited partnership or limited liability company is a party to the articles.
bill_summary: The bill revises laws related to corporations and associations in Maryland, including establishing a process for transferring assets secured by collateral without requiring stockholder approval, and making amendments to rules about mergers, asset transfers, and corporate governance.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Commerce or relevant corporate regulatory agency
stakeholders: Maryland corporations, limited liability companies, partnerships, and their stakeholders
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a streamlined process for asset transfers secured by collateral, reducing the need for stockholder approval, which is a significant change in corporate governance procedures.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty or include programs aimed at reducing it.

Title: Baltimore City – Alcoholic Beverages – Authorizations and Revisions
Synopsis: Requiring the Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore City to impose a fee of not more than $250 for expedited processing of certain Class C per diem licenses; requiring the Board to adopt regulations related to the application process for Class C per diem licenses, including for the denial or revocation of the licenses, and limiting the number of licenses that may be issued to a person for the same location within a certain period of time; etc.
bill_summary: The bill makes various revisions to alcohol licensing laws in Baltimore City, including establishing fees for expedited license processing, setting regulations for license applications, and authorizing specific new licenses in certain districts with conditions.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Baltimore City
stakeholders: Alcohol license applicants, Baltimore City residents, local businesses, and community organizations in Baltimore City
innovative_summary: The bill introduces specific licensing conditions and memorandums of understanding with community organizations, but does not employ new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on alcohol licensing in Baltimore City does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Montgomery County - Speed Monitoring Systems - High-Risk Highways MC 17-25
Synopsis: Authorizing the placement and use of speed monitoring systems on highways in Montgomery County that are at high risk for certain motor vehicle crashes; prohibiting the placement and use of speed monitoring systems on certain highways in Montgomery County; requiring the fines collected by Montgomery County or by a municipal government in Montgomery County as a result of violations enforced by a speed monitoring system to be used to fund the study, design, and construction of certain safety-related projects; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the use of speed monitoring systems on high-risk highways in Montgomery County, prohibits their use on certain other highways, and directs fines collected from violations to fund safety projects. It also mandates evaluations of the systems' effectiveness.
responsible_party: Montgomery County Department of Transportation or relevant municipal agencies
stakeholders: Residents and drivers in Montgomery County, especially those on high-risk highways
innovative_summary: The bill employs data-driven evaluation and targeted safety funding, integrating technology with strategic safety planning.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program's focus on traffic safety and infrastructure may indirectly benefit communities, but it does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Montgomery County - Alcoholic Beverages - Class BD-BWL Licenses - Multiple Licenses MC 18-25
Synopsis: Increasing to two the number of Class BD-BWL alcoholic beverages licenses in Montgomery County that the same person may hold; and specifying that the establishment for which a second class BD-BWL license is issued shall have average daily receipts from the sale of food that exceed the average daily receipts from the sale of alcoholic beverages.
bill_summary: The bill increases the number of Class BD–BWL alcoholic beverage licenses that a single person can hold in Montgomery County, specifies conditions for second licenses including sales receipts requirements, and clarifies licensing rules and fees.
responsible_party: Montgomery County Alcoholic Beverages Board
stakeholders: Alcoholic beverage license holders, businesses in Montgomery County, consumers
innovative_summary: The bill primarily modifies licensing rules and limits, with no new technology or innovative approach introduced.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Family Law - Child Custody - Determinations
Synopsis: Authorizing the court, in determining legal and physical custody in certain child custody proceedings, to consider certain factors; and authorizing the court to modify a child custody or visitation order if the court determines that there has been a material change in circumstances since the issuance of the order that related to the needs of the child or the ability of the parents to meet those needs and that modifying the order is in the best interests of the child.
bill_summary: The bill updates Maryland laws regarding child custody and visitation, allowing courts to consider specific factors when determining custody arrangements, and clarifies circumstances under which custody or visitation orders can be modified, especially in cases involving abuse or significant changes in circumstances.
responsible_party: Maryland Judiciary or Family Court system
stakeholders: Children and their parents involved in custody and visitation disputes
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive list of factors for courts to consider in custody decisions, emphasizing the child's best interests and safety, but does not introduce new technologies or novel approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill primarily focuses on legal procedures and considerations in custody cases, with limited direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Housing Development Permits - Local Reporting Requirements (Maryland Housing Data Transparency Act)
Synopsis: Requiring certain counties to report information quarterly about certain housing development permits to the Department of Planning beginning January 1, 2027; authorizing municipalities to make certain quarterly reports to the Department regarding housing development permits issued by the municipality, beginning January 1, 2027; and requiring the Department of Planning to make certain permit information available on a public, interactive, and searchable website; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland counties with at least 150,000 residents to report quarterly on housing development permits, including detailed data on residential projects, to the Department of Planning. Municipalities may also report similar data. The Department will publish this data publicly to improve transparency and data access regarding housing development.
responsible_party: Department of Planning
stakeholders: Housing developers, local governments, residents, and policymakers interested in housing development data
innovative_summary: The bill employs a data transparency approach by requiring detailed, publicly accessible reports on housing permits, enhancing government transparency and data-driven decision-making.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to impact child poverty by increasing transparency and potentially facilitating more equitable housing development.

Title: Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission - Membership, Reporting, Billing, and Planning (WSSC Planning and Reporting Act of 2025) MC/PG 105-25
Synopsis: Requiring one of the three commissioners from Montgomery County on the Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission to be the Director of the Montgomery County Department of Environmental Protection or a designee; requiring the Commission to submit a long range comprehensive financial plan in a certain manner; requiring the budget authorization for the Office of the Inspector General of the Commission to be approved independently and without involvement of Commission staff; etc.
bill_summary: The bill makes various reforms and requirements for the Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission (WSSC), including changes to its membership, financial planning, transparency, customer engagement, and oversight. It also establishes reporting, planning, and evaluation processes to improve the agency's efficiency, sustainability, and accountability.
responsible_party: Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission (WSSC) and related Maryland state agencies
stakeholders: Residents and customers of Montgomery County and Prince George’s County, Maryland, and the WSSC
innovative_summary: The bill employs new approaches such as long-range financial planning scenarios, independent peer reviews, and a publicly accessible searchable website for transparency and accountability.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but may indirectly benefit residents through improved utility services and transparency.

Title: Property Tax - Credit for Law Enforcement Officer or Rescue Worker - Expansion to Judicial Officer
Synopsis: Authorizing the governing body of a county or municipal corporation or the Mayor and City Council of Baltimore City to provide a certain property tax credit to certain judicial officers, surviving spouses, or cohabitants; requiring the county or municipal corporation to define, by law, who is a correctional officer and judicial officer; and applying the Act retroactively to all taxable years beginning after June 30, 2022.
bill_summary: The bill expands property tax credits to include judicial officers, their surviving spouses, or cohabitants, and allows local governments to define and implement these credits.
responsible_party: Local governments (counties and municipal corporations) in Maryland
stakeholders: Judicial officers, their surviving spouses, cohabitants, and local government tax authorities
innovative_summary: The program introduces a property tax credit specifically for judicial officers and their families, which is a targeted approach to support public safety and judicial personnel.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily provides property tax relief to specific groups.

Title: Public and Nonpublic Schools - Student Elopement - Notice and Reporting Requirements (Ace's Law)
Synopsis: Requiring certain public and nonpublic schools to notify a parent or guardian if a student attempts or accomplishes an elopement, the act of leaving the school campus without permission; requiring certain schools and individualized education program teams to review and address with relevant stakeholders certain behavior in updating a student's individualized education program or behavior intervention plan; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires public and nonpublic schools in Maryland to notify parents or guardians within 24 hours if a student attempts or successfully elopes from the school campus. It establishes reporting requirements, review processes for students with behavioral plans, and creates an accountability system for schools to track and reduce elopement incidents.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education
stakeholders: Students, parents, schools, and school districts in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive data collection, reporting, and accountability system to address student elopement, integrating behavioral intervention reviews and trend analysis.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has the potential to improve student safety and behavioral support, which can contribute to reducing barriers to learning and well-being, indirectly impacting child poverty.

Title: Montgomery County - Board of Education - Student Member Compensation MC 7-25
Synopsis: Altering the compensation of the student member of the Montgomery County Board of Education.
bill_summary: The bill increases the compensation for the student member of the Montgomery County Board of Education, with specific salary amounts set for 2025 and 2026, and provides a scholarship and stipend program for student members based on the elected member compensation.
responsible_party: Montgomery County Board of Education
stakeholders: Student members of the Montgomery County Board of Education and their higher education costs
innovative_summary: The bill employs a structured stipend and scholarship program linked to elected member compensation, which is a somewhat innovative approach to compensating student representatives.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly provides compensation and educational support to student board members.

Title: Child Abuse and Neglect - Reports and Records - Disclosure
Synopsis: Requiring a local director of a local department of social services or the Secretary of Human Services to disclose certain reports and records of child abuse and neglect within 30 days after receiving a request if certain conditions are met; requiring the Secretary to notify the State's Attorney's office of a request to disclose certain reports and records of child abuse and neglect; requiring the State's Attorney's office to be given 30 days during which the office is authorized to redact certain portions of the reports and records; etc.
bill_summary: This bill revises the procedures for disclosing reports and records of child abuse and neglect in Maryland, including notification requirements and limitations on what information can be disclosed.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Human Services
stakeholders: Children and families involved in child abuse and neglect cases, child protective services, legal authorities
innovative_summary: The bill introduces specific protocols for disclosure of child abuse records, including notification and redaction processes, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus is on child abuse record disclosure procedures, which may indirectly impact child welfare but does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Public Safety - Immigration Enforcement (Maryland Values Act)
Synopsis: Requiring federal law enforcement officers to notify certain individuals of federal immigration action at certain sensitive locations; prohibiting certain schools, libraries, and units of State or local government that operate at certain sensitive locations from allowing certain federal personnel access to areas not accessible to the general public, subject to certain exceptions; requiring the Attorney General to develop and publish certain guidance regarding immigration enforcement actions at certain sensitive locations; etc.
bill_summary: This bill enhances protections against immigration enforcement actions at sensitive locations, restricts agreements related to immigration enforcement, and establishes policies for government and private entities to safeguard personal records and geolocation data, while also requiring notification and transfer procedures for certain individuals involved in immigration detainers.
responsible_party: Attorney General of Maryland and relevant state and local government agencies
stakeholders: Immigrants, public schools, libraries, healthcare facilities, and government agencies in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach combining legal restrictions, policy development, and data privacy protections, including guidance development and mandatory policy implementation, which is a relatively innovative approach to immigration enforcement and data privacy.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing more on immigration enforcement policies and data privacy protections.

Title: State Board of Cosmetologists - Licensing - Eyelash Extensions
Synopsis: Authorizing the State Board of Cosmetology to issue a limited license to provide eyelash extension services; altering the definition of "provide esthetic services" to include providing eyelash extension services; and requiring an applicant for a limited license to provide eyelash extension services to be at least 17 years old, have successfully completed a 9th grade education or equivalent, received certain training, and passed a practical and written examination.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland State Board of Cosmetologists to issue a limited license for providing eyelash extension services, expands the definition of esthetic services to include eyelash extensions, and establishes licensing, training, and operational regulations for eyelash extension technicians and related establishments.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Cosmetologists
stakeholders: Eyelash extension technicians, cosmetologists, estheticians, beauty salons, and consumers receiving eyelash extension services
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a specialized licensing pathway for eyelash extension services, including specific training and operational standards, representing a targeted approach to regulating a new beauty service.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily focuses on licensing and regulation of eyelash extension services.

Title: Montgomery County - School Bus Stops on Highways - Alterations MC 8-25
Synopsis: Applying certain provisions of law regarding school bus stops located on certain highways in Montgomery County to a school bus stop at a location for which at least 400 citations were issued in the preceding fiscal year to drivers traveling in the opposite direction of the bus stop; and prohibiting, beginning on December 31, 2028, locating a school bus stop on any highway with five or more undivided traffic lanes, except under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill modifies how traffic fines collected in Montgomery County are paid and used, directs that fines from certain traffic violations be paid directly to Montgomery County or the District Court, and allocates the funds for specific safety projects like constructing median dividers. It also sets new rules for school bus stops on highways in Montgomery County, including requirements for posting crossing guards or traffic control devices at bus stops on highways with five or more lanes.
responsible_party: Montgomery County Department of Transportation and the Maryland State Highway Administration
stakeholders: Residents and drivers in Montgomery County, school children, and transportation safety agencies
innovative_summary: The bill employs a targeted approach to traffic safety funding and integrates technology-based enforcement with specific allocation of fines for infrastructure improvements, which is moderately innovative.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on traffic safety and school bus stop safety measures can indirectly benefit children, but it does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Department of Commerce - Montgomery County Agricultural Reserve Study MC 15-25
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Commerce, in coordination with certain county agencies and organizations, to study economic development in and the tourist and visitor economy of the Montgomery County Agricultural Reserve and, on or before June 30, 2026, report its findings to the members of the Montgomery County Delegation to the General Assembly; and requiring the Department to make recommendations regarding policies and programs that can help promote and preserve the Montgomery County Agricultural Reserve.
bill_summary: This bill requires the Maryland Department of Commerce, in coordination with Montgomery County agencies and organizations, to study the economic development and tourism impact of the Montgomery County Agricultural Reserve. The study aims to understand visitor perceptions, identify key attractions, analyze how tourism supports local businesses and sites, and develop policies to promote and preserve the reserve. The department must report its findings by June 30, 2026.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Commerce in coordination with Montgomery County agencies and organizations
stakeholders: Small businesses, recreation sites, historic sites, and visitors in the Montgomery County Agricultural Reserve
innovative_summary: The program employs geolocation technology and data analysis to understand visitor behavior and economic impact, which is a modern approach to tourism and economic development planning.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by supporting local economic development and tourism, which can create jobs and economic opportunities.

Title: Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission - System Development Charge - Exemptions MC/PG 107-25
Synopsis: Requiring, rather than authorizing, the Montgomery County Council and the Prince George's County Council to grant exemptions from the system development charge imposed by the Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission for certain properties and projects located in Montgomery County; limiting the exemption to $80,000; altering the method by which the county councils establish eligibility for the exemptions; prohibiting the county councils from requiring that an applicant for an exemption own the property for which the exemption is sought; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Montgomery County and Prince George's County Councils to grant exemptions from the system development charge imposed by the Washington Suburban Sanitary Commission for certain properties and projects, with specific eligibility criteria and reporting requirements.
responsible_party: Montgomery County Council and Prince George's County Council
stakeholders: Property owners and developers in Montgomery County and Prince George's County, especially those involved in revitalization, community organizations, child care, and developmentally disabled programs.
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured exemption process for certain properties, with annual reporting and first-come, first-served approval, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to impact child poverty by supporting community organizations and services for youth and developmentally disabled individuals.

Title: Queen Anne's County - Municipalities - Speed Limits
Synopsis: Authorizing municipalities in Queen Anne's County to decrease the maximum speed limit to not less than 15 miles per hour on highways without performing an engineering and traffic investigation.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes municipalities in Queen Anne's County to lower speed limits on highways to not less than 15 miles per hour without conducting an engineering and traffic investigation.
responsible_party: Municipalities in Queen Anne's County
stakeholders: Residents and travelers in Queen Anne's County
innovative_summary: The bill allows local municipalities to set lower speed limits without the usual engineering investigation, streamlining local traffic safety measures.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily affecting traffic regulations.

Title: Somerset County - Alcoholic Beverages - Liquor Tasting License
Synopsis: Establishing a liquor tasting license in Somerset County; authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Somerset County to issue the license to the holder of a Class A beer, wine, and liquor license; and establishing liquor tasting license fees.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a liquor tasting license in Somerset County, allowing holders of Class A beer, wine, and liquor licenses to permit tasting events where consumers can sample liquor without charge, under specified limits.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Somerset County
stakeholders: Liquor license holders, consumers, and the local alcohol industry in Somerset County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a specialized tasting license with tiered fees, facilitating controlled alcohol tastings and potentially encouraging local business and tourism.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty but may support local economic development.

Title: Health Insurance - Coverage for Specialty Drugs
Synopsis: Prohibiting certain insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations from excluding coverage for certain specialty drugs that are administered or dispensed by a provider that is an in-network provider of covered medical oncology services and complies with State regulations for the administering and dispensing of specialty drugs, if the specialty drugs meet certain qualifications; and requiring the reimbursement rate for certain specialty drugs to meet certain criteria.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits certain health insurers and plans from excluding coverage for specific specialty drugs that are administered or dispensed by qualified providers, sets reimbursement standards for these drugs, and regulates pharmacy benefits managers to ensure fair access and reimbursement for specialty drugs.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health or Insurance Department (not explicitly specified)
stakeholders: Patients requiring specialty drugs, healthcare providers, insurers, pharmacy benefits managers
innovative_summary: The bill introduces regulations to ensure coverage and fair reimbursement for specialty drugs, including restrictions on exclusions and requirements for provider participation, which is a structured approach to improving access.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has potential to reduce child poverty by improving access to essential specialty medications, which can improve health outcomes for children with complex or chronic conditions.

Title: Maryland Developmental Disabilities Administration Waiver Advisory Council - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Developmental Disabilities Administration Waiver Advisory Council to advise and provide recommendations to the Developmental Disabilities Administration on system design, service delivery, and quality enhancement strategies for the Medicaid waiver programs operated by the Administration.
bill_summary: This bill establishes the Maryland Developmental Disabilities Administration Waiver Advisory Council to advise on system design, service delivery, and quality strategies for Medicaid waiver programs for individuals with developmental disabilities.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals with developmental disabilities, their families, service providers, advocacy groups, and related state agencies
innovative_summary: The bill creates a collaborative, stakeholder-inclusive advisory council that employs evidence-based, data-driven approaches and emphasizes diversity, equity, and inclusion principles.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve access and quality of services for individuals with developmental disabilities, which can indirectly reduce child poverty among affected families.

Title: Hospitals and Medical Professional Liability Insurers - Obstetric Services Policies (Doula and Birth Policy Transparency Act)
Synopsis: Requiring certain hospitals to adopt certain policies relating to obstetric services and to provide evidence to the Maryland Department of Health that the hospital has the policies; requiring the Maryland Department of Health to provide certain policies to the public on request; and requiring insurers that issue or deliver medical professional liability insurance policies in the State to provide the Maryland Department of Health, on request, with information regarding the insurer's policy regarding coverage of obstetric services.
bill_summary: The bill requires hospitals to adopt policies supporting doulas, informed consent for significant medical interventions, and transfer procedures for obstetric care. It also mandates insurers to provide information on obstetric coverage to the Maryland Department of Health.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Pregnant individuals, hospitals, doulas, insurance companies, and families in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces policies to enhance birthing support and transparency, including doula support and transfer protocols, which employ a holistic approach to obstetric care.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has the potential to improve maternal health outcomes, which can contribute to reducing child poverty by supporting healthier pregnancies and births.

Title: Department of Social and Economic Mobility - Established
Synopsis: Establishing the Department of Social and Economic Mobility; providing for the Secretary of Social and Economic Mobility; providing the purpose of the Department is to provide support for units of State government, individuals, and businesses for the maintenance of social equity policies in the State; establishing the Department of Social and Economic Mobility Special Fund; requiring the Governor to include in the annual budget bill a certain appropriation from the Transportation Trust Fund to the Fund; etc.
bill_summary: This bill establishes the Maryland Department of Social Equity and Economic Mobility, consolidating several existing offices related to social equity, minority business enterprises, and cannabis industry equity programs. It creates a new fund to support these initiatives, defines the department's duties, and sets guidelines for program implementation, reporting, and interagency coordination.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Social Equity and Economic Mobility
stakeholders: Individuals and businesses from communities historically impacted by social and economic disadvantages, including minority and disadvantaged business owners and communities affected by drug policies.
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach by consolidating multiple social equity programs into a single department, establishing new funds, and creating structured reporting and coordination mechanisms, which is a relatively innovative approach to social equity governance.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to impact child poverty by promoting economic opportunities and social equity for disadvantaged communities.

Title: Anne Arundel County - Alcoholic Beverages - License and Permit Distance Requirements
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of Liquor Commissioners for Anne Arundel County to issue a certain dancing permit to the holder of a Class H beer and wine or beer, wine, and liquor license for a licensed premises located within 1,000 feet of a school located at the Annapolis Mall, rather than prohibiting the Board from doing so; and authorizing the Board to issue a new Class B beer and wine or beer, wine, and liquor license to an establishment located within 1,000 feet of a school located at the Annapolis Mall.
bill_summary: The bill modifies alcohol licensing rules in Anne Arundel County, allowing certain licenses to be issued or renewed within 1,000 feet of schools or places of worship, and clarifies conditions under which new licenses can be issued near schools, especially around the Annapolis Mall.
responsible_party: Anne Arundel County Board of Liquor Commissioners
stakeholders: Businesses with alcohol licenses, residents near schools and places of worship, and the general public in Anne Arundel County
innovative_summary: The bill primarily changes licensing rules and distances related to alcohol licenses; it does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly concerns licensing distances and rules.

Title: Anne Arundel County - Alcoholic Beverages - Limited Special Event Permit
Synopsis: Authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Anne Arundel County to issue a limited special event permit to holders of certain alcoholic beverages licenses; and authorizing a permit holder to provide music, dancing, and other legal forms of entertainment.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Board of License Commissioners for Anne Arundel County to issue a new type of permit called a 'Limited Cultural Special Event Permit' that allows license holders to provide cultural music, dancing, and entertainment for one day on a specific date, with certain restrictions and fees.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Anne Arundel County
stakeholders: License holders, cultural event organizers, residents of Anne Arundel County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new permit specifically for cultural events, allowing for a targeted and culturally focused entertainment option within existing licensing frameworks.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly facilitates cultural entertainment and licensing.

Title: Charles County - Off-Highway Recreational Vehicles - Regulation and Enforcement
Synopsis: Authorizing Charles County to regulate the operation of off-highway recreational vehicles in the county and to impound an off-highway recreational vehicle that is the subject of certain alleged motor vehicle violations.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Charles County to regulate the operation of off-highway recreational vehicles, including registration, age restrictions, and enforcement measures such as impoundment for violations.
responsible_party: Charles County government
stakeholders: Off-highway recreational vehicle users in Charles County, including minors and residents
innovative_summary: The bill introduces local regulation and enforcement mechanisms for off-highway recreational vehicles, including registration and impoundment, which are not commonly managed at the county level.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program's direct impact on child poverty is likely minimal, as it mainly involves vehicle regulation and enforcement.

Title: Health Insurance - Provider Directory - Required Updates
Synopsis: Renaming "network directory" to be "provider directory" to conform to a certain federal law; altering the time period from 15 to 2 working days within which certain carriers are required to update the information that must be made available in the carrier's provider directory on the Internet; altering the information required to be included in a provider directory; requiring that a provider directory in printed form include a statement regarding the accuracy of the provider information; etc.
bill_summary: This bill updates regulations concerning health insurance provider directories, including renaming 'network directory' to 'provider directory', setting update frequency requirements, and establishing standards for accuracy and notification procedures.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Commissioner
stakeholders: Health insurance enrollees, health care providers, health care facilities, and health insurance carriers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a systematic online system for providers to update their information and mandates frequent updates to improve accuracy, leveraging technology for better transparency.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on provider directory accuracy and transparency.

Title: Baltimore City - Office of the Sheriff - Neighborhood Services Unit
Synopsis: Establishing the Neighborhood Services Unit within the Office of the Sheriff of Baltimore City; requiring the Neighborhood Services Unit and the Board of License Commissioners of Baltimore City to work in partnership to enforce the alcoholic beverages laws of Baltimore City and to enter into a memorandum of understanding that specifies the respective roles and responsibilities of the parties and funding in connection with the partnership; expanding the authorized uses of certain revenue to include the Neighborhood Services Unit; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a Neighborhood Services Unit within the Office of the Sheriff of Baltimore City, which will work in partnership with the Board of License Commissioners to enforce alcohol laws and perform other duties. It also details funding mechanisms, including surcharges on civil case filing fees, to support the unit and sheriff benefits.
responsible_party: Office of the Sheriff of Baltimore City and the Board of License Commissioners of Baltimore City
stakeholders: Residents of Baltimore City, law enforcement, and businesses involved in alcohol licensing
innovative_summary: The program employs a partnership approach between law enforcement and licensing authorities, with dedicated funding from surcharges on civil case fees to support enforcement and community safety.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on law enforcement and community safety may indirectly benefit children by improving neighborhood conditions, but it does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Commercial Law - Credit Regulation - Earned Wage Access and Credit Modernization
Synopsis: Subjecting certain earned wage access products to the Maryland Consumer Loan Law and other provisions that regulate entities that provide consumer credit; restricting the acceptance of tips by certain lenders under certain circumstances; providing for the licensing or registration of certain entities offering earned wage access products with certain exemptions; regulating earned wage access service agreements; limiting the costs and fees associated with obtaining an earned wage access product; etc.
bill_summary: This bill regulates earned wage access products in Maryland by subjecting them to consumer credit laws, establishing licensing requirements for providers, and setting rules for service agreements, fees, and disclosures to protect consumers.
responsible_party: Maryland Office of Financial Regulation
stakeholders: Consumers using earned wage access services, providers of earned wage access, and employers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a comprehensive regulatory framework for earned wage access, including licensing, disclosure, and fee restrictions, which is a new approach to managing this emerging financial service.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to reduce child poverty by providing consumers with more affordable access to wages and financial stability.

Title: Environment - Managed Aquifer Recharge Pilot Program - Establishment
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from performing groundwater augmentation except under certain circumstances; establishing the Managed Aquifer Recharge Pilot Program to regulate and evaluate the use of treated reclaimed water as a source for groundwater augmentation through managed aquifer recharge permits; requiring the demonstration facility to address a groundwater supply or quality problem that is anticipated to occur in the next 25 years; etc.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a Managed Aquifer Recharge Pilot Program in Maryland to test the use of treated reclaimed water for groundwater augmentation, including permitting, regulation, and monitoring procedures.
responsible_party: Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Communities and industries involved in groundwater management and water reuse in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs advanced water treatment technologies and groundwater testing approaches to evaluate the feasibility of using reclaimed water for aquifer recharge.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve water supply sustainability, which can indirectly benefit child populations by ensuring reliable water access.

Title: Maryland Medical Assistance Program, Maryland Children’s Health Program, and Health Insurance – Transfers to Special Pediatric Hospitals – Prior Authorizations
Synopsis: Prohibiting the Maryland Medical Assistance Program, the Maryland Children's Health Program, managed care organizations, and certain health insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations from requiring prior authorization for a transfer to a special pediatric hospital.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits the Maryland Medical Assistance Program, the Maryland Children’s Health Program, managed care organizations, and certain health insurers from requiring prior authorization for transfers to special pediatric hospitals, starting January 1, 2026.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Children under 22 years old, or children with co-occurring physical and behavioral health conditions aged 2 to 23, and their families.
innovative_summary: The bill removes prior authorization requirements for transfers to specialized pediatric hospitals, streamlining access to specialized care for children with complex health needs.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has the potential to improve access to specialized pediatric care, which could positively impact children in vulnerable populations, including those in low-income families.

Title: Prescription Drug Repository Program - Revisions
Synopsis: Altering the Prescription Drug Repository Program, including by allowing certain entities located in another state to participate in the Program as drop-off sites and repositories, including over-the-counter drugs under the Program, and altering the individuals who are eligible to receive drugs or medical supplies under the Program; and altering the persons for whom and the activities with respect to which certain immunity is provided under the Program.
bill_summary: This bill revises the Maryland Prescription Drug Repository Program to include participation by out-of-state pharmacies and entities, allowing them to serve as drop-off sites and repositories for donated prescription drugs, over-the-counter drugs, and medical supplies, with updated regulations on handling, storage, and dispensing.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Pharmacy
stakeholders: Indigent and uninsured individuals, pharmacies, medical facilities, and out-of-state entities participating in drug donation and distribution
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a cross-state participation model for drug donation and distribution, leveraging out-of-state entities as part of the program, which is a new approach to drug repository programs.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to directly impact child poverty by increasing access to affordable medications for needy individuals, including children.

Title: Vaccinations by Pharmacists and Health Insurance Coverage for Immunizations
Synopsis: Altering the vaccinations that a pharmacist may administer, subject to certain requirements, to an individual of at least a certain age; altering the vaccinations included in the minimum package of child wellness services for which certain health insurers and nonprofit health service plans are required to provide coverage to include those recommended by the Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention as of December 31, 2024.
bill_summary: The bill expands the scope of vaccinations that pharmacists can administer to include individuals aged 3 and above, and updates the list of vaccines and protocols. It also requires health insurance plans to cover a minimum package of child wellness services, including immunizations and developmental screenings, without deductibles.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and the Maryland Insurance Administration
stakeholders: Children, parents, healthcare providers, insurance companies, and the general public in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach by expanding pharmacist-administered vaccinations and mandating insurance coverage for a broad range of child wellness services, integrating public health and insurance policy.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to reduce child poverty by increasing access to preventive healthcare and immunizations, which can reduce health disparities.

Title: Primary and Secondary Education - Youth-Centric Technology and Social Media Resource Guide
Synopsis: Requiring the National Center for School Mental Health at the University of Maryland School of Medicine, in consultation with the State Department of Education, to develop and publish a youth-centric technology and social media resource guide by the 2027-2028 school year; requiring the guide to be distributed, beginning with the 2027-2028 school year, to each public school and the parent teacher organization for each public school and posted on the websites of the Department and each county board; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the University of Maryland's National Center for School Mental Health, in consultation with the Maryland Department of Education, to develop, publish, and update a youth-centric technology and social media resource guide for public school students, starting with the 2027-2028 school year. The guide aims to provide age-appropriate information, best practices, and safety guidance on youth-oriented technology and social media use.
responsible_party: National Center for School Mental Health at the University of Maryland School of Medicine in consultation with the Maryland Department of Education
stakeholders: Public school students, parents, guardians, educators, and school administrators in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive, multimedia, and regularly updated guide that integrates research, technology landscape review, and best practices, utilizing a government-university partnership to proactively address youth technology use and safety.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to impact child poverty by promoting safe and informed use of technology, which can support educational engagement and mental health.

Title: Natural Resources - Vessels - Carbon Monoxide Warning Labels (Matthew's Law)
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from operating a gasoline-powered vessel manufactured after July 31, 2007, that has accommodation spaces, swim platforms, or aft lounging areas on the waters of the State unless the vessel has carbon monoxide warning labels affixed in conspicuous locations in the vicinity of both the transom and the helm of the vessel; and prohibiting the Department of Natural Resources from imposing a penalty on a person that violates the Act.
bill_summary: The bill prohibits operating certain gasoline-powered vessels with specific features on Maryland waters unless they have carbon monoxide warning labels affixed in designated locations. It also prevents the Department of Natural Resources from imposing penalties for violations.
responsible_party: Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Vessel operators and manufacturers of gasoline-powered vessels with accommodation spaces, swim platforms, or aft lounging areas in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a safety requirement for vessels with warning labels to prevent carbon monoxide poisoning, employing safety labeling as a preventive measure.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on vessel safety regulations.

Title: Garrett County - Bids and Contracts - Advertisement Exceptions
Synopsis: Providing that, in Garrett County, a certain requirement to advertise for bids does not apply to a certain contract for goods or services procured on an as-needed basis over time or for certain vehicles.
bill_summary: The bill amends procurement laws in Garrett County to allow the County Commissioners or their employees to enter into contracts for goods or services on an as-needed basis without advertising for bids, and to purchase up to two vehicles without bidding, thereby reducing procurement restrictions.
responsible_party: Garrett County Government
stakeholders: Garrett County residents and local government agencies involved in procurement
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a more flexible procurement process for Garrett County by allowing certain contracts to be made without the traditional bidding process, employing a streamlined approach to government procurement.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily changes procurement procedures for the county government.

Title: Caroline County - Alcoholic Beverages - Special Event Venue License and Multiple Event Licenses
Synopsis: Establishing the special event venue beer, wine, and liquor license in Caroline County; authorizing the Board of License Commissioners of Caroline County to issue the license to the owner of a venue with a certain zoning classification; authorizing holders of certain multiple event licenses in Caroline County to store alcoholic beverages on the licensed premises between individual events in a certain manner; requiring the license holder to keep complete records of all alcoholic beverages purchased and sold on the premises; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a new special event venue license for alcohol sales in Caroline County, allowing venues with certain zoning to sell beer, wine, and liquor during specified events. It also creates a multiple event license option for such venues and volunteer fire companies, with provisions for storing alcohol between events and record-keeping requirements.
responsible_party: Caroline County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Venue owners, event organizers, volunteers fire companies, and the public attending events in Caroline County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a specialized licensing system for multiple events at a single venue, including provisions for alcohol storage and record-keeping, which is a relatively innovative approach to managing alcohol sales at events.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly pertains to alcohol licensing at venues.

Title: Anne Arundel County - Property Tax - Day Care Centers and Child Care Centers
Synopsis: Exempting personal property used in connection with certain large family child care homes from valuation and taxation in Anne Arundel County; authorizing the governing body of Anne Arundel County or the governing body of a municipal corporation in Anne Arundel County to grant, by law, a property tax credit against the real property tax owed on the portion of real property used for certain child care centers and day care centers; etc.
bill_summary: The bill provides property tax exemptions and credits for certain personal property and real estate used in connection with large family child care homes, child care centers, and day care centers in Anne Arundel County, Maryland.
responsible_party: Anne Arundel County government or municipal corporations within Anne Arundel County
stakeholders: Child care providers, families using child care services, and the local community in Anne Arundel County
innovative_summary: The bill employs targeted property tax credits and exemptions to incentivize the development and operation of child care facilities, integrating tax policy with child care support.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to reduce child poverty by supporting child care infrastructure, which can improve access to affordable child care for families in need.

Title: Department of General Services - Assessment of State-Owned Facilities - Child Care Centers
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of General Services to conduct an assessment of facilities owned by the State and operated by the 16 State agencies the Department supports to evaluate whether the facility or a portion of the facility would be suitable to lease to a child care center;  requiring the Department to report to the General Assembly the results of the assessment and a description of whether each facility is suitable to lease to a child care center by December 1, 2026; and requiring the report to be published on the Department's website.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of General Services to assess all state-owned facilities operated by 16 state agencies to determine if they are suitable for leasing to child care centers. The department must report the findings to the General Assembly and publish the report on its website by December 1, 2026.
responsible_party: Department of General Services
stakeholders: Children and families in need of child care, state agencies, and the general public
innovative_summary: The bill employs a data-driven approach to repurpose existing state-owned facilities for child care, which is a strategic and innovative use of government assets to address child care needs.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to improve access to affordable child care, which can help reduce child poverty by supporting working families.

Title: Security Guards and Security Guard Employers - Registration, Certification, and Regulation
Synopsis: Providing that a cannabis agent who is employed to provide security services for a cannabis licensee or cannabis registrant as a security guard or by a security guard agency is not required to obtain a State or national criminal history records check if the cannabis agent is authorized to provide security guard services; altering the definition of "security guard employer" for purposes of certain provisions of law to exclude video lottery facilities, sports wagering facility licensees, and health care facilities; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies regulations concerning cannabis agents and security guards, including exemptions from criminal background checks for cannabis agents providing security services, and updates definitions and licensing requirements for security guard agencies and employers. It also clarifies the scope of certain security-related entities.
responsible_party: Maryland Alcoholic Beverages and Cannabis Administration, Maryland Department of State Police, Maryland State Lottery and Gaming Control Agency, Maryland Department of Health, Maryland State Government
stakeholders: Cannabis licensees, security guard agencies, security guards, cannabis agents, and related regulatory bodies in Maryland.
innovative_summary: The bill introduces specific exemptions from criminal background checks for cannabis agents providing security services, streamlining security employment processes within the cannabis industry, and clarifies regulatory definitions and responsibilities.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on security and licensing regulations within the cannabis industry.

Title: Health Insurance - Provider Panels - Credentialing for Behavioral Health Care Professionals
Synopsis: Altering the providers of certain community-based health services that a carrier is prohibited from rejecting for participation on the carrier's provider panel; altering the period of time in which certain carriers are required to accept or deny certain social workers, counselors, and psychology associates for participation on the carrier's provider panel to within 60 days after the date a carrier receives a completed application.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the credentialing process for behavioral health care professionals, such as social workers, counselors, and psychology associates, seeking to participate in health insurance provider panels in Maryland. It prohibits rejection of providers who practice within their scope and are accredited, and sets specific timelines for carriers to accept or reject applications.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health or Insurance Commissioner (implied)
stakeholders: Behavioral health care professionals, health insurance carriers, and patients seeking behavioral health services in Maryland.
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a more streamlined and timely credentialing process for behavioral health providers, including the use of online credentialing systems and specific timelines, which is a modern approach to credentialing.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to improve access to behavioral health services, which can help reduce child poverty by supporting mental health and well-being.

Title: Health Insurance - Required Coverage - Hearing Aids
Synopsis: Altering the circumstances under which certain insurers, nonprofit health service plans, and health maintenance organizations are required to provide coverage for medically appropriate and necessary hearing aids for adults to require coverage if the hearing aid is ordered, fitted, and dispensed by a licensed hearing aid dispenser.
bill_summary: The bill requires health insurance providers in Maryland to cover medically necessary hearing aids for adults, including coverage if prescribed and fitted by a licensed audiologist or hearing aid dispenser, with a limit of $1,400 per hearing aid every 36 months.
responsible_party: Health insurance providers in Maryland
stakeholders: Adults with hearing impairments in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill standardizes coverage for hearing aids for adults, including provisions for higher-cost hearing aids and coverage by licensed professionals, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty as it primarily addresses adult hearing aid coverage.

Title: Lead Testing and Inspections - Falsifying Information - Penalty
Synopsis: Establishing a civil penalty not exceeding $50,000 for a person who falsifies information that is submitted in a report of the results of lead-contaminated dust testing or visual inspection of an affected property.
bill_summary: This bill establishes penalties for falsifying information in lead testing and inspection reports, including civil penalties up to $50,000 and other enforcement measures.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Property owners, tenants, lead testing and inspection professionals, and the general public concerned with lead safety
innovative_summary: The bill primarily enforces existing lead safety regulations with increased penalties for falsification, without introducing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty but aims to improve lead safety, which can benefit children in affected properties.

Title: Vehicle Laws - Driver's Licenses - Electronic Credentials (Maryland Mobile ID Enhancement Act)
Synopsis: Authorizing the Motor Vehicle Administration to enter into an agreement to facilitate the issuance, use, and verification of electronic credentials through a national association of motor vehicle agencies; and authorizing an individual who will operate a rented vehicle to use a certain electronic credential showing a representation of a valid driver's license, instead of a driver's license, to rent the vehicle.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration to issue and verify electronic driver credentials, which can be used instead of physical driver's licenses, especially for renting vehicles. It also establishes agreements with other agencies for the use of these electronic credentials.
responsible_party: Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration
stakeholders: Drivers, vehicle rental companies, and the general public in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces the use of electronic credentials for driver's licenses, allowing digital verification and use in vehicle rentals, employing new digital technology and inter-agency agreements.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly modernizes driver credential verification and rental processes.

Title: Vehicle Equipment - Portable Variable Messaging Signs - Authorization
Synopsis: Authorizing a tow truck to display a portable variable messaging sign mounted on the tow truck while at the scene of a crash or a disabled vehicle; and requiring the portable variable messaging sign to conform to the standards established in the manual on uniform traffic control devices adopted by the State Highway Administration and display only messages approved by the Administration.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes tow trucks to display portable variable messaging signs at the scene of crashes or disabled vehicles, provided they conform to specific standards and are approved by the Maryland State Highway Administration.
responsible_party: Maryland State Highway Administration
stakeholders: Tow truck operators, drivers involved in crashes or disabled vehicles, highway safety officials
innovative_summary: The bill introduces the use of portable variable messaging signs on tow trucks at crash scenes, employing new signage technology for traffic management.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on traffic safety and management.

Title: Civil Actions - Child Sexual Abuse
Synopsis: Altering certain provisions relating to the award of noneconomic damages to a claimant in an action for child sexual abuse; altering certain provisions relating to the liability of the State under the Maryland Tort Claims Act and of a local government under the Local Government Tort Claims Act for certain claims of child sexual abuse; and requiring the Maryland Judiciary to report to the General Assembly by January 31, 2027, and each year thereafter, on the amount of each award and a summary of the sexual abuse claims related to the award.
bill_summary: This bill removes the statute of limitations for civil actions for damages arising from child sexual abuse that occurred while the victim was a minor, allowing such claims to be filed at any time. It also adjusts damages limits, liability caps, and sovereign immunity defenses for claims against the state, local governments, and school boards related to child sexual abuse, with specific provisions for claims that would have been barred before October 1, 2023.
responsible_party: Maryland Judiciary and State Insurance Commissioner
stakeholders: Victims of child sexual abuse, state and local government entities, school boards, and insurance providers
innovative_summary: The bill employs a novel approach by removing the statute of limitations for child sexual abuse claims, allowing victims to seek damages at any time, and establishing specific liability and insurance standards for government entities.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus is on legal and liability reforms related to child sexual abuse claims, with no direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Health Care Facilities - Hospitals and Freestanding Birthing Centers - Perinatal Care Standards
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health, in coordination with the Maryland Institute for Emergency Medical Services Systems, to adopt regulations establishing minimum perinatal care standards for hospitals that meet or exceed the Maryland Perinatal System Standards for each hospital that provides obstetrical services; and requiring each hospital that provides obstetrical services and freestanding birthing centers, as a condition of licensure, to comply with certain minimum perinatal care standards.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Health, in coordination with the Maryland Institute for Emergency Medical Services Systems, to adopt regulations establishing minimum perinatal care standards for hospitals providing obstetrical services and for freestanding birthing centers. These standards must meet or exceed the Maryland Perinatal System Standards and are a condition for licensure.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Hospitals, freestanding birthing centers, pregnant individuals, newborns
innovative_summary: The bill employs a regulatory approach to establish minimum perinatal care standards, ensuring quality and safety in obstetrical services and birthing centers, which is a standard government approach but with a focus on specific care standards.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program could potentially improve maternal and infant health outcomes, which may contribute to reducing child poverty indirectly.

Title: Howard County - Alcoholic Beverages - Class D Licenses - Delivery
Synopsis: Applying certain provisions of law relating to the delivery of alcoholic beverages in Howard County to a holder or an employee of a holder of a Class D license.
bill_summary: The bill allows holders or employees of Class D alcohol licenses in Howard County to deliver alcoholic beverages within the county, with specific requirements for age verification and documentation.
responsible_party: Howard County Alcoholic Beverages Board or local licensing authority
stakeholders: Alcoholic beverage license holders, employees, and consumers in Howard County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a regulated alcohol delivery service within Howard County, including age verification and documentation procedures.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty as it primarily regulates alcohol delivery services.

Title: Support and Protections for Individuals Affected by Federal Actions (Protect Our Federal Workers Act)
Synopsis: Renaming the Federal Government Shutdown Employee Assistance Loan Fund to be the Federal Government Employee Assistance Loan Fund; authorizing funds appropriated to the Catastrophic Event Account to be expended to assist in funding costs connected to a relocation, closure, or mass layoff of a unit of the federal government; establishing the Expedited Hiring Program in the Department of Budget and Management; authorizing an appointing authority to recruit for certain vacant positions in State government; etc.
bill_summary: This bill establishes a fund to assist federal employees and contractors in Maryland who are financially impacted by federal government shutdowns, closures, relocations, or layoffs. It also expands the powers of the Maryland Attorney General to address federal actions affecting residents, creates an expedited hiring program for federal workers transitioning to state jobs, and authorizes transfers of funds for these purposes.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor and Maryland Attorney General's Office
stakeholders: Federal government employees and contractors in Maryland, Maryland residents affected by federal actions
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach combining financial assistance, legal action, and expedited hiring to support residents impacted by federal government shutdowns and actions, integrating new programs and expanded powers for state agencies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has a moderate potential to directly impact child poverty by supporting federal employees and contractors who may be primary breadwinners, thereby stabilizing household income.

Title: Courts - Parental Accommodations
Synopsis: Requiring circuit courthouses in the State, constructed or renovated on or after October 1, 2025, to maintain on its premises a private lactation room to be used by certain individuals; providing that breast-feeding mothers and certain individuals caring for children under 3 years old may be excused from jury service; and requiring the Maryland Judiciary to collect certain information on jury service excusals and report annually to the Maryland General Assembly beginning by December 31, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland circuit courthouses constructed or renovated after October 1, 2025, to have private lactation rooms for nursing mothers and individuals caring for young children. It also allows breastfeeding mothers and certain caregivers to be excused from jury service and mandates the Maryland Judiciary to collect and report data on jury service excusals.
responsible_party: Maryland Judiciary
stakeholders: Breastfeeding mothers, individuals caring for young children, jurors, and the general public who use courthouses.
innovative_summary: The bill introduces the requirement for private lactation rooms in courthouses and formalizes the process for excusing breastfeeding mothers and caregivers from jury service, combining health accommodations with jury service policies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to impact child poverty by supporting parents and caregivers, enabling their participation in civic duties and employment.

Title: Juveniles - Truancy Reduction Pilot Programs - Report
Synopsis: Requiring the Chief Justice of the Supreme Court of Maryland to report annually by November 1 to the General Assembly on the Truancy Reduction Pilot Program; and requiring the report to include the number of Truancy Reduction Pilot Programs established in State, the number of participants in each pilot program; information on the outcomes of the participants in each program, and recommendations to improve the function of the current program.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Judiciary to report on the impact and effectiveness of Truancy Reduction Pilot Programs, including data on student GPA, graduation rate, and truancy rate, and to make recommendations on their effectiveness in Baltimore City. The report is due by December 1, 2026.
responsible_party: Maryland Judiciary
stakeholders: Students involved in truancy reduction programs, schools, and families in Maryland, especially in Baltimore City.
innovative_summary: The bill mainly focuses on reporting and evaluation of existing pilot programs, with no new technology or innovative approaches introduced.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly involves reporting on program outcomes.

Title: Local Government - Hiring and Promotion Preferences for Veterans and Spouses of Service Members and Veterans (Families Serve Act)
Synopsis: Authorizing counties and municipalities to grant a preference in hiring and promotion to eligible veterans, spouses of an eligible service member, spouses of certain eligible veterans and eligible service members, and surviving spouses of deceased eligible veterans; and authorizing counties and municipalities to adopt a local law that allows for the application of a certain credit on a selection test for eligible spouses, eligible veterans, and certain spouses and surviving spouses.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Maryland counties and municipalities to adopt laws that give hiring and promotion preferences to veterans, their spouses, and surviving spouses, including applying test credits and establishing local laws for these preferences.
responsible_party: Counties and municipalities in Maryland
stakeholders: Veterans, spouses of service members, surviving spouses of deceased veterans, local government agencies
