innovative_summary: The bill introduces local laws allowing for test credits and preferences in hiring and promotion for veterans and their families, which is a targeted approach to support military families.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by supporting veteran families, but it is primarily focused on employment preferences.

Title: Maryland Small Business Innovation Research and Technology Transfer Incentive Program - Alterations
Synopsis: Repealing certain provisions of law specifying certain limitations on awards or investments provided to certain small businesses under the Maryland Small Business Innovation Research and Technology Transfer Incentive Program.
bill_summary: The bill amends the Maryland Small Business Innovation Research and Technology Transfer Incentive Program by repealing certain limitations on awards or investments to small businesses, allowing for increased support, especially for those engaged in research related to public health crises.
responsible_party: The Maryland Department of Commerce (The Corporation)
stakeholders: Small businesses engaged in research and development, especially those involved in public health crisis response
innovative_summary: The program enhances existing support for small businesses by removing previous restrictions on awards, potentially increasing the scale and impact of government support for innovation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on supporting small businesses involved in public health research could indirectly benefit child populations by fostering health-related innovations and economic growth.

Title: Economic Development - Western Maryland Economic Future Investment Board and Senator George C. Edwards Fund - Alterations
Synopsis: Altering the composition of the Western Maryland Economic Future Investment Board; providing that the Executive Director serves as a nonvoting member of the Board, but may vote to break a tie; providing criteria for the awarding of grant and loan funding to include the creation or retention of at least 25 jobs, creation or retention of at least 10 jobs each with wages that exceed 120% of the State minimum wage, or creates significant population growth in the area in which the project is located; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the Western Maryland Economic Future Investment Board and the Senator George C. Edwards Fund, including changes to membership, funding, and project criteria, to promote economic development and job creation in the region.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Economic Development
stakeholders: Residents and businesses in Western Maryland region
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a regional economic development fund with specific criteria for project evaluation and funding, including matching funds and job creation targets, employing a structured approach to regional economic growth.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to reduce child poverty by creating jobs and stimulating economic growth in the region.

Title: Motor Vehicles – Rental Fleet Vehicles – Registration
Synopsis: Establishing an alternative registration process for rental fleet vehicles; requiring the Motor Vehicle Administration to issue distinctive registration plates for rental vehicles registered under the alternative process; and requiring, in addition to an annual registration fee, the owner of a registered rental vehicle to pay a one-time initial registration fee not to exceed $8.50 when the new registration plates are issued.
bill_summary: The bill establishes an alternative registration process for rental fleet vehicles in Maryland, including the issuance of distinctive registration plates and a one-time initial registration fee.
responsible_party: Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration
stakeholders: Rental fleet vehicle owners and rental vehicle users in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a specialized registration process and distinctive plates for rental fleet vehicles, streamlining registration and identification.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on vehicle registration processes.

Title: Transportation-Related Tolls - Installment Payment Plans
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Transportation Authority to establish programs to offer installment payment plans for the payment of certain tolls, in excess of $300.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Transportation Authority and the Department of Transportation to establish income-based installment payment plans for paying tolls, civil penalties, and fines related to transportation violations.
responsible_party: Maryland Transportation Authority and Department of Transportation
stakeholders: Individuals with unpaid tolls, civil penalties, and fines, especially those with low income
innovative_summary: The bill introduces income-based installment payment plans for transportation-related fines and tolls, employing a structured approach to payment assistance.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to directly impact child poverty by providing payment relief to low-income individuals, reducing financial burdens.

Title: Land Use and Real Property - Accessory Dwelling Units - Requirements and Prohibitions
Synopsis: Establishing the policy of the State to promote and encourage the creation of accessory dwelling units on land with a single-family detached dwelling unit as the primary dwelling unit in order to meet the housing needs of the citizens of the State; requiring, on or before October 1, 2026, the legislative body of certain counties or municipal corporations to adopt a local law authorizing the development of accessory dwelling units on land with certain single-family detached dwelling units subject to certain requirements; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland counties and municipal corporations to adopt laws allowing the development of accessory dwelling units (ADUs) on land zoned for single-family detached homes, with specific requirements and restrictions. It also establishes policies for the approval, design, and regulation of ADUs, including parking, impact fees, and utility connections, and clarifies the treatment of ADUs in property restrictions and homeowners associations.
responsible_party: Local county and municipal governments in Maryland
stakeholders: Homeowners, residents in single-family zones, local governments, and community associations
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach to facilitate and regulate the development of accessory dwelling units, including treatment of ADUs as separate lots for voting and assessments, and sets standards for their development, which is relatively innovative in local land use policy.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to impact child poverty by increasing affordable housing options and supporting family stability.

Title: Local Finance - Special Taxing Districts - Anne Arundel County Erosion Prevention Projects and Erosion Control Projects
Synopsis: Requiring interest earnings on money deposited for a certain taxing and assessment district to be credited to that district; specifying that a certain provision of law governing the petition process for the construction of an erosion prevention project or erosion control project in a certain district in Anne Arundel County does not apply to certain planning, permitting, or cost estimate activities; authorizing certain entities to use tax funds for upkeep or reconstruction of an existing shore erosion control project; etc.
bill_summary: The bill modifies laws related to erosion prevention and control projects in Maryland, particularly in Anne Arundel County. It clarifies how interest earnings on funds are credited, allows the use of tax funds for maintenance of existing erosion control projects without a petition, and updates procedures for project planning and approval.
responsible_party: Local government, specifically county governing bodies and district councils
stakeholders: Property owners and residents in districts affected by erosion control projects in Maryland, especially in Anne Arundel County
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates legal procedures and clarifies funding rules for erosion control projects; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly concerns local erosion control projects and funding procedures.

Title: Prince George's County - Chesapeake and Atlantic Coastal Bays Critical Area Protection Program - Cutting or Clearing Trees MC/PG 113-25
Synopsis: Providing that, in Prince George's County, to enforce a certain violation involving the clearing or cutting of trees in the Chesapeake and Atlantic Coastal Bays Critical Area, the Prince George's County Department of Permitting, Inspections, and Enforcement must record a lien on property that is the subject of the violation in a certain manner; establishing certain limits, prohibitions, requirements, and authorizations on actions certain local jurisdictions may take if a lien is not recorded as required by the Act; etc.
bill_summary: The bill provides protections for property owners in Prince George's County regarding the cutting or clearing of trees in the Chesapeake and Atlantic Coastal Bays Critical Area. It limits liability for current owners who purchase property after violations by previous owners, mandates the recording of liens for violations, and requires reimbursement of costs for administrative enforcement actions. The bill also establishes regulations for enforcement and appeals, and applies retroactively to certain violations.
responsible_party: Prince George’s County government and Maryland–National Capital Park and Planning Commission
stakeholders: Property owners in Prince George’s County, environmental agencies, local government, and residents of the Chesapeake and Atlantic Coastal Bays Critical Area
innovative_summary: The bill employs a combination of legal protections for property owners, retroactive enforcement limits, and reimbursement provisions, which is a novel approach to environmental enforcement and property rights in the context of critical area management.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly addresses environmental enforcement and property owner protections.

Title: State Government - Equal Access to Public Services for Individuals With Limited English Proficiency and Individuals With Disabilities
Synopsis: Requiring the Governor's Office of Immigrant Affairs and the Department of Disabilities to convene the Maryland Language Advisory Group, by January 1, 2026, to make findings and recommendations on oversight, monitoring, investigation, and enforcement of certain provisions of law relating to equal access to public services for certain individuals; altering provisions of law relating to equal access to public services for individuals with limited English proficiency to include individuals with disabilities; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland state agencies to develop and implement language access plans to ensure individuals with limited English proficiency and disabilities have equal access to public services. It establishes oversight, monitoring, and enforcement mechanisms, including the creation of an advisory group and annual reporting.
responsible_party: Governor’s Office of Immigrant Affairs and Department of Disabilities
stakeholders: Individuals with limited English proficiency and individuals with disabilities in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive, structured approach to language access, including the development of standardized plans, policies, and oversight mechanisms, and the creation of an advisory group to guide implementation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to significantly improve access to public services for vulnerable populations, which can help reduce barriers that contribute to child poverty.

Title: State Board of Professional Counselors and Therapists - Temporary Telehealth Licenses - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing a temporary telehealth license to be issued by the State Board of Professional Counselors and Therapists authorizing the holder to provide clinical professional counseling services only to a student attending an institution of higher education in the State if the student and out-of-state licensed professional counselor have a previously established relationship that has existed for at least 6 months; limiting the term of the temporary license to 6 months; and prohibiting the renewal of a temporary licensed issued under the Act.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a temporary telehealth license for out-of-state licensed professional counselors to provide counseling services to students enrolled in Maryland's institutions of higher education, under specific conditions and for a limited period.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Professional Counselors and Therapists
stakeholders: Students enrolled in Maryland institutions of higher education and out-of-state licensed professional counselors
innovative_summary: The program employs a temporary licensing approach to facilitate telehealth counseling services across state lines, leveraging telehealth technology and interstate licensing agreements.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve access to mental health services for students, which can help reduce barriers related to mental health that contribute to child and youth poverty.

Title: Maryland State Department of Education - Publicly Funded Prekindergarten - Analysis and Report (Mixed Delivery Model Viability Act)
Synopsis: Requiring the State Department of Education to convene a workgroup to conduct an analysis of the mixed delivery, publicly funded prekindergarten system established under the Blueprint for Maryland's Future; and requiring the workgroup to submit a final report, by December 31, 2027, to the Accountability and Implementation Board and the General Assembly on any changes made by the Department in response to the recommendations in its interim report, and any additional recommendations for changes to the prekindergarten system; etc.
bill_summary: This bill requires the Maryland State Department of Education to form a workgroup to analyze the mixed delivery, publicly funded prekindergarten system established under the Blueprint for Maryland’s Future. The analysis will review policies, implementation, reimbursement methods, administrative processes, language accessibility, resource pooling, facility challenges, and integration of children with disabilities, with the goal of improving the program's efficacy and equity.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Education
stakeholders: Prekindergarten children, families, private and public prekindergarten providers, child care providers, educators, and policymakers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive, collaborative approach to analyze and improve the existing prekindergarten system, including stakeholder feedback, policy review, and resource pooling strategies, which is a relatively innovative approach to system reform.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to impact child poverty by improving access, quality, and equity in early childhood education, which are critical factors in reducing child poverty.

Title: Public Health - Report on Establishing a Directory of Home Health Care Providers
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Department of Health, in consultation with certain stakeholders, to submit a report on the feasibility of establishing and maintaining an online directory of home health care providers to certain committees of the General Assembly by December 31, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Health to report on the feasibility of creating an online directory of home health care providers in the state, including details on what information to include and how to support workforce development and communication.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Home health care providers and individuals seeking home health care services in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a digital directory to connect consumers with providers and support workforce development, which is a modern approach to healthcare resource management.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve access to home health care, which can help reduce child poverty by supporting families' health needs.

Title: Disability Services - Adapted Vehicle Access Pilot Program - Established
Synopsis: Establishing the Adapted Vehicle Access Pilot Program to provide adapted vehicles to individuals who require a mobility aid; and requiring the Department of Disabilities to implement and administer the Program, request, apply for, and facilitate certain donations to the Program, study the impacts of the Program, and report to the Governor and the General Assembly on the Program on or before December 1, 2028.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Adapted Vehicle Access Pilot Program to provide adapted vehicles to individuals who require a wheelchair or mobility aid, aiming to improve their independence and mobility.
responsible_party: Department of Disabilities
stakeholders: Individuals who require mobility aids and have limited access to transportation, especially in areas with limited public transit
innovative_summary: The program employs a targeted approach to provide adapted vehicles through donations and grants, focusing on individuals with mobility needs in underserved areas.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by increasing mobility and access to opportunities for individuals with disabilities.

Title: Howard County - Alcoholic Beverages - Class MT (Movie Theater) License
Synopsis: Establishing a Class MT (movie theater) beer, wine, and liquor license in Howard County; authorizing the Board of License Commissioners for Howard County to issue the license to the owner of a movie theater who holds a crowd control training certification; authorizing a license holder to sell beer, wine, and liquor to certain patrons at retail for on-premises consumption; and authorizing the Board to set certain limitations on and requirements for the license.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a new Class MT (movie theater) license in Howard County that allows movie theaters to sell beer, wine, and liquor for on-premises consumption to patrons who have purchased tickets to movies. It authorizes the Howard County Board of License Commissioners to issue this license, set hours, fees, and other requirements, and adopt regulations.
responsible_party: Howard County Board of License Commissioners
stakeholders: Movie theater patrons and owners in Howard County
innovative_summary: The program introduces a specialized alcohol license for movie theaters, integrating alcohol sales into entertainment venues, which is a relatively innovative approach to licensing and entertainment regulation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily concerns licensing and alcohol sales regulations for movie theaters.

Title: Baltimore City - AIDS Prevention Sterile Needle and Syringe Exchange Pilot Program - Revisions
Synopsis: Renaming the AIDS Prevention Sterile Needle and Syringe Exchange Pilot Program to be the HIV Prevention Syringe Services Program; altering the duties of the Program to provide for the safe distribution of syringes and  hypodermic needles and account for the number of hypodermic needles and syringes exchanged and distributed by the Baltimore City Health Department; altering the membership and duties of the Program's oversight committee; altering the immunity provided to Program staff and participants; etc.
bill_summary: The bill renames the existing AIDS Prevention Sterile Needle and Syringe Exchange Pilot Program to the HIV Prevention Syringe Services Program in Baltimore City. It modifies the duties, oversight, and immunity provisions related to the program, emphasizing harm reduction, education, referrals to treatment, and data collection.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Health Department
stakeholders: Injecting drug users, public health officials, community organizations in Baltimore City
innovative_summary: The program employs modern harm reduction strategies, including mobile syringe services, data collection, and targeted outreach, with a focus on reducing HIV transmission among drug users.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty indirectly by improving community health and reducing the spread of HIV, which can alleviate economic burdens on affected families.

Title: State Personnel - Paid Family and Medical Leave
Synopsis: Requiring the Secretary of Budget and Management and the governing body of a public institution of higher education adopt regulations governing paid family and medical leave benefits for Executive Branch employees; establishing certain parameters for the paid family and medical leave; authorizing, beginning July 1, 2026, Executive Branch employees to submit a request for paid family and medical leave in accordance with established procedures; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes paid family and medical leave benefits for employees in the Maryland State Executive Branch, including regulations for requesting and granting leave, and repeals previous parental leave provisions.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Budget and Management
stakeholders: Employees in the Maryland State Executive Branch
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a comprehensive paid family and medical leave program, aligning state benefits with federal standards and expanding leave options.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to reduce child poverty by supporting working families during critical times, but its direct impact depends on implementation.

Title: Medical Records - Notice of Destruction - Method
Synopsis: Requiring that notice of the destruction of medical records be provided by first-class mail or by e-mail, rather than by both methods; and providing that if notice is provided by e-mail and no response or delivery receipt is obtained from the e-mail address to which notice was provided, the health care provider shall provide notice via first-class mail at least 10 days before the date on which the record is to be destroyed.
bill_summary: The bill updates the process for notifying patients about the destruction of their medical records, changing the notification method to either first-class mail or email, and clarifies the timing and requirements for such notices.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health or relevant healthcare providers
stakeholders: Patients and healthcare providers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a digital notification method (email) as an alternative to traditional mail, modernizing the notification process for medical record destruction.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on administrative procedures for medical records.

Title: Financial Institutions - Consumer Credit - Application of Licensing Requirements (Maryland Secondary Market Stability Act of 2025)
Synopsis: Providing that certain provisions of law governing the licensing of providers of certain financial services in the State do not apply to a certain trust that acquires or is assigned a certain mortgage loan under certain circumstances; establishing the Maryland Licensing Workgroup to study and make recommendations on licensing requirements for persons that provide financial services in the State; and requiring the Workgroup to report to the Governor and the General Assembly by December 31, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill clarifies licensing exemptions for certain financial service providers, establishes a Maryland Licensing Workgroup to study licensing requirements, and makes temporary adjustments to licensing laws related to mortgage and installment loans.
responsible_party: Maryland Office of Financial Regulation
stakeholders: Financial service providers, consumers, and residents of Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a collaborative government approach by creating a workgroup to study and recommend improvements to licensing systems, which is a strategic and participatory approach to regulatory reform.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but could improve access to credit and financial services for families, indirectly affecting child poverty.

Title: Prior Authorizations of State Debt - Alterations
Synopsis: Amending certain prior authorizations of State Debt to change the names of certain grantees, alter the authorized uses of certain grants, and extend the termination date of certain grants.
bill_summary: This bill authorizes numerous grants and funding for various public projects, including infrastructure, community centers, health facilities, arts centers, and revitalization efforts across Maryland, with many grants extending until 2032.
responsible_party: Various Maryland state agencies, including the Department of Housing and Community Development, Maryland Department of Transportation, and the University System of Maryland.
stakeholders: Local communities, public institutions, health care providers, educational facilities, and cultural organizations in Maryland.
innovative_summary: The bill primarily allocates funding for existing projects and infrastructure, with some grants involving matching funds and community engagement, but it does not employ new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on community development, health, and education infrastructure has the potential to impact child poverty indirectly by improving access to services and opportunities.

Title: Wicomico County Board of Education - Election of Members, Student Member, and Compensation
Synopsis: Altering, beginning with the general election in 2026, the districts from which certain members of the Wicomico County Board of Education are elected; adding at least one student member from the 11th or 12th grade in good standing and regularly enrolled in the public school system to the county board for purposes of advising the county board on the thoughts and feelings of students in the County public schools; and providing that the members of the county board are entitled to certain compensation and reimbursement.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the election districts for the Wicomico County Board of Education, adds at least one student member to the board, and sets compensation and reimbursement rules for members.
responsible_party: Wicomico County Board of Education
stakeholders: Students, Wicomico County residents, and local education stakeholders
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a student member to the county board and establishes procedures for their selection and participation, which is a relatively innovative approach to student engagement in local governance.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to impact child poverty by increasing student representation and engagement in education policy decisions.

Title: Gaming - Sports Wagering Facilities - Request for Relocation
Synopsis: Authorizing certain sports wagering facility licensees to submit a written request to the State Lottery and Gaming Control Commission to relocate the sports wagering facility if the facility was originally issued a Class B sports wagering facility license on or before September 30, 2023, and the new location is in the same county, complies with certain location requirements, and is approved by the Sports Wagering Application Review Commission.
bill_summary: This bill allows certain sports wagering facility licensees in Maryland to submit a written request to relocate their facility within the same county, subject to specific conditions and approvals.
responsible_party: Maryland State Lottery and Gaming Control Commission
stakeholders: Sports wagering facility licensees and their customers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a process for the flexible relocation of sports wagering facilities within the same county, streamlining operations and potentially improving service delivery.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily pertains to the regulation and relocation of sports wagering facilities.

Title: Barbers and Cosmetologists - License Qualifications - Domestic Violence Awareness Training
Synopsis: Requiring the State Board of Barbers and the State Board of Cosmetologists, beginning October 1, 2025, to require as a condition for licensure and initial renewal of a license an applicant or a licensee to complete certain training in domestic violence awareness; requiring the Maryland Department of Labor to approve certain domestic violence awareness training that is offered in person and virtually, includes guidance on certain topics, and has a duration of at least 1 hour; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland State Board of Barbers and the State Board of Cosmetologists to include a one-hour domestic violence awareness training as a qualification for licensing and license renewal for barbers, cosmetologists, and related practitioners. The training must be developed and approved by the Maryland Department of Labor and be offered free of charge.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor, State Board of Barbers, State Board of Cosmetologists
stakeholders: Barbers, cosmetologists, and related licensees in Maryland; domestic violence victims and the general public
innovative_summary: The bill employs a new approach by integrating domestic violence awareness training into licensing requirements for personal care professionals, utilizing both in-person and virtual formats, and providing the training free of charge.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by increasing awareness and support for domestic violence victims, which can indirectly benefit children in those households.

Title: Maryland Higher Education Commission - Academic Program Approval - Revisions
Synopsis: Requiring certain nonpublic institutions of higher education to submit a certain letter of intent regarding intended new graduate level programs to the Maryland Higher Education Commission in a certain manner and every 6 months; repealing a provision of law that required the Commission to circulate certain letters of intent; repealing a certain provision of law that limited which institutions of higher education could propose or implement certain academic programs for certain graduate level programs under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: The bill revises the process for approving new graduate programs at higher education institutions in Maryland, including requiring institutions to submit letters of intent every 6 months, and updates the criteria and procedures for program approval and collaboration, especially for emerging workforce needs.
responsible_party: Maryland Higher Education Commission
stakeholders: Higher education institutions, students, workforce development agencies, and regional industries in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured, collaborative approach to developing emerging workforce programs, including regular submission of letters of intent and enhanced coordination among institutions, leveraging strategic planning and feedback mechanisms.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to impact child poverty by aligning higher education programs with workforce needs, thereby improving employment opportunities for graduates.

Title: Real Property - Holding Over - Expedited Hearing and Service of Summons for Active Duty Service Members
Synopsis: Requiring the District Court to hold a hearing on a tenant holding over within 45 days after a landlord makes a complaint if the landlord or the landlord's spouse is on active duty with the United States military; and authorizing a private process server to serve a certain summons if the constable or sheriff of the county fails to serve the summons within 10 days after the summons is issued by the court.
bill_summary: This bill expedites court hearings and modifies service procedures for tenants on active military duty who are holding over after their lease ends, including allowing private process servers to serve summons under certain conditions.
responsible_party: Maryland District Court and local law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Active duty military service members, landlords, tenants, and legal system entities in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a faster hearing process for active military service members and allows private process servers to serve summons, employing new approaches to legal procedures.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on legal procedures for tenants and landlords.

Title: Real Property - Wrongful Detainer - Time of Hearing and Service of Process
Synopsis: Altering provisions relating to wrongful detainer actions, including requirements for summonses, hearing, and judgments.
bill_summary: This bill criminalizes fraudulent possession or claiming of residential real property, establishes procedures for owners to remove fraudulent possessors through affidavits and sheriff actions, and modifies the process for wrongful detainer actions including hearings, service, and appeals.
responsible_party: Maryland State Court System and Law Enforcement Agencies
stakeholders: Residential property owners, tenants, and individuals involved in property disputes in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new process for property owners to swiftly remove individuals fraudulently in possession of residential property using affidavits and sheriff actions, and streamlines wrongful detainer procedures with specific timelines and service methods.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily affecting property rights and legal procedures.

Title: Department of General Services - Identification Cards - Veteran Status Notation
Synopsis: Authorizing the Department of General Services to include a notation on a certain identification card indicating that the holder is a veteran under certain circumstances; requiring the Department to obtain the consent of a certain holder of an identification card before transmitting certain information to a certain executive agency; and prohibiting the Department from transmitting certain information obtained on an application for an identification card except under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Department of General Services to include a notation on identification cards indicating veteran status, with the individual's consent, and sets rules for transmitting veteran information to executive agencies.
responsible_party: Department of General Services
stakeholders: Veterans and state government agencies
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new way for veterans to have their status recognized on official ID cards and controls the sharing of this information, employing a targeted approach to veteran recognition.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on veteran identification and information sharing.

Title: Funeral Establishments, Crematories, and Reduction Facilities - Disposition of Unclaimed Remains - Veterans
Synopsis: Requiring a licensed funeral establishment, crematory operator, or reduction facility to take certain actions if a certain veterans service organization does not take possession of certain unclaimed cremains, hydrolyzed remains, or soil remains that qualify for a plot in a veterans cemetery within a certain period of time.
bill_summary: The bill requires funeral establishments, crematories, and reduction facilities to notify veterans service organizations about unclaimed remains of veterans or their dependents after 90 days. If the remains are identified as those of a veteran or eligible dependent, they may be transferred to a veterans service organization for disposition. If not claimed within 10 days, the remains are to be transferred to the Department of Veterans and Military Families for proper disposition, including burial in a veterans cemetery.
responsible_party: Department of Veterans and Military Families
stakeholders: Veterans, their families, funeral establishments, crematories, and reduction facilities in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a coordinated process involving identification and transfer of unclaimed veteran remains to ensure respectful disposition, integrating veterans organizations into the process.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on the disposition of veteran remains.

Title: Health Occupations Boards - Notation of Veteran Status and Eligibility for Benefits
Synopsis: Authorizing health occupations boards to include a notation indicating veteran status on a license, certificate, registration, or public profile.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Maryland health occupations boards to create a process for indicating veteran status on licenses, certificates, or registrations, and to assist in determining eligibility for veterans benefits.
responsible_party: Maryland health occupations boards
stakeholders: Veterans seeking health occupation licenses and certifications in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new process for health boards to recognize veteran status and facilitate benefits eligibility, leveraging existing documentation and electronic communication.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on veteran recognition within health professions.

Title: Chesapeake Conservation Corps Program - Renaming
Synopsis: Renaming the Chesapeake Conservation Corps Program to be the Thomas V. Mike Miller, Jr. Chesapeake Conservation and Climate Corps Program.
bill_summary: The bill renames the Chesapeake Conservation Corps Program to the Thomas V. Mike Miller, Jr., Chesapeake Conservation and Climate Corps Program, in honor of the long-serving Maryland Senate President, and continues its funding and activities related to environmental and energy conservation projects.
responsible_party: Chesapeake Bay Trust
stakeholders: Environmental conservation organizations, program participants, and the general public interested in Chesapeake Bay and climate initiatives
innovative_summary: The program employs a community-based approach to environmental conservation, engaging citizens of all ages in hands-on projects and volunteer activities, with a focus on climate and natural resource protection.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by providing environmental education and volunteer opportunities that can benefit communities, but it is primarily focused on conservation.

Title: Criminal Law - Animal Abuse or Neglect - Penalties
Synopsis: Prohibiting a person from committing a violation of the prohibition against abusing or neglecting an animal that results in the death of a domestic animal or livestock or the need to euthanize the domestic animal or livestock; providing that a person who violates the Act is guilty of a misdemeanor and on conviction is subject to imprisonment for up to 1 year or a fine of up to $5,000 or both; and authorizing a court to impost certain conditions of sentencing and probation.
bill_summary: This bill enhances penalties for animal abuse or neglect that results in the death or euthanasia of an animal, and authorizes courts to prohibit offenders from owning or residing with animals for a period of time. It also establishes new legal consequences and court conditions for violations.
responsible_party: Maryland judicial system (courts)
stakeholders: Individuals convicted of animal abuse or neglect, animals, and the general public concerned with animal welfare
innovative_summary: The bill introduces stricter penalties and court-ordered restrictions on offenders, including prohibition from owning animals, but does not employ new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Department of the Environment - Notation of Veteran Status
Synopsis: Authorizing the Department of the Environment to establish a certain process in collaboration with one or more boards under the Department's direction and control that requires a board to include a notation indicating veteran status on a professional license or certificate.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Department of the Environment to establish a process in collaboration with relevant boards to include a notation of veteran status on professional licenses or certificates and to assist in determining eligibility for veterans benefits.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Veterans applying for professional licenses and certificates in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program introduces a new process for recognizing veteran status on professional licenses and certificates, facilitating veterans' access to benefits and recognition.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on veteran recognition and benefits.

Title: Election Law - Absentee Ballots - Notice to Request Application
Synopsis: Requiring the local board of elections to send a written notice regarding a request for a State-approved absentee ballot application with a specimen ballot and any other mailings to voters and eligible voters to further awareness of the option of mail-in voting, except under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland local election boards to include a written notice on how to request an absentee ballot with certain mailings to voters at least 60 days before each statewide primary election, unless the voter has permanent absentee ballot status or other exceptions apply.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Voters in Maryland, especially those interested in absentee voting
innovative_summary: The bill employs a straightforward informational approach to increase awareness of absentee voting options through mandated notices.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly focuses on election notice procedures.

Title: Boating Accidents - Reporting Requirement - Property Damage
Synopsis: Specifying that property damage that results from an accident that involves any vessel subject to the State Boat Act while on the waters of the State includes damage to navigational aid markers, lights, or identifiers for purposes of a certain reporting requirement.
bill_summary: This bill amends Maryland law to specify that property damage resulting from certain boating accidents includes damage to navigational aid markers, lights, or identifiers, and updates the reporting requirements for such accidents.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Boaters, maritime authorities, and navigational aid providers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill clarifies and expands existing boating accident reporting requirements, but does not introduce new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Maryland Public Ethics Law - School Boards - Compliance Certification
Synopsis: Requiring each school board to certify to the State Ethics Commission, on or before October 1 each year, that the school board is in compliance with certain requirements of the Maryland Public Ethics Law.
bill_summary: The bill requires each school board in Maryland to annually certify to the State Ethics Commission that it is in compliance with the Maryland Public Ethics Law, with the certification due by October 1 each year, starting from October 1, 2025.
responsible_party: Maryland State Ethics Commission
stakeholders: School boards, school officials, and employees in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a mandatory annual compliance certification process for school boards to ensure adherence to ethics laws, which is a standard regulatory approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it mainly focuses on ethics compliance for school boards.

Title: Maryland Department of Labor - Licenses - Notation of Veteran Status and Eligibility for Benefits
Synopsis: Authorizing units in the Maryland Department of Labor to establish a certain process to include a notation of veteran status on an occupational license.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes units in the Maryland Department of Labor to establish a process for including a notation of veteran status on occupational licenses and to assist in determining eligibility for veterans' benefits.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Veterans applying for occupational licenses in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a new approach by integrating veteran status notation directly into occupational licenses and facilitating communication with veterans' benefit agencies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on veteran recognition and benefits.

Title: Boating Accidents - Duty to Stop at the Scene, Render Assistance, and Provide Information - Penalties
Synopsis: Requiring the operator of a vessel involved in a collision, accident, or other casualty stop the vessel as close as possible to the scene of the collision, accident, or casualty until the operator has rendered certain assistance and provided certain information; establishing certain criminal penalties for the operator of a vessel involved in a collision, accident, or other casualty who does not take certain actions in violation of the Act of imprisonment of up to 2 months or a fine not to exceed $500 or both; etc.
bill_summary: This bill updates Maryland law to require vessel operators involved in collisions, accidents, or casualties to stop near the scene, render assistance, and provide their information. It establishes penalties for failing to do so, including fines and imprisonment, and mandates reporting requirements for certain accidents.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Vessel operators, boaters, accident victims, property owners
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates legal requirements and penalties for vessel operators involved in accidents, with no new technology or innovative approaches introduced.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, focusing on vessel accident laws.

Title: State Board of Stationary Engineers - Member Appointments - Advice and Consent of the Senate
Synopsis: Providing that the Governor appoint members of the State Board of Stationary Engineers with the advice and consent of the Senate.
bill_summary: The bill amends the process for appointing members of the State Board of Stationary Engineers, requiring the Governor to appoint members with the advice and consent of the Senate.
responsible_party: State of Maryland, Department of Business Occupations and Professions
stakeholders: Stationary engineers, boiler industry representatives, boiler owners, consumers, and the Chief Boiler Inspector in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates appointment procedures for the State Board of Stationary Engineers, which is a standard governance process, not an innovative program.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Access to Counsel in Evictions - Task Force and Special Fund
Synopsis: Extending through fiscal year 2028 distributions by the Comptroller from funds gained from abandoned property in the State to the Access to Counsel in Evictions Special Fund; altering the staff and duties of the Access to Counsel in Evictions Task Force; and extending through fiscal year 2028 an annual $14,000,000 appropriation by the Governor from the Access to Counsel in Evictions Special Fund to the Maryland Legal Services Corporation.
bill_summary: The bill extends and makes permanent the requirement for the Comptroller to distribute funds from abandoned property to the Access to Counsel in Evictions Special Fund, and allocates $14 million annually from these funds to support legal representation for tenants facing eviction in Maryland. It establishes the Access to Counsel in Evictions Program, administered by the Maryland Legal Services Corporation, to provide legal services to low-income tenants, and creates a Task Force to evaluate and improve the program.
responsible_party: Maryland Legal Services Corporation (MLSC)
stakeholders: Low-income tenants facing eviction in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a dedicated fund and a specialized task force to systematically improve access to legal representation for tenants, representing a structured and targeted approach to addressing eviction issues.
child_poverty_direct_summary: High potential for impact on child poverty by stabilizing housing for low-income families and preventing homelessness.

Title: Agriculture - Departmental Authority Over Identification, Inspection, and Sale of Cantaloupes - Repeal
Synopsis: Repealing the Department of Agriculture's authority over the identification, inspection, and sale of cantaloupes.
bill_summary: This bill repeals the Maryland Department of Agriculture's authority over the identification, inspection, and sale of cantaloupes, effectively removing regulations related to cantaloupe oversight.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Agriculture
stakeholders: Cantaloupe growers, sellers, and consumers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill simplifies existing regulations by removing a specific regulatory authority, which is a straightforward legal change rather than an innovative program.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Health – General Article – References to Mental Health
Synopsis: Replacing references to mental hygiene with references to mental health in certain provisions of law governing public health; establishing that, by July 1, 2027, the Department of Health shall conduct a thorough review of Department regulations and adopt regulations to ensure consistency with the Act; and requiring the Department to update all public-facing electronic materials to be consistent with the Act as soon as practicable.
bill_summary: The bill updates legal references from 'mental hygiene' to 'mental health' in Maryland law, establishes a fund for community-based mental health services funded by proceeds from downsizing or closing mental health facilities, and requires a review and update of regulations and materials to reflect the terminology change.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals with mental health needs, mental health service providers, and the general public in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates terminology and establishes a fund for community-based mental health services, which is a standard approach rather than an innovative one.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but may improve mental health services for affected populations.

Title: Confined Aquatic Disposal Cells - Construction - Moratorium
Synopsis: Prohibiting the Department of the Environment from processing or making any recommendation on a certain application submitted for the purpose of constructing a confined aquatic disposal cell from June 1, 2025, through May 31, 2029; and prohibiting the Board of Public Works from approving a certain application submitted for the purpose of constructing a confined aquatic disposal cell from June 1, 2025, through May 31, 2029.
bill_summary: The bill imposes a moratorium on the processing and approval of applications for constructing confined aquatic disposal cells within 5 miles of residential overburdened communities in Maryland from June 1, 2025, to May 31, 2029.
responsible_party: Department of the Environment and the Board of Public Works
stakeholders: Residents of residential overburdened communities, environmental agencies, and organizations involved in dredging and disposal activities
innovative_summary: The bill employs a temporary moratorium approach to prevent construction of confined aquatic disposal cells near vulnerable communities, focusing on environmental justice and community health.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but may indirectly benefit vulnerable communities by reducing environmental health risks.

Title: Maryland Veterans Trust - Board of Trustees - Membership
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the Board of Trustees of the Maryland Veterans Trust to include the Secretary of Disabilities or the Secretary's designee.
bill_summary: This bill amends the membership of the Maryland Veterans Trust Board of Trustees to include the Secretary of Disabilities as a member.
responsible_party: Maryland Veterans Trust Board of Trustees
stakeholders: Veterans and individuals with disabilities in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates the composition of an existing board, which is a standard governance change, not an innovative program.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty or include programs aimed at reducing it.

Title: Correctional Services - Geriatric and Medical Parole
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Parole Commission to consider the age of  incarcerated individuals when determining whether to grant parole; altering how the Commission evaluates a request for medical parole, including providing for a meeting between the incarcerated individual and the Commission; requiring the Commission to develop procedures for assessing parole requests by older incarcerated individuals; requiring the Commission to report yearly to the Justice Reinvestment Oversight Board on the outcomes of certain parole considerations; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Parole Commission to consider the age of incarcerated individuals when determining parole eligibility, especially for geriatric and medically incapacitated prisoners. It establishes procedures for medical parole requests, including meetings and risk assessments, and expands eligibility criteria for geriatric parole. The bill also authorizes the use of savings from reduced incarceration to fund parole and reentry programs, including hiring psychologists for geriatric parole assessments.
responsible_party: Maryland Parole Commission and Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Incarcerated individuals, especially elderly and medically incapacitated prisoners, and the criminal justice system in Maryland.
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach to geriatric and medical parole, including risk assessments, medical evaluations, and targeted funding for specialized parole services, integrating health and safety considerations with parole processes.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on parole procedures for elderly and medically incapacitated prisoners.

Title: Maryland Veterans Service Animal Program - Eligibility - Family Members of Veterans
Synopsis: Expanding eligibility for the Maryland Veterans Service Animal Program to include a spouse or dependent of an eligible veteran.
bill_summary: The bill expands the eligibility for the Maryland Veterans Service Animal Program to include spouses and dependents of eligible veterans, and establishes a fund to support training and therapy services involving service dogs, support dogs, and therapy horses for veterans and their families.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Veterans Affairs
stakeholders: Veterans and their families in Maryland, including spouses and dependents of eligible veterans
innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive approach combining animal-assisted therapy, training, and outreach, with a dedicated fund and partnerships with nonprofit training entities, utilizing a holistic and community-based approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to improve mental health and well-being among veterans and their families, which can indirectly benefit children in those families, but it does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Board of Trustees of the Maryland Teachers and State Employees Supplemental Retirement Plans - Renaming
Synopsis: Renaming the Board of Trustees of the Maryland Teachers and State Employees Supplemental Retirement Plans to be the Board of Trustees of the Maryland State Employees Supplemental Retirement Plans; and providing that the Board of Trustees of the Maryland State Employees Supplemental Retirement Plans is the successor of the Board of Trustees of the Maryland Teachers and State Employees Supplemental Retirement Plans.
bill_summary: This bill renames the Board of Trustees of the Maryland Teachers and State Employees Supplemental Retirement Plans to the Board of Trustees of the Maryland State Employees Supplemental Retirement Plans, and clarifies that the successor board assumes all related powers, obligations, and properties.
responsible_party: Maryland State Department of Budget and Management or relevant State agency overseeing retirement plans
stakeholders: State employees, teachers, and retirees involved in the Maryland State Employees and Teachers Supplemental Retirement Plans
innovative_summary: The bill primarily involves administrative renaming and legal clarifications, with no new technologies or innovative approaches introduced.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty, as it pertains to retirement plan administration for state employees.

Title: Property Tax - Deadline to Set County and Municipal Corporation Tax Rates - Alteration
Synopsis: Altering, from July 1 to June 20, the deadline by which the governing body of a county or municipal corporation is required to set its property tax rate for the next taxable year.
bill_summary: The bill changes the deadline by which counties and municipal corporations in Maryland must set their property tax rates for the upcoming taxable year, moving the deadline to June 1.
responsible_party: Maryland counties and municipal governments
stakeholders: County and municipal residents, property owners
innovative_summary: This bill primarily modifies existing legal deadlines for setting property tax rates, which is a procedural change rather than an innovative program.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty, as it focuses on tax rate setting procedures.

Title: Drunk and Drug-Impaired Driving and Failure to Remain at the Scene - Revocation of Driver's License
Synopsis: Requiring the Motor Vehicle Administration to revoke the driver's license of a person who has been convicted of impaired driving that contributes to an accident, or fails to remain at the scene of an accident, that results in the death or life-threatening injury to another person; and authorizing a person whose driver's license is revoked under the Act or for homicide by motor vehicle while impaired to apply for license reinstatement after a certain period of time.
bill_summary: The bill mandates the revocation of a driver's license for individuals convicted of or granted probation before judgment for impaired driving that causes death or life-threatening injury, or for failing to remain at the scene of an accident resulting in death or injury. It also establishes procedures for license reinstatement after revocation and links license revocation to participation in the Ignition Interlock System Program.
responsible_party: Maryland Motor Vehicle Administration
stakeholders: Drivers convicted of impaired driving or involved in fatal or injury-causing accidents
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach linking license revocation to participation in the Ignition Interlock System Program, integrating legal consequences with technological safety measures.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on legal and safety procedures for impaired driving.

Title: Cannabis Reform - Revisions
Synopsis: Extending the time period from July 1, 2025, to July 1, 2026, during which a holder of a certain cannabis dispensary license may continue to deliver medical cannabis; limiting application submissions for on-site consumption licenses to social equity applicants under certain circumstances; authorizing a political subdivision to establish hours of operation for on-site consumption establishments; providing that a certain food sales exemption from the sales and use tax does not apply to the sale of certain cannabinoid beverages; etc.
bill_summary: The bill reforms Maryland's cannabis laws by extending medical cannabis delivery, establishing on-site consumption licenses, regulating cannabis events, and setting rules for cannabis sales and licensing, with a focus on social equity.
responsible_party: Maryland Cannabis Administration
stakeholders: Cannabis consumers, social equity applicants, cannabis businesses, local governments, and event organizers
innovative_summary: The bill introduces new approaches such as cannabis event permits, vendor permits, and on-site consumption licenses, employing technology for registration and regulation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but promotes social equity in cannabis licensing.

Title: Workers' Compensation - Payment From Uninsured Employers' Fund - Revisions
Synopsis: Authorizing the Worker's Compensation Commission to offset or credit against an award certain benefits paid by the Uninsured Employer's Fund; requiring the Workers' Compensation Commission to make the Fund a party to a claim filed against an uninsured employer; authorizing a covered employee or the dependents of a covered employee to apply to the Director of the Fund for payment from the Fund;  requiring the Fund to pay certain additional awards under certain circumstances; etc.
bill_summary: This bill revises the procedures and rules for the Uninsured Employers' Fund in Maryland's workers' compensation system, including how benefits are paid, how claims are handled, and the responsibilities of the Fund and employers.
responsible_party: Maryland Workers' Compensation Commission
stakeholders: Uninsured employers, covered employees, and their dependents in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces new procedures for the Fund to pay claims directly and to be involved as a party in claims against uninsured employers, streamlining the process and clarifying responsibilities.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has potential to reduce child poverty by ensuring injured workers or their dependents receive timely compensation, which can support families.

Title: Limited Line Credit Insurance - Qualification of Applicants
Synopsis: Altering certain requirements relating to programs of instruction for applicants for certain limited lines credit insurance licenses; and requiring the insurer that provides the program of instruction to retain records relating to the program of instruction while in use and for a period of at least 5 years after its last use.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland insurance law to modify requirements for programs of instruction for applicants seeking limited lines credit insurance licenses, including record-keeping and program design, and clarifies examination exemptions.
responsible_party: Maryland Insurance Administration
stakeholders: Applicants for limited lines credit insurance licenses and insurers providing instruction programs
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates existing licensing and instruction requirements with a focus on record-keeping and program design, without introducing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly concerns licensing procedures for insurance producers.

Title: State Government - Public Employee Relations Act - Alterations
Synopsis: Repealing the condition that must be met for a certain exclusive representative to meet with a new employee by video or similar technology; altering certain requirements for the deputy directors appointed by the Public Employee Relations Board; and altering certain procedures regarding the timing of exclusive representation elections.
bill_summary: The bill makes changes to Maryland's Public Employee Relations Act, including allowing new employees to meet with their representatives via video if public health concerns require remote meetings, clarifying the rights of employee organizations regarding membership dues deductions, and altering procedures for labor relations and elections.
responsible_party: Public Employee Relations Board
stakeholders: Public employees, employee organizations, public employers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces the option for remote meetings between new employees and their representatives via video technology, which is a modern approach to labor relations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's provisions are unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Department of the Environment - Fees, Penalties, Funding, and Regulation
Synopsis: Altering the authorized uses of the Maryland Clean Air Fund to include certain activities relating to mitigating and reducing air pollution in the State; authorizing the Department of the Environment to charge a fee for processing and issuing on-site sewage disposal permits and individual well construction permits under certain circumstances; requiring a holder of a license to transfer oil into the State to pay a certain fee when oil owned by the licensee is first transferred into the State; establishing the Private Dam Repair Fund; etc.
bill_summary: This bill makes various changes to environmental funding, fees, and regulations in Maryland, including expanding the uses of the Maryland Clean Air Fund, establishing a Private Dam Repair Fund, and updating permit and registration fees for environmental activities and infrastructure.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Environmental agencies, private dam owners, permit applicants, local governments, and residents affected by environmental regulations
innovative_summary: The bill introduces new funds, adjusts fees, and enhances regulatory oversight, including the creation of a Private Dam Repair Fund and new fee structures, employing a comprehensive approach to environmental management.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on environmental funding and infrastructure may indirectly benefit child populations through improved environmental quality, but it does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Controlled Hazardous Substance Facility Permit - Research Facilities - Chemical Warfare Material Requirements
Synopsis: Providing that certain provisions of law regarding chemical warfare material requirements under a controlled hazardous substance facility permit do not apply to the incineration of chemical warfare materials at a certain research facility if the incineration is done for research, development, or demonstration purposes; and establishing additional requirements applicable to research, development, and demonstration permits issued for the incineration of chemical warfare materials at a research facility.
bill_summary: The bill regulates the incineration of chemical warfare materials at research facilities in Maryland, establishing safety, monitoring, and emergency planning requirements, and authorizing special permits for research, development, and demonstration purposes.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Research facilities handling chemical warfare materials, local communities near such facilities, environmental and public health agencies
innovative_summary: The bill introduces specialized permits and rigorous monitoring requirements for the incineration of chemical warfare materials, including real-time emissions monitoring and public participation in emergency planning, representing a significant regulatory approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on environmental safety and hazardous waste management.

Title: Election Law - Local Boards of Elections - Election Plan Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring a local board of elections to submit an election plan to the State Board of Elections for approval at least 7 months before each statewide primary election; establishing requirements related to an election plan; and altering the requirements related to polling place plans, ballot drop box plans, and early voting center plans.
bill_summary: The bill updates election planning requirements for Maryland's local boards of elections, including submission timelines, detailed plans for polling places, ballot drop boxes, and early voting centers, and enhances public notification and participation in election planning processes.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Voters in Maryland, especially those in historically disenfranchised communities
innovative_summary: The bill introduces comprehensive planning and public engagement processes for election infrastructure, including detailed analysis of voter access and participation strategies, and uses technology for public notifications and feedback.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has potential to improve voting access for all communities, including disadvantaged groups, which can contribute to reducing child poverty by increasing civic participation and representation.

Title: Maryland Tort Claims Act - Employees of an Office of a Sheriff
Synopsis: Providing that an employee of the office of a sheriff of a county or Baltimore City is immune from liability under the Maryland Tort Claims Act in the same manner as a sheriff or deputy sheriff.
bill_summary: The bill extends liability immunity to employees of the office of a sheriff of a county or Baltimore City, similar to the immunity already granted to sheriffs and deputy sheriffs, under the Maryland Tort Claims Act.
responsible_party: Maryland State Government
stakeholders: Employees of sheriff's offices, sheriffs, deputy sheriffs, and the general public in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates legal liability protections for sheriff's office employees, which is a legal clarification rather than an innovative technological or approach-based program.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty, as it focuses on legal liability protections for law enforcement employees.

Title: Baltimore City - Alcoholic Beverages - Hours of Operation Violations - Civil Penalties
Synopsis: Establishing for a first offense by a holder of an alcoholic beverages license in Baltimore City of operating the licensed premises outside specified hours of operation without obtaining a certain exemption a fine of not less than $1,000 or suspension of the license or both, and for a second or subsequent offense a fine of not less than $2,000 and not more than $20,000 or suspension of the license or both.
bill_summary: The bill establishes civil penalties for alcohol license holders in Baltimore City who operate outside the permitted hours without an exemption, including fines and license suspensions for violations.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Alcoholic Beverages Board
stakeholders: Alcohol license holders, Baltimore City residents, local businesses
innovative_summary: The bill primarily enforces existing regulations with increased penalties; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it mainly addresses licensing violations and penalties.

Title: Maryland Protecting Opportunities and Regional Trade (PORT) Act - Reports of Attorney General - Frequency
Synopsis: Altering from each month to every 6 months the frequency with which the Attorney General is required to report to the General Assembly regarding the status of the recovery of economic damages arising from the closure of the Helen Delich Bentley Port of Baltimore and the collapse of the Francis Scott Key Bridge; and requiring the Attorney General to pursue all available options, including filing actions against the applicable parties, to recover all possible economic damages arising from the Port closure and the Bridge collapse.
bill_summary: The bill amends previous legislation to change the reporting frequency of the Maryland Attorney General regarding the recovery of economic damages from the collapse of the Francis Scott Key Bridge and the closure of the Port of Baltimore. It requires the Attorney General to report every six months starting July 1, 2024, until all damages are recovered or the process is resolved.
responsible_party: Attorney General of Maryland
stakeholders: State of Maryland, residents and businesses affected by the Port closure and bridge collapse
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates reporting requirements and does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Financial Institutions and Activities - Virtual Currency Kiosks - Registration and Regulation
Synopsis: Establishing registration and operating requirements for a virtual currency kiosk operator to operate a virtual currency kiosk in the State; authorizing the Commissioner of Financial Regulation to investigate and enforce the Act in a certain manner; and authorizing the Commissioner to assess against a virtual currency kiosk operator a civil penalty not to exceed $1,000 for each knowing and willful violation  of the Act.
bill_summary: This bill establishes registration, operational, and regulatory requirements for virtual currency kiosks and their operators in Maryland, including registration procedures, transaction limits, disclosure requirements, and enforcement powers.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor, Commissioner of Financial Regulation
stakeholders: Virtual currency kiosk operators and users in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive regulatory framework for virtual currency kiosks, including registration, disclosure, and enforcement, integrating new regulations into existing financial oversight structures.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on financial regulation and consumer protection.

Title: Election Law – Chief Election Judges – Party Affiliation
Synopsis: Requiring the election director of a local board of elections to designate chief election judges from certain political parties to each polling place except under certain circumstances; and requiring an election director who is unable to designate chief judges for a polling place at least 45 days before the start of early voting to make a certain designation in a certain manner.
bill_summary: The bill requires local election boards in Maryland to designate chief election judges from specific political parties at each polling place, with certain exceptions, to promote party representation and fairness in elections.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board of Elections
stakeholders: Voters, election officials, political parties in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a structured approach to ensure political party representation among election judges, but does not introduce new technologies or novel methods.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on election administration procedures.

Title: Department of Veterans and Military Families - Communications, Outreach, and Advocacy Program - Alterations
Synopsis: Requiring the Communications, Outreach, and Advocacy Program in the Department of Veterans and Military Families to expand certain services to include service members and their families; and requiring the Secretary of Veterans and Military Families to submit an annual report by December 1 each year to the Governor and the General Assembly that includes a general assessment of communication methods utilized in support of the Communications, Outreach, and Advocacy Program.
bill_summary: This bill requires the Maryland Department of Veterans and Military Families to establish and maintain an online registry for veterans, service members, and interested individuals to access information about available services, benefits, and news. It also expands the department's outreach and communication efforts to better inform and assist these populations.
responsible_party: Department of Veterans and Military Families
stakeholders: Veterans, service members, military families, and interested individuals in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a new online registry system to improve access to information and services for veterans and military families, integrating shareable data and modern communication methods.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving access to benefits and services for military families, which can alleviate financial hardships.

Title: Education - Youth Suicide Prevention School Program - Revisions
Synopsis: Altering the requirements of the Youth Suicide Prevention School Program to increase pupil awareness of the relationship between gambling and youth suicide.
bill_summary: The bill revises the Maryland Youth Suicide Prevention School Program to include increased awareness of the link between gambling and youth suicide, and emphasizes recognizing behavioral health issues, trauma, and violence among students.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education
stakeholders: Students, school personnel, community mental health agencies, parents, and youth involved in gambling activities
innovative_summary: The program incorporates new focus on gambling's impact on youth mental health and suicide prevention, integrating behavioral health recognition and community partnership strategies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to directly impact child poverty by addressing mental health and behavioral issues that can affect educational and social outcomes.

Title: Natural Resources - Canada Geese - Bag Limits
Synopsis: Requiring, during the migratory Canada goose (Atlantic population) hunting season, the bag limit for all Canada geese in certain areas of  the State, including geese found in the Atlantic Flyway Resident Population Hunt Zone and the Atlantic Population Hunt Zone, to conform to the bag limit for Atlantic population Canada geese adopted annually by the Department of the Interior's U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service.
