bill_summary: This bill requires that during the migratory Canada goose hunting season, the bag limit for all Canada geese in certain areas of Maryland conform to the annual bag limit set by the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Hunters and wildlife management authorities in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill aligns state hunting regulations with federal standards for migratory Canada geese, ensuring consistency across jurisdictions.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Baltimore County - Speed Monitoring Systems - Interstate 695 and Interstate 83
Synopsis: Authorizing the State Highway Administration to place and use not more than four speed monitoring systems on Interstate 695 and Interstate 83 in Baltimore County subject to notice requirements; requiring that fines collected in Baltimore County as a result of violations enforced by speed monitoring systems on Interstate 695 and Interstate 83 be used to recover costs and assist in covering the cost of roadway and safety improvements on Interstate 695 and Interstate 83 in Baltimore County; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland State Highway Administration to place and operate speed monitoring systems on Interstate 695 and Interstate 83 in Baltimore County, Maryland. It establishes that fines collected from violations recorded by these systems will be used to recover costs and fund roadway and safety improvements. The bill also sets procedures for issuing citations, handling violations, and reporting on the program's effectiveness.
responsible_party: Maryland State Highway Administration
stakeholders: Drivers and residents in Baltimore County, Maryland, especially those traveling on Interstate 695 and Interstate 83
innovative_summary: The program employs automated speed monitoring systems with specific procedures for calibration, operation, and enforcement, integrating technology with legal processes to improve traffic safety.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on roadway safety and infrastructure funding may indirectly benefit communities, but it does not directly target child poverty.

Title: Baltimore City - Raffles - Organizations Affiliated With a Professional Major League Baseball Team
Synopsis: Authorizing certain organizations that are affiliated with a professional major league baseball team that plays its home games in Baltimore City to conduct certain raffles; requiring the organization to obtain a permit to conduct raffles from an agency designated by the Baltimore City government; providing that a permit to hold certain raffles expires at the end of the calendar year in which the permit was issued; requiring that raffle tickets are sold using age-verification measures to ensure the buyer is at least 18; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes organizations affiliated with professional Major League Baseball teams that play in Baltimore City to conduct raffles, including specific rules for selling tickets and using electronic devices within certain geographic boundaries.
responsible_party: Designated City Agency in Baltimore City
stakeholders: Organizations affiliated with professional Major League Baseball teams in Baltimore City and their supporters
innovative_summary: The program employs geofencing technology and electronic device measures to regulate raffle sales within specific geographic areas, representing a technological approach to raffle regulation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on raffle regulations for specific organizations.

Title: Revenge Porn - Definition of Visual Representation and Civil Action
Synopsis: Authorizing a person to bring and maintain a civil action for defamation against another who distributes a computer-generated visual representation that is indistinguishable from an actual visual representation of the person and is of a sexual or intimate nature; and prohibiting a person from knowingly distributing a certain computer-generated visual representation of another under certain circumstances.
bill_summary: The bill defines and criminalizes the distribution of computer-generated visual representations of individuals that depict them with exposed intimate parts or engaged in sexual activity without consent, often referred to as revenge porn. It allows victims to bring civil actions for defamation or invasion of privacy and sets penalties for offenders.
responsible_party: Maryland Judiciary and law enforcement agencies
stakeholders: Individuals depicted in visual representations, victims of revenge porn, law enforcement, and the judiciary system
innovative_summary: The bill employs advanced definitions of computer-generated visual representations and establishes specific legal protections and civil remedies for victims, reflecting a modern approach to digital privacy and harassment issues.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty or include programs aimed at reducing it.

Title: Maryland Department of Health and Office of Health Care Quality - Nursing Home Inspections - Reporting
Synopsis: Requiring the Secretary of Health, on request of a county, to delegate to the county the authority to conduct surveys and complaint investigations of nursing homes; requiring the Maryland Department of Health to execute a certain memorandum of understanding with a requesting county within 90 days; and requiring that the Maryland Department of Health and counties equally share the costs of conducting surveys delegated by the Secretary of Health.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Health to delegate authority to counties for conducting nursing home site visits, surveys, and complaint investigations upon request, and establishes reporting requirements for these activities. It also sets procedures for investigations and survey schedules, and specifies cost-sharing between the state and counties.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health and Office of Health Care Quality
stakeholders: Nursing homes, residents, families, and local health agencies in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a decentralized approach to nursing home inspections by delegating authority to counties, with structured reporting and cost-sharing, leveraging local government involvement in health oversight.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily focuses on nursing home inspection processes.

Title: Maryland Police Training and Standards Commission - Review of Report and Recommendations
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Police Training and Standards Commission to annually review a certain report published by the Independent Investigations Division of the Office of the Attorney General; and requiring the Commission to make any recommendations that the Commission determines are appropriate based on its review of the report.
bill_summary: This bill requires the Maryland Police Training and Standards Commission to annually review a report published by the Independent Investigations Division of the Office of the Attorney General and to make recommendations based on that review.
responsible_party: Maryland Police Training and Standards Commission
stakeholders: Law enforcement agencies, oversight bodies, and the public interested in police accountability
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a regular review process for oversight reports, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Public Safety Officer - Performance of Duties - Death Benefits
Synopsis: Altering circumstances under which certain individuals are presumed to have died as a direct and proximate result of an injury sustained in the performance of duties for purposes of eligibility for death benefits.
bill_summary: This bill modifies the circumstances under which public safety officers are presumed to have died due to injuries sustained in the performance of their duties, expands death and disability benefits for such officers, and establishes procedures for participation in pension systems for law enforcement, firefighters, emergency medical technicians, and 9-1-1 specialists.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Public safety officers including law enforcement, firefighters, emergency medical technicians, and 9-1-1 specialists in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a presumption of death due to duty-related injury for certain conditions and expands pension participation, which are established approaches but with some updates to criteria and procedures.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, primarily affecting the families of deceased or disabled public safety officers.

Title: Natural Resources - Wildland Areas - Overhead Transmission Lines
Synopsis: Exempting certain areas in the Big Savage Mountain Wildland, Bear Pen Wildland, and Dan's Mountain Wildland from being designated as a wildland area, subject to a certificate of public convenience and necessity being obtained for a certain transmission line; and requiring the Public Service Commission to require an applicant for a certificate of public convenience and necessity for the construction of a certain overhead transmission line to provide wildland impact mitigation guarantees.
bill_summary: The bill establishes protections for certain wildland areas in Maryland by exempting specific regions from being designated as wildlands unless certain conditions are met, and it sets requirements for the construction of overhead transmission lines, including impact mitigation and land conservation plans.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources and Public Service Commission
stakeholders: Wildland areas, local communities, environmental groups, and utility companies involved in transmission line projects
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive stakeholder process, impact mitigation guarantees, and land conservation management plans to protect wildlands during transmission line construction, integrating environmental considerations into utility regulation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but promotes environmental preservation which can benefit community well-being.

Title: Environment - Coal Combustion By-Products - Fees, Coordinating Committee, and Regulations
Synopsis: Altering the factors that the Department of the Environment is required to consider in establishing a certain fee; requiring the Department to use certain excess fees collected from certain generators of coal combustion by-products for certain purposes; establishing the Statewide Coal Combustion By-Products Coordinating Committee to share information, monitoring results, and certain remedial actions with respect to certain coal combustion by-product sites; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a minimum fee for coal combustion by-product generators, creates a statewide coordinating committee to monitor and share information on coal by-products, and mandates the Department of the Environment to adopt regulations aligning with federal guidelines for managing coal combustion residuals.
responsible_party: Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Coal combustion by-product generators, environmental agencies, public health organizations, communities near coal sites
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a coordinated state-level oversight and monitoring system for coal combustion by-products, including regular reporting and regulatory updates, employing a collaborative approach.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty but may improve environmental health and safety, indirectly benefiting children.

Title: Registered Apprenticeship Investments for a Stronger Economy (RAISE) Act
Synopsis: Altering the duties of the Maryland Apprenticeship and Training Council; repealing the Youth Apprenticeship Advisory Committee; establishing the Maryland Office of Registered Apprenticeship Development to scale registered apprenticeships across industries and occupations to meet the needs of the State's economy; establishing the Maryland Pay Per Apprentice Program within the Maryland Department of Labor; establishing the Maryland Pay Per Apprentice Program Fund as a special, nonlapsing fund; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes new programs and initiatives to promote registered apprenticeships in Maryland, including waivers for licensing exams for apprentices, creation of the Maryland Office of Registered Apprenticeship Development, a Qualified Intermediary Program, and an Incentive Pay Program for apprentices, along with related advisory boards and funding mechanisms.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor and the Division of Workforce Development and Adult Learning
stakeholders: Apprentices, employers, workforce development organizations, and youth in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach combining program development, funding, and advisory structures to expand registered apprenticeships, utilizing new organizational units and incentive programs.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to reduce child poverty by increasing workforce opportunities and skills training for youth and young adults.

Title: Criminal Records – Expungement and Maryland Judiciary Case Search (Expungement Reform Act of 2025)
Synopsis: Altering certain provisions of law relating to waiting periods for the filing of certain petitions for expungement to authorize the filing of a petition a certain amount of time after the completion of the sentence; adding to the list of misdemeanor convictions that a person may expunge under certain circumstances; prohibiting the Maryland Judiciary Case Search from in any way referring to the existence of a charge of possession of cannabis if the conviction was later pardoned by the Governor; etc.
bill_summary: The Expungement Reform Act of 2025 modifies Maryland laws regarding the timing and eligibility for expunging criminal records, expands the list of misdemeanors eligible for expungement, and restricts the Maryland Judiciary Case Search from referencing certain records, including those resulting in acquittal or dismissal.
responsible_party: Maryland Judiciary or Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Individuals with criminal records seeking expungement, the general public, and the criminal justice system
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach to criminal record expungement, including restrictions on public record searches and expanded eligibility, which is a relatively innovative approach to criminal justice reform.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has potential to reduce child poverty by improving access to employment and housing opportunities for individuals with criminal records, thereby supporting families and children.

Title: Trafficking Regulated Firearms - Felony Classification
Synopsis: Requiring that the prosecution for an offense of trafficking a regulated firearm be instituted within 3 years after the offense was committed; reclassifying the prohibition against transporting a regulated firearm into the State for the purpose of unlawfully selling or trafficking the firearm to be a felony; and establishing a penalty on conviction of imprisonment of up to 10 years or a fine of up to $25,000 or both.
bill_summary: The bill changes the legal classification and penalties related to trafficking regulated firearms in Maryland. It reclassifies certain firearm trafficking offenses as felonies and extends the statute of limitations for prosecuting straw sales and illegal firearm transactions.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Public Safety and Correctional Services
stakeholders: Law enforcement agencies, firearm traffickers, public safety organizations, and residents of Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates legal classifications and penalties; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly impact child poverty but may improve community safety.

Title: Security Guard Agencies - Special Police Officers - Application for Appointment
Synopsis: Authorizing a certain security guard agency to apply for the appointment of special police officers in order to protect property owned or leased by the security guard agency's clients.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes security guard agencies in Maryland to apply for the appointment of special police officers to protect property owned or leased by their clients, expanding the entities eligible to appoint such officers and establishing training requirements.
responsible_party: Maryland Police Training and Standards Commission and the Maryland Department of Public Safety
stakeholders: Security guard agencies, property owners, clients, and the general public in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new pathway for security guard agencies to appoint special police officers, including specific training requirements, which is a new approach to private security and law enforcement collaboration.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily concerns security and law enforcement procedures.

Title: Real Property - Unlawfully Restrictive Covenant Modifications - County or Municipality Notice Requirements
Synopsis: Altering notice requirements relating to the recordation of a restrictive covenant modification to an unlawfully restrictive covenant by authorizing a county or municipality to provide notice by publication in one or more newspapers of general circulation in the county or municipality where the property is located once per week for 4 successive weeks and on the official website of a county or municipality where the property is located.
bill_summary: The bill modifies notice requirements for counties and municipalities in Maryland to record modifications to unlawfully restrictive covenants on properties, allowing for easier removal of discriminatory restrictions.
responsible_party: Maryland counties and municipalities
stakeholders: Property owners, residents in affected neighborhoods, local governments
innovative_summary: The bill employs a new approach by requiring public notices through multiple channels, including newspapers, courthouse postings, and official websites, to facilitate the removal of unlawful restrictive covenants.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on property law and local government procedures.

Title: Home Builders - New Home Sales - Notice of Appliance Warranty Registration
Synopsis: Requiring a person registered to build a new home to provide at the time of closing for the initial sale of a new home information about the warranties for appliances registered by the person, including the date of the warranty registration and the time remaining under the warranty.
bill_summary: The bill requires home builders registered to build new homes in Maryland to provide specific warranty information about appliances, including HVAC systems, at the time of the initial sale or closing.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor, Licensing, and Regulation (or equivalent agency responsible for home building regulations)
stakeholders: Homebuyers of new homes in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a straightforward approach to improve transparency for homebuyers by mandating the disclosure of appliance warranty information at the point of sale.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly focuses on consumer information and transparency.

Title: Prince George's County - Illegal Dumping and Litter Control Law - Video Evidence and Reward Programs
Synopsis: Authorizing Prince George's County to establish a pilot program allowing a member of the public to submit video evidence of an alleged violation of the Illegal Dumping and Litter Control Law to a certain enforcement unit; requiring the program to allow a member of the public to receive a portion of fines collected in relation to the violation; and authorizing the governing body of Prince George's County to refer unpaid fines to the Central Collection Unit of the Department of Budget and Management for collection.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Prince George's County to establish a pilot program allowing the public to submit video evidence of illegal dumping and littering violations, with rewards for evidence leading to convictions. It also details how fines collected from violations are used and sets the program's duration.
responsible_party: Prince George's County government
stakeholders: Residents of Prince George's County, environmental enforcement agencies, and the general public
innovative_summary: The program employs a new approach by incentivizing the public to submit video evidence of violations, integrating community participation with enforcement efforts.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving community environments and promoting civic engagement.

Title: Business Occupations and Professions - Professional Engineers - Examination
Synopsis: Requiring an applicant for a license to practice engineering to pass an examination in the fundamentals of engineering given by the State Board for Professional Engineers before passing the required examination in the principles and practice of engineering.
bill_summary: The bill requires applicants for a professional engineering license in Maryland to pass an examination in the fundamentals of engineering before taking the exam in the principles and practice of engineering.
responsible_party: Maryland State Board for Professional Engineers
stakeholders: Aspiring professional engineers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill standardizes the licensing process by requiring a two-step examination process, which is a common practice but ensures a structured pathway for licensure.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has no direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Public Safety - Police Accountability - Time Limit for Filing Administrative Charges
Synopsis: Altering the deadline for the completion of the process of review by a certain investigating unit through disposition by an administrative charging committee under certain circumstances; requiring a law enforcement agency to file any administrative charges arising out of an investigation of alleged police officer misconduct that is not required to be reviewed by an administrative charging committee within 1 year and 1 day after the date that the appropriate official employed by the law enforcement agency became aware of the incident; etc.
bill_summary: The bill amends the procedures and deadlines for law enforcement agencies and administrative committees to review and file charges related to police misconduct, including provisions for cases involving criminal investigations.
responsible_party: Maryland law enforcement agencies and administrative charging committees
stakeholders: Police officers, law enforcement agencies, and the public affected by police misconduct investigations
innovative_summary: The bill introduces specific time limits for review and filing of charges in police misconduct cases, including cases linked to criminal investigations, streamlining accountability processes.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus is on police accountability procedures and does not directly impact child poverty.

Title: Commission to Study Health Insurance Pooling - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing the Commission to Study Health Insurance Pooling to study the pooling of public employee health insurance purchasing between the State, counties, municipal corporations, and county boards of education in the State to maximize value and efficiency while maintaining a broad package of benefits and reasonable premiums for public employees; and requiring the Commission to report its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly by December 1, 2026.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Commission to Study Health Insurance Pooling to analyze the potential benefits of pooling public employee health insurance purchasing across the State, counties, and educational entities, and to make recommendations to improve efficiency and cost-effectiveness.
responsible_party: Department of Budget and Management
stakeholders: Public employees, State and local government entities, and health insurance providers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill proposes a comprehensive study and analysis of health insurance pooling for public employees, which is a strategic approach to improve cost efficiency and coverage through data-driven recommendations.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has the potential to reduce health insurance costs for public employees, which could indirectly benefit low-income families and reduce child poverty.

Title: Baltimore City - Property Tax - Authority to Impose on Vacant and Abandoned Property Owned by Nonprofit Organizations
Synopsis: Authorizing the Mayor and City Council of Baltimore City to establish, by law, a subclass of real property consisting of certain property that is owned by a nonprofit organization that has been vacant and has not been significantly improved for at least 5 consecutive years and to set a special property tax rate for that property.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes Baltimore City to establish a special property tax rate on vacant and abandoned property owned by nonprofit organizations that has not been used or significantly improved for 3 to 5 years, and to impose a higher tax rate on such properties.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Government
stakeholders: Nonprofit organizations, property owners, residents of Baltimore City
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a targeted property tax approach to incentivize the reuse and improvement of vacant properties owned by nonprofits, employing a specialized tax rate as a policy tool.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to impact child poverty by encouraging the reuse of vacant properties, which can lead to neighborhood revitalization and improved living conditions.

Title: State Government - Maryland Reparations Commission
Synopsis: Establishing the Maryland Reparations Commission to study and make recommendations relating to appropriate benefits to be made to individuals whose ancestors were enslaved in the State or were impacted by certain inequitable government policies; and requiring the Commission to submit a preliminary report by January 1, 2027, and a final report of its findings and recommendations to the Governor and the General Assembly by November 1, 2027.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Maryland Reparations Commission to study and recommend benefits for individuals impacted by slavery and historical inequitable government policies in Maryland, including potential reparations such as monetary compensation, property tax rebates, and social services.
responsible_party: Maryland Reparations Commission, State Archives, and public colleges or universities
stakeholders: Individuals impacted by slavery and historical inequality in Maryland, including descendants of enslaved people and communities affected by inequitable policies.
innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive, multi-stakeholder approach to study and recommend reparations, including examining historical policies, potential benefits, and funding sources, with a focus on reparations payments and social programs.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has the potential to directly impact child poverty by addressing historical inequities and providing reparations and social benefits to affected communities.

Title: Behavioral Health Crisis Response Grant Program - Funding
Synopsis: Requiring the Governor to include in the annual budget bill for each of fiscal years 2027 through 2029 an appropriation of $5,000,000 to the Behavioral Health Crisis Response Grant Program.
bill_summary: The bill allocates funding for the Behavioral Health Crisis Response Grant Program in Maryland, increasing annual appropriations from 2020 through 2029, and mandates that a portion of the funds be used for mobile crisis teams starting in 2023.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Health
stakeholders: Individuals experiencing behavioral health crises, local jurisdictions, mental health service providers
innovative_summary: The program emphasizes the development of mobile crisis teams and competitive grants, employing targeted approaches to improve crisis response systems.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to reduce child poverty by improving access to mental health crisis services for vulnerable populations.

Title: Baltimore City and Takoma Park - Stop Sign Monitoring Systems - Authorization of Pilot Program
Synopsis: Authorizing the use of stop sign monitoring systems in school zones in Baltimore City, if authorized by local law; providing that the owner or driver of a motor vehicle recorded failing to obey a stop sign is subject to a citation and a certain civil penalty under certain circumstances; establishing certain defenses to a charge of an alleged violation recorded by a stop sign monitoring system; requiring that 50% of the fines collected under the Act be distributed to the local management board and be used only for certain youth programming; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the use of stop sign monitoring systems in certain school zones in Baltimore City and Takoma Park, establishes procedures for citations and penalties, allocates a portion of fines to youth programs, and requires reports on the program's effectiveness.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Department of Transportation and the City of Takoma Park
stakeholders: Residents, drivers, and youth in Baltimore City and Takoma Park, especially in school zones
innovative_summary: The bill employs automated stop sign monitoring technology and integrates it with legal and enforcement procedures, representing a technological approach to traffic law enforcement.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to impact child poverty by funding youth programs and services in the affected districts.

Title: Criminal Procedure - U Nonimmigrant Status Petitions
Synopsis: Altering the requirements for certification of a U Nonimmigrant Status Petition; altering the individuals eligible to request a certain official to certify victim helpfulness relating to certification of a U Nonimmigrant Status Petition; altering the time periods within which a certain certifying entity shall certify or decline a certain form under certain circumstances; requiring a certifying entity to develop protocols to assist certain petitioners to take certain actions.
bill_summary: The bill modifies the certification process for U Nonimmigrant Status petitions in Maryland, including who can request certification, the timelines for certifying entities to respond, and the circumstances under which information can be disclosed.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor and certifying entities such as law enforcement agencies and legal authorities
stakeholders: Victims of qualifying crimes seeking U Nonimmigrant Status, law enforcement, legal authorities, and immigrant communities in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces protocols to assist petitioners with limited English proficiency and clarifies disclosure rules, employing a more structured and accessible approach to certification processes.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to impact child poverty by supporting victims of crimes, which can lead to improved safety and stability for affected families.

Title: Courtroom Security - Minimum Adequate Security
Synopsis: Requiring each law enforcement agency, department, or entity providing security at a courthouse facility to submit a report by September 30, 2025, to the Chief Justice of the Supreme Court of Maryland; requiring the report include the current number of court security officers available, the minimum number needed to meet adequate security standards, the current number of vacancies and a viable plan to meet minimum adequate security standards as identified in the Act; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes minimum security staffing standards for courtrooms in Maryland, requiring the presence of a specified number of security officers during proceedings, and mandates reporting from law enforcement agencies on their current staffing and plans to meet these standards.
responsible_party: Maryland Judiciary, Chief Justice of the Supreme Court of Maryland, law enforcement agencies providing courthouse security
stakeholders: Courthouse security personnel, law enforcement agencies, court staff, and individuals attending court proceedings
innovative_summary: The bill employs a structured staffing standard for courtroom security, with phased implementation and reporting requirements, but does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on security staffing standards in courthouses.

Title: St. Mary's County - Public Facilities Bond
Synopsis: Authorizing and empowering the County Commissioners of St. Mary's County to borrow not more than $71,000,000 in order to finance the construction, improvement, or development of certain public facilities in St. Mary's County, and to effect such borrowing by the issuance and sale at public or private sale of its general obligation bonds; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes St. Mary's County to issue up to $71 million in bonds to finance the construction, improvement, and development of various public facilities, including schools, roads, parks, and public safety buildings.
responsible_party: St. Mary's County Commissioners
stakeholders: Residents of St. Mary's County, including students, workers, and visitors who benefit from public facilities
innovative_summary: The bill employs traditional bond financing mechanisms for public infrastructure development, which are well-established and not particularly innovative.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving public facilities such as schools and community centers.

Title: Campaign Finance - Political Organizations - Disclosures on Solicitations (Stop Scam PACs Act)
Synopsis: Requiring certain political organizations to include certain disclaimers and disclosures on certain solicitations; authorizing the State Administrator of Elections to investigate a potential violation of the Act; and authorizing the State Board after the issuance of a public report of its finding to prohibit a person who violated the Act from making further solicitations for a certain period or impose a civil penalty not to exceed $10,000.
bill_summary: The bill, known as the Stop Scam PACs Act, requires certain political organizations to include disclaimers and disclosures on solicitations, especially when using candidate names or for electoral purposes. It authorizes the Maryland State Administrator of Elections to investigate violations and impose civil penalties.
responsible_party: Maryland State Administrator of Elections
stakeholders: Political organizations, candidates, political parties, and voters in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs enhanced disclosure requirements and investigative authority for election-related solicitations, which is a standard approach in campaign finance regulation.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on transparency and accountability in political fundraising.

Title: Courts - Artificial Intelligence Evidence Clinic Pilot Program - Establishment
Synopsis: Establishing an Artificial Intelligence Evidence Clinic Pilot Program within the Administrative Office of the Courts to provide expertise in artificial intelligence to the circuit courts and the District Court in the form of expert testimony on the authenticity of electronic evidence the court determines may have been created or altered using artificial intelligence; authorizing the Governor for fiscal years 2027 and 2028 to include an appropriation of $250,000 in the annual budget bill for the Program; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Artificial Intelligence Evidence Clinic Pilot Program within the Maryland courts to provide expert testimony on electronic evidence created or altered using AI. It involves higher education institutions in developing resources for courts and allocates funding for the program.
responsible_party: Administrative Office of the Courts
stakeholders: Circuit courts, district courts, college and university students, recent graduates, faculty, and technology professionals in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs innovative approaches by integrating artificial intelligence expertise into the judicial process and involving higher education institutions in developing AI-related court resources.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve access to expert testimony in civil cases, which could indirectly benefit populations affected by child poverty.

Title: Maryland Community Action Agencies - Funding
Synopsis: Requiring the Governor to include an appropriation of $250,000 in the annual budget bill to the Department of Housing and Community Development in fiscal years 2027 through 2030 as a grant to community action agencies statewide for measures to combat poverty.
bill_summary: The bill mandates that the Maryland Governor include specific annual appropriations in the state budget from 2027 to 2032 to fund community action agencies with operating grants, with increasing amounts each year.
responsible_party: Department of Housing and Community Development
stakeholders: Low-income residents and community action agencies in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a structured, multi-year funding program for community action agencies, with increasing annual grants, to enhance poverty alleviation efforts.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to directly impact child poverty by strengthening community services for low-income families.

Title: Labor and Employment - Uninsured Employers' Fund Board - Membership and Reserves
Synopsis: Altering the membership of the Uninsured Employers' Fund Board; and requiring, rather than authorizing, the Board to establish reserves to meet potential losses of the Uninsured Employers' Fund.
bill_summary: This bill alters the membership structure of the Uninsured Employers' Fund Board, requiring the Board to establish reserves to cover potential losses of the Fund, and specifies the appointment process and qualifications for Board members.
responsible_party: Uninsured Employers' Fund Board, Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Employers, employees, insurance companies, and the general public in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill mandates the establishment of reserves by the Board to proactively manage potential losses, which is a strategic financial approach to risk management.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty but may indirectly impact workers' protections and financial stability.

Title: Health Care Facilities - Service Member Community Members (SFC Matthew Fast Act )
Synopsis: Authorizing each health care facility to screen each patient for information on whether the patient is a service member community member, include on the patient's medical record whether the patient is a service member community member, and  meet certain standards established by The Joint Commission for the purpose of improving health care equity for warrior community members; and defining "service member community member" to mean a service member, a veteran, a certain spouse, a certain child, or a certain stepchild.
bill_summary: The bill requires health care facilities in Maryland to screen patients for their status as service members or veterans and to include this information in medical records. It aims to improve health care equity for service members, veterans, and their families by identifying them as a vulnerable population and reporting on progress annually.
responsible_party: Department of Veterans and Military Families
stakeholders: Service members, veterans, their families, and health care providers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a targeted screening and data collection approach to improve health care equity for military-connected populations, integrating standards from the Joint Commission.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve health outcomes and access for military-connected families, which could indirectly impact child poverty.

Title: Condominiums and Homeowners Associations - Elections, Financial Statements, and Enforcement
Synopsis: Establishing certain requirements for elections of the governing body of a condominium or homeowners association; requiring that the governing body of a condominium accommodate unit owner organizing activities relating to the governance of the condominium; prohibiting unit owners and lot owners from being charged for examining certain records of the condominium or homeowners association in a certain manner; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes new requirements for elections, record-keeping, and enforcement for condominiums and homeowners associations in Maryland. It aims to improve transparency, fairness, and accountability in governance and record access.
responsible_party: Division of Consumer Protection of the Office of the Attorney General
stakeholders: Unit owners, lot owners, condominium and homeowners association members in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs standardized election procedures, third-party election conductors, and digital platforms to enhance fairness and transparency in association governance.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty but may improve community stability and governance.

Title: Calvert County Sheriff - Deputy Sheriffs and Correctional Deputies - Collective Bargaining
Synopsis: Providing that full-time deputy sheriffs and correctional deputies at the rank of major and below in the Calvert County Sheriff's Office have the right to organize and negotiate with the County Administrator of Calvert County and the Calvert County Sheriff with regard to certain wages and employee benefits in a certain manner.
bill_summary: This bill grants certain deputy sheriffs and correctional deputies in Calvert County the right to organize and negotiate with county authorities regarding wages and employee health care premium share through collective bargaining.
responsible_party: Calvert County Sheriff’s Office and Calvert County government
stakeholders: Deputy sheriffs and correctional deputies in Calvert County, Calvert County government
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a formal collective bargaining process for law enforcement deputies in Calvert County, including certification, negotiations, and ratification procedures.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily addresses law enforcement employee rights.

Title: Health Benefit Plans - Calculation of Cost-Sharing Contribution - Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring administrators, carriers, and pharmacy benefits managers to include certain cost sharing amounts paid by or on behalf of an enrollee or a beneficiary when calculating the enrollee's or beneficiary's contribution to a cost sharing requirement for certain health care services; providing that the calculation requirement does not apply to enrollees in certain high-deductible health plans; requiring third parties that pay certain financial assistance to provide certain notification to an enrollee; etc.
bill_summary: The bill requires health insurers, nonprofit health plans, and health maintenance organizations to include discounts, financial assistance, and out-of-pocket expenses when calculating cost-sharing contributions for prescription drugs. It also mandates notification to enrollees about financial assistance and prohibits coverage terms from being conditioned on the availability of such assistance. The law aims to improve transparency and fairness in prescription drug cost-sharing.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Insurance
stakeholders: Insured individuals, enrollees, health insurers, pharmacy benefit managers, and healthcare providers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive approach to transparency and fairness in prescription drug cost-sharing, including mandatory notifications and restrictions on conditioning coverage on assistance availability, which is relatively innovative in healthcare policy.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has the potential to reduce child poverty by making prescription medications more affordable and accessible, thereby improving health outcomes and reducing financial barriers for families.

Title: Annual Corrective Bill
Synopsis: Correcting certain errors or omissions in certain articles of the Annotated Code; clarifying language; correcting certain obsolete references; reorganizing certain sections of the Annotated Code; providing that the Act is not intended to affect any law other than to correct technical errors; and providing for the correction of certain errors and obsolete provisions by the publishers of the Annotated Code.
bill_summary: This bill is an annual correction bill that amends various sections of Maryland law to fix errors, update references, and clarify language across multiple articles, including those related to alcohol, business, health, education, environment, and public safety.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Legislative Services
stakeholders: Maryland residents, government agencies, and organizations affected by the legal and procedural updates
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive approach to technical corrections and updates in legal language and references, but does not introduce new programs or technologies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly focuses on legal corrections and clarifications.

Title: Labor and Employment - Unpaid Parental Leave - Definition of Employer
Synopsis: Altering the definition of "employer" to exclude employers who are covered by the federal Family and Medical Leave Act for the current year from being required to provide to employees a certain unpaid parental leave benefit in the State.
bill_summary: The bill amends Maryland law to change the definition of 'employer' for unpaid parental leave, excluding employers covered by the federal Family and Medical Leave Act from being required to provide unpaid parental leave benefits in the state.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor or relevant state agency
stakeholders: Employees of small to medium-sized employers in Maryland, particularly those eligible for parental leave and working for employers not covered by federal FMLA
innovative_summary: The bill primarily changes legal definitions and eligibility criteria; it does not introduce new technologies or innovative approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly alters employer obligations and eligibility criteria for parental leave.

Title: Higher Education - Hunger-Free Campus Grant Program - Alterations
Synopsis: Requiring the Maryland Higher Education Commission to designate certain private institutions of higher education as hunger-free campuses; prohibiting a 4-year or 2-year private institution of higher education or a regional higher education center operated by a private nonprofit institution of higher education from being eligible to receive grant funding under the Hunger-Free Campus Grant Program; and authorizing the Governor in certain fiscal years to include $150,000 in the annual budget bill for the Program.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Hunger–Free Campus Grant Program in Maryland, designates certain higher education campuses as hunger–free if they meet specific criteria, and allocates funding to support initiatives that address student food insecurity, including food pantries, meal-sharing programs, and outreach efforts.
responsible_party: Maryland Higher Education Commission
stakeholders: Students at higher education institutions experiencing food insecurity
innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive approach by designating campuses as hunger–free based on specific criteria, and provides flexible grant funding to implement various food security initiatives, including meal-sharing and emergency assistance.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to directly reduce child poverty among college students facing food insecurity.

Title: Howard Community College - Board of Trustees, Meetings, and Contracts - Alterations Ho. Co. 1-25
Synopsis: Adding two members to the Board of Community College Trustees for Howard County; requiring each meeting of the Board to allow for public comment; requiring the Board to make a video or audio recording of its meetings which are to be made available on the Board's website; requiring Board members to undergo certain training specific to Board governance; and requiring the Board to submit a report to the General Assembly by January 1, 2026, and every 6 months thereafter until a contract is finalized, on the status of the faculty union contract.
bill_summary: This bill makes several changes to the governance of Howard Community College, including increasing the number of trustees, establishing meeting and transparency requirements, mandating biennial training for trustees, requiring annual employee satisfaction surveys, and setting rules for the renewal of the college president's contract.
responsible_party: Howard Community College Board of Trustees
stakeholders: Howard Community College employees, students, trustees, and the Howard County community
innovative_summary: The bill introduces transparency measures such as public comment opportunities, recording meetings, and annual employee satisfaction surveys, along with mandated trustee training, which are relatively innovative governance practices.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on governance and administrative procedures.

Title: Municipalities - Enforcement of Ordinances and Resolutions
Synopsis: Increasing from $1,000 to $5,000 the maximum amount of a criminal fine or municipal infraction that may be imposed by a municipality to enforce certain ordinances and resolutions enacted by the municipality.
bill_summary: This bill increases the maximum fine that a municipality can impose for violations of local ordinances and resolutions, raising it from $1,000 to $5,000. It also clarifies that violations can be classified as municipal infractions, which are civil offenses, with fines up to $5,000.
responsible_party: Municipal governments in Maryland
stakeholders: Residents and businesses within Maryland municipalities, local government authorities
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates legal limits on fines and clarifies classification of violations, which is a rule change rather than an innovative program.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty or include specific programs targeting it.

Title: Workers' Compensation - Claims Application Form - Authorization for Release of Information
Synopsis: Altering the entities to which a claimant is required to authorize the release in a claim application filed with the Workers' Compensation Commission to include the Uninsured Employers' Fund and the Subsequent Injury Fund; altering the information which a claimant is required to authorize the release in a claim application to include additional claims filed by the claimant and information in the custody of the Commission; etc.
bill_summary: This bill amends the procedures for workers' compensation claims in Maryland, specifically altering the entities to which claimants must authorize the release of medical and financial information, and clarifies the scope and duration of these authorizations.
responsible_party: Maryland Workers’ Compensation Commission
stakeholders: Workers filing workers' compensation claims and their legal representatives
innovative_summary: The bill primarily updates legal procedures and authorization scopes; it does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly concerns workers' compensation claim procedures.

Title: Department of Human Services - Study on Private Treatment Foster Care Homes
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of Human Services to conduct a study to determine the types of State support that would be appropriate and beneficial to assist private providers of treatment foster care homes in the provision of services; and requiring the Department to report its findings and recommendations on or before December 1, 2025.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland Department of Human Services to review and reallocate part of its budget to provide child care stipends to private treatment foster care homes, similar to public ones. It also mandates a study to determine the types of state support beneficial for private providers of treatment foster care.
responsible_party: Department of Human Services
stakeholders: Children in treatment foster care, private treatment foster care providers, families of children in foster care
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new approach by providing child care stipends to private treatment foster care homes, aligning their support with public foster care standards, and conducting a study to improve support mechanisms.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to directly impact child poverty by improving support and resources for children in private treatment foster care, which can lead to better care and stability.

Title: Electronic Smoking Devices - Seizure and Wholesaler Record-Keeping Requirements
Synopsis: Authorizing the Executive Director of the Alcohol, Tobacco, and Cannabis Commission to seize electronic smoking devices that are sold or offered for sale in violation of certain provisions of law without a warrant; establishing procedures for the return of certain property seized by the Executive Director; establishing certain record-keeping requirements for electronic smoking devices wholesaler distributors and wholesaler importers; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the seizure of illegal electronic smoking devices and tobacco products without a warrant, establishes procedures for their return and destruction, and creates licensing and record-keeping requirements for electronic smoking device wholesalers and manufacturers in Maryland.
responsible_party: Alcohol, Tobacco, and Cannabis Commission of Maryland
stakeholders: Electronic smoking device manufacturers, wholesalers, retailers, and consumers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive regulatory framework including licensing, record-keeping, and seizure procedures, with an emphasis on enforcement and compliance, utilizing existing law and law enforcement tools.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on regulation and enforcement of electronic smoking devices and tobacco products is unlikely to have a direct impact on child poverty.

Title: Maryland Self-Service Storage Act - Sale of Personal Property in Satisfaction of Lien - Notice Requirements
Synopsis: Requiring an operator of a certain self-service storage facility to notify an occupant in default at least 10 days before conducting a sale of the occupant's property stored in the self-storage facility of the time, place, and terms of the sale by hand delivery, verified mail, or electronic mail at the occupant's last known address; and requiring the operator of a self-storage facility to send a second notice if no response has been received 5 days prior to the sale.
bill_summary: This bill updates Maryland law regarding the sale of personal property stored in self-service storage facilities, specifically by clarifying and expanding the notice requirements that operators must follow before conducting a sale to enforce a lien on stored property.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Commerce or relevant self-service storage regulatory authority
stakeholders: Self-service storage facility operators and occupants of storage units in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces electronic mail as a valid method of notice and requires online advertising of sales, modernizing the notification process.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on legal procedures for storage lien enforcement.

Title: Business Regulation - Cellular Phone Carriers - Authorized Users
Synopsis: Requiring a cellular phone carrier to allow a customer of record who is responsible for payment of an account to have the option to designate other individuals as authorized users on the customer's account and to allow an authorized user to take certain actions in connection with the account.
bill_summary: The bill requires cellular phone carriers to include an option in their service contracts that allows multiple individuals to be designated as authorized users on an account. These authorized users can then purchase services, devices, or take actions related to the account, provided all record customers agree in writing.
responsible_party: Cellular phone carriers and the Maryland Public Service Commission (implied)
stakeholders: Cellular phone customers and authorized users in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a formalized process for multiple authorized users on a cellular service account, enhancing user flexibility and control.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on consumer rights and account management.

Title: Mold - Landlord Requirements and Regulations (Maryland Tenant Mold Protection Act)
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of the Environment, the Maryland Department of Health, the Department of Housing and Community Development, the Maryland Department of Labor, and the Department of General Services to develop a certain pamphlet and website; requiring a landlord to provide a tenant with certain information at certain times and in a certain manner; requiring a landlord to perform a mold assessment and mold remediation within 15 days after receipt of a written notice regarding the detection of mold; etc.
bill_summary: The Maryland Tenant Mold Protection Act requires state agencies to develop educational materials on mold, mandates landlords to provide tenants with this information, and sets standards and timelines for mold assessment and remediation in rental properties. It also authorizes the state to adopt regulations establishing uniform standards for mold assessment and remediation.
responsible_party: Department of the Environment, Maryland Department of Health, Department of Housing and Community Development, Maryland Department of Labor, Department of General Services
stakeholders: Tenants in rental properties, landlords, property management agencies, and residents affected by mold hazards
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive, multi-agency approach to standardize mold assessment and remediation, including the development of educational resources and the adoption of uniform standards and regulations, which is a relatively innovative approach to mold management in housing.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has moderate potential to impact child poverty by improving housing conditions and health outcomes for residents, including children, in rental properties.

Title: Cyber Maryland Program - Revisions
Synopsis: Transferring the Cyber Maryland Program from the Maryland Technology Development Corporation to the Maryland Department of Labor; altering the duties of the Program; requiring the Program to issue competitive grants and contracts beginning in fiscal year 2026, to enhance cybersecurity workforce development, including cybersecurity for operational technology; authorizing the Governor for fiscal year 2027 and each fiscal year thereafter to include in the annual budget bill an appropriation sufficient to run the program; etc.
bill_summary: The bill revises the Cyber Maryland Program, transferring it to the Maryland Department of Labor, expanding its duties to include awarding grants and contracts to enhance cybersecurity workforce development, and establishing a Cyber Maryland Fund to support various cybersecurity initiatives and programs.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Labor
stakeholders: Cybersecurity workforce, students, veterans, employers, educational institutions, and community organizations in Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a comprehensive, data-driven approach to cybersecurity workforce development, including strategic planning, competitive grants, and targeted clinics, leveraging industry collaboration and innovative funding strategies.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a high potential to impact child poverty by improving access to cybersecurity education and workforce opportunities for diverse populations, including students and underserved communities.

Title: Department of the Environment - Community Water and Sewerage Systems - Cybersecurity Planning and Assessments
Synopsis: Requiring the Department of the Environment to coordinate, in coordination with the Department of Information Technology and the Maryland Department of Emergency Management, cybersecurity efforts within community water systems and community sewerage systems; establishing the roles and responsibilities of various State agencies with respect to regulating, assessing, and promoting cybersecurity efforts within the water and wastewater sector; etc.
bill_summary: This bill mandates the Maryland Department of the Environment to coordinate cybersecurity efforts for community water and sewerage systems, establish standards, require incident reporting, and promote cybersecurity awareness and training within the water sector.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of the Environment, Maryland Department of Information Technology, Maryland Department of Emergency Management
stakeholders: Community water and sewerage system providers, local governments, and residents served by these systems
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a comprehensive, coordinated cybersecurity framework for water infrastructure, including standards, incident reporting, training, and regular assessments, employing modern cybersecurity practices like zero-trust architecture.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty but enhances critical infrastructure security, which indirectly benefits vulnerable populations.

Title: Governor's Office for Children - Boys and Girls Clubs of Maryland - Grant Funding
Synopsis: Requiring the Governor to include $250,000 in the annual budget bill for fiscal years 2027 through 2030 to the Governor's Office for Children to provide grants to fund operating expenses for the Boys and Girls Clubs of Maryland.
bill_summary: The bill requires the Maryland governor to include a $250,000 annual appropriation from fiscal year 2027 through 2030 in the state budget to fund grants for the Boys and Girls Clubs of Maryland, as part of the efforts of the Governor's Office for Children to promote child well-being and reduce child poverty.
responsible_party: Governor’s Office for Children
stakeholders: Children served by the Boys and Girls Clubs of Maryland and their families
innovative_summary: The bill employs a traditional approach of providing targeted grants through a state office, with no new technologies or innovative methods introduced.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has a moderate potential to directly impact child poverty by supporting youth programs that promote well-being and development.

Title: Office of Social Equity - Community Reinvestment and Repair Fund - Modifications
Synopsis: Repealing provisions of law requiring the Office of Social Equity to report on the Community Reinvestment and Repair Fund and to solicit public input on the uses of the Fund and publish a review of the input; requiring the Office to oversee the appropriation of funds from the Fund and to train Fund recipients; altering certain limitations on the use of the Fund; limiting certain administrative costs to administer the Fund to a certain amount; requiring counties to administer funds from the Fund in a certain manner; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes the Office of Social Equity within the Maryland Cannabis Administration, creates the Community Reinvestment and Repair Fund to support communities impacted by cannabis law enforcement, and sets up a Community Reinvestment and Repair Advisory Board to oversee fund distribution and program implementation. It details fund sources, eligible uses, and reporting requirements for counties.
responsible_party: Office of Social Equity within the Maryland Cannabis Administration
stakeholders: Communities disproportionately impacted by cannabis law enforcement, local community organizations, and residents of Maryland
innovative_summary: The program employs a social equity approach, allocating tax revenue from cannabis sales to repair and reinvest in impacted communities, with oversight and input from a dedicated advisory board, integrating community participation and targeted funding.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to reduce child poverty by funding community services, education, housing, and health initiatives in impacted areas.

Title: Environment - Packaging and Paper Products - Producer Responsibility Plans
Synopsis: Requiring certain producers of covered materials, individually or as part of a producer responsibility organization, to submit a certain covered materials producer responsibility plan to the Department of the Environment for review and approval on or before July 1, 2028, and every 5 years thereafter, in accordance with certain requirements, or to develop an alternative collection program; requiring a producer responsibility organization to pay certain costs to the Department; etc.
bill_summary: The bill establishes a producer responsibility program for packaging materials and paper products in Maryland. It requires producers to submit responsibility plans, sets recycling and waste reduction goals, creates a producer responsibility organization, and sets up funding and enforcement mechanisms to improve recycling, reuse, and waste management.
responsible_party: Department of the Environment
stakeholders: Producers, local governments, service providers, and residents of Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a comprehensive, modern approach to waste management by implementing extended producer responsibility, creating a producer responsibility organization, and establishing detailed performance and reporting requirements, integrating stakeholder engagement and environmental goals.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has high potential to impact child poverty by improving recycling infrastructure and environmental health, which can benefit communities and reduce environmental hazards.

Title: Public Schools - High School Sports Officials - Payment and Fees
Synopsis: Establishing requirements for local school systems that issue invitations for bids for high school sports officiating services for boys' and girls' high school sports; authorizing the Department of Education to develop guidelines to assist a local school system in the implementation of the provisions of the Act, including additional criteria for determining which high school sports qualify as similar boys' and girls' high school sports.
bill_summary: This bill requires Maryland local school systems to issue joint bids for boys' and girls' high school sports officiating services, ensure equal pay for officials in similar roles for similar sports, and develop a list categorizing similar sports for boys and girls. It also sets guidelines for procurement and pay parity among officials.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Education in consultation with the Maryland Public Secondary Schools Athletic Association
stakeholders: High school sports officials, students, schools, and athletic associations in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill employs a coordinated procurement approach and establishes a categorization system for similar sports to ensure pay parity, which is a new approach to managing high school sports officiating services.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has potential to improve fairness and pay equity for officials, which could indirectly benefit students and communities, but its direct impact on child poverty is limited.

Title: Health Insurance - Medicare Supplement Policies - Insurance Producer Commission
Synopsis: Requiring a carrier to pay the same commission rates to an insurance producer for the sale of certain Medicare supplement policies without regard to whether the policies are sold during an open enrollment period, as underwritten policies, or under certain provisions of law.
bill_summary: The bill requires Maryland health insurance carriers to pay the same commission rates to insurance producers for selling Medicare supplement policies, regardless of whether the policies are sold during a guaranteed issue period, open enrollment, or underwritten.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Insurance
stakeholders: Insurance producers, Medicare beneficiaries, insurance carriers
innovative_summary: The bill standardizes commission rates for Medicare supplement policies across different sale periods, promoting fairness and transparency.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty as it primarily affects insurance sales practices.

Title: Municipalities - Legislative Audit - Exemption
Synopsis: Exempting a municipality with annual revenues below $100,000 from a certain audit requirement; clarifying that a certain audit exemption does not affect certain financial reporting requirements; and authorizing the Joint Audit and Evaluation Committee to request or require certain municipalities to conduct a review or audit of their financial records if the financial report indicates a financial or accounting irregularity or concern.
bill_summary: The bill exempts municipalities in Maryland with annual revenues below $100,000 from mandatory annual financial audits, allowing them to be audited once every four years unless the Legislative Auditor determines more frequent audits are necessary. It clarifies that this exemption does not affect the requirement to file financial reports and allows the Joint Audit and Evaluation Committee to request or require reviews or audits if irregularities are found.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Legislative Services and the Legislative Auditor
stakeholders: Municipalities with low annual revenues, local government officials, residents of small municipalities
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a tiered audit exemption based on municipality revenue, streamlining financial oversight for small municipalities and reducing audit frequency, which is a moderate innovation in government financial oversight.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it primarily concerns financial audit requirements for small municipalities.

Title: Howard County - Patuxent River Wildland - Use of Mechanical or Motorized Equipment Ho. Co. 5-25
Synopsis: Authorizing the Department of Natural Resources to use mechanical or motorized equipment to retain, maintain, remove, or replace existing trails and remove, replace, or dispose of nonnative species within the Patuxent River Wildland to ensure clear and safe access to the wildland.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Department of Natural Resources to use mechanical or motorized equipment within the Patuxent River Wildland for maintenance, ecological preservation, and public education purposes, including maintaining paths and removing nonnative species.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Natural Resources
stakeholders: Public, environmental conservation groups, local communities near the Patuxent River Wildland
innovative_summary: The bill employs mechanical and motorized equipment for ecological management and public education within a protected wildland area, which is a modern approach to conservation and land management.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on ecological preservation and public education.

Title: Anne Arundel County - Board of License Commissioners - Alterations
Synopsis: Increasing from three to five the membership of the Board of License Commissioners for Anne Arundel County; altering the eligibility requirements for Board membership; requiring the Board to adopt and publish a certain ethics policy; prohibiting the Board from using certain information as a factor in determining whether to issue or renew a license; requiring the Board to submit a report on the racial breakdown of the disciplinary actions taken by the Board to the General Assembly each year; etc.
bill_summary: The bill makes changes to the Board of License Commissioners for Anne Arundel County, including increasing membership, altering appointment and eligibility criteria, requiring the adoption of an ethics policy, and modifying reporting and penalty procedures.
responsible_party: Board of License Commissioners for Anne Arundel County
stakeholders: Residents and license applicants in Anne Arundel County
innovative_summary: The bill introduces policies for transparency and non-discrimination, such as including race and ethnicity data on applications and prohibiting its use in licensing decisions.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill does not directly address child poverty or include programs aimed at reducing it.

Title: Local Government - Accommodations Intermediaries - Hotel Rental Tax - Collection by Comptroller and Alterations
Synopsis: Requiring certain accommodations intermediaries to collect and remit the hotel rental tax to the Comptroller rather than to each county; providing for the administration of the hotel rental tax by the Comptroller; providing that certain provisions of State law prevail over certain local laws or agreements related to the hotel rental tax; repealing the authority of certain counties to provide for certain exemptions from the hotel rental tax; etc.
bill_summary: The bill mandates that accommodations intermediaries, such as booking platforms, collect and remit hotel rental taxes directly to the Maryland Comptroller instead of local counties, and it updates rules, rates, and procedures related to hotel and short-term rental taxes across various counties and municipalities in Maryland.
responsible_party: Maryland Comptroller's Office
stakeholders: Hotels, accommodations intermediaries, short-term rental platforms, and travelers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a centralized collection system for hotel and short-term rental taxes through accommodations intermediaries, employing digital platforms and streamlining tax collection and remittance processes.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill's focus on tax collection and revenue distribution does not directly target child poverty but could indirectly impact community resources.

Title: Natural Resources - Maryland Heritage Areas Authority - Funding and Grants
Synopsis: Authorizing the Maryland Heritage Areas Authority to award grants and loans to certain entities for the management of certified heritage areas under certain circumstances; establishing a maximum funding amount of $300,000 for certain grants, not to exceed 80% of the estimated project cost; decreasing from 10% to 7%, or $600,000, whichever amount is greater, the percentage of Program Open Space funds transferred to the Maryland Heritage Areas Authority Financing Fund that may be used for certain operating expenses; etc.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes the Maryland Heritage Areas Authority to award grants and loans for managing, developing, and interpreting certified heritage areas, and makes changes to funding and operational rules for the Authority, including adjustments to the use of Program Open Space funds and the maximum funding amounts.
responsible_party: Maryland Heritage Areas Authority
stakeholders: Communities and organizations involved in heritage areas and preservation in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces increased flexibility in funding and management of heritage areas, including higher grant percentages and expanded use of funds, but does not employ new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The program has limited direct impact on child poverty, focusing mainly on heritage and cultural preservation.

Title: Baltimore City - Alcoholic Beverages - License Extension
Synopsis: Extending until the end of July 1, 2026, the expiration of an alcoholic beverages license issued for the 5700 block of Falls Road in Baltimore City for transfer and renewal purposes.
bill_summary: This bill extends the expiration date of a specific alcoholic beverages license in Baltimore City to July 1, 2026, to allow for transfer and renewal purposes.
responsible_party: Baltimore City Alcoholic Beverages Licensing Authority
stakeholders: Alcoholic beverage license holders, Baltimore City residents, local businesses
innovative_summary: The bill employs a temporary legal extension to facilitate license transfer and renewal, which is a straightforward regulatory adjustment without employing new technologies or approaches.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has minimal direct impact on child poverty as it primarily concerns licensing regulations.

Title: Baltimore County and Baltimore City - Vehicle Laws - Lighting on Privately Owned Vehicles
Synopsis: Authorizing not more than five of the highest ranking officers from certain nonprofit volunteer emergency medical services organizations located in Baltimore County and Baltimore City to have their privately owned vehicles equipped with red or red and white lights or signal devices which may be displayed only while on route to or at the scene of an emergency.
bill_summary: The bill authorizes certain volunteer emergency medical services organizations in Baltimore County and Baltimore City to allow up to five of their highest-ranking officers to equip their privately owned vehicles with red or red and white lights or signal devices, which can only be displayed while on route to or at the scene of an emergency.
responsible_party: Maryland Department of Transportation or relevant transportation authority
stakeholders: Volunteer emergency medical services officers and organizations in Baltimore County and Baltimore City
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a new allowance for volunteer emergency medical officers to equip private vehicles with emergency lights, which is a targeted change in vehicle lighting regulations for emergency responders.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty as it mainly changes vehicle lighting regulations for volunteer emergency responders.

Title: Alcoholic Beverages - Class 5 Breweries - On-Premises Consumption
Synopsis: Increasing the percentage of beer not produced by the holder of a Class 5 brewery license that the license holder is permitted to sell for on-premises consumption if the holder also holds an applicable on-site consumption permit or a Class D license.
bill_summary: The bill increases the percentage of beer not produced by a Class 5 brewery license holder that can be sold for on-premises consumption, allowing more flexibility for breweries to sell beer brewed elsewhere under certain conditions.
responsible_party: Maryland Alcoholic Beverages and Cannabis Commission
stakeholders: Class 5 breweries and consumers in Maryland
innovative_summary: The bill introduces a more flexible approach to beer sales for breweries, allowing them to sell a higher percentage of beer brewed outside their premises, which is a moderate change in licensing rules.
child_poverty_direct_summary: The bill has limited direct impact on child poverty, as it mainly changes licensing rules for breweries.
